name: Complete Pokémon Pokédex
desc: This is a full list of every Pokémon from all 8 generations of the Pokémon series, along with their main stats.

name: Weepinbell
desc: Weepinbell is a Grass/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Flycatcher Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 070 (Red/Blue/Yellow)065 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)070 (FireRed/LeafGreen)065 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)027 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)070 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: It spits out POISONPOWDER to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of ACID.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is melted inside by strong acids.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Even though it is filled with ACID, it does not melt because it also oozes a neutralizing fluid.
pokedex_entries.Silver: If its prey is bigger than its mouth, it slices up the victim with sharp leaves, then eats every morsel.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When it’s hungry, it swings its razor-sharp leaves, slicing up any unlucky object nearby for food.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: WEEPINBELL has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the POKéMON hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It spits out POISONPOWDER to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of ACID.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: At night, a WEEPINBELL hangs on to a tree branch with its hooked rear and sleeps. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Even though it is filled with acid, it does not melt because it also oozes a protective fluid.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: If its prey is bigger than its mouth, it slices up the victim with sharp leaves, then eats every morsel.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.
pokedex_entries.X: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.
pokedex_entries.Y: It spits out Poison Powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: This Pokémon has the appearance of a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.

name: Bellsprout
desc: Bellsprout is a Grass/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Flower Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: A carnivorous POKéMON that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny insects with its vines and devours them.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It plants its feet deep underground to replenish water. It can’t escape its enemy while it’s rooted.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: If it notices anything that moves, it immediately flings its vine at the object.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: BELLSPROUT’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this POKéMON spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: A carnivorous POKéMON that traps and eats bugs. It appears to use its root feet to replenish moisture.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A BELLSPROUT’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, it leaks a fluid that melts even iron.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It plants its feet deep underground to replenish water. It can’t escape its enemy while it’s rooted.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.
pokedex_entries.X: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Bellsprout’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.

name: Machamp
desc: Machamp is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Superpower Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 068 (Yellow/Red/Blue)142 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)075 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)068 (FireRed/LeafGreen)042 (Diamond/Pearl)042 (Platinum)144 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)059 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)077 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)097 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)119 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)068 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)140 (Sword/Shield)042 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)156 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this POKéMON fires off awesome punches.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: MACHAMP has the power to hurl anything aside. However, trying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its arms to get tangled. This POKéMON tends to leap into action before it thinks.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: MACHAMP is known as the POKéMON that has mastered every kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its four arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown far over the horizon.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its superpowerful punches are said to knock the victim flying clear over the horizon.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is impossible to defend against punches and chops doled out by its four arms. Its fighting spirit flares up when it faces a tough opponent.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It can knock a train flying with a punch. However, it is terrible at delicate work using its fingers.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
pokedex_entries.X: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.
pokedex_entries.Y: It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Machamp has the power to hurl anything aside. However, trying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its arms to get tangled. This Pokémon tends to leap into action before it thinks.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Machamp is known as the Pokémon that has mastered every kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its four arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown far over the horizon.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It unleashes megaton-level punches that send opponents flying clear over the horizon.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It can lift heavy loads with the greatest of ease. It can even heft dump trucks. But its clumsy fingers prevent it from doing any precision work.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It grasps its opponents with its four arms and twists them up in an intricate hold. People call it “the Machamp special.”
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: With four arms, it can attack and defend simultaneously. It’s said to have mastered every martial art in the world.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this Pokémon fires off awesome punches.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It can knock a train flying with a punch. However, it is terrible at delicate work using its fingers.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: In close combat, its four arms afford it offensive and defensive supremacy. In but a blink, this valiant Pokémon can overwhelm its foes with more than 1,000 blows from its fists.

location.Sword: The Gigantamax energy coursing through its arms makes its punches hit as hard as bomb blasts.
location.Shield: One of these Pokémon once used its immeasurable strength to lift a large ship that was in trouble. It then carried the ship to port.

name: Machoke
desc: Machoke is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Superpower Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: The belt around its waist holds back its energy. Without it, this POKéMON would be unstoppable.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable POKéMON never gets tired.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The muscles covering its body teem with power. Even when still, it exudes an amazing sense of strength.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: This tough POKéMON always stays in the zone. Its muscles become thicker after every battle.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: MACHOKE’s thoroughly toned muscles possess the hardness of steel. This POKéMON has so much strength, it can easily hold aloft a sumo wrestler on just one finger.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: MACHOKE undertakes bodybuilding every day even as it helps people with tough, physically demanding labor. On its days off, this POKéMON heads to the fields and mountains to exercise and train.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A belt is worn by a MACHOKE to keep its overwhelming power under control. Because it is so dangerous, no one has ever removed the belt.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: MACHOKE’s boundless power is very dangerous, so it wears a belt that suppresses its energy.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It can lift a dump truck with one hand. Using that power, it helps people with heavy jobs.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable Pokémon never gets tired.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The muscles covering its body teem with power. Even when still, it exudes an amazing sense of strength.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.
pokedex_entries.X: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
pokedex_entries.Y: It can lift a dump truck with one hand. Using that power, it helps people with heavy jobs.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Machoke’s thoroughly toned muscles possess the hardness of steel. This Pokémon has so much strength, it can easily hold aloft a sumo wrestler on just one finger.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Machoke undertakes bodybuilding every day even as it helps people with tough, physically demanding labor. On its days off, this Pokémon heads to the fields and mountains to exercise and train.
pokedex_entries.Sun: As a result of its continual workouts, it has developed tremendous power. It uses that power to help people with their work.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It willingly assists with hard labor because it knows the work is good training for its muscles.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When it encounters an enemy that’s truly mighty, this Pokémon removes the power-save belt from its waist and unleashes its full power.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: A popular motif for sculptures, its incredibly well-developed muscles have captured the imagination of many an artist.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: The belt around its waist holds back its energy. Without it, this Pokémon would be unstoppable.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Machoke’s boundless power is very dangerous, so it wears a belt that suppresses its energy.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It can lift a dump truck with one hand. Using that kind of strength, it helps people do heavy jobs.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A sturdy creature boasting a robust physique and boundless stamina. Loves training above all else and voluntarily assists with tasks such as construction and clearing land.

name: Machop
desc: Machop is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Superpower Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Very powerful in spite of its small size. Its mastery of many types of martial arts makes it very tough.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It loves to work out and build its muscles. It is never satisfied, even if it trains hard all day long.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It trains by lifting rocks in the mountains. It can even pick up a GRAVELER with ease.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: MACHOP’s muscles are special - they never get sore no matter how much they are used in exercise. This POKéMON has sufficient power to hurl a hundred adult humans.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: MACHOP exercises by hefting around a GRAVELER as if it were a barbell. There are some MACHOP that travel the world in a quest to master all kinds of martial arts.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It continually undertakes strenuous training to master all forms of martial arts. Its strength lets it easily hoist a sumo wrestler onto its shoulders.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It hefts a GRAVELER repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its muscles never cramp however much it trains. It lives in the mountains away from humans.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of GEODUDE at once.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It loves to work out and build its muscles. It is never satisfied, even if it trains hard all day long.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of Geodude at once.
pokedex_entries.X: It hefts a Graveler repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Machop’s muscles are special—they never get sore no matter how much they are used in exercise. This Pokémon has sufficient power to hurl a hundred adult humans.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Machop exercises by hefting around a Graveler as if it were a barbell. There are some Machop that travel the world in a quest to master all kinds of martial arts.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.
pokedex_entries.Moon: With its superhuman strength, it’s able to throw a hundred people all at the same time. Its strength comes from lifting Graveler every day.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Once this Pokémon has gained enough confidence and muscle from training with its friends, it challenges Makuhita to a battle.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It likes food that’s highly nutritious because its instincts drive it to build muscle efficiently.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Very powerful in spite of its small size. Its mastery of many types of martial arts makes it very tough.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It hefts a Graveler repeatedly to strengthen its entire body. It uses every type of martial arts.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its muscles never cramp however much it trains. It lives in the mountains away from humans.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Though as small as a child, it has strength enough to easily throw a well-built adult. Striving to become ever stronger, Machop trains by carrying a Graveler on its shoulders.

name: Kadabra
desc: Kadabra is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Psi Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Many odd things happen if this POKéMON is close by. For example, it makes clocks run backwards.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It possesses strong spiritual power. The more danger it faces, the stronger its psychic power.
pokedex_entries.Silver: If it uses its abilities, it emits special alpha waves that cause machines to malfunction.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When it closes its eyes, twice as many alpha particles come out of the surface of its body.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: KADABRA emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache. Only those people with a particularly strong psyche can hope to become a TRAINER of this POKéMON.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: KADABRA holds a silver spoon in its hand. The spoon is used to amplify the alpha waves in its brain. Without the spoon, the POKéMON is said to be limited to half the usual amount of its telekinetic powers.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It happened one morning - a boy with extrasensory powers awoke in bed transformed into KADABRA.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is rumored that a boy with psychic abilities suddenly transformed into KADABRA while he was assisting research into extrasensory powers.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: If one is nearby, an eerie shadow appears on TV screens. Seeing the shadow is said to bring bad luck.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: When it uses its psychic power, it emits strong ha waves that can ruin precision devices.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It stares at its silver spoon to focus its mind. It emits more alpha waves while doing so.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It possesses strong spiritual power. The more danger it faces, the stronger its psychic power.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: If it uses its abilities, it emits special alpha waves that cause machines to malfunction.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It stares at its silver spoon to focus its mind. It emits more alpha waves while doing so.
pokedex_entries.X: When it uses its psychic power, it emits strong alpha waves that can ruin precision devices.
pokedex_entries.Y: If it uses its abilities, it emits special alpha waves that cause machines to malfunction.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Kadabra emits a peculiar alpha wave if it develops a headache. Only those people with a particularly strong psyche can hope to become a Trainer of this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Kadabra holds a silver spoon in its hand. The spoon is used to amplify the alpha waves in its brain. Without the spoon, the Pokémon is said to be limited to half the usual amount of its telekinetic powers.
pokedex_entries.Sun: A theory exists that this Pokémon was a young boy who couldn’t control his psychic powers and ended up transformed into this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Kadabra’s presence infests televisions and monitors with creepy shadows that bring bad luck.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It stares at a silver spoon to amplify its psychic powers before it lets loose. Apparently, gold spoons are no good.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It possesses strong mental capabilities, but its psychic powers are halved when it’s not holding a silver spoon.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Many odd things happen if this Pokémon is close by. For example, it makes clocks run backward.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon’s telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: If one is nearby, an eerie shadow appears on TV screens. Seeing the shadow is said to bring bad luck.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: When it uses its psychic power, it emits strong alpha waves that can ruin precision instruments.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: There are rumors that a child with mystical powers became a Kadabra; however, this remains unverified. I suspect that the spoon Kadabra holds enhances its brain waves.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Route 215, Victory Road, Dazzling Cave, Stargleam Cavern
location.Legends: Arceus: Sandgem Flats, Lake Acuity, Space-Time Distortion

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and TELEPORT to safety.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It senses impending attacks and TELEPORTS away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
pokedex_entries.Silver: If it decides to TELEPORT randomly, it creates the illusion that it has created copies of itself.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It hypnotizes itself so that it can teleport away when it senses danger, even if it is asleep.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: ABRA sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this POKéMON immediately teleports to safety.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: ABRA needs to sleep for eighteen hours a day. If it doesn’t, this POKéMON loses its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is attacked, ABRA escapes using TELEPORT while it is still sleeping.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. It uses a variety of extrasensory powers even while asleep.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Using its ability to read minds, it will sense impending danger and TELEPORT to safety.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A POKéMON that sleeps 18 hours a day. Observation revealed that it uses TELEPORT to change its location once every hour.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. Even when awake, it teleports itself while remaining seated.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Even while asleep, it maintains a telepathic radar. It teleports when it is threatened.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It senses impending attacks and teleports away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: If it decides to teleport randomly, it evokes the illusion that it has created copies of itself.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.
pokedex_entries.X: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. It uses a variety of extrasensory powers even while asleep.
pokedex_entries.Y: It senses impending attacks and teleports away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Abra sleeps for eighteen hours a day. However, it can sense the presence of foes even while it is sleeping. In such a situation, this Pokémon immediately teleports to safety.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Abra needs to sleep for eighteen hours a day. If it doesn’t, this Pokémon loses its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is attacked, Abra escapes using Teleport while it is still sleeping.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It sleeps 18 hours a day. Even while sleeping, it will teleport itself to treetops and pick and eat berries there.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It can teleport itself to safety while it’s asleep, but when it wakes, it doesn’t know where it is, so it panics.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It uses various psychic powers even while it’s sleeping, so you can’t tell whether or not it’s awake.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It can read others’ minds and will teleport away when danger approaches. You must clear your mind if you want to catch it.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. Even when awake, it teleports itself while remaining seated.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Even while asleep, it maintains a telepathic radar. It teleports when it is threatened.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra can control its psychic powers—should danger approach, the Pokémon will simply teleport away.

location.Legends: Arceus: Sandgem Flats, Lake Acuity, Windswept Run

name: Poliwrath
desc: Poliwrath is a Water/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Tadpole Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake champion swimmers.
pokedex_entries.Gold: This strong and skilled swimmer is even capable of crossing the Pacific Ocean just by kicking.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It can use its well-developed arms and legs to run on the surface of the water for a split second.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: POLIWRATH’s highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this POKéMON can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: An adept swimmer, it knows the front crawl, butterfly, and more. It is faster than the best human swimmers.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: A swimmer adept at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its highly developed muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. This POKéMON can swim back and forth across the Pacific Ocean without effort.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: This strong and skilled swimmer is even capable of crossing the Pacific Ocean just by kicking.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
pokedex_entries.X: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.
pokedex_entries.Y: A swimmer adept at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Poliwrath’s highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pokémon can swim back and forth across the ocean without effort.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Poliwrath in the Alola region are strong swimmers that use the breaststroke. Many children learn to swim by imitating Poliwrath.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s quite a gifted swimmer, even among Water-type Pokémon, but it normally spends its time on land.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The muscles it has developed through swimming are thick and powerful. When it lands a square punch, it can turn huge boulders to dust.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake world-class swimmers.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: With its extremely tough muscles, it could keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.

name: Poliwhirl
desc: Poliwhirl is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Tadpole Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 061 (Red/Blue/Yellow)073 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)061 (FireRed/LeafGreen)073 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)034 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)150 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)183 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)061 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)143 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Under attack, it uses its belly spiral to put the foe to sleep. It then makes its escape.
pokedex_entries.Gold: The swirl on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it may gradually cause drowsiness.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The skin on most of its body is moist. However, the skin on its belly spiral feels smooth.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Though it is skilled at walking, it prefers to live underwater where there is less danger.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: The surface of POLIWHIRL’s body is always wet and slick with an oily fluid. Because of this greasy covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its two legs are well developed. Even though it can live on the ground, it prefers living in water.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It can live in or out of water. When out of water, it constantly sweats to keep its body slimy.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its body surface is always wet and slick with an oily fluid. Because of this greasy covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: The swirl on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it may gradually cause drowsiness.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The skin on most of its body is moist. However, the skin on its belly spiral feels smooth.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.
pokedex_entries.X: It can live in or out of water. When out of water, it constantly sweats to keep its body slimy.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its two legs are well developed. Even though it can live on the ground, it prefers living in water.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: The surface of Poliwhirl’s body is always wet and slick with a slimy fluid. Because of this slippery covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Although it can live on land, it prefers to stay in the water, where it has fewer natural enemies.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It marches over the land in search of bug Pokémon to eat. Then it takes them underwater so it can dine on them where it’s safe.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it has become capable of living on land, it spends its time in the water, where its prey, fish Pokémon, are plentiful.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its health suffers when its skin dries out, so be sure to moisturize it diligently.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Under attack, it uses its belly spiral to put the foe to sleep. It then makes its escape.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’ grasp and escape.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.

name: Poliwag
desc: Poliwag is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Tadpole Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 060 (Red/Blue/Yellow)072 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)060 (FireRed/LeafGreen)072 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)033 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)149 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)182 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)060 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)142 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: The direction of the spiral on the belly differs by area. It is more adept at swimming than walking.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Because it is inept at walking on its newly grown legs, it always swims around in water.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The direction of its belly spiral differs by area. The equator is thought to have an effect on this.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The swirl on its belly is its insides showing through the skin. It looks clearer after it eats.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: POLIWAG has a very thin skin. It is possible to see the POKéMON’s spiral innards right through the skin. Despite its thinness, however, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its slick black skin is thin and damp. A part of its internal organs can be seen through the skin as a spiral pattern.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its newly grown legs prevent it from walking well. It appears to prefer swimming over walking.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is possible to see this POKéMON’s spiral innards right through its thin skin. However, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Because it is inept at walking on its newly grown legs, it always swims around in water.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The direction of its belly spiral differs by area. The equator is thought to have an effect on this.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.
pokedex_entries.X: Its slick black skin is thin and damp. A part of its internal organs can be seen through the skin as a spiral pattern.
pokedex_entries.Y: The direction of the spiral on the belly differs by area. It is more adept at swimming than walking.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Poliwag has a very thin skin. It is possible to see the Pokémon’s spiral innards right through the skin. Despite its thinness, however, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.
pokedex_entries.Sun: The swirl on its belly is its internal organs showing through. If the swirl is tinged white, that means it’s affected by some disease.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It’s still not very good at walking. Its Trainers should train this Pokémon to walk every day.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land. So it does its best to waddle along, but when an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The direction of the swirl on their stomachs differs depending on where they live. Poliwag aficionados can tell them apart at a glance.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: The direction of the spiral on the belly differs by area. It is more adept at swimming than walking.
pokedex_entries.Sword: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.
pokedex_entries.Shield: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.

name_origin.primate: set of mammals including monkeys, apes, etc

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
pokedex_entries.Gold: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It will beat up anyone who makes it mad, even if it has to chase them until the end of the world.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: When PRIMEAPE becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It is always outrageously furious. If it gives chase, it will tenaciously track the target no matter how far.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it catches up.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: When it becomes furious, its blood circulation becomes more robust, and its muscles are made stronger. But it also becomes much less intelligent.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.
pokedex_entries.X: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
pokedex_entries.Y: It is always outrageously furious. If it gives chase, it will tenaciously track the target no matter how far.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It has been known to become so angry that it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in death, however.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It will never forgive opponents who have angered it. Even after it has beaten them down until they can’t move, it never ever forgives.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The blood vessels in its brain are sturdier than those of other Pokémon, so it can stay healthy despite its constant raging.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It becomes angry if it sees an opponent’s eyes and gets angrier if the opponent runs. Even after it beats the opponent, it is still angry.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Route 225, 226, Spacious Cave, Grassland Cave, Sunlit Cavern

name: Mankey
desc: Mankey is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Pig Monkey Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 056 (Red/Blue/Yellow)134 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)056 (FireRed/LeafGreen)136 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)079 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)093 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)056 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: An agile POKéMON that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It’s unsafe to approach if it gets violently enraged for no reason and can’t distinguish friends from foes.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: When MANKEY starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it’s a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Light and agile on its feet, and ferocious in temperament. When angered, it flies into an uncontrollable frenzy.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: When it starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it’s a sure sign of anger. However, since this happens instantly, there is no time to flee.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It’s unsafe to approach if it gets violently enraged for no reason and can’t distinguish friends from foes.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
pokedex_entries.X: It’s unsafe to approach if it gets violently enraged for no reason and can’t distinguish friends from foes.
pokedex_entries.Y: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it’s a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages, and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its raging tires it out and causes it to fall asleep, but the anger resonating in its dreams causes it to wake up—which infuriates it all over again.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The smallest of things could cause it to lose its temper. Because it doesn’t hold in its stress, this Pokémon can live a long time.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: If one gets angry, all the others around it will get angry, so silence is a rare visitor in a troop of Mankey.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It lives in treetop colonies. If one member of the group becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Route 225, 226, Spacious Cave, Grassland Cave, Sunlit Cavern

name: Enamorus
desc: Enamorus is a Fairy/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Love-Hate Pokémon.

name: Overqwil
desc: Overqwil is a Dark/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Pin Cluster Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname “sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.

name: Sneasler
desc: Sneasler is a Poison/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Free Climb Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Because of Sneasler’s virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

name: Basculegion
desc: Basculegion is a Water/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Big Fish Pokémon.

name: Ursaluna
desc: Ursaluna is a Normal/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Peat Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: I believe it was Hisui’s swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.

name: Kleavor
desc: Kleavor is a Bug/Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Axe Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one’s only recourse is to flee.

name: Wyrdeer
desc: Wyrdeer is a Normal/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Big Horn Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

name: Calyrex
desc: Calyrex is a Psychic/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the King Pokémon.

name: Spectrier
desc: Spectrier is a Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Swift Horse Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s kicks are said to separate soul from body.
pokedex_entries.Shield: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.

name: Glastrier
desc: Glastrier is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Wild Horse Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.

name: Regidrago
desc: Regidrago is a Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Dragon Orb Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: An academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.

name: Regieleki
desc: Regieleki is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Electron Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s body will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar’s electricity.

name: Zarude
desc: Zarude is a Dark/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Rogue Monkey Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It’s incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Once the vines on Zarude’s body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.

location.Sword: This Zarude left its pack to raise a human child. The cloth Zarude would wrap the child with has a comforting scent that calmed the child’s crying.
location.Shield: This Zarude’s special strength stems from its love and care for an orphaned human child that the Pokémon has raised since the child’s infancy.

name: Urshifu
desc: Urshifu is a Fighting/Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Wushu Pokémon.

name: Kubfu
desc: Kubfu is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Wushu Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.

name: Eternatus
desc: Eternatus is a Poison/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Gigantic Pokémon.

name: Zamazenta
desc: Zamazenta is a Fighting/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Warrior Pokémon.

name: Zacian
desc: Zacian is a Fairy/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Warrior Pokémon.

name: Dragapult
desc: Dragapult is a Dragon/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Stealth Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: When it isn’t battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult’s horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.

name: Drakloak
desc: Drakloak is a Dragon/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Caretaker Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.

name: Dreepy
desc: Dreepy is a Dragon/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Lingering Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.

name: Duraludon
desc: Duraludon is a Steel/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Alloy Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.

location.Sword: It’s grown to resemble a skyscraper. Parts of its towering body glow due to a profusion of energy.
location.Shield: The hardness of its cells is exceptional, even among Steel types. It also has a body structure that’s resistant to earthquakes.

name: Arctovish
desc: Arctovish is a Water/Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Fossil Pokémon.

name_origin.arctic: icy region around the North Pole

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Water Absorb2. Ice BodySlush Rush (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sword: Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.

name: Dracovish
desc: Dracovish is a Water/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Fossil Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Water Absorb2. Strong JawSand Rush (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sword: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.

name: Arctozolt
desc: Arctozolt is an Electric/Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Fossil Pokémon.

name_origin.arctic: icy region around the North Pole

pokedex_entries.Sword: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.

name: Dracozolt
desc: Dracozolt is an Electric/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Fossil Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.

name: Copperajah
desc: Copperajah is a Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Copperderm Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.
pokedex_entries.Shield: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.

location.Sword: So much power is packed within its trunk that if it were to unleash that power, the resulting blast could level mountains and change the landscape.
location.Shield: After this Pokémon has Gigantamaxed, its massive nose can utterly demolish large structures with a single smashing blow.

name: Cufant
desc: Cufant is a Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Copperderm Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It’s also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.

name: Morpeko
desc: Morpeko is an Electric/Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Two-Sided Pokémon.

name: Indeedee
desc: Indeedee is a Psychic/Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Emotion Pokémon.

name: Eiscue
desc: Eiscue is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Penguin Pokémon.

name: Stonjourner
desc: Stonjourner is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Big Rock Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.

location.Sword: Route 10, Lake of Outrage, Giant's Bed, Giant's Foot
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Frosmoth
desc: Frosmoth is an Ice/Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Frost Moth Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains. The temperature of its wings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

name: Snom
desc: Snom is an Ice/Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Worm Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.

location.SwordShield: Route 8, 10, Lake of Outrage, Slippery Slope, Snowslide Slope, Path to the Peak

name: Pincurchin
desc: Pincurchin is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Sea Urchin Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.

location.SwordShield: Route 9, Courageous Cavern, Loop Lagoon, Frigid Sea

name: Falinks
desc: Falinks is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Formation Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass’s orders are absolute.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.

name: Alcremie
desc: Alcremie is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Cream Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: The moment it evolved, it took on a bitter flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The cells that compose its cream fluctuated suddenly during evolution, giving the cream a bitter flavor.

location.Sword: Cream pours endlessly from this Pokémon’s body. The cream stiffens when compressed by an impact. A harder impact results in harder cream.
location.Shield: It launches swarms of missiles, each made of cream and loaded with 100,000 kilocalories. Get hit by one of these, and your head will swim.

name: Milcery
desc: Milcery is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Cream Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
pokedex_entries.Shield: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.

name: Runerigus
desc: Runerigus is a Ground/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Grudge Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.

name: Mr. Rime
desc: Mr. Rime is an Ice/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Comedian Pokémon.

name_origin.rhyme: words ending in the same sound

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Tangled Feet2. Screen CleanerIce Body (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.

name: Sirfetch'd
desc: Sirfetch'd is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Wild Duck Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.
pokedex_entries.Shield: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.

location.Sword: Evolve Farfetch'd/Galarian Farfetch'd
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Cursola
desc: Cursola is a Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Coral Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Evolve Corsola/Galarian Corsola

name: Perrserker
desc: Perrserker is a Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Viking Pokémon.

name_origin.purr: sound a cat makes when content

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Battle Armor2. Tough ClawsSteely Spirit (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sword: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.
pokedex_entries.Shield: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.

name: Obstagoon
desc: Obstagoon is a Dark/Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Blocking Pokémon.

name_origin.obstacle: something that blocks or hinders progress

pokedex_entries.Sword: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

name: Grimmsnarl
desc: Grimmsnarl is a Dark/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Bulk Up Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would.

location.Sword: By transforming its leg hair, this Pokémon delivers power-packed drill kicks that can bore huge holes in Galar’s terrain.
location.Shield: Gigantamax energy has caused more hair to sprout all over its body. With the added strength, it can jump over the world’s tallest building.

name: Morgrem
desc: Morgrem is a Dark/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Devious Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it’s trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.

location.SwordShield: Glimwood Tangle, Giant's Bed, Snowslide Slope, Giant's Foot

name: Impidimp
desc: Impidimp is a Dark/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Wily Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.

location.SwordShield: Giant's Mirror, Hammerlocke Hills, Motostoke Outskirts, Stony Wilderness, Slippery Slope

name: Hatterene
desc: Hatterene is a Psychic/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Silent Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon is also known as the Forest Witch.

location.Sword: This Pokémon can read the emotions of creatures over 30 miles away. The minute it senses hostility, it goes on the attack.
location.Shield: Beams like lightning shoot down from its tentacles. It’s known to some as the Raging Goddess.

name: Hattrem
desc: Hattrem is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Serene Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.

location.SwordShield: Glimwood Tangle, Dusty Bowl, Frostpoint Field, Giant's Bed, Old Cemetery, Giant's Foot, Frigid Sea, Three-Point Pass, Ballimere Lake

name: Hatenna
desc: Hatenna is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Calm Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures’ emotions. If you don’t have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.

location.SwordShield: Hammerlocke Hills, Motostoke Outskirts, Stony Wilderness, Slippery Slope, Frostpoint Field, Giant's Bed, Old Cemetery, Giant's Foot, Frigid Sea, Three-Point Pass, Ballimere Lake

name: Polteageist
desc: Polteageist is a Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Black Tea Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Trainers Polteageist trusts will be allowed to experience its distinctive flavor and aroma firsthand by sampling just a tiny bit of its tea.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When angered, it launches tea from its body at the offender’s mouth. The tea causes strong chills if swallowed.

location.Sword: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.
location.Shield: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.

name: Sinistea
desc: Sinistea is a Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Black Tea Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: The swirl pattern in this Pokémon’s body is its weakness. If it gets stirred, the swirl loses its shape, and Sinistea gets dizzy.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It absorbs the life-force of those who drink it. It waits patiently, but opportunities are fleeting— it tastes so bad that it gets spat out immediately.

location.Sword: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.
location.Shield: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.

name: Grapploct
desc: Grapploct is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Tantrum Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.

name: Clobbopus
desc: Clobbopus is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Tantrum Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.

name: Centiskorch
desc: Centiskorch is a Fire/Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Radiator Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Flash Fire2. White SmokeFlame Body (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sword: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.
pokedex_entries.Shield: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.

location.Sword: Gigantamax energy has evoked a rise in its body temperature, now reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Its heat waves incinerate its enemies.
location.Shield: The heat that comes off a Gigantamax Centiskorch may destabilize air currents. Sometimes it can even cause storms.

name: Sizzlipede
desc: Sizzlipede is a Fire/Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Radiator Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Flash Fire2. White SmokeFlame Body (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sword: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

name: Toxtricity
desc: Toxtricity is an Electric/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Punk Pokémon.

name: Toxel
desc: Toxel is an Electric/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Baby Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.

location.SwordShield: Route 7, Bridge Field, Giant's Cap, Hammerlocke Hills, Motostoke Riverbank, Stony Wilderness

name: Barraskewda
desc: Barraskewda is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Skewer Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda’s flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.

location.SwordShield: Route 2, Dusty Bowl, Lake of Outrage, Motostoke Riverbank

name: Arrokuda
desc: Arrokuda is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Rush Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It’s very proud of that jaw.
pokedex_entries.Shield: After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant swallows it up.

location.SwordShield: Route 2, Motostoke Riverbank, Hulbury, Challenge Beach, Forest of Focus, Training Lowlands

name: Cramorant
desc: Cramorant is a Flying/Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Gulp Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.

location.Sword: This Cramorant has accidentally gotten a Pikachu lodged in its gullet. Cramorant is choking a little, but it isn’t really bothered.
location.Shield: The half-swallowed Pikachu is so startled that it isn’t struggling yet, but it’s still looking for a chance to strike back.

name: Sandaconda
desc: Sandaconda is a Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Sand Snake Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Sand Spit2. Shed SkinSand Veil (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sword: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.

location.Sword: Its sand pouch has grown to tremendous proportions. More than 1,000,000 tons of sand now swirl around its body.
location.Shield: Sand swirls around its body with such speed and power that it could pulverize a skyscraper.

name: Silicobra
desc: Silicobra is a Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Sand Snake Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Sand Spit2. Shed SkinSand Veil (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sword: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

location.SwordShield: Route 6, Challenge Road, Forest of Focus, Potbottom Desert, Training Lowlands

name: Appletun
desc: Appletun is a Grass/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Apple Nectar Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.

location.Sword: It blasts its opponents with massive amounts of sweet, sticky nectar, drowning them under the deluge.
location.Shield: Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokémon’s nectar has thickened. The increased viscosity lets the nectar absorb more damage than before.

name: Flapple
desc: Flapple is a Grass/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Apple Wing Pokémon.

name_origin.flap: to move wings up and down

pokedex_entries.Sword: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.

location.Sword: Under the influence of Gigantamax energy, it produces much more sweet nectar, and its shape has changed to resemble a giant apple.
location.Shield: If it stretches its neck, the strong aroma of its nectar pours out. The scent is so sickeningly sweet that one whiff makes other Pokémon faint.

name: Applin
desc: Applin is a Grass/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Apple Core Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.
pokedex_entries.Shield: As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.

location.SwordShield: Route 5, Dusty Bowl, Giant's Mirror, Stony Wilderness, Challenge Beach, Fields of Honor, Forest of Focus, Insular Sea, Loop Lagoon, Soothing Wetlands, Stepping-Stone Sea, Training Lowlands, Workout Sea

name: Coalossal
desc: Coalossal is a Rock/Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Coal Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Steam Engine2. Flame BodyFlash Fire (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.

location.Sword: Its body is a colossal stove. With Gigantamax energy stoking the fire, this Pokémon’s flame burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
location.Shield: When Galar was hit by a harsh cold wave, this Pokémon served as a giant heating stove and saved many lives.

name: Carkol
desc: Carkol is a Rock/Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Coal Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Steam Engine2. Flame BodyFlash Fire (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sword: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.
pokedex_entries.Shield: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

location.SwordShield: Bridge Field, Giant's Cap, Stony Wilderness, Ballimere Lake, Lakeside Cave

name: Rolycoly
desc: Rolycoly is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Coal Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.

location.SwordShield: Route 3, Galar Mine, Giant's Cap, Motostoke Riverbank

name: Boltund
desc: Boltund is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Dog Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.

location.SwordShield: Dusty Bowl, Lake of Outrage, Motostoke Riverbank, Ballimere Lake

name: Yamper
desc: Yamper is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Puppy Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.

location.SwordShield: Route 2, 4, Giant's Mirror, Motostoke Riverbank, Stony Wilderness, Ballimere Lake

name: Drednaw
desc: Drednaw is a Water/Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Bite Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Strong Jaw2. Shell ArmorSwift Swim (hidden ability)
