pokedex_entries.Sword: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.

location.Sword: It responded to Gigantamax energy by becoming bipedal. First it comes crashing down on foes, and then it finishes them off with its massive jaws.
location.Shield: In the Galar region, there’s a tale about this Pokémon chewing up a mountain and using the rubble to stop a flood.

name: Chewtle
desc: Chewtle is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Snapping Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Strong Jaw2. Shell ArmorSwift Swim (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sword: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

location.SwordShield: Route 2, 4, 5, Motostoke, Giant's Cap, Giant's Mirror, Motostoke Outskirts, Motostoke Riverbank, Hulbury, Galar Mine No. 2, Courageous Cavern, Soothing Wetlands

name: Dubwool
desc: Dubwool is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Sheep Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

location.SwordShield: Dusty Bowl, Hammerlocke Hills, Motostoke Riverbank, Slippery Slope, Frostpoint Field, Giant's Bed, Snowslide Slope, Three-Point Pass

name: Wooloo
desc: Wooloo is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Sheep Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

location.SwordShield: Route 1, 4, Motostoke Riverbank, Slippery Slope, Frostpoint Field, Giant's Bed, Snowslide Slope, Three-Point Pass

name: Eldegoss
desc: Eldegoss is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Cotton Bloom Pokémon.

name_origin.gossypium: Latin name for the cotton plant

pokedex_entries.Sword: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

location.SwordShield: Dusty Bowl, Giant's Cap, Motostoke Riverbank, Stony Wilderness

name: Gossifleur
desc: Gossifleur is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Flowering Pokémon.

name_origin.gossypium: Latin name for the cotton plant

pokedex_entries.Sword: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

name: Thievul
desc: Thievul is a Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Fox Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.

location.SwordShield: Route 7, 9, Bridge Field, Hammerlocke Hills, Stony Wilderness

name: Nickit
desc: Nickit is a Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Fox Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.

location.SwordShield: Route 1, 2, Dusty Bowl, Giant's Mirror, Stony Wilderness

name: Orbeetle
desc: Orbeetle is a Bug/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Seven Spot Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.

location.Sword: Its brain has grown to a gargantuan size, as has the rest of its body. This Pokémon’s intellect and psychic abilities are overpowering.
location.Shield: If it were to utilize every last bit of its power, it could control the minds of every living being in its vicinity.

name: Dottler
desc: Dottler is a Bug/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Radome Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.
pokedex_entries.Shield: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

location.SwordShield: Route 5, Giant's Cap, Giant's Mirror, Stony Wilderness

name: Blipbug
desc: Blipbug is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Larva Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

location.SwordShield: Route 1, 2, Slumbering Weald, Giant's Cap, Challenge Beach, Challenge Road, Fields of Honor, Honeycalm Island, Insular Sea, Loop Lagoon, Stepping-Stone Sea, Training Lowlands, Workout Sea

name: Corviknight
desc: Corviknight is a Flying/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Raven Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar region’s airborne taxi service.

location.Sword: Imbued with Gigantamax energy, its wings can whip up winds more forceful than any a hurricane could muster. The gusts blow everything away.
location.Shield: The eight feathers on its back are called blade birds, and they can launch off its body to attack foes independently.

name: Corvisquire
desc: Corvisquire is a Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Raven Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.

location.SwordShield: Giant's Mirror, Hammerlocke Hills, Motostoke Riverbank, Ballimere Lake

name: Rookidee
desc: Rookidee is a Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Tiny Bird Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.

name: Greedent
desc: Greedent is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Greedy Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.

location.SwordShield: Route 6, 7, 9, Axew's Eye, Bridge Field, Giant's Cap, Giant's Mirror, Giant's Seat, Hammerlocke Hills, Lake of Outrage, Motostoke Riverbank, Slippery Slope, Frostpoint Field, Giant's Bed, Giant's Foot, Ballimere Lake

name: Skwovet
desc: Skwovet is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Cheeky Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.

location.SwordShield: Route 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, Rolling Fields, Slumbering Weald, Dappled Grove, Motostoke Riverbank, North Lake Miloch, Watchtower Ruins, Challenge Beach, Fields of Honor, Forest of Focus, Insular Sea, Loop Lagoon, Soothing Wetlands, Stepping-Stone Sea, Training Lowlands, Workout Sea, Slippery Slope, Frostpoint Field, Giant's Bed, Giant's Foot, Ballimere Lake

name: Inteleon
desc: Inteleon is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Secret Agent Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.

location.Sword: Gigantamax Inteleon’s Water Gun move fires at Mach 7. As the Pokémon takes aim, it uses the crest on its head to gauge wind and temperature.
location.Shield: It has excellent sniping skills. Shooting a berry rolling along over nine miles away is a piece of cake for this Pokémon.

name: Drizzile
desc: Drizzile is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Water lizard Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.

name: Sobble
desc: Sobble is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Water Lizard Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.

name: Cinderace
desc: Cinderace is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Striker Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

location.Sword: Infused with Cinderace’s fighting spirit, the gigantic Pyro Ball never misses its targets and completely roasts opponents.
location.Shield: Gigantamax energy can sometimes cause the diameter of this Pokémon’s fireball to exceed 300 feet.

name: Raboot
desc: Raboot is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Rabbit Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.

name: Scorbunny
desc: Scorbunny is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Rabbit Pokémon.

name_origin.bunny: slang for rabbit, a small mammal with long ears

pokedex_entries.Sword: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.

name: Rillaboom
desc: Rillaboom is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Drummer Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.

location.Sword: Gigantamax energy has caused Rillaboom’s stump to grow into a drum set that resembles a forest.
location.Shield: Rillaboom has become one with its forest of drums and continues to lay down beats that shake all of Galar.

name: Thwackey
desc: Thwackey is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Beat Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.

name: Grookey
desc: Grookey is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 8. It is known as the Chimp Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.

name: Melmetal
desc: Melmetal is a Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Hex Nut Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
pokedex_entries.Sword: At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.

location.Sword: In a distant land, there are legends about a cyclopean giant. In fact, the giant was a Melmetal that was flooded with Gigantamax energy.
location.Shield: It can send electric beams streaking out from the hole in its belly. The beams’ tremendous energy can vaporize an opponent in one shot.

name: Meltan
desc: Meltan is a Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Hex Nut Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid metal within its body is how it generates energy.
pokedex_entries.Shield: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.

name: Zeraora
desc: Zeraora is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Thunderclap Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It runs as fast as lightning strikes, shredding its opponents with its high-voltage claws.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs. Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and thunder echoes.

name: Blacephalon
desc: Blacephalon is a Fire/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Fireworks Pokémon.

name_origin.cephalo-: of or relating to the head

pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.

name: Stakataka
desc: Stakataka is a Rock/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Rampart Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

name: Naganadel
desc: Naganadel is a Poison/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Poison Pin Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

name: Poipole
desc: Poipole is a Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Poison Pin Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

name: Marshadow
desc: Marshadow is a Fighting/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Gloomdweller Pokémon.

name_origin.shadow: dark area created by blocking out light

pokedex_entries.Sun: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It lurks in the shadows of others, copying their movements and powers. This Pokémon is craven and cowering.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.
pokedex_entries.Sword: By slipping into the shadow of a martial arts master and copying their movements, this Pokémon learned the ultimate techniques.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow, so it went undiscovered for a long time.

name: Magearna
desc: Magearna is a Steel/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Artificial Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.

location.Sun: This beautiful form reflects Magearna’s appearance when first presented to a king’s daughter 500 years ago.
location.Moon: This gorgeous Magearna looks as it did at the time of its invention. Its luxurious decoration pleased the king’s daughter.
location.Ultra Sun: This is its form from almost 500 years ago. Its body is nothing more than a container—its artificial heart is the actual life-form.
location.Ultra Moon: It functions thanks to its artificial soul. The vivid decoration is proof that it was presented as a gift to royalty.

name: Necrozma
desc: Necrozma is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Prism Pokémon.

name: Guzzlord
desc: Guzzlord is a Dark/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Junkivore Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It’s one of the Ultra Beasts.
pokedex_entries.Moon: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.

name: Kartana
desc: Kartana is a Grass/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Drawn Sword Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
pokedex_entries.Moon: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This Ultra Beast’s body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Celesteela
desc: Celesteela is a Steel/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Launch Pokémon.

name_origin.celestial: of or relating to space or heaven

pokedex_entries.Sun: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.
pokedex_entries.Moon: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: One of the dangerous UBs, high energy readings can be detected coming from both of its huge arms.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Xurkitree
desc: Xurkitree is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Glowing Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.

name: Pheromosa
desc: Pheromosa is a Bug/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Lissome Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.
pokedex_entries.Moon: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Buzzwole
desc: Buzzwole is a Bug/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Swollen Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.
pokedex_entries.Moon: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.

name: Nihilego
desc: Nihilego is a Rock/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Parasite Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.
pokedex_entries.Moon: One of the Ultra Beasts. It’s unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: A life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.

name: Lunala
desc: Lunala is a Psychic/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Moone Pokémon.

name_origin.lunar: of or relating to the Moon

pokedex_entries.Sun: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Said to live in another world, this Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name “the beast that calls the moon.”
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Known as the Beast That Calls the Moon, this Pokémon lives by taking in any and all light and converting it into its own energy.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It steals the light from its surroundings and then becomes the full moon, showering its own light across the night sky.

name: Solgaleo
desc: Solgaleo is a Psychic/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Sunne Pokémon.

name_origin.solar: of or relating to the Sun

pokedex_entries.Sun: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and life-forms from other worlds are called here to this world.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: In writings from the distant past, it’s called by the name “the beast that devours the sun.”
pokedex_entries.Sword: When light radiates from its body, this Pokémon could almost appear to be the sun. It will dispel any darkness and light up the world.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light radiates boundlessly from it.

name: Cosmoem
desc: Cosmoem is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Protostar Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.
pokedex_entries.Moon: There’s something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the “cocoon of the stars” and built an altar to worship it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The absorption of starlight fuels this Pokémon’s growth. The shell that encases it is harder than any known material.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate, frantically building up energy within its core as preparation for evolution.

name: Cosmog
desc: Cosmog is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Nebula Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
pokedex_entries.Moon: In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. It’s said to be a Pokémon from another world, but no specific details are known.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn’t seem to care.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Whether or not it’s a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it’s in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon came from another universe. Its gaseous body is so light that even a gentle breeze can blow it away.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Cosmog is very curious but not very cautious, often placing itself in danger. If things start to look dicey, it teleports away.

name: Tapu Fini
desc: Tapu Fini is a Water/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Land Spirit Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.

name: Tapu Bulu
desc: Tapu Bulu is a Grass/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Land Spirit Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The guardian deity of Ula’ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it’s called a guardian deity, it’s violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.

name: Tapu Lele
desc: Tapu Lele is a Psychic/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Land Spirit Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.
pokedex_entries.Moon: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It heals the wounds of people and Pokémon by sprinkling them with its sparkling scales. This guardian deity is worshiped on Akala.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

name: Tapu Koko
desc: Tapu Koko is an Electric/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Land Spirit Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.

name: Kommo-o
desc: Kommo-o is a Dragon/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Scaly Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 273 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)363 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)394 (Sword/Shield)167 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When it howls after finishing off its prey, the metallic sounds of its celebrating comrades can be heard from all around.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It battles valiantly with its fists, which are armored in steel scales. Kommo-o specializes in uppercuts.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents. This Pokémon will battle only those who stand steadfast in the face of this display.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.

location.Sword: Evolve Jangmo-o/Hakamo-o
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Hakamo-o
desc: Hakamo-o is a Dragon/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Scaly Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 272 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)362 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)393 (Sword/Shield)166 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time they’re regrown.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It makes noise by clanging its scales together. When the rhythm has reached its peak, Hakamo-o attacks.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The scales it sheds can be molded and processed to make pots and pans. They conduct heat well, so they’re a popular item.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are signs of its strength. It shows them off to defeated opponents.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.

location.Sword: Lake of Outrage
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Jangmo-o
desc: Jangmo-o is a Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Scaly Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 271 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)361 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)392 (Sword/Shield)165 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It will never show an enemy its back in battle. Ancient warriors liked Jangmo-o for its valiant disposition and made it one of their own.
pokedex_entries.Sword: They learn to fight by smashing their head scales together. The dueling strengthens both their skills and their spirits.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s become as hard as metal.

location.Sword: Lake of Outrage, Challenge Road, Potbottom Desert
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Dhelmise
desc: Dhelmise is a Ghost/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Sea Creeper Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 263 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)344 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)360 (Sword/Shield)162 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Sun: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey like Wailord.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its chain-like green seaweed can stretch outward for hundreds of yards. For some reason, it gets along well with Skrelp.
pokedex_entries.Sword: After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.

name: Drampa
desc: Drampa is a Normal/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Placid Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: If a child it has made friends with is bullied, Drampa will find the bully’s house and burn it to the ground.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It appears in towns and plays with the children. Drampa will protect kids when they’re in danger, so their moms don’t have to worry.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Lake of Outrage

name: Bruxish
desc: Bruxish is a Water/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Gnash Teeth Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder’s shell is no match for it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It burrows beneath the sand, radiating psychic power from the protuberance on its head. It waits for prey as it surveys the area.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie’s spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.

name: Mimikyu
desc: Mimikyu is a Ghost/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Disguise Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 242 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)315 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)301 (Sword/Shield)046 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Sun: After going to all the effort of disguising itself, its neck was broken. Whatever is inside is probably unharmed, but it’s still feeling sad.
pokedex_entries.Moon: If its neck is broken or its rag torn during an attack, it works through the night to patch it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It stands in front of a mirror, trying to fix its broken neck as if its life depended on it. It has a hard time getting it right, so it’s crying inside.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Sad that its true identity may be exposed, Mimikyu will mercilessly seek revenge on any opponent that breaks its neck.
pokedex_entries.Sword: There will be no forgiveness for any who reveal that it was pretending to be Pikachu. It will bring the culprit down, even at the cost of its own life.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its disguise made from an old rag allowed it to avoid an attack, but the impact broke the neck of the disguise. Now everyone knows it’s a Mimikyu.

location.Sun: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.
location.Moon: A lonely Pokémon, it conceals its terrifying appearance beneath an old rag so it can get closer to people and other Pokémon.
location.Ultra Sun: Although it’s a quiet, lonely Pokémon, if you try to look at what’s under its rag, it will become agitated and resist violently.
location.Ultra Moon: A gust of wind revealed what hides under this Pokémon’s rag to a passing Trainer, who went home and died painfully that very night.
location.Sword: It wears a rag fashioned into a Pikachu costume in an effort to look less scary. Unfortunately, the costume only makes it creepier.
location.Shield: There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyu’s old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.

name: Togedemaru
desc: Togedemaru is an Electric/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Roly-Poly Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When it’s surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its capacity to produce electricity is somewhat limited, so it gets charged up by letting lightning strike it!
pokedex_entries.Sword: With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon takes in electricity from other electric Pokémon. It stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

name: Turtonator
desc: Turtonator is a Fire/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Blast Turtle Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It lives in volcanoes and eats sulfur and other minerals. Materials from the food it eats form the basis of its explosive shell.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its exploding shell poses a real danger but is sensitive to moisture. On rainy days, Turtonator takes silent refuge in caves.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.

location.Sword: Lake of Outrage
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Komala
desc: Komala is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Drowsing Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The log it holds was given to it by its parents at birth. It has also been known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It stays asleep from the moment it’s born. When it falls into a deep sleep, it stops moving altogether.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.

name: Minior
desc: Minior is a Rock/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Meteor Pokémon.

name: Silvally
desc: Silvally is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Synthetic Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This is its form once it has awakened and evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is greatly increased.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.
pokedex_entries.Sword: A solid bond of trust between this Pokémon and its Trainer awakened the strength hidden within Silvally. It can change its type at will.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

location.Sun: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
location.Moon: Upon awakening, its RKS System is activated. By employing specific memories, this Pokémon can adapt its type to confound its enemies.
location.Ultra Sun: Having been awakened successfully, it can change its type and battle—just like a certain Pokémon depicted in legends.
location.Ultra Moon: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
location.Sword: Thanks to its awakened powers, it can change to the <Type> type to match the memory it has equipped.
location.Shield: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory it’s holding. This is its <Type>-type form.

name: Type: Null
desc: Type: Null is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Synthetic Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Due to the danger that this synthetic Pokémon may go on a rampage, it wears a control mask to restrain its power.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: A Pokémon weapon developed for a specific mission, it went berserk during an experiment, so it was cryogenically frozen.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: There’s danger of its going on a rampage, so its true power is sealed away beneath its control mask.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Rumor has it that the theft of top-secret research notes led to a new instance of this Pokémon being created in the Galar region.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.

name: Pyukumuku
desc: Pyukumuku is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Sea Cucumber Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
pokedex_entries.Moon: These Pokémon line the beaches. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The tradition known as Pyukumuku chucking started from the custom of throwing Pyukumuku back into the sea after they wash onshore.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its entire body is covered in its own slime. If you accidentally step on one, you’ll slip, and it will get mad and smack you!
pokedex_entries.Sword: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.

location.SwordShield: Route 9, South Lake Miloch, Giant's Seat

name: Palossand
desc: Palossand is a Ghost/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Sand Castle Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 187 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)226 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)134 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Each of its grains of sand has its own will. Palossand eats small Pokémon and siphons away their vital essence while they’re still alive.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Once it has whipped up a sandstorm to halt its opponents in their tracks, this terrifying Pokémon snatches away their vitality.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Palossand is known as the Beach Nightmare. It pulls its prey down into the sand by controlling the sand itself, and then it sucks out their souls.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates water. Palossand can’t maintain its castle-like shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.

name: Sandygast
desc: Sandygast is a Ghost/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Sand Heap Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 186 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)225 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)133 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It likes the shovel on its head, so Sandygast will get serious and fight any children who come to take it back.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: If you build sand mounds when you’re playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Grudges of the dead have possessed a mound of sand and become a Pokémon. Sandygast is fond of the shovel on its head.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes control of anyone who puts their hand into its mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.

name: Golisopod
desc: Golisopod is a Bug/Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Hard Scale Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 183 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)222 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)233 (Sword/Shield)125 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It battles skillfully with its six arms, but spends most of its time peacefully meditating in caves deep beneath the sea.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The shell covering its body is as hard as diamond. This Pokémon will do anything it takes to win.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its claws, which it can extend and retract at will, are its greatest weapons. Golisopod is sometimes accompanied by Wimpod.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It will do anything to win, taking advantage of every opening and finishing opponents off with the small claws on its front legs.
pokedex_entries.Shield: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.

name: Wimpod
desc: Wimpod is a Bug/Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Turn Tail Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 182 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)221 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)232 (Sword/Shield)124 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its habitat varies from beaches to seabeds. A natural scavenger, it will gleefully chow down on anything edible, no matter how rotten.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It will pick up anything it finds on the ground. Sometimes it finds coins, so Murkrow and Meowth will go after it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: An astonishingly cowardly Pokémon, Wimpod will whir its legs at high speeds to run away if anything comes near it.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s nature’s cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.

location.SunMoon: Route 8, Poni Wilds, Poni Breaker Coast
location.Ultra SunUltra Moon: Route 8, Poni Breaker Coast, Dividing Peak Tunnel
location.SwordShield: Bridge Field, Giant's Mirror, Hammerlocke Hills, Motostoke Riverbank, Galar Mine No. 2, Courageous Cavern

name: Passimian
desc: Passimian is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Teamwork Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 177 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)216 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)343 (Sword/Shield)090 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: They use their saliva to stick leaves to their shoulders. You can tell what troop they belong to from the position of the leaves.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Berries are its weapons as well as the staple of its diet. The one that can throw a berry the farthest is the boss of the troop.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Displaying amazing teamwork, they follow the orders of their boss as they all help out in the search for their favorite berries.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.

location.Sword: Glimwood Tangle, Forest of Focus
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Oranguru
desc: Oranguru is a Normal/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Sage Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 176 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)215 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)342 (Sword/Shield)089 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it’s best suited to veteran Trainers.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It normally spends its time meditating in the treetops. It throws Poké Balls and gives other Pokémon orders as it pleases.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Oranguru don’t get along with each other, so they’re always engaging in battles of wits to decide which one is superior.
pokedex_entries.Sword: With waves of its fan—made from leaves and its own fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to other Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Glimwood Tangle, Forest of Focus

name: Comfey
desc: Comfey is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Posy Picker Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 174 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)210 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)079 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokémon is a hit with many people.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It stretches sticky vines out from its head and picks flowers to adorn itself with. When it doesn’t have any flowers, it feels uneasy.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It picks flowers and sticks them to its body with fluids it produces. The aroma that wafts from its petals has a healing effect.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won’t wither once they’re attached to a Comfey.
pokedex_entries.Shield: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.

name: Tsareena
desc: Tsareena is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Fruit Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Leaf Guard2. Queenly MajestySweet Veil (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sun: Its long, striking legs aren’t just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
pokedex_entries.Moon: A Pokémon known for the beauty of its well-shaped legs, it sometimes appears as a mascot in advertisements for beauty salons.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: A master of grand and beautiful kicks, it can knock out even kickboxing champions with a single blow.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: A Pokémon with an aggressive personality and a mastery of kicking, it cackles every time it kicks an opponent.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This feared Pokémon has long, slender legs and a cruel heart. It shows no mercy as it stomps on its opponents.
pokedex_entries.Shield: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon’s legs leaves a wound in the opponent’s body and soul that will never heal.

name: Steenee
desc: Steenee is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Fruit Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon is always bouncing around energetically. Other Pokémon are attracted by its lively appearance and pleasant aroma.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s protected by its hard sepals, so it plays with bird Pokémon without worry. They peck it relentlessly, but it doesn’t care.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It bounces around, swinging the sepals on its head with abandon. They’re quite painful when they smack you!
pokedex_entries.Sword: As it twirls like a dancer, a sweet smell spreads out around it. Anyone who inhales the scent will feel a surge of happiness.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.

name: Bounsweet
desc: Bounsweet is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Fruit Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Although it’s too sugary for human consumption, Bounsweet’s sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Because of its sweet, delicious aroma, bird Pokémon are always after it, but it’s not intelligent enough to care.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It tries to resist being swallowed by a bird Pokémon by spinning the sepals on its head. It’s usually a fruitless attempt.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its body gives off a sweet, fruity scent that is extremely appetizing to bird Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.

location.SwordShield: Rolling Fields, East Lake Axewell, Dappled Grove, West Lake Axewell, Stony Wilderness, Watchtower Ruins

name: Bewear
desc: Bewear is a Normal/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Strong Arm Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It waves its hands wildly in intimidation and warning. Life is over for anyone who doesn’t run away as fast as possible.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It boasts tremendous physical strength. Many people call it the most dangerous Pokémon in the Alola region.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show its affection with a hug. Letting it do that is dangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.

location.SwordShield: Axew's Eye, Giant's Seat, Lake of Outrage

name: Stufful
desc: Stufful is a Normal/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Flailing Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.
pokedex_entries.Moon: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. It’s an incredibly dangerous Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It boasts power enough to split large trees in half. The organ on its rear releases an odor that it uses to communicate with others of its kind.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Stufful hates to be hugged or touched in any way. It will squirm, thrash, and resist with amazing power.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.

location.SwordShield: Route 5, East Lake Axewell, Bridge Field, Dappled Grove, Giant's Seat, Hammerlocke Hills, North Lake Miloch

name: Salazzle
desc: Salazzle is a Poison/Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Toxic Lizard Pokémon.

name_origin.salamander: lizard-like amphibian (also a mythical fire-dwelling creature)

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 162 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)196 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)245 (Sword/Shield)160 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It punishes Salandit that couldn’t bring it food with a fierce slap of its flame-spewing palm.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.

location.Ultra Moon: Wela Volcano Park, Lush Jungle, Heahea Beach

name: Salandit
desc: Salandit is a Poison/Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Toxic Lizard Pokémon.

name_origin.salamander: lizard-like amphibian (also a mythical fire-dwelling creature)

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 161 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)195 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)244 (Sword/Shield)159 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can’t evolve.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It weakens opponents and sends them reeling with its poisonous gas. Salandit doesn’t deal well with Spinda, since it’s always reeling.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its venom sacs produce a fluid that this Pokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail. This process creates Salandit’s poisonous gas.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.

location.Ultra SunUltra Moon: Route 8, Wela Volcano Park, Lush Jungle
location.Sword: Stony Wilderness, Challenge Road
location.Shield: Motostoke Outskirts, Motostoke Riverbank, Stony Wilderness, Challenge Road

name: Shiinotic
desc: Shiinotic is a Grass/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Illuminating Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It puts its prey to sleep and siphons off their vitality through the tip of its arms. If one of its kind is weakened, it helps by sending it vitality.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When it starts fighting for territory with Parasect, the entire area gets completely coated in spores!
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to sleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing, it drains their vitality with its fingertips.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.

name: Morelull
desc: Morelull is a Grass/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Illuminating Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
pokedex_entries.Moon: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It scatters its shining spores around itself. Even though they’re dangerous, nighttime tours of forests where Morelull live are popular.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It likes damp dark places. When night falls, the spores filling the caps of its mushrooms glow.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Pokémon living in the forest eat the delicious caps on Morelull’s head. The caps regrow overnight.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.

name: Lurantis
desc: Lurantis is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Bloom Sickle Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 144 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)177 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)018 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis’s vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: For self-protection, it pretends to be a bug Pokémon. Both of its arms bear keen-edged petals.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: As it slashes into its enemies, it looks like it’s dancing. Its elegant appearance has led some to call it the most glamorous Grass Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon resembles a beautiful flower. A properly raised Lurantis will have gorgeous, brilliant colors.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The petals on this Pokémon’s arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.

name: Fomantis
desc: Fomantis is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Sickle Grass Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 143 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)176 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)017 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When the sun rises, Fomantis spreads its four leaves and bathes in the sunlight. The tip of its head has a pleasant aroma.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It loves the sunshine. When it basks in the sunlight regularly, it grows up with vivid coloration.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When bathed in sunlight, this Pokémon emits a pleasantly sweet scent, which causes bug Pokémon to gather around it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around at night.

location.SwordShield: Challenge Beach, Fields of Honor, Forest of Focus, Soothing Wetlands, Training Lowlands

name: Araquanid
desc: Araquanid is a Water/Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Water Bubble Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 142 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)175 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)215 (Sword/Shield)092 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Sun: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It usually passes its time in the water. When its belly is full, it stores its subdued prey in the water bubble on its head.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It has a habit of storing things it values in its water bubble. If its Trainer doesn’t watch out, Araquanid will try to put them in its bubble!
pokedex_entries.Sword: It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning prey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then take its time to savor its meal.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.

location.SwordShield: Lake of Outrage, Giant's Bed, Old Cemetery, Giant's Foot, Frigid Sea, Three-Point Pass, Ballimere Lake

name: Dewpider
desc: Dewpider is a Water/Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Water Bubble Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 141 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)174 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)214 (Sword/Shield)091 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Sun: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
pokedex_entries.Moon: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other’s way.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It can only breathe oxygen that has dissolved in water, so it wears a water bubble on its head when it walks around on land.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body and then covers its head with it. Meeting another Dewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.

location.SwordShield: Route 5, Motostoke Riverbank, Stony Wilderness, Giant's Bed, Old Cemetery, Giant's Foot, Frigid Sea, Three-Point Pass, Ballimere Lake

name: Mudsdale
desc: Mudsdale is a Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Draft Horse Pokémon.

name_origin.Clydesdale: a large, heavy breed of horse

pokedex_entries.Sun: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It remains calm and unmoving no matter the situation. It mixes dirt with the saliva in its mouth to make a special kind of mud.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It can trudge mountain roads without rest for three days and three nights, all the while dragging a 10-ton load.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale’s legs sets harder than stone. It’s so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.

location.SwordShield: Axew's Eye, Dusty Bowl, Giant's Seat

name: Mudbray
desc: Mudbray is a Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Donkey Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: The mud stuck to Mudbray’s hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It loves playing in the mud. If it isn’t showered with mud on a daily basis, it gets stressed out and stops listening to its Trainer.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Possessing mighty power, Mudbray can be loaded with 50 times its own body weight and will be totally fine.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Loads weighing up to 50 times as much as its own body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon. It’s skilled at making use of mud.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.

location.SwordShield: Route 3, Rolling Fields, South Lake Miloch, East Lake Axewell, Dappled Grove, West Lake Axewell, Giant's Cap, Giant's Seat, North Lake Miloch

name: Toxapex
desc: Toxapex is a Poison/Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Brutal Star Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 114 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)137 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)308 (Sword/Shield)128 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Those attacked by Toxapex’s poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: To attack, this Pokémon sends toxic spikes flying at its enemies. Ones that come close get mown down by the claws on its feet.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: With its 12 legs, it creates a dome to shelter within. The flow of the tides doesn’t affect Toxapex in there, so it’s very comfortable.
pokedex_entries.Sword: To survive in the cold waters of Galar, this Pokémon forms a dome with its legs, enclosing its body so it can capture its own body heat.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.

name: Mareanie
desc: Mareanie is a Poison/Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Brutal Star Pokémon.

name_origin.marine: of or relating to the sea

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 113 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)136 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)307 (Sword/Shield)127 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Sun: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It’s found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola’s head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: They eat Corsola branches, so Mareanie are hated by craftsmen who work with Corsola branches that have naturally fallen off.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Aside from its head, its body parts regenerate quickly if they’re cut off. After a good night’s sleep, Mareanie is back to normal.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The first symptom of its sting is numbness. The next is an itching sensation so intense that it’s impossible to resist the urge to claw at your skin.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.

location.SwordShield: Route 9, Giant's Mirror, Motostoke Riverbank, Loop Lagoon

name: Wishiwashi
desc: Wishiwashi is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Small Fry Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 110 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)133 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)155 (Sword/Shield)110 (The Isle of Armor)

name: Lycanroc
desc: Lycanroc is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Wolf Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 104 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)127 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)158 (The Isle of Armor)

name: Rockruff
desc: Rockruff is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Puppy Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 103 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)126 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)157 (The Isle of Armor)

name: Ribombee
desc: Ribombee is a Bug/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Bee Fly Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Honey Gather2. Shield DustSweet Veil (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sun: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Some of Ribombee’s pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Rain makes pollen damp, so Ribombee hates rain. When it sees ominous clouds, it finds a hollow in a tree, where it waits stock-still.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It can predict the weather from moisture levels and wind direction. Ribombee only reveals itself when there are a few clear days in a row.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar. The puffs’ effects depend on the type of ingredients and how much of each one is used.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.

location.Ultra Sun: Ula'ula Meadow, Poni Meadow, Heahea Beach

name: Cutiefly
desc: Cutiefly is a Bug/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Bee Fly Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Honey Gather2. Shield DustSweet Veil (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sun: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it’s able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. In fields of flowers, it gets into skirmishes with Butterfree over food.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Cutiefly can pick up the auras of living things. It skillfully reads those auras to predict its foes’ movements and make fools of them.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. You can find Cutiefly hovering around Gossifleur, trying to get some of Gossifleur’s pollen.
pokedex_entries.Shield: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.

location.SwordShield: Route 4, Bridge Field, Giant's Mirror, Motostoke Riverbank

name: Oricorio
desc: Oricorio is a Fire/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Dancing Pokémon.

name: Crabominable
desc: Crabominable is a Fighting/Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Woolly Crab Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Hyper Cutter2. Iron FistAnger Point (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sun: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.

name: Crabrawler
desc: Crabrawler is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Boxing Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Hyper Cutter2. Iron FistAnger Point (hidden ability)
