pokedex_entries.Sun: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.

location.SunMoon: Route 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 10, 12, 15, 16, 17, Berry Fields, Poni Wilds, Poni Plains
location.Ultra SunUltra Moon: Route 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 10, 16, 17, Berry Fields, Poni Wilds, Poni Plains, Ula'ula Beach

name: Vikavolt
desc: Vikavolt is a Bug/Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Stag Beetle Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It has an organ that generates electricity in its abdomen. It concentrates energy in its strong jaws and fires off powerful jolts of electricity.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Vikavolt flusters opponents with acrobatic flying maneuvers. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electric beam attack.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it through its jaws, and then fires the electricity off in concentrated beams.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.

name: Charjabug
desc: Charjabug is a Bug/Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Battery Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
pokedex_entries.Moon: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It buries itself in fallen leaves and barely moves, munching away on humus. If you accidentally step on one, you’ll get a shock!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its stout shell provides excellent defense from attacks. It uses electricity on persistent opponents.
pokedex_entries.Sword: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.

location.SwordShield: Axew's Eye, Dusty Bowl, Hammerlocke Hills

name: Grubbin
desc: Grubbin is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Larva Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: If you find its nest, you shouldn’t stick your hand inside. You’ll get bitten by an irritated Grubbin.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It spits a sticky thread to stop opponents in their tracks, and then it grabs them in its sharp, sturdy mandibles to take them down.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may flee rather than risk getting caught in its large mandibles that can snap thick tree branches.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.

location.SwordShield: Route 1, East Lake Axewell, Slumbering Weald, Dappled Grove, North Lake Miloch, Watchtower Ruins

name: Gumshoos
desc: Gumshoos is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Stakeout Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it’s always snoozing by nightfall.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it’s diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémon boasts incredible patience.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it wasn’t originally found in Alola, this Pokémon was brought over a long time ago when there was a huge Rattata outbreak.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!

location.SunMoon: Route 10, 11, 14, 15, 16, 17, Akala Outskirts, Tapu Village, Malie City, Poni Wilds, Ancient Poni Path, Poni Grove, Poni Plains, Poni Gauntlet
location.Ultra Sun: Route 8, 10, 14, 15, 16, 17, Akala Outskirts, Tapu Village, Mount Lanakila, Poni Plains, Heahea Beach
location.Ultra Moon: Route 8, 10, 14, 15, 16, 17, Akala Outskirts, Tapu Village, Mount Lanakila, Poni Plains

name: Yungoos
desc: Yungoos is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Loitering Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its stomach takes up most of its long torso. It’s a big eater, so the amount Trainers have to spend on its food is no laughing matter.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.

name: Toucannon
desc: Toucannon is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Cannon Pokémon.

name_origin.toucan: brightly colored bird with a large beak

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Keen Eye2. Skill LinkSheer Force (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Sun: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: They smack beaks with others of their kind to communicate. The strength and number of hits tell each other how they feel.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.

name: Trumbeak
desc: Trumbeak is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Bugle Beak Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.
pokedex_entries.Moon: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It can bend the tip of its beak to produce over a hundred different cries at will.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.

location.SunMoonUltra SunUltra Moon: Route 8, 11, Lush Jungle, Poni Grove, Poni Plains

name: Pikipek
desc: Pikipek is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Woodpecker Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It pecks at trees with its hard beak. You can get some idea of its mood or condition from the rhythm of its pecking.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

name: Primarina
desc: Primarina is a Water/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Soloist Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon’s Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony in song.
pokedex_entries.Sword: With its mouth, it makes sonic waves that sound like beautiful singing. It uses the sonic waves to control its water balloons.
pokedex_entries.Shield: For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.

name: Brionne
desc: Brionne is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Pop Star Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It gets excited when it sees a dance it doesn’t know. This hard worker practices diligently until it can learn that dance.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.
pokedex_entries.Sword: As if dancing, it artfully dodges the attacks of its enemies. All the while, it’s busy forming a bunch of balloons to overwhelm its foes.
pokedex_entries.Shield: On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance with one another to the singing of the Primarina that’s leading them.

name: Popplio
desc: Popplio is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Sea Lion Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It’s famous for being a hard worker.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons to jump higher. It’s quite the acrobatic fighter!
pokedex_entries.Sword: It creates special bouncy balloons to send at its opponents. When the balloons pop, the sheer force of their bursting is what deals damage.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.

name: Incineroar
desc: Incineroar is a Fire/Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Heel Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it’s not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer’s orders with complete nonchalance.
pokedex_entries.Moon: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it’s rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It excels at violent, no-holds-barred battles. The temperature of the flames that issue from its navel exceeds 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Incineroar’s rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.

name: Torracat
desc: Torracat is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Fire Cat Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokémon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer’s whole body covered in scratches.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it’s feeling good. When it isn’t feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.
pokedex_entries.Sword: In the midst of battle, the fire pouch on Torracat’s neck rings like a bell and produces stronger flames than usual.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.

name: Litten
desc: Litten is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Fire Cat Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It doesn’t allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won’t open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It spends even the smallest amount of downtime grooming its fur with its tongue. Loose fur gathers in its stomach and serves as fuel for fiery moves.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.

name: Decidueye
desc: Decidueye is a Grass/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Arrow Quill Pokémon.

name: Dartrix
desc: Dartrix is a Grass/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Blade Quill Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sun: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don’t groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It throws one knifelike feather after another at its enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak point. These feathers are known as blade quills.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It never slacks when it comes to the task of cleaning its feathers. Thorough preening keeps it looking spiffy and its blade quills nice and sharp.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.

name: Rowlet
desc: Rowlet is a Grass/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 7. It is known as the Grass Quill Pokémon.

name_origin.arrow: thin weapon shot from a bow

pokedex_entries.Sun: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Silently it glides, drawing near its targets. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer’s pocket or bag as a nest.
pokedex_entries.Sword: At a distance, it launches its sharp feathers while flying about. If the enemy gets too close, Rowlet switches tactics and delivers vicious kicks.
pokedex_entries.Shield: During the day, it builds up energy via photosynthesis. At night, it flies silently through the sky, on the prowl for prey.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.

name: Volcanion
desc: Volcanion is a Fire/Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Steam Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

name: Hoopa
desc: Hoopa is a Psychic/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Mischief Pokémon.

name: Diancie
desc: Diancie is a Rock/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Jewel Pokémon.

name: Zygarde
desc: Zygarde is a Dragon/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Order Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 150 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)205 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)263 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)

name: Yveltal
desc: Yveltal is a Dark/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Destruction Pokémon.

name_origin.Y: letter; game in which Yveltal appears

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

name: Xerneas
desc: Xerneas is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Life Pokémon.

name_origin.X: letter; game in which Xerneas appears
name_origin.Cernunnos: Celtic god based on a deer (itself from the Latin ‘cervus’)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

name: Noivern
desc: Noivern is a Flying/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Sound Wave Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 114 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)084 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)177 (Sword/Shield)182 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it has a violent disposition, if you give it a nice ripe fruit that it loves, Noivern will suddenly become tame.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This hot-blooded Pokémon attacks anything it sees with ultrasonic waves that can crush boulders.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Aggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly torment enemies that are helpless in the dark.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.

location.SwordShield: Lake of Outrage, Ballimere Lake, Lakeside Cave

name: Noibat
desc: Noibat is a Flying/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Sound Wave Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 113 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)083 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)176 (Sword/Shield)181 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Fruits are its favorite foods. This gourmet carefully picks out just the ripe ones using its sonar.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It flies around in search of fruit to eat. It uses ultrasonic waves to detect which fruits are ripe.
pokedex_entries.Sword: After nightfall, they emerge from the caves they nest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic waves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.

location.SwordShield: Bridge Field, Watchtower Ruins, Galar Mine No. 2

name: Avalugg
desc: Avalugg is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Iceberg Pokémon.

name_origin.vugg: small cavity in rock or ice

name: Bergmite
desc: Bergmite is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Ice Chunk Pokémon.

name_origin.stalagmite: column of ice rising from the floor of a cave

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It blocks opponents’ attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.
pokedex_entries.Sword: They chill the air around them to −150 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing the water in the air into ice that they use as armor.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon lives in areas of frigid cold. It secures itself to the back of an Avalugg by freezing its feet in place.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.

location.SwordShield: Route 9, Lake of Outrage, Frigid Sea, Three-Point Pass
location.Legends: Arceus: Arena's Approach, Avalugg's Legacy, Ice Column Chamber

name: Gourgeist
desc: Gourgeist is a Ghost/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Pumpkin Pokémon.

name: Pumpkaboo
desc: Pumpkaboo is a Ghost/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Pumpkin Pokémon.

name_origin.pumpkin: large orange fruit, often used at Halloween
name_origin.peek-a-boo: childish game involving hiding and suddenly reappearing

name: Trevenant
desc: Trevenant is a Ghost/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Elder Tree Pokémon.

name_origin.revenant: one who has returned from the dead

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 062 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)197 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)251 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)339 (Sword/Shield)034 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It’s kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.
pokedex_entries.Sun: This Pokémon is said to devour anyone daring to ravage the forest. To the creatures dwelling in the forest, it offers great kindness.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Through its roots, it exerts control over other trees. A deadly curse falls upon anyone cutting down trees in forests where Trevenant dwell.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s feared as a ghost of the forest. Lumberjacks bring along Fire types, which Trevenant hates, when they enter the forest.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This Pokémon controls trees via roots stretching from its feet, and it will attack anyone that dares to ravage the forest.
pokedex_entries.Sword: People fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.

name: Phantump
desc: Phantump is a Ghost/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Stump Pokémon.

name_origin.stump: remainder of a tree after being cut down

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 061 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)196 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)250 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)338 (Sword/Shield)033 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: According to old tales, these Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.
pokedex_entries.Sun: These Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died in the forest. Their cries sound like eerie screams.
pokedex_entries.Moon: According to legend, medicine to cure any illness can be made by plucking the green leaves on its head, brewing them, and boiling down the liquid.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: By imitating the voice of a child, it causes people to get hopelessly lost deep in the forest. It’s trying to make friends with them.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: An unknown spirit came to lodge in a tree stump, creating this Pokémon. A cure-all can be made from an infusion of its green leaves.
pokedex_entries.Sword: After a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s rebirth as this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.

location.SwordShield: Glimwood Tangle, Slippery Slope, Old Cemetery, Snowslide Slope, Giant's Foot, Three-Point Pass

name: Klefki
desc: Klefki is a Steel/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Key Ring Pokémon.

name_origin.key: piece of metal for opening locks

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 050 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)241 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)314 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)028 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.
pokedex_entries.Sun: This even-tempered Pokémon has a habit of collecting keys. It will sneak into people’s homes to steal their keys.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It inserts its horn into chinks in metal, absorbing metal ions. For some reason, it collects keys.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it’s unclear why it collects keys, giving it a key makes Klefki very happy. However, it apparently only likes master keys.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Long ago it lived in mines, but once the minerals that make up its diet became scarcer, Klefki began appearing in human settlements.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon is constantly collecting keys. Entrust a Klefki with important keys, and the Pokémon will protect them no matter what.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.

name: Goodra
desc: Goodra is a Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Dragon Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 021 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)180 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)219 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)391 (Sword/Shield)117 (Legends: Arceus)062 (The Isle of Armor)

name: Sliggoo
desc: Sliggoo is a Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Soft Tissue Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 020 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)179 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)218 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)390 (Sword/Shield)116 (Legends: Arceus)061 (The Isle of Armor)

name: Goomy
desc: Goomy is a Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Soft Tissue Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 019 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)178 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)217 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)389 (Sword/Shield)115 (Legends: Arceus)060 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn’t dry out.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It’s covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
pokedex_entries.Sun: The weakest of all Dragon-type Pokémon, it’s unable to breathe if its skin dries out, so it sticks to shady places.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it needs some thorough hand-washing.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It uses its horns to check out its surroundings. They’re very sensitive, so if you grab them, it will feel a strong shock and be unable to move.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its body is mostly water. If it dries out, it will die, so it’s always sitting with perfect stillness in the shade.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Because most of its body is water, it will dry up if the weather becomes too arid. It’s considered the weakest dragon Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as Goomy pick up any sign of enemies, they go into hiding. This is how they’ve survived.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Goomy hides away in the shade of trees, where it’s nice and humid. If the slime coating its body dries out, the Pokémon instantly becomes lethargic.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Lake of Outrage, Soothing Wetlands

name: Carbink
desc: Carbink is a Rock/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Jewel Pokémon.

name_origin.carbon: core element of diamond and other minerals

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 124 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)101 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)123 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)128 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It’s occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Some say that deep beneath the surface of the world, a pack of Carbink live with their queen in a kingdom of jewels.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: To keep the jewels on their bodies free of tarnish, packs of Carbink use their soft manes to polish one another’s jewels.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.

location.SunMoon: Ten Carat Hill, Vast Poni Canyon, Poké Pelago
location.Ultra SunUltra Moon: Ten Carat Hill, Vast Poni Canyon
location.SwordShield: Tunnel to the Top, Roaring-Sea Caves, Lakeside Cave

name: Dedenne
desc: Dedenne is an Electric/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Antenna Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 110 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)291 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)103 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It sneaks into people’s homes and steals electricity from their outlets. When your electric bill seems off, it’s the handiwork of this rascal.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its surroundings. Its lower whiskers are organs that shoot electricity.
pokedex_entries.Sword: A Dedenne’s whiskers pick up electrical waves other Dedenne send out. These Pokémon share locations of food or electricity with one another.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Since Dedenne can’t generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.

name: Hawlucha
desc: Hawlucha is a Fighting/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Wrestling Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It overwhelms opponents with quick moves, but sometimes it showboats for too long when it’s using a special move and gets itself into a pinch.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: In combat, Hawlucha leaps nimbly about, taking advantage of its opponents’ blind spots. It’s also skilled at using superb submission holds.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.

name: Sylveon
desc: Sylveon is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Intertwining Pokémon.

name_origin.sylph: an invisible spirit of the air; a fairy

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 085 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)131 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)161 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)204 (Sword/Shield)033 (Legends: Arceus)082 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around the arm of its beloved Trainer and walks with him or her.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura that weakens hostility in its prey, causing them to let down their guard. Then it attacks.
pokedex_entries.Moon: When this Pokémon sights its prey, it swirls its ribbonlike feelers as a distraction. A moment later, it pounces.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Once a fight breaks out, it will unflinchingly charge at dragon Pokémon that are many times larger than itself.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Sylveon wraps its ribbonlike feelers around its Trainer’s arm because this touch enables it to read its Trainer’s feelings.
pokedex_entries.Sword: By releasing enmity-erasing waves from its ribbonlike feelers, Sylveon stops any conflict.
pokedex_entries.Shield: There’s a Galarian fairy tale that describes a beautiful Sylveon vanquishing a dreadful dragon Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It emits a soothing aura from its ribbon-shaped organs. It wraps these appendages around quarrelers to instantly restore calm to the situation.

name: Aurorus
desc: Aurorus is a Rock/Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Tundra Pokémon.

name_origin.aurora: a luminous atmospheric phenomenon occurring in the arctic/antarctic

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 067 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)246 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)086 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent’s attack.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: An Aurorus was found frozen solid within a glacier, just as it appeared long ago, which became quite a big event in the news.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This usually quiet and kindly Pokémon has a surface temperature of around –240 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Aurorus was restored from a fossil. It’s said that when this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.

name: Amaura
desc: Amaura is a Rock/Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Tundra Pokémon.

name_origin.aurora: a luminous atmospheric phenomenon occurring in the arctic/antarctic

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 066 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)245 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)085 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It lived in cold areas in ancient times. It’s said that when Amaura whinnies, auroras appear in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Amaura was restored successfully, but it’s not expected to live long because of the heat of the current environment.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind in cold lands where there were fewer predators.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.

location.SwordShield: Slippery Slope, Frostpoint Field, Snowslide Slope

name: Tyrantrum
desc: Tyrantrum is a Rock/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Despot Pokémon.

name_origin.tantrum: a display of rage or frustration

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 065 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)244 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)084 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Complete restoration is impossible, allowing room for theories that its entire body was once covered in a feather-like coat.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The king of the ancient world, it can easily crunch a car with the devastating strength of its enormous jaws.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon is from about 100,000,000 years ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious but magnificent.
pokedex_entries.Shield: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.

name: Tyrunt
desc: Tyrunt is a Rock/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Royal Heir Pokémon.

name_origin.runt: the smallest of a litter of animals

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 064 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)243 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)083 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn’t like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its large jaw has incredible destructive power. Some theories suggest that its restored form is different from its form of long ago.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Tyrunt is spoiled and selfish. It may just be trying to frolic, but sometimes the ones it’s trying to frolic with are gravely injured.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern times. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear apart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.

name: Heliolisk
desc: Heliolisk is an Electric/Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Generator Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Dry Skin2. Sand VeilSolar Power (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.
pokedex_entries.Sword: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.
pokedex_entries.Shield: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

name: Helioptile
desc: Helioptile is an Electric/Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Generator Pokémon.

name_origin.reptile: cold-blooded creatures such as lizards and snakes

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Dry Skin2. Sand VeilSolar Power (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon’s electric moves.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.

name: Clawitzer
desc: Clawitzer is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Howitzer Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 033 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)350 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)197 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It compresses the water it has sucked up and then projects it with enough power to punch a hole right through a thick sheet of iron.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its right arm is packed with meat. When its pincer falls off, it’s exported to be used as a cooking ingredient.
pokedex_entries.Sword: After using the feelers on its oversized claw to detect the location of prey, Clawitzer launches a cannonball of water at its target.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Clawitzer’s right arm is a cannon that launches projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a Clawitzer’s cannon arm can sink a tanker.

location.Sword: Honeycalm Island, Honeycalm Sea, Insular Sea, Stepping-Stone Sea, Workout Sea
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Clauncher
desc: Clauncher is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Water Gun Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 032 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)349 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)196 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its claws occasionally fall off, and it keeps a low profile until they grow back. The meat of its claws is so delicious!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It moves around by jetting water from its right pincer. It has a poor sense of balance, so it’s terrible at swimming straight.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Clauncher’s claws can fall off during battle, but they’ll regenerate. The meat inside the claws is popular as a delicacy in Galar.
pokedex_entries.Shield: By detonating gas that accumulates in its right claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet. This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.

location.Sword: Honeycalm Island, Honeycalm Sea, Insular Sea, Stepping-Stone Sea, Workout Sea
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Dragalge
desc: Dragalge is a Poison/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Mock Kelp Pokémon.

name_origin.algae: aquatic plant family that includes seaweed

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 031 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)348 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)195 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This vicious Pokémon sprays a poisonous liquid on opponents that come near. For whatever reason, it gets along really well with Dhelmise.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It blends in with seaweed to ambush its prey and then takes them down with a poisonous liquid strong enough to melt metal.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Dragalge uses a poisonous liquid capable of corroding metal to send tankers that enter its territory to the bottom of the sea.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the ocean’s surface and bathing it in sunlight.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Honeycalm Island, Honeycalm Sea, Insular Sea, Stepping-Stone Sea, Workout Sea

name: Skrelp
desc: Skrelp is a Poison/Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Mock Kelp Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 030 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)347 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)194 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It vanishes into seaweed and remains perfectly still to avoid attacks from large Pokémon. Rotten seaweed is its main food source.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It’s not good at swimming, so it clings to the seaweed. In the Alola region, it’s often found near Dhelmise.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating seaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on the seaweed, Skrelp feasts on them instead.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Honeycalm Island, Honeycalm Sea, Insular Sea, Stepping-Stone Sea, Workout Sea

name: Barbaracle
desc: Barbaracle is a Rock/Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Collective Pokémon.

name_origin.barnacle: marine crustacean, typically attached to ship bottoms

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Barbaracle’s legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head’s orders.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Seven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.

location.SwordShield: Route 9, Dusty Bowl, Lake of Outrage

name: Binacle
desc: Binacle is a Rock/Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Two-Handed Pokémon.

name_origin.barnacle: marine crustacean, typically attached to ship bottoms

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.
pokedex_entries.Sword: After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.

location.Y: Route 8, 12, Cyllage City, Ambrette Town, Azure Bay
location.SwordShield: Bridge Field, Motostoke Riverbank, Galar Mine No. 2

name: Malamar
desc: Malamar is a Dark/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Overturning Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 011 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)027 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)291 (Sword/Shield)109 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When it comes to strong hypnosis, there’s an endless number of people who utilize Malamar for their nefarious deeds.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It flashes the pattern on its torso to control its prey and draw them in. The edges of its fins are supremely sharp.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer under Malamar’s control.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.

name: Inkay
desc: Inkay is a Dark/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Revolving Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 010 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)026 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)290 (Sword/Shield)108 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent’s will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It draws prey near with its blinking lights and then wraps them up in its long tentacles and holds them in place.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When exchanging information with others of its kind, it flashes the light-emitting spots on its body in a complex rhythm.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It spins while making its luminescent spots flash. These spots allow it to communicate with others by using different patterns of light.
pokedex_entries.Shield: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.

location.Ultra SunUltra Moon: Route 1, Poni Wilds, Ancient Poni Path, Poni Gauntlet
location.SwordShield: Route 7, 9, Bridge Field, Hammerlocke Hills, Challenge Beach, Fields of Honor, Loop Lagoon, Training Lowlands

name: Slurpuff
desc: Slurpuff is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Meringue Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human’s, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It’s like it can see with its nose!
pokedex_entries.Sword: By taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their mental and physical condition. It’s hoped that this skill will have many medical applications.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.

location.Sword: Evolve Swirlix
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Swirlix
desc: Swirlix is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Cotton Candy Pokémon.

name_origin.swirl: to move in a spiral shape

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It eats its own weight in sugar every day. If it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes incredibly grumpy.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.

location.Sword: Route 5, Glimwood Tangle, Giant's Mirror, Stony Wilderness
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Aromatisse
desc: Aromatisse is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Fragrance Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The scent that constantly emits from its fur is so powerful that this Pokémon’s companions will eventually lose their sense of smell.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Evolve Spritzee

name: Spritzee
desc: Spritzee is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Perfume Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.
pokedex_entries.Sword: A scent pouch within this Pokémon’s body allows it to create various scents. A change in its diet will alter the fragrance it produces.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Route 5, Glimwood Tangle, Giant's Mirror, Stony Wilderness

name: Aegislash
desc: Aegislash is a Steel/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Royal Sword Pokémon.

name: Doublade
desc: Doublade is a Steel/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Sword Pokémon.

name_origin.blade: the flat cutting part of a sword, etc.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.

name: Honedge
desc: Honedge is a Steel/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Sword Pokémon.

name_origin.edge: thin, sharp side of a blade

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person’s arm and drains that person’s life energy completely.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Honedge’s soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedge’s body.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people’s lives away.

name: Meowstic
desc: Meowstic is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Constraint Pokémon.

name_origin.mystic: of or relating to the occult or psychics

name: Espurr
desc: Espurr is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Restraint Pokémon.

name_origin.purr: sound a cat makes when content

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Though Espurr’s expression never changes, behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to contain its devastating psychic power.
pokedex_entries.Shield: There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.

name: Furfrou
desc: Furfrou is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Poodle Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s fur into the most exquisite style.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

location.Ultra SunUltra Moon: Route 2, Hau'oli City, Poni Wilds, Ancient Poni Path

name: Pangoro
desc: Pangoro is a Fighting/Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Daunting Pokémon.

name_origin.gorogoro: Japanese term for a rumbling sound

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 092 (X/Y — Central Kalos)221 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)285 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)112 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won’t put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It charges ahead and bashes its opponents like a berserker, uncaring about any hits it might take. Its arms are mighty enough to snap a telephone pole.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It boasts superb physical strength. Those who wish to become Pangoro’s Trainer have no choice but to converse with their fists.
pokedex_entries.Moon: From the slight twitches of its bamboo leaf, it deduces its opponent’s movements. It’s eager to tussle but kindhearted toward its companions.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This rowdy Pokémon boasts great physical strength. Many Trainers are also smitten by its lively character.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Pangoro is the type to talk with its fists. It doesn’t say much as it pummels opponents with enough force to send a dump truck flying.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.

name: Pancham
desc: Pancham is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Playful Pokémon.

name_origin.champion: fighter who has defeated all opponents

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 091 (X/Y — Central Kalos)220 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)284 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)111 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It does its level best to glare and pull a scary face, but it can’t help grinning if anyone pats its head.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It grows up imitating the behavior of Pangoro, which it looks up to as a leader.
pokedex_entries.Moon: There’s no point to the leaf in its mouth, aside from an effort to look cool. It’s mischievous, so it’s not well suited to inexperienced Trainers.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It follows Pangoro around like a henchman. When Pancham makes a big mistake, its leaf gets taken away.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It’s desperate to intimidate its opponents. Be nice and pretend to be scared if you catch it glaring at you intensely.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its master’s actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.

location.SwordShield: Route 3, Rolling Fields, East Lake Axewell, West Lake Axewell

name: Gogoat
desc: Gogoat is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Mount Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

name: Skiddo
desc: Skiddo is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Mount Pokémon.

name_origin.kiddo: slang for a child; ‘kid’ is a baby goat

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

name: Florges
desc: Florges is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Garden Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It controls the flowers it grows. The petal blizzards that Florges triggers are overwhelming in their beauty and power.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

name: Floette
desc: Floette is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Single Bloom Pokémon.

name_origin.florette: one of a cluster of small flowers

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It raises flowers and uses them as weapons. The more gorgeous the blossom, the more power it contains.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

location.Ultra Sun: The flower it’s holding can no longer be found blooming anywhere. It’s also thought to contain terrifying power.
location.Ultra Moon: Terrifying energy is concealed within its ominous flower, but Floette still swings it about innocently.

name: Flabébé
desc: Flabébé is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Single Bloom Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind’s embrace with an untroubled heart.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

name: Pyroar
desc: Pyroar is a Fire/Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Royal Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride’s cubs.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.

name: Litleo
desc: Litleo is a Fire/Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Lion Cub Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When they’re young, they live with a pride. Once they’re able to hunt prey on their own, they’re kicked out and have to make their own way.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.

name: Vivillon
desc: Vivillon is a Bug/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Scale Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Shield Dust2. Compound EyesFriend Guard (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

name: Spewpa
desc: Spewpa is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Scatterdust Pokémon.

name_origin.pupa: immobile cocoon stage of an insect

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

name: Scatterbug
desc: Scatterbug is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Scatterdust Pokémon.

name_origin.scatter: throw or distribute across a large area

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Shield Dust2. Compound EyesFriend Guard (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

name: Talonflame
desc: Talonflame is a Fire/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Scorching Pokémon.

name_origin.talon: a bird’s claw (especially birds of prey)

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 016 (X/Y — Central Kalos)160 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)194 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)024 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When attacking prey, it can reach speeds of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek. It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them firmly in its talons.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It zooms directly at its prey at flight speeds of close to 310 mph, while fiery embers scatter from gaps in its feathers.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its tough wings don’t allow fire to pass through them. A long time ago, firefighters’ outfits were made from Talonflame wings.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Bird Pokémon make up most of its diet. It approaches at high speeds and smacks them down to the ground with its powerful kick.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Talonflame mainly preys upon other bird Pokémon. To intimidate opponents, it sends embers spewing from gaps between its feathers.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to 310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks, giving the prey no chance to escape.

name: Fletchinder
desc: Fletchinder is a Fire/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Ember Pokémon.

name_origin.fletch: a feather, as used on a dart/arrow

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 015 (X/Y — Central Kalos)159 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)193 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)023 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The hotter the flame sac on its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.
pokedex_entries.Sun: From its beak, it fires embers at its prey. Once it has caught them, it grills them at high heat before feasting upon them.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It will not tolerate other Fletchinder entering its territory, which has a radius of several miles.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It scatters embers in the tall grass. Then bug Pokémon, frightened by the flames, come flying out, and Fletchinder gobbles them up.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its speed right after takeoff already puts it in the top speed class of all bird Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Fletchinder launches embers into the den of its prey. When the prey comes leaping out, Fletchinder’s sharp talons finish it off.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and aggressive. These Pokémon fight among themselves over feeding grounds.

location.SwordShield: Honeycalm Island, Honeycalm Sea, Insular Sea, Loop Lagoon, Stepping-Stone Sea, Workout Sea

name: Fletchling
desc: Fletchling is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Tiny Robin Pokémon.

name_origin.fletch: a feather, as used on a dart/arrow
name_origin.fledgling: a young bird learning to fly

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 014 (X/Y — Central Kalos)158 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)192 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)022 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it’s merciless to intruders that enter its territory.
pokedex_entries.Sun: This amiable Pokémon is easy to train. But when battle is joined, it shows its ferocious side.
pokedex_entries.Moon: When it’s excited, its temperature can double, spiking hormone production in its body.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: While it’s an amiable Pokémon, if you touch it unexpectedly, it will heat up its body in an instant, and you’ll be burned.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its body is always warm. Trainers who live in cold areas apparently sleep with it in their bed.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its melodious cries are actually warnings. Fletchling will mercilessly peck at anything that enters its territory.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When this Pokémon gets excited, its body temperature increases sharply. If you touch a Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.

location.SwordShield: Challenge Road, Loop Lagoon, Potbottom Desert

name: Diggersby
desc: Diggersby is a Normal/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Digging Pokémon.

name_origin.bunny: slang for rabbit, a small mammal with long ears

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it’s finished digging, it lounges lazily.
pokedex_entries.Sword: With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during tunnel construction.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.

location.SwordShield: Axew's Eye, Bridge Field, Giant's Cap, Giant's Mirror, Giant's Seat, North Lake Miloch

name: Bunnelby
desc: Bunnelby is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Digging Pokémon.

name_origin.bunny: slang for rabbit, a small mammal with long ears

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.

location.SwordShield: Rolling Fields, East Lake Axewell, Dappled Grove, West Lake Axewell, Giant's Cap, North Lake Miloch

name: Greninja
desc: Greninja is a Water/Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Ninja Pokémon.

name: Frogadier
desc: Frogadier is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Bubble Frog Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.

name: Froakie
desc: Froakie is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Bubble Frog Pokémon.

name_origin.croaky: husky, squawking noise made by frogs

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

name: Delphox
desc: Delphox is a Fire/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Fox Pokémon.

name_origin.Delphic oracle: the most important oracle in Greek mythology

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

name: Braixen
desc: Braixen is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Fox Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

name: Fennekin
desc: Fennekin is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Fox Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

name: Chesnaught
desc: Chesnaught is a Grass/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Spiny Armor Pokémon.

name_origin.chestnut: edible nut in a spiky shell

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

name: Quilladin
desc: Quilladin is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Spiny Armor Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.

name: Chespin
desc: Chespin is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 6. It is known as the Spiny Nut Pokémon.

name_origin.chestnut: edible nut in a spiky shell

pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.

name: Genesect
desc: Genesect is a Bug/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Paleozoic Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Over 300 million years ago, it was feared as the strongest of hunters. It has been modified by Team Plasma.
pokedex_entries.White: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

name: Meloetta
desc: Meloetta is a Normal/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Melody Pokémon.

name: Keldeo
desc: Keldeo is a Water/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Colt Pokémon.

name_origin.kelpie: a supernatural water horse from Celtic folklore
name_origin.rodeo: a public exhibition of cowboy skills

name: Kyurem
desc: Kyurem is a Dragon/Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Boundary Pokémon.

name: Landorus
desc: Landorus is a Ground/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Abundance Pokémon.

name_origin.-us: common cloud suffix; possession of a given quality

name: Zekrom
desc: Zekrom is a Dragon/Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Deep Black Pokémon.

name_origin.ze: used as a harder sound than ‘re’ to indicate a stronger character

pokedex_entries.Black: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.
pokedex_entries.White: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When the interior part of its tail spins like a motor, Zekrom can generate many bolts of lightning to blast its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Mythology tells us that if people lose the righteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms will be razed by Zekrom’s lightning.

name: Reshiram
desc: Reshiram is a Dragon/Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Vast White Pokémon.

name_origin.re: used as a softer sound than ‘ze’ to indicate a weaker character
