pokedex_entries.Black: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.
pokedex_entries.White: When Reshiram’s tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world’s weather.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When Reshiram’s tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world’s weather.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Flames spew from its tail as it flies through the sky like a jet airplane. It’s said that this Pokémon will scorch the world.
pokedex_entries.Shield: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, Reshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.

name: Thundurus
desc: Thundurus is an Electric/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Bolt Strike Pokémon.

name_origin.thunder: loud noise produced by a lightning strike
name_origin.-us: common cloud suffix; possession of a given quality

name: Tornadus
desc: Tornadus is a Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Cyclone Pokémon.

name_origin.-us: common cloud suffix; possession of a given quality

name: Virizion
desc: Virizion is a Grass/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Grassland Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: This Pokémon fought humans in order to protect its friends. Legends about it continue to be passed down.
pokedex_entries.White: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.
pokedex_entries.Sword: A legend tells of this Pokémon working together with Cobalion and Terrakion to protect the Pokémon of the Unova region.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.

name: Terrakion
desc: Terrakion is a Rock/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Cavern Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: This Pokémon came to the defense of Pokémon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.
pokedex_entries.White: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.

name: Cobalion
desc: Cobalion is a Steel/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Iron Will Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: This legendary Pokémon battled against humans to protect Pokémon. Its personality is calm and composed.
pokedex_entries.White: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon appears in a legend alongside Terrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in defense of the Unova region’s Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.

name: Volcarona
desc: Volcarona is a Bug/Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Sun Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona’s fire provided a replacement for the sun.
pokedex_entries.White: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Thought to be an embodiment of the sun, it appeared during a bitterly cold winter and saved Pokémon from freezing.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona’s fire provided a replacement for the sun.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: As it flies, it scatters its flaming scales. It was feared by ancient people, who referred to it as “the rage of the sun.”
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: According to legends, it was hatched from a flaming cocoon to save people and Pokémon that were suffering from the cold.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Volcarona scatters burning scales. Some say it does this to start fires. Others say it’s trying to rescue those that suffer in the cold.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon emerges from a cocoon formed of raging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as a deity of fire.

name: Larvesta
desc: Larvesta is a Bug/Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Torch Pokémon.

name_origin.larva: young feeding stage of an insect

pokedex_entries.Black: This Pokémon was believed to have been born from the sun. When it evolves, its entire body is engulfed in flames.
pokedex_entries.White: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Said to have been born from the sun, it spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Said to have been born from the sun, it spews fire from its horns and encases itself in a cocoon of fire when it evolves.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When battling opponents, it sprays fire from its five horns. The max temperature of the flames can reach nearly 5,500 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It protects itself with flame. Long years ago, people believed Larvesta had a nest on the sun.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The people of ancient times believed that Larvesta fell from the sun.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Larvesta’s body is warm all over. It spouts fire from the tips of its horns to intimidate predators and scare prey.

name: Hydreigon
desc: Hydreigon is a Dark/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Brutal Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. Anything that moves seems like a foe to it, triggering its attack.
pokedex_entries.White: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!
pokedex_entries.Sword: There are a slew of stories about villages that were destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything that moves.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into the opponent. Their attacks won’t slow until their target goes down.

location.Sword: Evolve Deino/Zweilous
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Zweilous
desc: Zweilous is a Dark/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Hostile Pokémon.

name_origin.jealous: envious (Zweilous’ heads fight with each other)

pokedex_entries.Black: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
pokedex_entries.White: Since their two heads do not get along and compete with each other for food, they always eat too much.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
pokedex_entries.Sword: While hunting for prey, Zweilous wanders its territory, its two heads often bickering over which way to go.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in scars even without battling others.

location.Sword: Lake of Outrage
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Deino
desc: Deino is a Dark/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Irate Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It tends to bite everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.
pokedex_entries.White: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When it encounters something, its first urge is usually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will commit the associated scent to memory.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Because it can’t see, this Pokémon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.

location.Sword: Lake of Outrage, Roaring-Sea Caves
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Durant
desc: Durant is a Bug/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Iron Ant Pokémon.

name_origin.durable: hard to break, does not wear easily

pokedex_entries.Black: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
pokedex_entries.White: Durant dig nests in mountains. They build their complicated, interconnected tunnels into mazes.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
pokedex_entries.Sword: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

location.Black 2White 2: Twist Mountain, Clay Tunnel, Underground Ruins
location.SwordShield: Route 6, Giant's Mirror, Lake of Outrage, Giant's Bed, Old Cemetery, Three-Point Pass

name: Heatmor
desc: Heatmor is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Anteater Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It breathes through a hole in its tail while it burns with an internal fire. Durant is its prey.
pokedex_entries.White: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant’s steel bodies and consume their insides.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant’s steel bodies and consume their insides.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.
pokedex_entries.Sword: There’s a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.
pokedex_entries.Shield: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.

location.SwordShield: Route 6, Giant's Mirror, Lake of Outrage, Giant's Bed, Old Cemetery, Three-Point Pass

name: Mandibuzz
desc: Mandibuzz is a Dark/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Bone Vulture Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 136 (Black/White)112 (Black 2/White 2)078 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)092 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)284 (Sword/Shield)182 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.
pokedex_entries.White: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest with ease.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest with ease.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They adorn themselves beautifully with bones. This is supposedly an effort to attract males, but no male Mandibuzz have ever been found.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It circles in the sky, keeping a keen eye out for Pokémon in a weakened state. Its choicest food is Cubone.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It skillfully arranges the bones of its prey to construct its nest. Most of the bones are Cubone.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It’s always searching for food for Vullaby. When it finds a weak Pokémon, Mandibuzz swoops it right off to its nest.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Although it’s a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they’re ready to leave the nest.
pokedex_entries.Shield: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Dusty Bowl, Lake of Outrage

name: Vullaby
desc: Vullaby is a Dark/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Diapered Pokémon.

name_origin.lullaby: a song used to lull people to sleep

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 135 (Black/White)111 (Black 2/White 2)077 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)091 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)283 (Sword/Shield)181 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.
pokedex_entries.White: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It protects its plump posterior with the bones of prey it has consumed. As it grows, it replaces the bones.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It can’t fly yet and must wait until its wings have developed more. Since it’s still at a playful age, it hops around friskily.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Mandibuzz gives it the bones it wears. Vullaby’s wings are short, so it can’t fly yet, but it jumps around, dreaming of wide open skies.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth spurts. It often has to replace the bones it wears as its size increases.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game

desc: Braviary is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Valiant Pokémon.

name_origin.aviary: a place where birds are kept

name: Rufflet
desc: Rufflet is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Eaglet Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 133 (Black/White)109 (Black 2/White 2)075 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)089 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)281 (Sword/Shield)221 (Legends: Arceus)179 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.
pokedex_entries.White: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It stands up to massive opponents, not out of courage, but out of recklessness. But that is how it gets stronger.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow stronger and more powerful each time they faint or are injured.
pokedex_entries.Moon: With its sharp claws, this Pokémon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, it’s a carnivore at heart.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: With its powerful legs and sturdy claws, it can crack even the hard shells of Shellder and pluck out their insides.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Known as a natural-born warrior, soon after its hatching, it will challenge its parent to a fight in order to gain their acceptance.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If it spies a strong Pokémon, Rufflet can’t resist challenging it to a battle. But if Rufflet loses, it starts bawling.
pokedex_entries.Shield: A combative Pokémon, it’s ready to pick a fight with anyone. It has talons that can crush hard berries.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its chick-like looks belie its hotheadedness. It challenges its parents at every opportunity, desperate to prove its strength.

location.Sword: Route 8, Bridge Field, Stony Wilderness, Potbottom Desert

name: Bouffalant
desc: Bouffalant is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Bash Buffalo Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
pokedex_entries.White: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They are known to charge so wildly that if a train were to enter their territory, they would send it flying.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
pokedex_entries.Sword: These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.
pokedex_entries.Shield: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.

name: Bisharp
desc: Bisharp is a Dark/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Sword Blade Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 131 (Black/White)224 (Black 2/White 2)049 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)338 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)247 (Sword/Shield)030 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: It leads a group of Pawniard. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.
pokedex_entries.White: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: No matter how strong the Bisharp, it’s said that if the blade on its head is chipped, it will retire from its position as the boss.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It leads a group of Pawniard. Bisharp doesn’t even change its expression when it deals the finishing blow to an opponent.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.

name: Pawniard
desc: Pawniard is a Dark/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Sharp Blade Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 130 (Black/White)223 (Black 2/White 2)048 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)337 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)246 (Sword/Shield)029 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.
pokedex_entries.White: They fight at Bisharp’s command. They cling to their prey and inflict damage by sinking their blades into it.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: After shredding its prey, it sharpens its blades on a stone by the river. Each Pawniard has its own favorite sharpening stone.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It follows Bisharp’s orders to a tee when it attacks enemies. After slashing an opponent, Pawniard clangs both of its blades together.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.
pokedex_entries.Shield: A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.

location.SwordShield: Route 8, Giant's Cap, Giant's Mirror, Motostoke Outskirts, Motostoke Riverbank, Stony Wilderness, Challenge Road, Forest of Focus, Potbottom Desert, Soothing Wetlands

name: Golurk
desc: Golurk is a Ground/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Automaton Pokémon.

name_origin.lurk: to lie or wait in concealment

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 129 (Black/White)272 (Black 2/White 2)092 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)313 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)089 (Sword/Shield)154 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.
pokedex_entries.White: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Golurk were created to protect people and Pokémon. They run on a mysterious energy.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Some say that ancient people invented Golurk to serve as a laborer. It follows its master’s orders faithfully.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When the seal on its chest is removed, it rages indiscriminately, turning the whole town around it into a mountain of rubble.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient castles served as perches from which Golurk could fire energy beams.
pokedex_entries.Shield: There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn’t been proven.

name: Golett
desc: Golett is a Ground/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Automaton Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 128 (Black/White)271 (Black 2/White 2)091 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)312 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)088 (Sword/Shield)153 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.
pokedex_entries.White: These Pokémon are thought to have been created by the science of an ancient and mysterious civilization.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It’s been active for thousands of years.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It’s been active for thousands of years.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its movements are powered by a mysterious energy. It has continued to move since ancient times, so its power may soon run out.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although ancient people apparently built it by working with clay, the source of its energy is unclear.
pokedex_entries.Sword: They were sculpted from clay in ancient times. No one knows why, but some of them are driven to continually line up boulders.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.

location.SwordShield: Route 8, Rolling Fields, Dappled Grove, Giant's Cap, Giant's Seat, North Lake Miloch, Stony Wilderness, Watchtower Ruins

name: Druddigon
desc: Druddigon is a Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Cave Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Rough Skin2. Sheer ForceMold Breaker (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 127 (Black/White)270 (Black 2/White 2)141 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)374 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)063 (The Isle of Armor)119 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.
pokedex_entries.White: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It runs through the narrow tunnels formed by Excadrill and Onix. It uses its sharp claws to catch prey.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The red skin on its face is harder than rock. In narrow caves, it squares off against its enemies and charges face-first right into them.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It infiltrates tunnels that Pokémon like Diglett and Dugtrio have dug and quietly waits for prey to pass through.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips sunbathing—it won’t be able to move if its body gets too cold.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.

location.SwordShield: Snowslide Slope, Path to the Peak, Three-Point Pass

name: Mienshao
desc: Mienshao is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Martial Arts Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 126 (Black/White)220 (Black 2/White 2)004 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)360 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)164 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.
pokedex_entries.White: They use the long fur on their arms as a whip to strike their opponents.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It overwhelms its opponents with continuous attacks and then slowly stores up power before delivering the finishing blow.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When Mienshao lets out a bizarre wail, you’re in danger. A flurry of kicks and chops too fast to see is about to be unleashed!
pokedex_entries.Sword: When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging opponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the fur on its arms.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.

name: Mienfoo
desc: Mienfoo is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Martial Arts Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 125 (Black/White)219 (Black 2/White 2)003 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)359 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)163 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.
pokedex_entries.White: They have mastered elegant combos. As they concentrate, their battle moves become swifter and more precise.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: They can often be seen in packs in the morning, slowly moving their bodies through a series of poses.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: They seclude themselves in the mountains and devote themselves to training. The form of their kicks and chops differs from pack to pack.
pokedex_entries.Sword: In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop with its arms more than 100 times.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.

name: Stunfisk
desc: Stunfisk is a Ground/Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Trap Pokémon.

name: Accelgor
desc: Accelgor is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Shell Out Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 123 (Black/White)158 (Black 2/White 2)025 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)276 (Sword/Shield)065 (The Isle of Armor)098 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.
pokedex_entries.White: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When its body dries out, it weakens. So it wraps a membrane around itself for protection while it spits poison.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.

name: Shelmet
desc: Shelmet is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Snail Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 122 (Black/White)157 (Black 2/White 2)024 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)275 (Sword/Shield)064 (The Isle of Armor)097 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: When attacked, it defends itself by closing the lid of its shell. It can spit a sticky, poisonous liquid.
pokedex_entries.White: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell. This reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast, however, because they can still get into the shell.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.

location.Black 2White 2: Route 6, 8, 11, Icirrus City, Moor of Icirrus

name: Cryogonal
desc: Cryogonal is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Crystallizing Pokémon.

name_origin.cryogenic: of or relating to very low temperatures

pokedex_entries.Black: When its body temperature goes up, it turns into steam and vanishes. When its temperature lowers, it returns to ice.
pokedex_entries.White: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148° F.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Sword: With its icy chains, Cryogonal freezes those it encounters. It then takes its victims away to somewhere unknown.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When the weather gets hot, these Pokémon turn into water vapor. Cryogonal are almost never seen during summer.

location.SwordShield: Slippery Slope, Frostpoint Field, Giant's Bed, Old Cemetery, Snowslide Slope, Giant's Foot, Frigid Sea, Three-Point Pass, Ballimere Lake

name: Beartic
desc: Beartic is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Freezing Pokémon.

name_origin.arctic: frozen region at the very top of the Earth

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Snow Cloak2. Slush RushSwift Swim (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Black: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.
pokedex_entries.White: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways across the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways across the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It swims through frigid seas, searching for prey. From its frozen breath, it forms icy fangs that are harder than steel.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It swims energetically through frigid seas. When it gets tired, it freezes the seawater with its breath so it can rest on the ice.

name: Cubchoo
desc: Cubchoo is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Chill Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.
pokedex_entries.White: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When this Pokémon is in good health, its snot becomes thicker and stickier. It will smear its snot on anyone it doesn’t like.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It sniffles before performing a move, using its frosty snot to provide an icy element to any move that needs it.

location.SwordShield: Route 10, Bridge Field, Dusty Bowl, Giant's Mirror, Hammerlocke Hills, Stony Wilderness

name: Haxorus
desc: Haxorus is a Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Axe Jaw Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
pokedex_entries.White: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its tusks are incredibly destructive. They can easily slice through a thick, sturdy steel column every time.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its resilient tusks are its pride and joy. It licks up dirt to take in the minerals it needs to keep its tusks in top condition.
pokedex_entries.Shield: While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if angered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams are how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.

name: Fraxure
desc: Fraxure is a Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Axe Jaw Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they’ve been fighting.
pokedex_entries.White: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.
pokedex_entries.Sword: After battle, this Pokémon carefully sharpens its tusks on river rocks. It needs to take care of its tusks—if one breaks, it will never grow back.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure’s favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents, stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.

name: Axew
desc: Axew is a Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Tusk Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
pokedex_entries.White: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its large tusks have a tendency to break, but each time they grow back, they grow in harder and sturdier.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.
pokedex_entries.Sword: These Pokémon nest in the ground and use their tusks to crush hard berries. Crushing berries is also how they test each other’s strength.
pokedex_entries.Shield: They play with each other by knocking their large tusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but they grow back so quickly that it isn’t a concern.

location.Sword: Route 6, Axew's Eye, Hammerlocke Hills
location.Shield: Route 6, Axew's Eye

name: Chandelure
desc: Chandelure is a Ghost/Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Luring Pokémon.

name_origin.lure: attract or entice, often for evil means

pokedex_entries.Black: It absorbs a spirit, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.
pokedex_entries.White: Being consumed in Chandelure’s flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Being consumed in Chandelure’s flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.
pokedex_entries.Shield: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it’s said.

name: Lampent
desc: Lampent is a Ghost/Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Lamp Pokémon.

name_origin.lamp: device producing light, usually via a flame

pokedex_entries.Black: This ominous Pokémon is feared. Through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen.
pokedex_entries.White: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon appears just before someone passes away, so it’s feared as an emissary of death.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.

location.SwordShield: Lake of Outrage, Giant's Bed, Old Cemetery

name: Litwick
desc: Litwick is a Ghost/Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Candle Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.
pokedex_entries.White: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when it absorbs life force from people or Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The flame on its head keeps its body slightly warm. This Pokémon takes lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.

name: Beheeyem
desc: Beheeyem is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Cerebral Pokémon.

initials for ‘Bug Eyed Monster’, i.e. an alien

pokedex_entries.Black: It can manipulate an opponent’s memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.
pokedex_entries.White: It uses psychic power to control an opponent’s brain and tamper with its memories.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven’t been decoded.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven’t been decoded.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It uses psychic power to control an opponent’s brain and tamper with its memories.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: With its psychic powers, it rewrites its opponents’ memories. You, too, may have already had your memories rewritten.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It has strong psychic powers. Using its fingers that flash three different colors, it controls its opponents and rewrites their memories.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.

name: Elgyem
desc: Elgyem is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Cerebral Pokémon.

initials for ‘Little Green Man’ i.e. an alien

pokedex_entries.Black: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.
pokedex_entries.White: This Pokémon had never been seen until it appeared from far in the desert 50 years ago.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It controls tremendous psychic power. Most reports of alien sightings are actually just people mistaking Elgyem for an alien.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This Pokémon is shrouded in mystery. It’s said to have appeared from a UFO that fell from the sky about 50 years ago.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery will appear on the screen. That scenery is said to be from its home.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to exert its psychic powers.

name: Eelektross
desc: Eelektross is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the EleFish Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
pokedex_entries.White: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

name: Eelektrik
desc: Eelektrik is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the EleFish Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.
pokedex_entries.White: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

name: Tynamo
desc: Tynamo is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the EleFish Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
pokedex_entries.White: These Pokémon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

name: Klinklang
desc: Klinklang is a Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Gear Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.
pokedex_entries.White: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The minigear spins at high speed. Then the energy from the red core charges the minigear to make it ready to fire.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.
pokedex_entries.Sword: From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of electricity. Its red core contains an enormous amount of energy.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The three gears that compose this Pokémon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t a living creature.

name: Klang
desc: Klang is a Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Gear Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
pokedex_entries.White: Spinning minigears are rotated at high speed and repeatedly fired away. It is dangerous if the gears don’t return.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn’t return, it will die.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn’t return, it will die.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and this Pokémon’s rotation speed increases sharply.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.

name: Klink
desc: Klink is a Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Gear Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
pokedex_entries.White: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Two bodies comprise a fixed pair. They spin around each other to generate energy.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The two minigears that compose this Pokémon are closer than twins. They mesh well only with each other.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient people’s invention of the first gears.

location.SwordShield: Route 3, South Lake Miloch, Axew's Eye, Dappled Grove, West Lake Axewell, Hammerlocke Hills, North Lake Miloch

name: Ferrothorn
desc: Ferrothorn is a Grass/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Thorn Pod Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.
pokedex_entries.White: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: By swinging around its three spiky feelers and shooting spikes, it can obliterate an opponent.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: By swinging around its three spiky feelers and shooting spikes, it can obliterate an opponent.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.

name: Ferroseed
desc: Ferroseed is a Grass/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Thorn Seed Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.
pokedex_entries.White: They stick their spikes into cave walls and absorb the minerals they find in the rock.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn’t very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s spikes grow big and strong.

location.SwordShield: Route 4, Bridge Field, Motostoke Riverbank, Stony Wilderness, Lakeside Cave

name: Galvantula
desc: Galvantula is a Bug/Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the EleSpider Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
pokedex_entries.White: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It creates barriers from electrified silk that stun foes. This works as a weapon as well as a defense.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.

location.SwordShield: Route 7, Lake of Outrage, Giant's Bed, Old Cemetery, Giant's Foot, Three-Point Pass, Ballimere Lake

name: Joltik
desc: Joltik is a Bug/Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Attaching Pokémon.

name_origin.jolt: a sudden movement or burst of electricity

pokedex_entries.Black: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.
pokedex_entries.White: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Since it can’t generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Since it can’t generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It’s soaking up static electricity because it can’t produce a charge on its own.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They’re often found sticking to Yamper’s hindquarters.

location.SwordShield: Route 4, Rolling Fields, South Lake Miloch, East Lake Axewell, Dappled Grove, West Lake Axewell, Giant's Cap, Giant's Mirror, North Lake Miloch

name: Alomomola
desc: Alomomola is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Caring Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 100 (Black/White)182 (Black 2/White 2)149 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)157 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)191 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)

pokedex_entries.Black: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.
pokedex_entries.White: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It uses its special mucus to close the wounds of injured Pokémon. The reason for this behavior remains unknown.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Fishermen take them along on long voyages, because if you have an Alomomola with you, there’ll be no need for a doctor or medicine.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.

location.Black 2White 2: Route 4, 17, 18, 21, P2 Laboratory, Virbank City, Virbank Complex

name: Jellicent
desc: Jellicent is a Water/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Floating Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
pokedex_entries.White: They propel themselves by expelling absorbed seawater from their bodies. Their favorite food is life energy.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its body is mostly seawater. It’s said there’s a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its body is mostly seawater. It’s said there’s a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Jellicent is always hanging around fancy cruise ships and tankers, hoping to drag away its prey.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Fishermen are terrified of Jellicent. It’s rumored to drag them into the sea and steal their lives away.

location.Sword: These Pokémon have body compositions that are mostly identical to seawater. They make their lairs from sunken ships.
location.Shield: The crown on its head gets bigger and bigger as it absorbs more and more of the life-force of other creatures.

name: Frillish
desc: Frillish is a Water/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Floating Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped around the body of its opponent, it sinks to the ocean floor.
pokedex_entries.White: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It wraps its veillike arms and legs around prey swimming by and drags them down to the depths of the ocean.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Using the invisible poison spikes on its veillike arms and legs, it paralyzes its enemies and causes them to drown.

location.Sword: It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws it down to the deeps, five miles below the ocean’s surface.
location.Shield: Its thin, veillike arms have tens of thousands of poisonous stingers. Females have slightly longer stingers.

name: Amoonguss
desc: Amoonguss is a Grass/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Mushroom Pokémon.

name_origin.among us: from the phrase ‘a fungus among us’

pokedex_entries.Black: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
pokedex_entries.White: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It moves the caps on both arms and does a dance to lure prey. It prefers damp places.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon puffs poisonous spores at its foes. If the spores aren’t washed off quickly, they’ll grow into mushrooms wherever they land.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Amoonguss generally doesn’t move much. It tends to stand still near Poké Balls that have been dropped on the ground.

name: Foongus
desc: Foongus is a Grass/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Mushroom Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
pokedex_entries.White: For some reason, this Pokémon resembles a Poké Ball. They release poison spores to repel those who try to catch them.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball then releases poison spores.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.
pokedex_entries.Sword: No one knows what the Poké Ball–like pattern on Foongus means or why Foongus has it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The spores released from this Pokémon’s hands are highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried, the spores can be used as stomach medicine.

name: Escavalier
desc: Escavalier is a Bug/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Cavalry Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 095 (Black/White)156 (Black 2/White 2)023 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)274 (Sword/Shield)067 (The Isle of Armor)096 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: They fly around at high speed, striking with their pointed spears. Even when in trouble, they face opponents bravely.
pokedex_entries.White: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.
pokedex_entries.Sword: They use shells they’ve stolen from Shelmet to arm and protect themselves. They’re very popular Pokémon in the Galar region.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.

name: Karrablast
desc: Karrablast is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Clamping Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 094 (Black/White)155 (Black 2/White 2)022 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)273 (Sword/Shield)066 (The Isle of Armor)095 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
pokedex_entries.White: When they feel threatened, they spit an acidic liquid to drive attackers away. This Pokémon targets Shelmet.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell— it eats only the contents.

location.Black 2White 2: Route 6, 8, 11, Icirrus City, Moor of Icirrus
location.Sword: Route 7, Bridge Field, Giant's Cap, Hammerlocke Hills, Motostoke Riverbank, Forest of Focus, Old Cemetery
location.Shield: Route 7, Bridge Field, Hammerlocke Hills, Motostoke Riverbank, Forest of Focus, Old Cemetery

name: Emolga
desc: Emolga is an Electric/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Sky Squirrel Pokémon.

name_origin.momonga: Japanese scientific name of the ‘dwarf flying squirrel’

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 093 (Black/White)144 (Black 2/White 2)086 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)274 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)364 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)102 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: The energy made in its cheeks’ electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.
pokedex_entries.White: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It glides on its outstretched membrane while shocking foes with the electricity stored in the pouches on its cheeks.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The energy made in its cheeks’ electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It glides using its cape-like membrane. Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking its friends and foes alike.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It grills berries and bug Pokémon with electric shocks and makes a meal of them. It usually nests in the holes gouged in trees by Pikipek.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: They store up electricity to fly through the air. When thunder cracks at night, sometimes there are almost enough of them to blot out the sky.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird Pokémon keep their distance. That’s why Emolga can keep all its food to itself.
pokedex_entries.Sword: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can’t fly properly.

location.BlackWhite: Route 5, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12, 15, 16, Dragonspiral Tower, Abundant Shrine, Lostlorn Forest, Village Bridge
location.Black 2White 2: Route 5, 6, 7, 9, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 22, 23, Dragonspiral Tower, Abundant Shrine, Lostlorn Forest, Village Bridge

name: Sawsbuck
desc: Sawsbuck is a Normal/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Season Pokémon.

initials for the four seasons: Summer, Autumn, Winter, Spring

pokedex_entries.Black: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.
pokedex_entries.White: The plants growing on its horns change according to the season. The leaders of the herd possess magnificent horns.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

name: Deerling
desc: Deerling is a Normal/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Season Pokémon.

name_origin.deer: a species of mammal with antlers

pokedex_entries.Black: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.
pokedex_entries.White: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

name: Vanilluxe
desc: Vanilluxe is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Snowstorm Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Ice Body2. Snow WarningWeak Armor (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 090 (Black/White)257 (Black 2/White 2)087 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)257 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)334 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)074 (Sword/Shield)024 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and attack their foes with violent blizzards.
pokedex_entries.White: If both heads get angry simultaneously, this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything in snow.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: If both heads get angry simultaneously, this Pokémon expels a blizzard, burying everything in snow.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Each of its two heads has a brain, and when they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies by exhaling a violent blizzard.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Even if it loses one of its heads, it can live relatively problem-free. It makes snow clouds inside its body.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It blasts blizzards from its two mouths. It can create snow anywhere, so it gets a lot of love from skiers and snowboarders.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Vanilluxe is born when two Vanillish, half-melted by the day’s light, stick to each other and freeze together in the cold return of night.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When its anger reaches a breaking point, this Pokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes every creature around it, be they friend or foe.
pokedex_entries.Shield: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Vanillish
desc: Vanillish is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Icy Snow Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Ice Body2. Snow CloakWeak Armor (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 089 (Black/White)256 (Black 2/White 2)086 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)256 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)333 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)073 (Sword/Shield)023 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.
pokedex_entries.White: It conceals itself from enemy eyes by creating many small ice particles and hiding among them.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be restored by refreezing it, but the process leaves its body slightly warped.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon has existed since the Ice Age. It controls particles of ice, freezes its opponents, and then shatters them with a headbutt.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It sprays its enemies with grains of ice to freeze them. Most Vanillish in Alola are smaller than average.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This hearty Pokémon survived the Ice Age. It’s incredibly popular in very hot regions.
pokedex_entries.Sword: By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body. This Pokémon can be hard to find on days with warm, sunny weather.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.

location.SwordShield: Route 8, 10, Axew's Eye, Dusty Bowl, Frostpoint Field, Giant's Bed, Old Cemetery, Snowslide Slope, Giant's Foot, Roaring-Sea Caves, Frigid Sea, Three-Point Pass, Ballimere Lake

name: Vanillite
desc: Vanillite is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Fresh Snow Pokémon.

name_origin.delight: great pleasure (often in relation to food)

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Ice Body2. Snow CloakWeak Armor (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 088 (Black/White)255 (Black 2/White 2)085 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)255 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)332 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)072 (Sword/Shield)022 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: The temperature of their breath is -58° F. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.
pokedex_entries.White: This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. Their breath is -58° F.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The temperature of their breath is -58 degrees Fahrenheit. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Born of an icicle, this Pokémon uses its frosty breath to make ice crystals, causing snow to fall.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It feels pleasantly cool when embraced. This Pokémon is treasured by households in warm regions.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It exhales cold air that is at –58 degrees Fahrenheit. When it’s in a warm place, it shrinks little by little.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When the morning sun hit an icicle, it wished not to melt, and thus Vanillite was born. At night, it buries itself in snow to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.

location.SwordShield: Rolling Fields, South Lake Miloch, East Lake Axewell, Bridge Field, Dappled Grove, West Lake Axewell, Giant's Cap, Giant's Mirror, Hammerlocke Hills, Lake of Outrage, Motostoke Riverbank, North Lake Miloch, Frostpoint Field, Giant's Bed, Old Cemetery, Snowslide Slope, Giant's Foot, Frigid Sea, Three-Point Pass, Ballimere Lake

name: Swanna
desc: Swanna is a Water/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the White Bird Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
pokedex_entries.White: It administers sharp, powerful pecks with its bill. It whips its long neck to deliver forceful repeated strikes.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

name: Ducklett
desc: Ducklett is a Water/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Water Bird Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food--peat moss.
pokedex_entries.White: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

name: Reuniclus
desc: Reuniclus is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Multiplying Pokémon.
