pokedex_entries.Black: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
pokedex_entries.White: These remarkably intelligent Pokémon fight by controlling arms that can grip with rock-crushing power.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
pokedex_entries.Sword: While it could use its psychic abilities in battle, this Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms around to beat opponents into submission.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Lake of Outrage

name: Duosion
desc: Duosion is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Mitosis Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
pokedex_entries.White: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thoughts, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum power.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range of more than half a mile—but only if its two brains can agree with each other.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Dusty Bowl, Slippery Slope, Frostpoint Field

name: Solosis
desc: Solosis is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Cell Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
pokedex_entries.White: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It communicates with others telepathically. Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Giant's Cap, Slippery Slope, Frostpoint Field

name: Gothitelle
desc: Gothitelle is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Astral Body Pokémon.

name_origin.mademoiselle: French for ‘Miss’, referring to a woman

pokedex_entries.Black: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
pokedex_entries.White: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’ life spans.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It can see the future from the movement of the stars. When it learns its Trainer’s life span, it cries in sadness.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’ life spans.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It has tremendous psychic power, but it dislikes conflict. It’s also able to predict the future based on the movement of the stars.
pokedex_entries.Shield: A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle went missing that same day and was never seen again.

location.Sword: Lake of Outrage
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Gothorita
desc: Gothorita is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Manipulate Pokémon.

name_origin.se\u00f1orita: Spanish for ‘Miss’, referring to a woman

pokedex_entries.Black: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.
pokedex_entries.White: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s said that when stars shine in the night sky, this Pokémon will spirit away sleeping children. Some call it the Witch of Punishment.
pokedex_entries.Shield: On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s psychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.

location.Sword: Dusty Bowl, Giant's Cap, Slippery Slope, Frostpoint Field
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Gothita
desc: Gothita is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Fixation Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
pokedex_entries.White: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It stares intently at everything. It can become so obsessed with watching that it doesn’t notice attacks.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Though they’re still only babies, there’s psychic power stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and sometimes they use that power to fight.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe it’s speaking to something only it can see.

location.Sword: Giant's Cap, Slippery Slope, Frostpoint Field
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Cinccino
desc: Cinccino is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Scarf Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.
pokedex_entries.White: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Cinccino’s body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Cinccino’s body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The white parts of its coat are covered in an oil secreted from its body, so this Pokémon can slide right away from its enemies’ attacks.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The oil that seeps from its body is really smooth. For people troubled by bad skin, this oil is an effective treatment.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.
pokedex_entries.Shield: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.

name: Minccino
desc: Minccino is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Chinchilla Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.
pokedex_entries.White: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: A clean freak that will not allow even the slightest mess, it uses its tail like a mop to thoroughly clean any and all filth.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When its tail has gotten dirty from self-cleaning or from cleaning its nest, Minccino spends a whole day washing its tail in clean spring water.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.
pokedex_entries.Shield: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.

location.SwordShield: Route 5, Rolling Fields, East Lake Axewell, Giant's Cap

name: Zoroark
desc: Zoroark is a Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Illusion Fox Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 077 (Black/White)152 (Black 2/White 2)125 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)029 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)220 (Legends: Arceus)088 (The Isle of Armor)

name: Zorua
desc: Zorua is a Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Tricky Fox Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 076 (Black/White)151 (Black 2/White 2)124 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)028 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)219 (Legends: Arceus)087 (The Isle of Armor)

name: Garbodor
desc: Garbodor is a Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Trash Heap Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 075 (Black/White)106 (Black 2/White 2)075 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)207 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)265 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)158 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.Black: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.White: They absorb garbage and make it part of their bodies. They shoot a poisonous liquid from their right-hand fingertips.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you’ll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.
pokedex_entries.Moon: For a time, their numbers increased explosively in Alola. Since the arrival of Grimer, their population has decreased dramatically.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It locks opponents in place with its left hand, immobilizing them by entirely dousing their bodies with poisonous liquid.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Some say the reason Garbodor in Alola are a little stronger than their counterparts elsewhere is the presence of Muk, their natural enemy.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.

location.Sword: Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokémon’s toxic gas has become much thicker, congealing into masses shaped like discarded toys.
location.Shield: It sprays toxic gas from its mouth and fingers. If the gas engulfs you, the toxins will seep in all the way down to your bones.

name: Trubbish
desc: Trubbish is a Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Trash Bag Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 074 (Black/White)105 (Black 2/White 2)074 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)206 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)264 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)157 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.Black: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.
pokedex_entries.White: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Wanting more garbage, they follow people who litter. They always belch poison gas.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Unsanitary places are what they like best. They can be spotted in Alola, often with Grimer in hot pursuit.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It gorges on trash until its stomach is full. Then it belches toxic gas. An unlucky whiff of gas will put a person in the hospital.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Poisonous gas leaks out of it when it breathes. Muk that catch a whiff of that stench will come drooling.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: If a young Pokémon or child breathes in the toxic gas that Trubbish belches out, it could be a life-threatening situation.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.

name: Archeops
desc: Archeops is a Rock/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the First Bird Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 073 (Black/White)129 (Black 2/White 2)193 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)240 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)150 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
pokedex_entries.White: It runs better than it flies. It catches prey by running at speeds comparable to those of an automobile.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Although apparently able to fly, they tended to run along the ground, averaging speeds of roughly 25 mph.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They hunted in flocks. When one Archeops had the prey cornered, another would swoop on it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This ancient Pokémon’s plumage is delicate, so if anyone other than an experienced professional tries to restore it, they will fail.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, the muscles it uses to flap its wings are still weak, so it needs a long runway in order to take off.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph, building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Though capable of flight, Archeops was apparently better at hunting on the ground.

name: Archen
desc: Archen is a Rock/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the First Bird Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 072 (Black/White)128 (Black 2/White 2)192 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)239 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)149 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.
pokedex_entries.White: Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon is thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It was revived from an ancient fossil. Not able to fly, it lived in treetops and hopped from one branch to another.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon is thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It is the ancestor of all bird Pokémon. Archen itself could not actually fly but moved by hopping from treetop to treetop.
pokedex_entries.Moon: To all appearances flightless, it was able to glide down from tall treetops to snag its prey.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Once thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon, some of the latest research suggests that may not be the case.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Restored from a fossil, this ancient bird Pokémon has wings but can’t yet fly.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable to fly. But it’s very good at jumping.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokémon.

name: Carracosta
desc: Carracosta is a Water/Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Prototurtle Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 071 (Black/White)127 (Black 2/White 2)195 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)242 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)148 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
pokedex_entries.White: Incredible jaw strength enables them to chew up steel beams and rocks along with their prey.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It constructed its sturdy shell by crunching and swallowing the hard shells or bones of its prey.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Active both on land and in the sea, this Pokémon drags its land-based prey into the water to finish it off.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its jaws are terrifyingly powerful. It could eat Omastar and Omanyte whole and not be bothered in the slightest by their shells.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Carracosta eats every last bit of the prey it catches, even the shells and bones, to further strengthen its sturdy shell.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Carracosta completely devours its prey—bones, shells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta’s own shell grows thick and sturdy.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.

name: Tirtouga
desc: Tirtouga is a Water/Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Prototurtle Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 070 (Black/White)126 (Black 2/White 2)194 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)241 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)147 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.
pokedex_entries.White: About 100 million years ago, these Pokémon swam in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to attack prey.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. It swam skillfully and dove to depths beyond half a mile.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: About 100 million years ago, these Pokémon swam in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to attack prey.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Based on studies of its skeletal structure, it can apparently dive to ocean depths of over half a mile.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Reputed to be the ancestor of most turtle Pokémon, it lived in warm seas approximately a hundred million years ago.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It was restored from an ancient fossil. Tirtouga lived in the sea but came up onto the land to search for prey.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its hunting grounds encompassed a broad area, from the land to more than half a mile deep in the ocean.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon inhabited ancient seas. Although it can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in search of prey.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life from a fossil.

name: Cofagrigus
desc: Cofagrigus is a Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Coffin Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
pokedex_entries.White: They pretend to be elaborate coffins to teach lessons to grave robbers. Their bodies are covered in pure gold.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.
pokedex_entries.Shield: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.

name: Yamask
desc: Yamask is a Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Spirit Pokémon.

name: Sigilyph
desc: Sigilyph is a Psychic/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Avianoid Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Wonder Skin2. Magic GuardTinted Lens (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Black: They never vary the route they fly, because their memories of guarding an ancient city remain steadfast.
pokedex_entries.White: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians’ emissaries.
pokedex_entries.Shield: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.

location.SwordShield: Lake of Outrage, Motostoke Riverbank, Stony Wilderness

name: Scrafty
desc: Scrafty is a Dark/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Hoodlum Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 066 (Black/White)118 (Black 2/White 2)101 (X/Y — Central Kalos)336 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)225 (Sword/Shield)162 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.White: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This Pokémon may be rude, but it takes very good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It taunts its opponents by spitting. It has a certain territory that it never leaves its whole life long.
pokedex_entries.Sword: As halfhearted as this Pokémon’s kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr’s concrete pillars.
pokedex_entries.Shield: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.

location.Sword: Evolve Scraggy
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Scraggy
desc: Scraggy is a Dark/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Shedding Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 065 (Black/White)117 (Black 2/White 2)100 (X/Y — Central Kalos)335 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)224 (Sword/Shield)161 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
pokedex_entries.White: It immediately headbutts anyone that makes eye contact with it. Its skull is massively thick.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: They move in small groups, walking around lazily. Anyone who makes eye contact gets smacked with a headbutt.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It stretches its saggy skin up to its neck to protect itself. The saggier their skin, the more respect they garner.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.

location.Sword: Bridge Field, Dusty Bowl, Giant's Cap, Motostoke Outskirts, Stony Wilderness, Galar Mine No. 2, Challenge Road, Potbottom Desert
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Crustle
desc: Crustle is a Bug/Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Stone Home Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
pokedex_entries.White: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When its boulder is broken in battles for territory, it feels unsure and begins to weaken.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry climates. It won’t come out of its boulder on rainy days.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.

name: Dwebble
desc: Dwebble is a Bug/Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Rock Inn Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: This Pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.White: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

location.XY: Route 8, 12, Cyllage City, Ambrette Town, Glittering Cave, Azure Bay
location.SwordShield: Rolling Fields, South Lake Miloch, East Lake Axewell, West Lake Axewell, Giant's Seat, Hammerlocke Hills, North Lake Miloch, Stony Wilderness, Watchtower Ruins, Courageous Cavern, Loop Lagoon

name: Maractus
desc: Maractus is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Cactus Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
pokedex_entries.White: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When it moves rhythmically, it makes a sound similar to maracas, making the surprised Pokémon flee.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
pokedex_entries.Sword: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.

location.SwordShield: Route 6, Bridge Field, Hammerlocke Hills, Stony Wilderness

name: Darmanitan
desc: Darmanitan is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Blazing Pokémon.

name_origin.daruma: daruma doll, a traditional Japanese doll

name: Darumaka
desc: Darumaka is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Zen Charm Pokémon.

name_origin.daruma: daruma doll, a traditional Japanese doll

name: Krookodile
desc: Krookodile is a Ground/Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Intimidation Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 059 (Black/White)101 (Black 2/White 2)045 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)234 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)303 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)178 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.
pokedex_entries.White: It can expand the focus of its eyes, enabling it to see objects in the far distance as if it were using binoculars.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.
pokedex_entries.Moon: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When it spots prey, even at a distance of over 30 miles, it swims through the desert as if it were water, then jumps out and chomps them.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It conceals itself in sandstorms that Flygon whip up and waits patiently for prey to appear.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sands. Krookodile’s mighty jaws can bite through heavy plates of iron with almost no effort at all.
pokedex_entries.Shield: While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has the patience to stay hidden under sand for days, lying in wait for prey.

name: Krokorok
desc: Krokorok is a Ground/Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Desert Croc Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 058 (Black/White)100 (Black 2/White 2)044 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)233 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)302 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)177 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
pokedex_entries.White: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Krokorok really hates it when its body gets cold. On nights when the temperature drops, it digs deep into the desert sands.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to see in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in the dead of night without getting lost.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won’t move much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.

name: Sandile
desc: Sandile is a Ground/Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Desert Croc Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 057 (Black/White)099 (Black 2/White 2)043 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)232 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)301 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)176 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.
pokedex_entries.White: It moves along below the sand’s surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It moves along below the sand’s surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It conceals itself in the sand and chomps down on the legs of any prey that unwarily walk over it. Its favorite food is Trapinch.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Alola, where it’s warm all year round, is a comfortable environment for this Pokémon. Sometimes you’ll even see it outside of deserts.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Sandile’s still not good at hunting, so it mostly eats things that have collapsed in the desert. It’s called “the cleaner of the desert.”
pokedex_entries.Sword: The desert gets cold at night, so when the sun sets, this Pokémon burrows deep into the sand and sleeps until sunrise.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile moves through the desert as if it’s swimming.

name: Basculin
desc: Basculin is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Hostile Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 056 (Black/White)104 (Black 2/White 2)060 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)188 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)154 (Sword/Shield)166 (Legends: Arceus)064 (The Crown Tundra)

name: Lilligant
desc: Lilligant is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Flowering Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 055 (Black/White)085 (Black 2/White 2)086 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)104 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)094 (Legends: Arceus)202 (The Isle of Armor)

name: Petilil
desc: Petilil is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Bulb Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 054 (Black/White)084 (Black 2/White 2)085 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)103 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)093 (Legends: Arceus)201 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
pokedex_entries.White: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Although the leaves on its head are bitter enough to cause dizziness, they provide relief from weariness—even more so when boiled.
pokedex_entries.Moon: By pruning the leaves on its head with regularity, this Pokémon can be grown into a fine plump shape.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Some say if you dry the leaves on its head, boil them down, and drink the infusion, your vigor will return, so Petilil is popular with the elderly.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: They prefer clean water and soil. When the environment they live in turns bad, the whole bunch will up and move to a new area.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Petilil appears around sources of clean water. Boiling leaves from this Pokémon’s head results in a liquid that’s sometimes used as a bug repellent.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The deeper the color of a Petilil’s leaves, the healthier the Pokémon is. Petilil sometimes makes its home in a well-tended field or flowerbed.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes. Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.

location.White: Abundant Shrine, Lostlorn Forest, Pinwheel Forest
location.White 2: Abundant Shrine, Castelia City, Lostlorn Forest, Victory Road, Pinwheel Forest
location.Moon: Melemele Meadow, Ula'ula Meadow, Malie Garden, Poni Plains, Poni Meadow
location.Ultra Moon: Melemele Meadow, Ula'ula Meadow, Malie Garden, Poni Plains, Poni Meadow

name: Whimsicott
desc: Whimsicott is a Grass/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Windveiled Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 053 (Black/White)083 (Black 2/White 2)088 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)106 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)263 (Sword/Shield)169 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
pokedex_entries.White: Riding whirlwinds, they appear. These Pokémon sneak through gaps into houses and cause all sorts of mischief.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It rides on the wind and slips into people’s homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton-filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon appears, riding upon the wind. But if the wind gusts up, it’ll blow the cotton on this Pokémon’s head clean off.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This nuisance sneaks into people’s homes, where it hides important things and scatters cotton all over the place.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Whimsicott doesn’t live in a fixed location. It floats around on whirling winds, appearing all over the place to perform its mischief.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.
pokedex_entries.Shield: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.

location.Black: Abundant Shrine, Lostlorn Forest, Pinwheel Forest
location.Black 2: Abundant Shrine, Castelia City, Lostlorn Forest, Victory Road, Pinwheel Forest

name: Cottonee
desc: Cottonee is a Grass/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Cotton Puff Pokémon.

name_origin.cottony: soft like cotton, a natural material

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 052 (Black/White)082 (Black 2/White 2)087 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)105 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)262 (Sword/Shield)168 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Black: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
pokedex_entries.White: They go wherever the wind takes them. On rainy days, their bodies are heavier, so they take shelter beneath big trees.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.
pokedex_entries.Sun: When it finds others of its kind, they all stick together. When enough of them have collected, the mass resembles a cumulonimbus cloud.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Pillows and beds stuffed with cotton exhaled by Cottonee are soft and puffy, light and airy— altogether top quality.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can’t move as well.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When attacked, it expels cotton from its body to create a diversion. The cotton it loses grows back in quickly.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s highly prized by many luxury brands.

location.Black: Abundant Shrine, Lostlorn Forest, Pinwheel Forest
location.Black 2: Abundant Shrine, Castelia City, Lostlorn Forest, Victory Road, Pinwheel Forest
location.Sun: Melemele Meadow, Ula'ula Meadow, Malie Garden, Poni Plains, Poni Meadow
location.Ultra Sun: Melemele Meadow, Ula'ula Meadow, Malie Garden, Poni Plains, Poni Meadow

name: Scolipede
desc: Scolipede is a Bug/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Megapede Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
pokedex_entries.White: Highly aggressive, it uses the claws near its neck to dig into its opponents and poison them.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.

name: Whirlipede
desc: Whirlipede is a Bug/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Curlipede Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
pokedex_entries.White: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Storing energy for evolution, it sits. But, when predators approach, it moves to stab them with poison spikes.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.

name: Venipede
desc: Venipede is a Bug/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Centipede Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.
pokedex_entries.White: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Using the feelers on its head and tail, it picks up vibrations in the air to determine its prey’s location and state.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.

name: Leavanny
desc: Leavanny is a Bug/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Nurturing Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.
pokedex_entries.White: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

name: Swadloon
desc: Swadloon is a Bug/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Leaf-Wrapped Pokémon.

name_origin.swaddle: to bind with strips of cloth
name_origin.cocoon: a pupal casing made by some insects

pokedex_entries.Black: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
pokedex_entries.White: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Preferring dark, damp places, it spends the entire day eating fallen leaves that lie around it.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

name: Sewaddle
desc: Sewaddle is a Bug/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Sewing Pokémon.

name_origin.swaddle: to bind with strips of cloth

pokedex_entries.Black: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.
pokedex_entries.White: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

name: Sawk
desc: Sawk is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Karate Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train.
pokedex_entries.White: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If you see a Sawk training in the mountains in its single-minded pursuit of strength, it’s best to quietly pass by.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.

location.Sword: Route 8, Bridge Field, Giant's Mirror, Motostoke Outskirts, Motostoke Riverbank
location.Shield: Trade/migrate from another game

name: Throh
desc: Throh is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Judo Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
pokedex_entries.White: When they encounter foes bigger than themselves, they try to throw them. They always travel in packs of five.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throh’s belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearer’s sweat.
pokedex_entries.Shield: They train in groups of five. Any member that can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.

location.Sword: Trade/migrate from another game
location.Shield: Route 8, Bridge Field, Giant's Mirror, Motostoke Outskirts, Motostoke Riverbank

name: Seismitoad
desc: Seismitoad is a Water/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Vibration Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Swift Swim2. Poison TouchWater Absorb (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Black: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.
pokedex_entries.White: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: By putting power into its bumps, it creates vibrations and increases the power of its punches.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.

location.BlackWhite: Route 8, Icirrus City, Moor of Icirrus
location.Black 2White 2: Route 8, Icirrus City, Moor of Icirrus, Pinwheel Forest

name: Palpitoad
desc: Palpitoad is a Water/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Vibration Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
pokedex_entries.White: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to capture prey.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.
pokedex_entries.Shield: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

location.BlackWhite: Route 8, Icirrus City, Moor of Icirrus
location.Black 2White 2: Route 8, Icirrus City, Moor of Icirrus, Pinwheel Forest

name: Tympole
desc: Tympole is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Tadpole Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: They warn others of danger by vibrating their cheeks to create a high-pitched sound.
pokedex_entries.White: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Graceful ripples running across the water’s surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.

location.SwordShield: South Lake Miloch, Dappled Grove, West Lake Axewell, North Lake Miloch, Watchtower Ruins

name: Conkeldurr
desc: Conkeldurr is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Muscular Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
pokedex_entries.White: They use concrete pillars as walking canes. They know moves that enable them to swing the pillars freely in battle.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.

name: Gurdurr
desc: Gurdurr is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Muscular Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
pokedex_entries.White: They strengthen their bodies by carrying steel beams. They show off their big muscles to their friends.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.

location.Black 2White 2: Twist Mountain, Victory Road, Pinwheel Forest, Relic Passage
location.Sword: Route 8, Dusty Bowl, Stony Wilderness, Giant's Bed, Giant's Foot
location.Shield: Route 8, Dusty Bowl, Giant's Bed, Giant's Foot

name: Timburr
desc: Timburr is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Muscular Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.
pokedex_entries.White: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It loves helping out with construction projects. It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt, it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.

name: Audino
desc: Audino is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Hearing Pokémon.

name_origin.'I dunno': Audino is a pun on said phrase

name: Excadrill
desc: Excadrill is a Ground/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Subterrene Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Sand Rush2. Sand ForceMold Breaker (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Black: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
pokedex_entries.White: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Forming a drill with its steel claws and head, it can bore through a steel plate, no matter how thick it is.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill’s rampant digging.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.

location.BlackWhite: Giant Chasm, Challenger's Cave, Victory Road
location.Black 2White 2: Giant Chasm, Wellspring Cave, Twist Mountain, Victory Road, Clay Tunnel, Reversal Mountain, Seaside Cave, Underground Ruins

name: Drilbur
desc: Drilbur is a Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Mole Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Sand Rush2. Sand ForceMold Breaker (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Black: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.
pokedex_entries.White: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.

location.BlackWhite: Chargestone Cave, Mistralton Cave, Wellspring Cave, Twist Mountain
location.Black 2White 2: Chargestone Cave, Mistralton Cave, Relic Passage
location.SwordShield: Dusty Bowl, Galar Mine, Giant's Cap, Giant's Mirror, Hammerlocke Hills, Stony Wilderness

name: Swoobat
desc: Swoobat is a Psychic/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Courting Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.
pokedex_entries.White: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out. Afterward, it won’t be able to fly for a little while.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.

name: Woobat
desc: Woobat is a Psychic/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Bat Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.White: Suction from its nostrils enables it to stick to cave walls during sleep. It leaves a heart-shaped mark behind.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.
pokedex_entries.Sword: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it’s evidence that Woobat live there.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.

location.BlackWhite: Mistralton Cave, Wellspring Cave, Twist Mountain, Challenger's Cave, Victory Road
location.Black 2White 2: Mistralton Cave, Wellspring Cave, Twist Mountain, Clay Tunnel, Reversal Mountain, Relic Passage, Seaside Cave, Underground Ruins
location.SwordShield: Bridge Field, Galar Mine, Giant's Mirror, Watchtower Ruins, Brawlers' Cave, Courageous Cavern

name: Gigalith
desc: Gigalith is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Compressed Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 032 (Black/White)070 (Black 2/White 2)122 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)100 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)122 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)170 (Sword/Shield)156 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.
pokedex_entries.White: The solar energy absorbed by its body’s orange crystals is magnified internally and fired from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.
pokedex_entries.Sun: The blasts of energy it makes from sunbeams have terrifying power. However, it’s not able to fire its blasts at night or on rainy days.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Known for its hefty horsepower, this Pokémon is a popular partner for construction workers.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When it fires off energy with all its might, the power creates countless fissures on its body.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It absorbs rays of sunlight and shoots out energy. It’s usually lurking deep beneath the surface.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This hardy Pokémon can often be found on construction sites and in mines, working alongside people and Copperajah.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation— they can only be fired when the sun is out.

name: Boldore
desc: Boldore is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Ore Pokémon.

name_origin.ore: a mineral in its natural state

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 031 (Black/White)069 (Black 2/White 2)121 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)099 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)121 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)169 (Sword/Shield)155 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.
pokedex_entries.White: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its orange crystal is a mass of energy. Just one crystal fragment would provide enough fuel for a hundred dump trucks.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It explores caves in search of underground water. It’s not comfortable around water, so this Pokémon takes great care in lapping it up.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The energy overflowing from its body has turned into orange crystals that are hard enough to smash diamonds.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its orange crystals are lumps of powerful energy. They’re valuable, so Boldore is sometimes targeted for them.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be wary. It’s about to fire off bursts of energy.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it’s facing.

location.BlackWhite: Chargestone Cave, Mistralton Cave, Giant Chasm, Twist Mountain, Challenger's Cave, Victory Road
location.Black 2White 2: Chargestone Cave, Mistralton Cave, Wellspring Cave, Twist Mountain, Victory Road, Clay Tunnel, Reversal Mountain, Relic Passage, Seaside Cave, Underground Ruins
location.SwordShield: Route 8, Giant's Cap, Giant's Mirror, Lake of Outrage, Stony Wilderness

name: Roggenrola
desc: Roggenrola is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Mantle Pokémon.

name_origin.rock \u2018n\u2019 roller: relating to rock ‘n’ roll, a type of popular music

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 030 (Black/White)068 (Black 2/White 2)120 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)098 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)120 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)168 (Sword/Shield)154 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.
pokedex_entries.White: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The hexagonal-shaped hole is its ear. It has a tendency to walk in the direction the sound is coming from.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Born deep within the ground, it compares itself with similar species, such as Geodude and Carbink, to settle which has the hardest body.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The hexagonal cavity is its ear. It walks in the direction of sounds it hears, but if the sounds cease, it panics and topples over.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The hexagonal hole is its ear. Deep in that ear is an energy core, so if you stick your hand in there, Roggenrola will be very angry!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It was found in a fissure in a layer of exposed rock. The material that makes up its body is dirt from several hundred years ago.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s as hard as steel, but apparently a long soak in water will cause it to soften a bit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.

location.SwordShield: Rolling Fields, Galar Mine, Motostoke Outskirts, Stony Wilderness, Challenge Road

name: Zebstrika
desc: Zebstrika is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Thunderbolt Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Lightning Rod2. Motor DriveSap Sipper (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Black: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
pokedex_entries.White: This ill-tempered Pokémon is dangerous because when it’s angry, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

name: Blitzle
desc: Blitzle is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Electrified Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Lightning Rod2. Motor DriveSap Sipper (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Black: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.
pokedex_entries.White: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

name: Unfezant
desc: Unfezant is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Proud Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females’ flying abilities surpass those of the males.
pokedex_entries.White: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Males swing the plumage on their heads to threaten others, but females are better at flying.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females’ flying abilities surpass those of the males.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

location.Sword: Females of this species are very capable fliers, particularly notable for their stamina. They also take longer to adjust to people.
location.Shield: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.

name: Tranquill
desc: Tranquill is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Wild Pigeon Pokémon.

name_origin.quill: feather used for writing with ink

pokedex_entries.Black: It can return to its Trainer’s location regardless of the distance separating them.
pokedex_entries.White: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far it travels, it can always find its way back to its master and its nest.
pokedex_entries.Shield: These bright Pokémon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.

location.BlackWhite: Route 6, 7, 12, Dragonspiral Tower, Lostlorn Forest, Pinwheel Forest
location.SwordShield: Bridge Field, Giant's Mirror, Giant's Seat, Stony Wilderness

name: Pidove
desc: Pidove is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Tiny Pigeon Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Each follows its Trainer’s orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.
pokedex_entries.White: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This very forgetful Pokémon will wait for a new order from its Trainer even though it already has one.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Where people go, these Pokémon follow. If you’re scattering food for them, be careful— several hundred of them can gather at once.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.

location.Black 2White 2: Route 20, Castelia City, Virbank Complex, Floccesy Ranch
location.SwordShield: Rolling Fields, East Lake Axewell, North Lake Miloch, Watchtower Ruins

name: Musharna
desc: Musharna is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Drowsing Pokémon.

name_origin.lunar: of or relating to the Moon

pokedex_entries.Black: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.White: With the mist from its forehead, it can create shapes of things from dreams it has eaten.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When dark mists emanate from its body, don’t get too near. If you do, your nightmares will become reality.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to leave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.

name: Munna
desc: Munna is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Dream Eater Pokémon.

name_origin.lunar: of or relating to the Moon

pokedex_entries.Black: Munna always float in the air. People whose dreams are eaten by them forget what the dreams had been about.
pokedex_entries.White: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This Pokémon appears before people and Pokémon who are having nightmares and eats those dreams.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Late at night, it appears beside people’s pillows. As it feeds on dreams, the patterns on its body give off a faint glow.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it’s eating a good dream, and black when it’s eating a nightmare.

location.SwordShield: Rolling Fields, East Lake Axewell, Slumbering Weald, Axew's Eye, Bridge Field, Giant's Cap, Giant's Seat, Stony Wilderness

name: Simipour
desc: Simipour is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Geyser Pokémon.

name_origin.pour: to drop or flow liquid (referring to cooking and its Water type)

pokedex_entries.Black: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.
pokedex_entries.White: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
