pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

name: Panpour
desc: Panpour is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Spray Pokémon.

name_origin.pour: to drop or flow liquid (referring to cooking and its Water type)

pokedex_entries.Black: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
pokedex_entries.White: It does not thrive in dry environments. It keeps itself damp by shooting water stored in its head tuft from its tail.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

name: Simisear
desc: Simisear is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Ember Pokémon.

name_origin.sear: to heat/fry (referring to cooking and its Fire type)

pokedex_entries.Black: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.
pokedex_entries.White: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

name: Pansear
desc: Pansear is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the High Temp Pokémon.

name_origin.sear: to heat/fry (referring to cooking and its Fire type)

pokedex_entries.Black: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.
pokedex_entries.White: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600° F.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Simisage
desc: Simisage is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Thorn Monkey Pokémon.

name_origin.sage: a herb (referring to cooking and its Grass type)

pokedex_entries.Black: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
pokedex_entries.White: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It strikes its enemies with a thorn-covered tail. The leaf on its head is bitter.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

name: Pansage
desc: Pansage is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Grass Monkey Pokémon.

name_origin.sage: a herb (referring to cooking and its Grass type)

pokedex_entries.Black: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.
pokedex_entries.White: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.

name: Liepard
desc: Liepard is a Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Cruel Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: These Pokémon vanish and appear unexpectedly. Many Trainers are drawn to their beautiful form and fur.
pokedex_entries.White: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Don’t be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.

location.SwordShield: Route 7, 9, Axew's Eye, Bridge Field, Giant's Cap, Giant's Seat

name: Purrloin
desc: Purrloin is a Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Devious Pokémon.

name_origin.purr: sound a cat makes when content

pokedex_entries.Black: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.
pokedex_entries.White: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Their cute act is a ruse. They trick people and steal their valuables just to see the looks on their faces.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It steals things from people just to amuse itself with their frustration. A rivalry exists between this Pokémon and Nickit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.

location.SwordShield: Route 2, East Lake Axewell, Dappled Grove, West Lake Axewell, Motostoke Riverbank, North Lake Miloch, Watchtower Ruins

name: Stoutland
desc: Stoutland is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Big-Hearted Pokémon.

name_origin.land: referring to terriers, who get their name from ‘terra’

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 014 (Black/White)024 (Black 2/White 2)122 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)152 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)115 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.
pokedex_entries.White: This extremely wise Pokémon excels at rescuing people stranded at sea or in the mountains.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Being wrapped in its long fur is so comfortable that a person would be fine even overnight on a wintry mountain.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Being wrapped in its long fur is so comfortable that a person would be fine even overnight on a wintry mountain.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Intelligent, good-natured, and valiant, it’s a trustworthy partner on rescue teams.
pokedex_entries.Moon: With this wise Pokémon, there could be no concern that it would ever attack people. Some parents even trust it to babysit.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It pays no mind to the cold, thanks to its long warm coat. Stoutland in Alola look a little uncomfortable.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its fur is long and thick. A long time ago in cold regions, every household kept a Stoutland.
pokedex_entries.Sword: These Pokémon seem to enjoy living with humans. Even a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up to people in about three days.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.

name: Herdier
desc: Herdier is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Loyal Dog Pokémon.

name_origin.herd: to drive animals (e.g. sheep) into a group

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 013 (Black/White)023 (Black 2/White 2)121 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)151 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)114 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.
pokedex_entries.White: It loyally follows its Trainer’s orders. For ages, they have helped Trainers raise Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: This very loyal Pokémon helps Trainers, and it also takes care of other Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This very loyal Pokémon helps Trainers, and it also takes care of other Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its dense black fur grows continuously. The high cost of keeping its hard fur properly groomed makes this a troublesome Pokémon to train.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon obeys its master’s orders faithfully. However, it refuses to listen to anything said by a person it doesn’t respect.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The longer its black fur grows, the harder and more impervious it gets. Claws and fangs can’t easily penetrate it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It has been living with people for so long that portrayals of it can be found on the walls of caves from long, long ago.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon. So much so that there’s a theory that Herdier was the first Pokémon to partner with people.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.

name: Lillipup
desc: Lillipup is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Puppy Pokémon.

name_origin.Lilliput: fictional island inhabited by small people

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 012 (Black/White)022 (Black 2/White 2)120 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)150 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)113 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Black: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.
pokedex_entries.White: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it’s also smart enough to check its foe’s strength and avoid battle.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it’s also smart enough to check its foe’s strength and avoid battle.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Because it doesn’t yelp, it’s extremely popular with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The long fur surrounding its face functions as radar, enabling it to probe the condition of its battle opponents.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This Pokémon has excellent judgment. If it decides it can’t defeat an opponent, it immediately turns tail and vamooses.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This Pokémon is popular with beginners because it’s intelligent, obedient to its Trainer’s commands, and easy to raise.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious. It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect information about its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.

name: Watchog
desc: Watchog is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Lookout Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
pokedex_entries.White: They make the patterns on their bodies shine in order to threaten predators. Keen eyesight lets them see in the dark.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

name: Patrat
desc: Patrat is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Scout Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.
pokedex_entries.White: Extremely cautious, they take shifts to maintain a constant watch of their nest. They feel insecure without a lookout.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.

name: Samurott
desc: Samurott is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Formidable Pokémon.

name: Dewott
desc: Dewott is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Discipline Pokémon.

name_origin.dew: moisture often found on grass or plants

pokedex_entries.Black: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
pokedex_entries.White: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing in defeat.

name: Oshawott
desc: Oshawott is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Sea Otter Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
pokedex_entries.White: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The scalchop on its stomach isn’t just used for battle--it can be used to break open hard berries as well.
pokedex_entries.X: The scalchop on its stomach isn’t just used for battle--it can be used to break open hard berries as well.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: The scalchop on its stomach isn’t just used for battle—it can be used to break open hard berries as well.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I’ve conferred upon this shell the name “scalchop.”

name: Emboar
desc: Emboar is a Fire/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Mega Fire Pig Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
pokedex_entries.White: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: A flaring beard of fire is proof that it is fired up. It is adept at using many different moves.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

name: Pignite
desc: Pignite is a Fire/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Fire Pig Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
pokedex_entries.White: Whatever it eats becomes fuel for the flame in its stomach. When it is angered, the intensity of the flame increases.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

name: Tepig
desc: Tepig is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Fire Pig Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.
pokedex_entries.White: It blows fire through its nose. When it catches a cold, the fire becomes pitch-black smoke instead.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

name: Serperior
desc: Serperior is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Regal Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
pokedex_entries.White: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents but only give it their all when fighting a powerful opponent.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s noble eyes.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s noble eyes.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

name: Servine
desc: Servine is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Grass Snake Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
pokedex_entries.White: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

name: Snivy
desc: Snivy is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Grass Snake Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.
pokedex_entries.White: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

name: Victini
desc: Victini is a Psychic/Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 5. It is known as the Victory Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Black: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
pokedex_entries.White: It creates an unlimited supply of energy inside its body, which it shares with those who touch it.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.

name: Arceus
desc: Arceus is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Alpha Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It is described in mythology as the Pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing then shaped the world.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is described in mythology as the Pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was the first Pokémon born before the universe even existed.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

name: Shaymin
desc: Shaymin is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Gratitude Pokémon.

name_origin.shaman: intermediary between the natural and supernatural worlds

name: Darkrai
desc: Darkrai is a Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Pitch-Black Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Folklore has it that on moonless nights, this Pokémon will make people see horrific nightmares.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: To protect itself, it afflicts those around it with nightmares. However, it means no harm.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: To protect itself, it afflicts those around it with nightmares. However, it means no harm.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of a new moon.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Folklore has it that on moonless nights, this Pokémon will make people see horrific nightmares.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: On a moonless night, a strange incident occurred in which every one of a village’s inhabitants suffered nightmares. The villagers attested that Darkrai appeared before them in these nightmares.

name: Manaphy
desc: Manaphy is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Seafaring Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Water makes up 80% of its body. This Pokémon is easily affected by its environment.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Water makes up 80 percent of its body. This Pokémon is easily affected by its environment.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Rumored to migrate across the oceans and visit Hisui’s coastal waters only rarely. Although Manaphy resembles Phione, it is also quite different. The relation between the two is unclear.

name: Phione
desc: Phione is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Sea Drifter Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Can be seen floating offshore during seasons when the seas are warm. Its azure body blends in with the ocean waters—logic suggests this is a defense mechanism against natural predators.

name: Cresselia
desc: Cresselia is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Lunar Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: On nights around the quarter moon, the aurora from its tail extends and undulates beautifully.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Those who sleep holding CRESSELIA’s feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: On nights around the quarter moon, the aurora from its tail extends and undulates beautifully.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Those who sleep holding Cresselia’s feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: When it flies, it releases shiny particles from its veil-like wings. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Cresselia is reminiscent of the crescent moon. It leaves a brilliant line of light in its wake as it flies across the night sky. I daresay it resembles the heavenly maiden who created the Milky Way.

name: Giratina
desc: Giratina is a Ghost/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Renegade Pokémon.

name_origin.platina: an alloy of platinum, the game of which it is the mascot

name: Regigigas
desc: Regigigas is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Colossal Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It is believed to have shaped REGIROCK, REGICE, and REGISTEEL out of clay, ice, and magma.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
pokedex_entries.Sword: All over the world, there are legends that tell of Regigigas creating other Pokémon in its own image.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s said that Regigigas created other Pokémon from many different materials before it moved the continents to where they are today.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: According to legend, Regigigas pulled landmasses together and bound them with rope to create the continent of Hisui. Though I have my doubts, the story could well contain a shred of truth.

name: Heatran
desc: Heatran is a Fire/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Lava Dome Pokémon.

name_origin.transfer: to move from one place to another, esp. heat through metal

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its body is made of rugged steel. However, it is partially melted in spots because of its own heat.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its body is made of rugged steel. However, it is partially melted in spots because of its own heat.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Stories tell of this Pokémon being birthed from the boiling magma within Mount Coronet. Its molten-steel body holds many mysteries.

name: Palkia
desc: Palkia is a Water/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Spatial Pokémon.

name_origin.pearl: precious stone; game of which Palkia is the mascot

name: Dialga
desc: Dialga is a Steel/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Temporal Pokémon.

name_origin.diamond: precious stone; game of which Dialga is the mascot

name: Azelf
desc: Azelf is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Willpower Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It is thought that UXIE, MESPRIT and AZELF all came from the same egg.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When AZELF flew, people gained the determination to do things. It was the birth of willpower.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: This Pokémon is said to have endowed humans with the determination needed to face any of life’s difficulties.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When Azelf flew, people gained the determination to do things. It was the birth of willpower.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is known as the Being of Willpower. It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: The dreaded Being of Willpower. Legends tell of this Pokémon manipulating the will of its adversaries and turning them into puppets of its own.

name: Mesprit
desc: Mesprit is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Emotion Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When MESPRIT flew, people learned the joy and sadness of living. It was the birth of emotions.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: This Pokémon is said to have endowed the human heart with emotions, such as sorrow and joy.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When Mesprit flew, people learned the joy and sadness of living. It was the birth of emotions.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is known as the Being of Emotion. It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokémon was feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their emotions thrown into disarray.

name: Uxie
desc: Uxie is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Knowledge Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When UXIE flew, people gained the ability to solve problems. It was the birth of knowledge.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: According to some sources, this Pokémon provided people with the intelligence necessary to solve various problems.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When Uxie flew, people gained the ability to solve problems. It was the birth of knowledge.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Known as the Being of Knowledge, it is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A Pokémon feared but also respected for stealing away the memories of evildoers. I have found records that suggest Uxie holds dominion over knowledge.

name: Rotom
desc: Rotom is an Electric/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Plasma Pokémon.

name: Froslass
desc: Froslass is an Ice/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Snow Land Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 208 (Platinum)181 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)248 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)325 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)081 (Sword/Shield)207 (Legends: Arceus)027 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees F. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It freezes prey by blowing its -58 degrees F breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as FROSLASS.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as FROSLASS
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It freezes prey by blowing its -58 degrees F breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees Fahrenheit. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as Froslass.
pokedex_entries.Sun: When it finds humans or Pokémon it likes, it freezes them and takes them to its chilly den, where they become decorations.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The soul of a woman lost on a snowy mountain possessed an icicle, becoming this Pokémon. The food it most relishes is the souls of men.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It freezes hikers who have come to climb snowy mountains and carries them back to its home. It only goes after men it thinks are handsome.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It’s said that on nights of terrible blizzards, it comes down to human settlements. If you hear it knocking at your door, do not open it!
pokedex_entries.Sword: After a woman met her end on a snowy mountain, her regrets lingered on. From them, this Pokémon was born. Its favorite food is frozen souls.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It spits out cold air of nearly −60 degrees Fahrenheit to freeze its quarry. It brings frozen prey back to its lair and neatly lines them up.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It freezes foes with an icy breath that is nearly −60 degrees Fahrenheit. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A Pokémon inhabited by the soul of a woman who died bearing a grudge in the snowy mountains. Legends of Froslass placing deathly curses on misbehaving men send shivers down my spine.

location.Legends: Arceus: Avalanche Slopes, Avalugg's Legacy, Bonechill Wastes, Ice Column Chamber

name: Dusknoir
desc: Dusknoir is a Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Gripper Pokémon.

name_origin.dusk: the partial darkness between day and night

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: This feared Pokémon is said to travel to worlds unknown. Some even believe that it takes lost spirits along with it.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
pokedex_entries.Sword: At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit world, it steals people and Pokémon away. No one knows whether it has a will of its own.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With the mouth on its belly, Dusknoir swallows its target whole. The soul is the only thing eaten— Dusknoir disgorges the body before departing.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Comes to those whose lives have come to an end and escorts their souls to the afterlife. Known to mistakenly take the souls of those who yet have life left in them, albeit rarely.

name: Probopass
desc: Probopass is a Rock/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Compass Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 156 (Platinum)165 (Black 2/White 2)094 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)062 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)199 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)255 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)191 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It controls three units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force. With them, it can attack the foe from three directions.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It freely controls three units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances become unusable.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The main body controls three mobile units called Mini-Noses, which it maneuvers to catch prey.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don’t come back.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its entire body exudes strong magnetism. Probopass controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.

name: Gallade
desc: Gallade is a Psychic/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Blade Pokémon.

name_origin.blade: the flat cutting part of a knife, sword, etc.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 160 (Platinum)067 (X/Y — Central Kalos)032 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)123 (Sword/Shield)104 (Legends: Arceus)037 (The Isle of Armor)

name: Porygon-Z
desc: Porygon-Z is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Virtual Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 194 (Platinum)219 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)283 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)135 (Legends: Arceus)210 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...
pokedex_entries.Sun: In order to create a more advanced Pokémon, an additional program was installed, but apparently it contained a defect that makes it move oddly.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its program was modified to facilitate extra-dimensional activities, but that led to noticeably strange behavior.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its behavior is noticeably unstable, which is apparently due to the incompetence of the engineer who updated its programming.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: A faulty update was added to its programming. Its behavior is noticeably strange, so the experiment may have been a failure.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Z’s behavior.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Some say an additional program made this Pokémon evolve, but even academics can’t agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Additional software was installed to make it an even better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon’s offensive capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.

name: Mamoswine
desc: Mamoswine is an Ice/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Twin Tusk Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up to much amazement.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: A frozen MAMOSWINE was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It flourished worldwide during the ice age but its population declined when the masses of ice began to dwindle.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up to much amazement.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When the temperature rose at the end of the ice age, most Mamoswine disappeared.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It looks strong, and that’s exactly what it is. As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The ice age is over and the climate has warmed, so this Pokémon’s population has thinned.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This species reached its zenith during the period known as the ice age. I suspect that Hisui’s frigid climate is in harmony with Mamoswine’s constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.

name: Gliscor
desc: Gliscor is a Ground/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Fang Scorp Pokémon.

name_origin.scorpion: creature with pincers and a stinger in its tail

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Hyper Cutter2. Sand VeilPoison Heal (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It dances silently through the sky. When it approaches prey, it can land a critical hit in an instant.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, Gliscor swoops!
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once it has entirely drained its prey of blood.

name: Glaceon
desc: Glaceon is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Fresh Snow Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 170 (Platinum)098 (Black 2/White 2)084 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)130 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)160 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)203 (Sword/Shield)032 (Legends: Arceus)080 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: As a protective technique, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand like needles.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It causes small ice crystals to form by lowering the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It can control its body temperature at will. This enables it to freeze the moisture in the atmosphere, creating flurries of diamond dust.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It freezes its fur into icicles, spiky and sharp, and tackles its prey.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It protects itself by freezing its fur into sharp needles. It can drop its body temperature below –75 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It can instantaneously freeze any moisture that’s around it, creating ice pellets to shoot at its prey.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Any who become captivated by the beauty of the snowfall that Glaceon creates will be frozen before they know it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The coldness emanating from Glaceon causes powdery snow to form, making it quite a popular Pokémon at ski resorts.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: As a defense mechanism, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand out like needles.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly. It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters like gems while it flutters and dances around.

name: Yanmega
desc: Yanmega is a Bug/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Ogre Darner Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The beat of its wings is so powerful that it accidentally dislodges full-grown trees when it takes off in flight.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes’ heads instantly while flying by at high speed.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes’ heads instantly while flying by at high speed.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy, aiming only for prey’s most vulnerable spots. Any who manage to tame this Pokémon must be of incredible bravery.

name: Leafeon
desc: Leafeon is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Verdant Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 169 (Platinum)097 (Black 2/White 2)083 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)129 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)159 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)202 (Sword/Shield)031 (Legends: Arceus)081 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It basically does not fight. With cells similar to those of plants, it can perform photosynthesis.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When you see LEAFEON asleep in a patch of sunshine, you’ll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It basically does not fight. With cells similar to those of plants, it can perform photosynthesis.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: With cells similar to those of plants, it performs photosynthesis inside its body and creates pure air.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you’ll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its cellular composition is closer to that of a plant than an animal. It uses photosynthesis to produce its energy supply without eating food.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it doesn’t like disputes, it will sharpen the leaf on its tail into a blade and fight if it has to protect its friends.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It gets its nutrition from photosynthesis. It lives a quiet life deep in forests where clean rivers flow.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Galarians favor the distinctive aroma that drifts from this Pokémon’s leaves. There’s a popular perfume made using that scent.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon’s tail is blade sharp, with a fantastic cutting edge that can slice right though large trees.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur. Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail’s sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.

name: Togekiss
desc: Togekiss is a Fairy/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Jubilee Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.
pokedex_entries.Sword: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Known as a bringer of blessings, it’s been depicted on good-luck charms since ancient times.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It will never appear where there is strife. Sightings of this Pokémon have recently become rare.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Scant few have ever sighted this Pokémon. After studying what literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when peace reigns in the land.

name: Magmortar
desc: Magmortar is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Blast Pokémon.

name_origin.magma: the melted rock in a volcano

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 202 (Platinum)055 (Black 2/White 2)168 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)202 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)176 (Legends: Arceus)020 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When shooting 3,600 degree F fireballs from its arms, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They dwell in volcanic craters. According to what is known, a single pair of male and female Magmortar lives in one volcano.
pokedex_entries.Moon: From its arm, it launches fireballs hotter than 3,500 degrees Fahrenheit. Its arm starts to melt when it fires a whole barrage.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: There are still quite a few factories that rely on the flames provided by Magmortar to process metals.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Living in the crater of a volcano has caused this Pokémon’s body to resemble its environment—it has an organ similar to a magma chamber.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to melt an iron pot in an instant.

name: Electivire
desc: Electivire is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Thunderbolt Pokémon.

name_origin.wire: thin strand of metal used to conduct electricity

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 199 (Platinum)058 (Black 2/White 2)228 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)297 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)184 (Legends: Arceus)017 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Heedless of enemy attacks, it closes in, shoves its tails onto the foe, then looses high voltage.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Heedless of enemy attacks, it closes in, shoves its tails onto the foe, then looses high voltage.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The instant it presses the tips of its tails onto an opponent, it sends over 20,000 volts of electricity into the foe.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It pushes the tips of its tails against its foes and then lets loose a high-voltage current. Its foes are burned to a crisp in an instant.
pokedex_entries.Moon: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It grips its tail, which spews electricity, and then beats down opponents with the power of its electrified fist.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.
pokedex_entries.Shield: In terms of electrical-energy output, Electivire is one of the best among all Electric Pokémon. It discharges high-voltage currents from its tails.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of electricity.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.

name: Tangrowth
desc: Tangrowth is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Vine Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: When it remains still, it appears to be a large shrub. Unsuspecting prey that wander near get ensnared by its vines.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can’t even see its eyes.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Even if one of its arms is eaten, it’s fine. The Pokémon regenerates quickly and will go right back to normal.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can’t even see its eyes.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Vine growth is accelerated for Tangrowth living in warm climates. If the vines grow long, Tangrowth shortens them by tearing parts of them off.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.

name: Rhyperior
desc: Rhyperior is a Ground/Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Drill Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 188 (Platinum)052 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)178 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)266 (Sword/Shield)122 (Legends: Arceus)185 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. GEODUDE are shot at rare times.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: From holes in its palms, it fires out GEODUDE. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It can load up to three projectiles per arm into the holes in its hands. What launches out of those holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming attacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon as that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. On rare occasions, the Pokémon even shoots out Geodude.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.

name: Lickilicky
desc: Lickilicky is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Licking Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 162 (Platinum)181 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)285 (Black 2/White 2)135 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)376 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)126 (Legends: Arceus)055 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The long tongue is always soggy with slobber. The saliva contains a solvent that causes numbness.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its saliva can decompose anything. It wraps its long tongue around things to coat them with its sticky saliva.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It has space in its throat to store saliva. It can also roll up its tongue and store it in the same spot.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: The long tongue is always soggy with slobber. The saliva contains a solvent that causes numbness.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: A contest is under way to determine which one can stick its tongue out the farthest. The current record is...more than 82 feet.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It uses its tongue much more skillfully than its hands or its feet. It can deftly pick up a single small bean with its tongue.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Lickilicky’s strange tongue can stretch to many times the length of its body. No one has figured out how Lickilicky’s tongue can stretch so far.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Lickilicky can do just about anything with its tongue, which is as dexterous as the human hand. In contrast, Lickilicky’s use of its fingers is clumsy.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky’s height. Beware of the saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.

name: Magnezone
desc: Magnezone is an Electric/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Magnet Area Pokémon.

name_origin.magnetic zone: alternative name for a magnetic field, the region near a magnet

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 180 (Platinum)050 (Black 2/White 2)071 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)086 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)049 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)056 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)179 (Legends: Arceus)107 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A group tried to use scientific means to make MAGNEZONE evolve, but their efforts ended in failure.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Exposure to a special magnetic field changed MAGNETON’s molecular structure, turning it into MAGNEZONE.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: A group tried to use scientific means to make Magnezone evolve, but their efforts ended in failure.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Three units generate magnetism. There have been many mistaken reports of UFO sightings when Magnezone flies through the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Moon: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It uses radar to monitor its territory. Intruders are quickly disposed of with a hyper beam.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: There are still people who believe that this Pokémon came from outer space. It emanates a powerful magnetic field.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Some say that Magnezone receives signals from space via the antenna on its head and that it’s being controlled by some mysterious being.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s thought that a special magnetic field changed the molecular structure of this Pokémon’s body, and that’s what caused the Pokémon’s evolution.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Its three units generate magnetism.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: I theorize that a special magnetic field influenced this Pokémon, changing its molecular structure and causing it to evolve. It emits strange radio waves toward space from its antenna.

location.Legends: Arceus: Celestica Trail, Clamberclaw Cliffs, Fabled Spring

name: Weavile
desc: Weavile is a Dark/Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Sharp Claw Pokémon.

name_origin.weasel: small mammal with a long body

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 145 (Diamond/Pearl)145 (Platinum)253 (Black 2/White 2)092 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)250 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)327 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)293 (Sword/Shield)145 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)204 (Legends: Arceus)029 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Diamond: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It sends signals to others by carving odd patterns in frost-covered trees and ice.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They communicate by clawing signs in boulders and work together to surround enemies.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon’s main food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew, which they carefully divide among their group.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Thanks to its increased intelligence, scrapping over food is a thing of the past. A scratch from its claws will give you a case of frostbite!
pokedex_entries.Sword: They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of a group of Weavile.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its friends to find. The number of distinct signs is said to be over 500.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It sends signals to others of its kind by carving odd patterns on trees and ice.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.

name: Abomasnow
desc: Abomasnow is a Grass/Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Frost Tree Pokémon.

desc: Snover is a Grass/Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Frost Tree Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 142 (Diamond/Pearl)142 (Platinum)088 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)096 (Sword/Shield)142 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)217 (Legends: Arceus)031 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The berries that grow around its belly are like ice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love these berries.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: One is likely to encounter this Pokémon while out in the snow. There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but doing no harm—rather, they bond with the children.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Scientists discovered that the distinctive patterns on its back differ by region.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: People organize tours to see this Pokémon frolic and skim the tops of waves with REMORAID.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: People organize tours to see this Pokémon frolic and skim the tops of waves with Remoraid.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The pattern on its back varies by region. It often swims in a school of Remoraid.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The pattern on its back varies by region. It often swims in a school of Remoraid.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s highly friendly and easily tamed. Tours that take people swimming with Mantyke are a super-popular beach activity.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Mantyke are friendly toward people and will approach boats closely. The patterns on their backs differ depending on their habitat.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Mantyke living in Galar seem to be somewhat sluggish. The colder waters of the seas in this region may be the cause.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and they’ll all fight together to repel attackers.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: A friendly Pokémon that senses the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Scientists discovered that the distinctive patterns on its back differ by region.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Though ball-like in shape, this Pokémon is a proficient swimmer. I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It crawls along the seafloor using its long front fins like legs. It competes for food with LANTURN.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: LUMINEON swimming in the darkness of the deep sea look like stars shining in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It crawls along the seafloor using its long front fins like legs. It competes for food with Lanturn.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.
pokedex_entries.Sun: With its shining light, it lures its prey close. However, the light also happens to attract ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This deep-sea Pokémon lives at the bottom of the sea. Its fins haul it over the seabed in search of its favorite food—Starmie.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Deep down at the bottom of the ocean, prey is scarce. Lumineon get into fierce disputes with Lanturn over food.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: They traverse the deep waters as if crawling over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its fins shine like stars in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing patterns on its four fins.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking— it’s as though there were shining stars right there.
