name: Mothim
desc: Mothim is a Bug/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Moth Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by COMBEE.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It does not keep a nest. It flies over fields and mountains in constant search of floral honey.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: While it loves floral honey, it won’t gather any itself. Instead, it plots to steal some from COMBEE.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the COMBEE hive.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: While it loves floral honey, it won’t gather any itself. Instead, it plots to steal some from Combee.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It loves the nectar of flowers and steals nectar collected by Combee.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It does not keep a nest. It flies over fields and mountains in constant search of its much-beloved nectar.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers, Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.

location.Legends: Arceus: Grueling Grove, Aipom Hill, Ginkgo Landing, Spring Path, Veilstone Cape, Wayward Wood

name: Wormadam
desc: Wormadam is a Bug/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Bagworm Pokémon.

name: Burmy
desc: Burmy is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Bagworm Pokémon.

name: Bastiodon
desc: Bastiodon is a Rock/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Shield Pokémon.

name_origin.bastion: a structure protruding from a fortification

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 039 (Diamond/Pearl)039 (Platinum)191 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)238 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)039 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)211 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: When attacked, they form a wall with their shieldlike faces to protect their young.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When attacked, they form a wall. Their rock-hard faces serve to protect them from the attacks.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.
pokedex_entries.Sun: While it can guard against any sort of attack from the front, it is left without recourse when attacked from behind.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It lived in the same environments as Rampardos. Their fossils have been found together— seemingly from after they’d fought to the finish.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The bones of its face are huge and hard, so they were mistaken for its spine until after this Pokémon was successfully restored.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This Pokémon is from roughly 100 million years ago. Its terrifyingly tough face is harder than steel.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: When attacked, they form a wall with their shield-like faces to protect their young.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its face is sturdy—as strong as diamond—and this hardness offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still unknown, such as its natural habitat.

name: Shieldon
desc: Shieldon is a Rock/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Shield Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 038 (Diamond/Pearl)038 (Platinum)190 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)237 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)038 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)210 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.Diamond: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Many fossils of this Pokémon have been found, but almost none have shown signs of damage to the face.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few enemies would have been willing to square off against its heavily armored face, so it’s thought.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: A mild-mannered, herbivorous Pokémon, it used its face to dig up tree roots to eat. The skin on its face was plenty tough.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although its fossils can be found in layers of primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever been discovered.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Much remains unknown about this Pokémon, as few have ever seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict, and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.

name: Rampardos
desc: Rampardos is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Head Butt Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 037 (Diamond/Pearl)037 (Platinum)189 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)236 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)037 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)209 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its powerful head butt has enough power to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
pokedex_entries.Sun: The result of repeated headbutts is a skull grown thick and hard. However, its brain has shrunk in size compared with Cranidos’s.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Records exist of a revived fossil that evolved into Rampardos. It proceeded to escape and then destroy a skyscraper with a headbutt.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: In ancient times, people would dig up fossils of this Pokémon and use its skull, which is harder than steel, to make helmets.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully. Its brain was really small, so some theories suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its powerful headbutt has enough force to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.

name: Cranidos
desc: Cranidos is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Head Butt Pokémon.

name_origin.cranium: brain or head, referring to Cranidos’ thick skull

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 036 (Diamond/Pearl)036 (Platinum)188 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)235 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)036 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)208 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It was resurrected from an iron ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its head butts.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with head butts.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: CRANIDOS toughen up their already rock-hard heads by headbutting one another.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with head butts.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It was resurrected from an iron ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its headbutts.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with headbutts.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It lived in jungles around a hundred million years ago. It used its skillful headbutts to combat Aerodactyl.
pokedex_entries.Moon: In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found, the fossilized trunks of trees snapped in two are also often found.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: A primeval Pokémon, it possesses a hard and sturdy skull, lacking any intelligence within.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It snapped trees by headbutting them, and then it fed on their ripe berries.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It was resurrected from an iron-ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its headbutts.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the area like the pealing of a bell.

name: Roserade
desc: Roserade is a Grass/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Bouquet Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 027 (Diamond/Pearl)027 (Platinum)135 (Black 2/White 2)073 (X/Y — Central Kalos)099 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)061 (Sword/Shield)027 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)091 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Each of its hands contains different toxins, but both hands can jab with near-fatal power.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its sweet aroma attracts prey. Then it spews poison. The more toxic it is, the sweeter its aroma.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Each of its hands contains different toxins, but both hands can jab with near-fatal power.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.
pokedex_entries.Sword: After captivating opponents with its sweet scent, it lashes them with its thorny whips.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The poison in its right hand is quick acting. The poison in its left hand is slow acting. Both are life threatening.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.

name: Budew
desc: Budew is a Grass/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Bud Pokémon.

name_origin.dew: moisture often found on grass or plants

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Natural Cure2. Poison PointLeaf Guard (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 025 (Diamond/Pearl)025 (Platinum)133 (Black 2/White 2)071 (X/Y — Central Kalos)097 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)059 (Sword/Shield)025 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)089 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It lives alongside clear ponds. It scatters pollen that induces harsh sneezing and runny noses.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Sensitive to changing temperature, the bud is said to bloom when it feels the sun’s warm touch.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When it feels the sun’s warm touch, it opens its bud to release pollen. It lives alongside clear pools.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Sensitive to changing temperature, the bud is said to bloom when it feels the sun’s warm touch.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Sensitive to changing temperatures, the bud blooms when it’s warm, releasing toxic pollen.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When it feels the sun’s warm touch, it opens its bud to release pollen. It lives alongside clear pools.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The pollen it releases contains poison. If this Pokémon is raised on clean water, the poison’s toxicity is increased.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon is highly sensitive to temperature changes. When its bud starts to open, that means spring is right around the corner.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It lives alongside clear ponds. It scatters pollen that induces harsh sneezing and runny noses.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: When the sun’s light strengthens, the bud atop this Pokémon’s head opens. This is a sign to the people that the harsh winter is over, and the season of budding has begun.

name: Luxray
desc: Luxray is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Gleam Eyes Pokémon.

name_origin.x-ray: electromagnetic radiation that can ‘see through’ certain objects

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 019 (Diamond/Pearl)019 (Platinum)019 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)017 (Legends: Arceus)027 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey--even those taking shelter behind a wall.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: LUXRAY’s ability to see through objects comes in handy when it’s scouting for danger.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
pokedex_entries.X: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey--even those taking shelter behind a wall.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Luxray’s ability to see through objects comes in handy when it’s scouting for danger.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey—even those taking shelter behind a wall.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Luxray can see through solid objects. It will instantly spot prey trying to hide behind walls, even if the walls are thick.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Seeing through solid objects uses up a lot of Luxray’s electricity, so the Pokémon sleeps for long periods of time to store up energy.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey—even those taking shelter behind a wall.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say that when Luxray’s two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémon can see through anything.

name: Luxio
desc: Luxio is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Spark Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 018 (Diamond/Pearl)018 (Platinum)018 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)016 (Legends: Arceus)026 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It rests its forelegs on others to communicate with rhythmic electric pulses from its claws.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
pokedex_entries.Sword: By joining its tail with that of another Luxio, this Pokémon can receive some of the other Luxio’s electricity and power up its own electric blasts.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Upon encountering an opponent, this Pokémon prepares for battle by extending its claws, which can put out 1,000,000 volts of electricity.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause opponents to faint. It lives in small groups.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It rests its forelegs on others to communicate with rhythmic electric pulses from its claws.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Proudly uses its electrified claws as weapons. It seems to be a gracious Pokémon, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with others of its kind.

name: Shinx
desc: Shinx is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Flash Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 017 (Diamond/Pearl)017 (Platinum)017 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)015 (Legends: Arceus)025 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Diamond: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its forelegs have a muscle-based system of generating electricity. Its body shines if endangered.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when it’s in trouble.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon generates electricity by contracting its muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx is generating a tremendous amount of electricity.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Electricity makes this Pokémon’s fur glow. Shinx sends signals to others of its kind by shaking the tip of its tail while the tail tip is shining brightly.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its forelegs have a muscle-based system of generating electricity. Its body shines when it is in danger.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Shakes its body to generate electricity. Its stature belies its aggression—one must be patient to tame this Pokémon.

name: Kricketune
desc: Kricketune is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Cricket Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: By allowing its cry to resonate in the hollow of its belly, it produces a captivating sound.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It uses its cutlass-like arms to produce sound, the melody of which varies from individual to individual. It is a worthwhile endeavor to seek out one’s favorite tunes.

name: Kricketot
desc: Kricketot is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Cricket Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are the hallmarks of fall evenings.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: When the trees take on new hues, more of these Pokémon appear. The tone they create by striking their antennae together resembles that of the marimba, an instrument of foreign lands.

name: Bibarel
desc: Bibarel is a Normal/Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Beaver Pokémon.

name_origin.barrel: wooden container often holding water or liquid

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: While its movements out of water are sluggish, it can swim as fast as any FEEBAS.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A river dammed by BIBAREL will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by people nearby.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by people nearby.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: While its movements out of water are sluggish, it can swim as fast as any Feebas.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Bibarel fur repels water and is also a fantastic material for heat retention. These Pokémon create dams on rivers to live in.

name: Bidoof
desc: Bidoof is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Plump Mouse Pokémon.

name_origin.tooth: hard object in the mouth for biting/chewing food

pokedex_entries.Diamond: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A comparison revealed that BIDOOF’s front teeth grow at the same rate as RATTATA’s.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It lives in groups by the water. It chews up boulders and trees around its nest with its incisors.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A comparison revealed that Bidoof’s front teeth grow at the same rate as Rattata’s.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Bidoof has an unsophisticated face and is rarely flustered by anything. There have been incidents involving Bidoof sauntering into villages and gnawing on the houses without a single care.

name: Staraptor
desc: Staraptor is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Predator Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When STARAVIA evolve into STARAPTOR, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger than itself.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It has left the flock, having gained strength enough to survive on its own. The astounding force with which Staraptor flies through the air allows it to carry away large, burly targets.

name: Staravia
desc: Staravia is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Starling Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It flies around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon. It stays within a huge flock.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a STARAVIA cries noisily.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: They fly around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon, moving together in huge flocks.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: They live in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: They form remarkably large flocks and are constantly fighting amongst themselves. I suspect that those with magnificent plumes on their heads are the strong ones.

name: Starly
desc: Starly is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Starling Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Usually with a large flock, it is barely noticeable when alone. Its cries are very strident.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Usually with a large flock, it is barely noticeable when alone. Its cries are very strident.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: They live in the fields and mountains, gathering in large flocks. Their cries are quite obnoxious. Though small, their wings are strong—a strike from them leaves pain that persists for a week.

location.Legends: Arceus: Aspiration Hill, Horseshoe Plains, Tidewater Dam, Deadwood Haunt, Ginkgo Landing, Windswept Run

name: Empoleon
desc: Empoleon is a Water/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Emperor Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It avoids unnecessary disputes, but it will decimate anything that threatens its pride.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Since ancient times, it has been revered by the people of Hisui, who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for even master-crafted blades.

name: Prinplup
desc: Prinplup is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Penguin Pokémon.

name_origin.prince: heir to a throne of an emperor or king

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its wings deliver wicked blows that snap even the thickest of trees. It searches for prey in icy seas.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Because every PRINPLUP considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its wings deliver wicked blows that snap even the thickest of trees. It searches for prey in icy seas.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity to match.

name: Piplup
desc: Piplup is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Penguin Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It lives along shores in northern countries. A skilled swimmer, it dives for over 10 minutes to hunt.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It doesn’t like to be taken care of. It’s difficult to bond with since it won’t listen to its Trainer.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It doesn’t like to be taken care of. It’s difficult to bond with since it won’t listen to its Trainer.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It lives along the shore in northern countries. A skilled swimmer, it dives for over 10 minutes while hunting.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It’s an adorable little thing—as cute as any child—but it’s also prideful, unwilling to accept handouts from people.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Fountainspring Cave, Riverbank Cave, Still-Water Cavern

name: Infernape
desc: Infernape is a Fire/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Flame Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It uses a special kind of martial arts involving all its limbs. Its fire never goes out.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It uses a special kind of martial arts involving all its limbs. Its fire never goes out.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A tall, hardy Pokémon with a dazzling appearance. It shrouds itself in flame and battles as if engaged in dance—truly a sight to behold.

name: Monferno
desc: Monferno is a Fire/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Playful Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: To intimidate attackers, it stretches the fire on its tail to make itself appear bigger.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: A bigger fire on its tail and a brighter blue pattern on its face means its rank in its pack is higher.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: To intimidate attackers, it expands the fire on its tail to make itself appear bigger.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one of its weapons.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.

name: Chimchar
desc: Chimchar is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Chimp Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can’t extinguish the fire.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can’t extinguish the fire.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can’t extinguish the fire.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Full of vigor and always in high spirits. It was once known by the name “Lantern-Tail” and feared as some kind of apparition.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Volcanic Cave, Sandsear Cave, Typhlo Cavern

name: Torterra
desc: Torterra is a Grass/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Continent Pokémon.

name_origin.tortoise: large reptile with a protective shell

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Groups of this Pokémon migrating in search of water have been mistaken for “moving forests.”
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Some Pokémon are born on a TORTERRA’s back and spend their entire life there.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground, a gigantic TORTERRA dwelled.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Some Pokémon are born on a Torterra’s back and spend their entire life there.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground, a gigantic Torterra dwelled.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Groups of this Pokémon migrating in search of water have been mistaken for moving forests.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This remarkable, large-bodied Pokémon would serve beautifully as borrowed scenery for a garden, and its strength is peerless. Torterra roams the wilderness in search of clean water.

name: Grotle
desc: Grotle is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Grove Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: The shell is hardened soil. Some Pokémon come to peck the berries growing on the trees on its back.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: A GROTLE that lives in the forest is said to have its own secret springwater.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe the trees on its shell.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its shell is hardened soil. Some Pokémon come to peck the berries growing on the trees on its back.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Appears where there is clean spring water. The fruit that grows on the shrubs on its shell is sweet, nutritious, and truly delicious.

name: Turtwig
desc: Turtwig is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 4. It is known as the Tiny Leaf Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy TURTWIG, the shell should feel moist.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It undertakes photosynthesis within its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if the Pokémon is thirsty.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly damp and warm to the touch.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Grassland Cave, Riverbank Cave, Still-Water Cavern, Sunlit Cavern

name: Deoxys
desc: Deoxys is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the DNA Pokémon.

name_origin.deoxyribonucleic acid: the full technical name for DNA, the core genetic material for all living things

name: Jirachi
desc: Jirachi is a Steel/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Wish Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: A legend states that JIRACHI will make true any wish that is written on notes attached to its head when it awakens. If this POKéMON senses danger, it will fight without awakening.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: JIRACHI will awaken from its sleep of a thousand years if you sing to it in a voice of purity. It is said to make true any wish that people desire.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It is said to make any wish come true. It is awake for only seven days out of a thousand years.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: JIRACHI is said to make wishes come true. While it sleeps, a tough crystalline shell envelops the body to protect it from enemies.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Generations have believed that any wish written on a note on its head will come true when it awakens.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.
pokedex_entries.X: Generations have believed that any wish written on a note on its head will come true when it awakens.
pokedex_entries.Y: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: A legend states that Jirachi will make true any wish that is written on notes attached to its head when it awakens. If this Pokémon senses danger, it will fight without awakening.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Jirachi will awaken from its sleep of a thousand years if you sing to it in a voice of purity. It is said to make true any wish that people desire.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Once every 1,000 years, the singing of a pure voice will rouse this Pokémon from its near-perpetual slumber. It wakes for only seven days.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s believed that when this Pokémon wakes from its 1,000-year slumber, it will grant any wishes written on the notes attached to its head.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is said to wake up for just seven days every 1,000 years and use its power to grant any wish.

name: Rayquaza
desc: Rayquaza is a Dragon/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Sky High Pokémon.

name: Groudon
desc: Groudon is a Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Continent Pokémon.

name_origin.don: of great size/importance; lord or master

name: Kyogre
desc: Kyogre is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Sea Basin Pokémon.

name: Latios
desc: Latios is a Dragon/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Eon Pokémon.

name: Latias
desc: Latias is a Dragon/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Eon Pokémon.

name: Registeel
desc: Registeel is a Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Iron Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: REGISTEEL has a body that is harder than any kind of metal. Its body is apparently hollow. No one has any idea what this POKéMON eats.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: REGISTEEL was imprisoned by people in ancient times. The metal composing its body is thought to be a curious substance that is not of this earth.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It is sturdier than any kind of metal. It hardened due to pressure underground over tens of thousands of years.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its body is harder than any other kind of metal. The body metal is composed of a mysterious substance. Not only is it hard, it shrinks and stretches flexibly.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its body is said to be harder than any kind of metal. A study has revealed that its body is hollow.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.
pokedex_entries.X: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its body is said to be harder than any kind of metal. A study has revealed that its body is hollow.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Registeel has a body that is harder than any kind of metal. Its body is apparently hollow. No one has any idea what this Pokémon eats.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Registeel was imprisoned by people in ancient times. The metal composing its body is thought to be a curious substance that is not of this earth.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Registeel’s body is made of a strange material that is flexible enough to stretch and shrink but also more durable than any metal.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s rumored that this Pokémon was born deep underground in the planet’s mantle and that it emerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.

name: Regice
desc: Regice is an Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Iceberg Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: REGICE’s body was made during an ice age. The deep-frozen body can’t be melted, even by fire. This POKéMON controls frigid air of minus 328 degrees F.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: REGICE cloaks itself with frigid air of negative 328 degrees F. Things will freeze solid just by going near this POKéMON. Its icy body is so cold, it will not melt even if it is immersed in magma.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: Research revealed that its body is made of the same kind of ice that is found at the South Pole.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its entire body is made of Antarctic ice. After extensive studies, researchers believe the ice was formed during an ice age.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It is said to have slept in a glacier for thousands of years. Its body can’t be melted, even by magma.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.X: It is said to have slept in a glacier for thousands of years. Its body can’t be melted, even by magma.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Regice’s body was made during an ice age. The deep-frozen body can’t be melted, even by fire. This Pokémon controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Regice cloaks itself with frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit. Things will freeze solid just by going near this Pokémon. Its icy body is so cold, it will not melt even if it is immersed in magma.
pokedex_entries.Sword: With cold air that can reach temperatures as low as −328 degrees Fahrenheit, Regice instantly freezes any creature that approaches it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon’s body is made of solid ice. It’s said that Regice was born beneath thick ice in the ice age.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of −328 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Regirock
desc: Regirock is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Rock Peak Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: REGIROCK was sealed away by people long ago. If this POKéMON’s body is damaged in battle, it is said to seek out suitable rocks on its own to repair itself.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: REGIROCK’s body is composed entirely of rocks. Recently, a study made the startling discovery that the rocks were all unearthed from different locations.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It is entirely composed of rocks with no sign of a brain or heart. It is a mystery even to modern scientists.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A POKéMON that is made entirely of rocks and boulders. If parts of its body chip off in battle, REGIROCK repairs itself by adding new rocks.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The same rocks that form its body have been found in ground layers around the world.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.
pokedex_entries.X: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.
pokedex_entries.Y: The same rocks that form its body have been found in ground layers around the world.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Regirock was sealed away by people long ago. If this Pokémon’s body is damaged in battle, it is said to seek out suitable rocks on its own to repair itself.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Regirock’s body is composed entirely of rocks. Recently, a study made the startling discovery that the rocks were all unearthed from different locations.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Every bit of Regirock’s body is made of stone. As parts of its body erode, this Pokémon sticks rocks to itself to repair what’s been lost.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Cutting-edge technology was used to study the internals of this Pokémon’s rock body, but nothing was found—not even a brain or a heart.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, Regirock attaches rocks to repair itself.

name: Metagross
desc: Metagross is a Steel/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Iron Leg Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 192 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)264 (Black 2/White 2)201 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)216 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)280 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)131 (The Crown Tundra)

name: Metang
desc: Metang is a Steel/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Iron Claw Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 191 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)263 (Black 2/White 2)200 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)215 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)279 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)130 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: When two BELDUM fuse together, METANG is formed. The brains of the BELDUM are joined by a magnetic nervous system. By linking its brains magnetically, this POKéMON generates strong psychokinetic power.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: When two BELDUM fuse together, METANG is formed. The brains of the BELDUM are joined by a magnetic nervous system. This POKéMON turns its arms to the rear for traveling at high speed.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It floats midair using magnetism. Its body is so tough, even a crash with a jet plane won’t leave a scratch.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: The claws tipping its arms pack the destructive power to tear through thick iron sheets as if they were silk. It flies at over 60 miles per hour.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It is formed by two BELDUM joining together. Its steel body won’t be scratched if it collides with a jet.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When two BELDUM fuse together, a magnetic nervous system places their brains in union.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won’t be scratched if it collides with a jet.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its two brains are linked, amplifying its psychic power.
pokedex_entries.X: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won’t be scratched if it collides with a jet.
pokedex_entries.Y: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its two brains are linked, amplifying its psychic power.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: When two Beldum fuse together, Metang is formed. The brains of the Beldum are joined by a magnetic nervous system. By linking its brains magnetically, this Pokémon generates strong psychokinetic power.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: When two Beldum fuse together, Metang is formed. The brains of the Beldum are joined by a magnetic nervous system. This Pokémon turns its arms to the rear for traveling at high speed.
pokedex_entries.Sun: When two Beldum link together, their psychic power is doubled. Their intelligence, however, remains unchanged.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It adores magnetic minerals, so it pursues Nosepass at speeds exceeding 60 mph.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: With its two brains, it fires powerful psychic energy to stop its prey in their tracks.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It flies at high speeds around the skies. When it finds its prey, Metang takes a firm grip with its sharp claws and never lets go.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Two Beldum have become stuck together via their own magnetic forces. With two brains, the resulting Metang has doubled psychic powers.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Using magnetic forces to stay aloft, this Pokémon flies at high speeds, weaving through harsh mountain terrain in pursuit of prey.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won’t be scratched if it collides with a jet.

name: Beldum
desc: Beldum is a Steel/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Iron Ball Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 190 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)262 (Black 2/White 2)199 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)214 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)278 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)129 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: Instead of blood, a powerful magnetic force courses throughout BELDUM’s body. This POKéMON communicates with others by sending controlled pulses of magnetism.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: BELDUM keeps itself floating by generating a magnetic force that repels earth’s natural magnetism. When it sleeps, this POKéMON anchors itself to a cliff using the hooks on its rear.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It uses magnetic waves to converse with its kind. All the cells in its body are magnetic.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: When BELDUM gather in a swarm, they move in perfect unison as if they were but one POKéMON. They communicate with each other using brain waves.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The magnetic force generated by its body repels the ground’s natural magnetism, letting it float.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its cells are all magnetic, and it communicates with others by using magnetic pulses.
pokedex_entries.X: The magnetic force generated by its body repels the ground’s natural magnetism, letting it float.
pokedex_entries.Y: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Instead of blood, a powerful magnetic force courses throughout Beldum’s body. This Pokémon communicates with others by sending controlled pulses of magnetism.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Beldum keeps itself floating by generating a magnetic force that repels earth’s natural magnetism. When it sleeps, this Pokémon anchors itself to a cliff using the hooks on its rear.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its cells are all magnets. It uses magnetism to communicate with others of its kind.
pokedex_entries.Moon: With magnetic traction, it pulls its opponents in close. When they’re in range, it slashes them with its rear claws.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Instead of blood, magnetism flows through its body. When it’s feeling bad, try giving it a magnet.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: If you anger it, it will do more than rampage. It will also burst out strong magnetism, causing nearby machines to break.
pokedex_entries.Sword: From its rear, Beldum emits a magnetic force that rapidly pulls opponents in. They get skewered on Beldum’s sharp claws.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The cells in this Pokémon’s body are composed of magnetic material. Instead of blood, magnetic forces flow through Beldum’s body.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: They converse with one another by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Route 228, Rocky Cave, Whiteout Cave, Icy Cave, Big Bluff Cavern, Glacial Cavern

name: Salamence
desc: Salamence is a Dragon/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Dragon Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 189 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)016 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)198 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)119 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)149 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)115 (The Crown Tundra)

name: Shelgon
desc: Shelgon is a Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Endurance Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 188 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)015 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)197 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)118 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)148 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)114 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: Inside SHELGON’s armor-like shell, cells are in the midst of transformation to create an entirely new body. This POKéMON’s shell is extremely heavy, making its movements sluggish.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: Covering SHELGON’s body are outgrowths much like bones. The shell is very hard and bounces off enemy attacks. When awaiting evolution, this POKéMON hides away in a cavern.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It hardly eats while it awaits evolution. It becomes hardier by enduring hunger. Its shell peels off the instant it begins to evolve.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It surrounds its body in an iron-hard shell to accumulate enough power to evolve.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.
pokedex_entries.X: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Inside Shelgon’s armor-like shell, cells are in the midst of transformation to create an entirely new body. This Pokémon’s shell is extremely heavy, making its movements sluggish.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Covering Shelgon’s body are outgrowths much like bones. The shell is very hard and bounces off enemy attacks. When awaiting evolution, this Pokémon hides away in a cavern.
pokedex_entries.Sun: The cells within its shell transform with explosive speed, preparing it for evolution.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They lurk deep within caves—motionless, neither eating nor drinking. Why they don’t die is not known.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The cells within its body are changing at a bewildering pace. Its hard shell is made from the same substance as bone.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Shelgon lives deep within caves. It stays shut up in its hard shell, dreaming of the day it will be able to fly.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon has covered its body in a hard shell that has the same composition as bone. Shelgon stores energy for evolution.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Shelgon ignores its hunger entirely, never eating any food. Apparently, Shelgon will evolve once all its energy stores are used up.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant the Pokémon evolves.

location.Sword: Evolve Bagon
location.Shining Pearl: Spacious Cave, Dazzling Cave, Stargleam Cavern

name: Bagon
desc: Bagon is a Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Rock Head Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 187 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)014 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)196 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)117 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)147 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)113 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: BAGON has a dream of one day soaring in the sky. In doomed efforts to fly, this POKéMON hurls itself off cliffs. As a result of its dives, its head has grown tough and as hard as tempered steel.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: BAGON harbors a never-ending dream of one day soaring high among the clouds. As if trying to dispel its frustration over its inability to fly, this POKéMON slams its hard head against huge rocks and shatters them into pebbles.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: Its steel-hard head can shatter boulders. It longingly hopes for wings to grow so it can fly.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Although it is small, this POKéMON is very powerful because its body is a bundle of muscles. It launches head-butts with its ironlike skull.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its well-developed neck muscles and ironlike head can smash boulders into pieces.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.
pokedex_entries.X: Its well-developed neck muscles and iron-like head can smash boulders into pieces.
pokedex_entries.Y: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Bagon has a dream of one day soaring in the sky. In doomed efforts to fly, this Pokémon hurls itself off cliffs. As a result of its dives, its head has grown tough and as hard as tempered steel.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Bagon harbors a never-ending dream of one day soaring high among the clouds. As if trying to dispel its frustration over its inability to fly, this Pokémon slams its hard head against huge rocks and shatters them into pebbles.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its belief that it will be able to fly one day is apparently the influence of information carried in its genes.
pokedex_entries.Moon: With its steel-hard stone head, it headbutts indiscriminately. This is because of the stress it feels at being unable to fly.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Whenever it sees bird Pokémon flying through the sky, it becomes envious and smashes its surroundings to bits with headbutts.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Some theories suggest that its behavior of forcefully bashing its head into things stimulates cells that affect its evolution.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Bagon jumps off cliffs every day, trying to grow stronger so that someday it will be able to fly.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Bagon is a solitary Pokémon that doesn’t form groups with others of its kind. It also has a head hard enough to cleave a boulder in one strike.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.

location.Sword: Tunnel to the Top
location.Shining Pearl: Route 210, Spacious Cave, Dazzling Cave, Stargleam Cavern

name: Luvdisc
desc: Luvdisc is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Rendezvous Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 183 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)029 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)192 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)111 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)134 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: LUVDISC live in shallow seas in the tropics. This heart-shaped POKéMON earned its name by swimming after loving couples it spotted in the ocean’s waves.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: LUVDISC’s heart-shaped body is a symbol of love and romance. It is said that any couple meeting this POKéMON is promised a loving relationship that never ends.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: During the spawning season, countless LUVDISC congregate at coral reefs, turning the waters pink.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: LUVDISC make the branches of CORSOLA their nests. There is a custom from long ago of giving a LUVDISC as a gift to express one’s feelings of love.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its heart-shaped body makes it popular. In some places, you would give a LUVDISC to someone you love.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.
pokedex_entries.X: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.
pokedex_entries.Y: During the spawning season, countless Luvdisc congregate at coral reefs, turning the waters pink.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Luvdisc live in shallow seas in the tropics. This heart-shaped Pokémon earned its name by swimming after loving couples it spotted in the ocean’s waves.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Luvdisc’s heart-shaped body is a symbol of love and romance. It is said that any couple meeting this Pokémon is promised a loving relationship that never ends.
pokedex_entries.Sun: If a Luvdisc is left on its own, it becomes despondent, leaving itself open to attack. That is when Pelipper snatch them up.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Loving couples have a soft spot for this Pokémon, so honeymoon hotels often release this Pokémon into their pools.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: There was an era when it was overfished due to the rumor that having one of its heart-shaped scales would enable you to find a sweetheart.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola’s branches.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It lives in warm seas. It is said that couples who find this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.

location.BlackWhite: Route 4, 13, Driftveil City, Undella Bay, Undella Town
location.Black 2White 2: Route 13, 21, Undella Town, Humilau City, Seaside Cave
