name: Solrock
desc: Solrock is a Rock/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Meteorite Pokémon.

name_origin.solar: of or relating to the Sun

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SOLROCK is a new species of POKéMON that is said to have fallen from space. It floats in air and moves silently. In battle, this POKéMON releases intensely bright light.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: Sunlight is the source of SOLROCK’s power. It is said to possess the ability to read the emotions of others. This POKéMON gives off intense heat while rotating its body.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It absorbs solar energy during the day. Always expressionless, it can sense what its foe is thinking.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Solar energy is the source of this POKéMON’s power. On sunny days, groups of SOLROCK line up facing the sun and absorb its light.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: A new Pokémon species, rumored to be from the sun. It gives off light while spinning.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: A new Pokémon species, rumored to be from the sun. It gives off light while spinning.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.
pokedex_entries.X: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.
pokedex_entries.Y: It absorbs solar energy during the day. Always expressionless, it can sense what its foe is thinking.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Solrock is a new species of Pokémon that is said to have fallen from space. It floats in air and moves silently. In battle, this Pokémon releases intensely bright light.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Sunlight is the source of Solrock’s power. It is said to possess the ability to read the emotions of others. This Pokémon gives off intense heat while rotating its body.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: This new Pokémon species is rumored to be an avatar of the sun. The Pokémon gives off light while spinning.

name: Lunatone
desc: Lunatone is a Rock/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Meteorite Pokémon.

name_origin.lunar: of or relating to the Moon

pokedex_entries.Ruby: LUNATONE was discovered at a location where a meteorite fell. As a result, some people theorize that this POKéMON came from space. However, no one has been able to prove this theory so far.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: LUNATONE becomes active around the time of the full moon. Instead of walking, it moves by floating in midair. The POKéMON’s intimidating red eyes cause all those who see it to become transfixed with fear.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: Its health ebbs and flows with the lunar cycle. It brims with power when exposed to the light of the full moon.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It becomes very active on the night of a full moon. This POKéMON was first discovered 40 years ago at the site of a meteor strike.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Because it turns active on nights of the full moon, it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Because it turns active on nights of the full moon, it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It’s active on the night of a full moon.
pokedex_entries.X: Because it turns active on nights of the full moon, it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.
pokedex_entries.Y: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Lunatone was discovered at a location where a meteoroid fell. As a result, some people theorize that this Pokémon came from space. However, no one has been able to prove this theory so far.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Lunatone becomes active around the time of the full moon. Instead of walking, it moves by floating in midair. The Pokémon’s intimidating red eyes cause all those who see it to become transfixed with fear.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It’s active on the night of a full moon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It becomes active on nights with a full moon, so it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.

name: Seviper
desc: Seviper is a Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Fang Snake Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SEVIPER shares a generations-long feud with ZANGOOSE. The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This POKéMON attacks using its sword-edged tail.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SEVIPER’s swordlike tail serves two purposes - it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This POKéMON will not give up its long-running blood feud with ZANGOOSE.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It sharpens its swordlike tail on hard rocks. It hides in tall grass and strikes unwary prey with venomous fangs.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: SEVIPER and ZANGOOSE are eternal rivals. It counters a ZANGOOSE’s dazzling agility with its swordlike tail, which also oozes a horrible poison.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: For many generations, it has feuded with ZANGOOSE. It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any ZANGOOSE. It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: For many generations, it has feuded with Zangoose. It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Constant polishing makes the edge of the blade on its tail extremely sharp. It’s Zangoose’s archrival.
pokedex_entries.X: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any Zangoose. It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.
pokedex_entries.Y: Constant polishing makes the edge of the blade on its tail extremely sharp. It’s Zangoose’s archrival.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Seviper shares a generations-long feud with Zangoose. The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This Pokémon attacks using its sword-edged tail.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: For many generations, it has feuded with Zangoose. It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.

location.Shining Pearl: Grassland Cave, Swampy Cave, Dazzling Cave, Sunlit Cavern, Stargleam Cavern, Bogsunk Cavern

name: Zangoose
desc: Zangoose is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Cat Ferret Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: Memories of battling its arch-rival SEVIPER are etched into every cell of ZANGOOSE’s body. This POKéMON adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: ZANGOOSE usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This POKéMON shares a bitter rivalry with SEVIPER that dates back over generations.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: If it comes across a SEVIPER, its fur bristles and it assumes its battle pose. Its sharp claws are its best weapon.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: When it battles, it stands on its hind legs and attacks with its sharply clawed forelegs. Its fur bristles if it encounters any SEVIPER.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It has feuded with SEVIPER for many generations. Its sharp claws are its biggest weapons.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its fur would all stand on end if it smelled a SEVIPER nearby. Its sharp claws tear up its foes.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It has feuded with Seviper for many generations. Its sharp claws are its biggest weapons.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It’s Seviper’s archrival. To threaten those it encounters, it fans out the claws on its front paws.
pokedex_entries.X: It has feuded with Seviper for many generations. Its sharp claws are its biggest weapons.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its fur would all stand on end if it smelled a Seviper nearby. Its sharp claws tear up its foes.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Memories of battling its archrival Seviper are etched into every cell of Zangoose’s body. This Pokémon adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It has feuded with Seviper for many generations. Its sharp claws are its greatest weapons.

desc: Altaria is a Dragon/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Humming Pokémon.

name: Swablu
desc: Swablu is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Cotton Bird Pokémon.

name_origin.swab: a piece of cotton (referring to Swablu’s wings)

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 121 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)171 (Platinum)246 (Black 2/White 2)139 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)126 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)035 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SWABLU has light and fluffy wings that are like cottony clouds. This POKéMON is not frightened of people. It lands on the heads of people and sits there like a cotton-fluff hat.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SWABLU loves to make things clean. If it spots something dirty, it will wipe and polish it with its cottony wings. If its wings become dirty, this POKéMON finds a stream and showers itself.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A POKéMON that has wings like cottony clouds. After enduring winter, in which little food is available, SWABLU flocks move closer to towns in the spring.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Its wings are like cotton tufts. If it perches on someone’s head, it looks like a cotton hat.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It can’t relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its wings bring cottony clouds to mind. It grooms with springwater and loves to sit on heads.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It can’t relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: For some reason, it likes to land on people’s heads softly and act like it’s a hat.
pokedex_entries.X: For some reason, it likes to land on people’s heads softly and act like it’s a hat.
pokedex_entries.Y: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Swablu has light and fluffy wings that are like cottony clouds. This Pokémon is not frightened of people. It lands on the heads of people and sits there like a cotton-fluff hat.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Swablu loves to make things clean. If it spots something dirty, it will wipe and polish it with its cottony wings. If its wings become dirty, this Pokémon finds a stream and showers itself.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its cottony wings are full of air, making them light and fluffy to the touch. Swablu takes diligent care of its wings.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Since Swablu looks like a cumulus cloud, foes can have a hard time finding it. Apparently its wings turned white over many generations.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its wings are like cotton tufts. If it perches on someone’s head, it looks like a cotton hat.

name: Cacturne
desc: Cacturne is a Grass/Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Scarecrow Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: During the daytime, CACTURNE remains unmoving so that it does not lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This POKéMON becomes active at night when the temperature drops.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, CACTURNE will follow in a ragtag group. The POKéMON are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It lives in deserts. It becomes active at night when it hunts for prey exhausted from the desert’s heat.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: After spending thousands of years in harsh deserts, its blood transformed into the same substances as sand. It is nocturnal, so it hunts at night.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day’s desert heat.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Packs of them follow travelers through the desert until the travelers can no longer move.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day’s desert heat.
pokedex_entries.X: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day’s desert heat.
pokedex_entries.Y: Packs of them follow travelers through the desert until the travelers can no longer move.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: During the daytime, Cacturne remains unmoving so that it does not lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This Pokémon becomes active at night when the temperature drops.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day’s desert heat.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Route 228, Grassland Cave, Rocky Cave, Swampy Cave, Sunlit Cavern, Big Bluff Cavern, Bogsunk Cavern

name: Cacnea
desc: Cacnea is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Cactus Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: CACNEA lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes near, this POKéMON shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring the victim down.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower CACNEA grows. This POKéMON battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It prefers harsh environments such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: CACNEA live in deserts with virtually no rainfall. It battles by swinging its thick, spiked arms. Once a year, a yellow flower blooms.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive for 30 days without water.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It lives in arid locations. Its yellow flowers bloom once a year.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive for 30 days without water.
pokedex_entries.X: It lives in arid locations. Its yellow flowers bloom once a year.
pokedex_entries.Y: It prefers harsh environments such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Cacnea lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes near, this Pokémon shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring the victim down.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive for 30 days without water.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Route 228, Grassland Cave, Rocky Cave, Swampy Cave, Sunlit Cavern, Big Bluff Cavern, Bogsunk Cavern

name: Flygon
desc: Flygon is a Ground/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Mystic Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 118 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)123 (Black 2/White 2)005 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)123 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)237 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)306 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)323 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: FLYGON is nicknamed “the elemental spirit of the desert.” Because its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this POKéMON is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: FLYGON whips up a sandstorm by flapping its wings. The wings create a series of notes that sound like singing. Because the “singing” is the only thing that can be heard in a sandstorm, this POKéMON is said to be the desert spirit.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It hides itself by kicking up desert sand with its wings. Red covers shield its eyes from sand.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: The flapping of its wings sounds like singing. To prevent detection by enemies, it hides itself by flapping up a cloud of desert sand.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as “The Desert Spirit.”
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It is nicknamed “The Desert Spirit” because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as “The Desert Spirit.”
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Known as “The Desert Spirit,” this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.
pokedex_entries.X: It hides itself by kicking up desert sand with its wings. Red covers shield its eyes from sand.
pokedex_entries.Y: Known as “The Desert Spirit,” this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Flygon is nicknamed “the elemental spirit of the desert.” Because its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this Pokémon is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Flygon whips up a sandstorm by flapping its wings. The wings create a series of notes that sound like singing. Because the “singing” is the only thing that can be heard in a sandstorm, this Pokémon is said to be the desert spirit.
pokedex_entries.Sun: The flapping of its wings sounds something like singing. Those lured by the sound are enveloped in a sandstorm, becoming Flygon’s prey.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon hides in the heart of sandstorms it creates and seldom appears where people can see it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: By flapping their wings, Flygon cause sandstorms that conceal Krookodile. The team then splits the prey they catch.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: People continue to have their hearts stolen by its enchanting songs and find themselves stranded in the desert.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon hides in the heart of sandstorms it creates and seldom appears where people can see it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It is nicknamed the Desert Spirit because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as the Desert Spirit.

name: Vibrava
desc: Vibrava is a Ground/Dragon type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Vibration Pokémon.

name_origin.larva: young feeding stage of an insect

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 117 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)122 (Black 2/White 2)004 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)122 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)236 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)305 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)322 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: To make prey faint, VIBRAVA generates ultrasonic waves by vigorously making its two wings vibrate. This POKéMON’s ultrasonic waves are so powerful, they can bring on headaches in people.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: VIBRAVA’s wings have not yet completed the process of growing. Rather than flying long distances, they are more useful for generating ultrasonic waves by vibrating.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It generates ultrasonic waves by violently flapping its wings. After making its prey faint, it melts the prey with acid.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It looses ultrasonic waves by rubbing its wings together. Since a VIBRAVA’s wings are still in the process of growing, it can only fly short distances.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It violently shudders its wings, generating ultrasonic waves to induce headaches in people.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It vibrates its wings vigorously, creating ultrasonic waves that cause serious headaches.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It violently shudders its wings, generating ultrasonic waves to induce headaches in people.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The ultrasonic waves it generates by rubbing its two wings together cause severe headaches.
pokedex_entries.X: The ultrasonic waves it generates by rubbing its two wings together cause severe headaches.
pokedex_entries.Y: It generates ultrasonic waves by violently flapping its wings. After making its prey faint, it melts the prey with acid.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: To make prey faint, Vibrava generates ultrasonic waves by vigorously making its two wings vibrate. This Pokémon’s ultrasonic waves are so powerful, they can bring on headaches in people.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Vibrava’s wings have not yet completed the process of growing. Rather than flying long distances, they are more useful for generating ultrasonic waves by vibrating.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Rather than using its underdeveloped wings for flight, it rubs them together, producing ultrasonic waves to attack its enemies.
pokedex_entries.Moon: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It vibrates its wings to generate ultrasonic waves, causing its prey to faint. Then it buries the prey alive in the sand to preserve it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It vibrates its wings to send out odd sound waves. Trainers who are with it need earplugs.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The ultrasonic waves it generates by rubbing its two wings together cause severe headaches.
pokedex_entries.Shield: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It violently shudders its wings, generating ultrasonic waves to induce headaches in people.

name: Trapinch
desc: Trapinch is a Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Ant Pit Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Hyper Cutter2. Arena TrapSheer Force (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 116 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)121 (Black 2/White 2)003 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)121 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)235 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)304 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)321 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: TRAPINCH’s nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit dug in sand. This POKéMON patiently waits for prey to tumble down the pit. Its giant jaws have enough strength to crush even boulders.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: TRAPINCH is a patient hunter. It digs an inescapable pit in a desert and waits for its prey to come tumbling down. This POKéMON can go a whole week without access to any water.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It lives in arid deserts. It makes a sloping pit trap in sand where it patiently awaits prey.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its big jaws crunch through boulders. Because its head is so big, it has a hard time getting back upright if it tips over onto its back.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It makes a conical pit in desert sand and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit in the desert. Once something has fallen in, there is no escape.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It makes a conical pit in desert sand and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
pokedex_entries.X: It lives in arid deserts. It makes a sloping pit trap in sand where it patiently awaits prey.
pokedex_entries.Y: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Trapinch’s nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit dug in sand. This Pokémon patiently waits for prey to tumble down the pit. Its giant jaws have enough strength to crush even boulders.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Trapinch is a patient hunter. It digs an inescapable pit in a desert and waits for its prey to come tumbling down. This Pokémon can go a whole week without access to any water.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It can live for a week without eating a thing. It waits patiently at the bottom of its nest for prey to appear.
pokedex_entries.Moon: As it digs through the sand, its giant jaws crush any rocks that obstruct its path. It builds a funnel-shaped nest.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its jaws are strong enough to crush rocks but so heavy that it can’t get up if it flips over. Sandile seize those moments as their chance.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It builds nests that double as traps, lying in wait for its prey to get caught. When night falls, it digs itself a spot beneath the sand to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit in the desert. Once something has fallen in, there is no escape.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It makes a conical pit in desert sand and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

name: Spinda
desc: Spinda is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Spot Panda Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 114 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)131 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)119 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)105 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)128 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: All the SPINDA that exist in the world are said to have utterly unique spot patterns. The shaky, tottering steps of this POKéMON give it the appearance of dancing.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: No two SPINDA are said to have identical spot patterns on their hides. This POKéMON moves in a curious manner as if it is stumbling in dizziness. Its lurching movements can cause the opponent to become confused.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: No two SPINDA are said to have identical patterns. It confuses foes with its stumbling motions.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is distinguished by a pattern of spots that is always different. Its unsteady, tottering walk has the effect of fouling its foe’s aim.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: No two SPINDA have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The chances of two SPINDA having identical spot patterns is less than one in four billion.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.
pokedex_entries.X: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.
pokedex_entries.Y: The chances of two Spinda having identical spot patterns is less than one in four billion.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: All the Spinda that exist in the world are said to have utterly unique spot patterns. The shaky, tottering steps of this Pokémon give it the appearance of dancing.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: No two Spinda are said to have identical spot patterns on their hides. This Pokémon moves in a curious manner as if it is stumbling in dizziness. Its lurching movements can cause the opponent to become confused.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its steps are staggering and unsteady, but Spinda thinks it’s walking in a straight line.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Each and every Spinda has a slightly different configuration of spots. There are collectors who enjoy the tiny differences in their spot patterns.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its steps are shaky and stumbling. Walking for a long time makes it feel sick.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Each Spinda’s spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents’ attacks brilliantly!
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Their tottering steps hinder the aim of foes.

name: Grumpig
desc: Grumpig is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Manipulate Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: GRUMPIG uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe. When this POKéMON uses its special power, its snorting breath grows labored.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: GRUMPIG uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This POKéMON’s black pearls are valuable as works of art.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It can gain control over foes by doing odd dance steps. The black pearls on its forehead are precious gems.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It stores power in the black pearls on its forehead. When it uses psychic power, it performs an odd dance step. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It uses black pearls to amplify its psycho-power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It uses black pearls to amplify its psycho-power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes’ minds.
pokedex_entries.X: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes’ minds.
pokedex_entries.Y: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe. When this Pokémon uses its special power, its snorting breath grows labored.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokémon’s black pearls are valuable as works of art.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.

name: Spoink
desc: Spoink is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Bounce Pokémon.

name_origin.spring: a coil that enables a bouncing action

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SPOINK bounces around on its tail. The shock of its bouncing makes its heart pump. As a result, this POKéMON cannot afford to stop bouncing - if it stops, its heart will stop.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SPOINK keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this POKéMON’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It apparently dies if it stops bouncing about. It carries a pearl from CLAMPERL on its head.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A POKéMON that manipulates psychic power at will. It doesn’t stop bouncing even when it is asleep. It loves eating mushrooms that grow underground.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It bounces around on its tail to keep its heart pumping. It carries a pearl from CLAMPERL on its head.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Using its tail like a spring, it keeps its heart beating by bouncing constantly. If it stops, it dies.
pokedex_entries.X: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.
pokedex_entries.Y: It bounces around on its tail to keep its heart pumping. It carries a pearl from Clamperl on its head.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Spoink bounces around on its tail. The shock of its bouncing makes its heart pump. As a result, this Pokémon cannot afford to stop bouncing—if it stops, its heart will stop.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.

name: Torkoal
desc: Torkoal is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Coal Pokémon.

name_origin.tortoise: large reptile with a protective shell

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 105 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)096 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)110 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)223 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)287 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)300 (Sword/Shield)173 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: TORKOAL digs through mountains in search of coal. If it finds some, it fills hollow spaces on its shell with the coal and burns it. If it is attacked, this POKéMON spouts thick black smoke to beat a retreat.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: TORKOAL generates energy by burning coal. It grows weaker as the fire dies down. When it is preparing for battle, this POKéMON burns more coal.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It burns coal inside its shell. If it is attacked, it belches thick, black smoke and flees.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It battles using energy it gets from burning coal. When loosing smoke from its nostrils, it lets off a sound that is similar to a locomotive’s horn.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
pokedex_entries.X: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.
pokedex_entries.Y: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Torkoal digs through mountains in search of coal. If it finds some, it fills hollow spaces on its shell with the coal and burns it. If it is attacked, this Pokémon spouts thick black smoke to beat a retreat.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Torkoal generates energy by burning coal. It grows weaker as the fire dies down. When it is preparing for battle, this Pokémon burns more coal.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Coal is the source of Torkoal’s energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mountains where they live.
pokedex_entries.Moon: If the fire burning within its shell goes out, it will die. Those who wish to raise one in their home must always keep something flammable at hand.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: You can tell how it’s feeling by the smoke spouting from its shell. Tremendous velocity is a sign of good health.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It burns coal to produce energy. When it has burned through all of its coal, it becomes unable to move.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
pokedex_entries.Shield: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is in a tough situation.

name: Numel
desc: Numel is a Fire/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Numb Pokémon.

name_origin.camel: hump-backed mammal commonly found in desert areas

pokedex_entries.Ruby: NUMEL is extremely dull witted - it doesn’t notice being hit. However, it can’t stand hunger for even a second. This POKéMON’s body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: NUMEL stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees F within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the POKéMON’s body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: Magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. When it grows cold, the magma hardens and slows it.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A NUMEL stores boiling magma in the hump on its back. It is a hardy POKéMON that can transport a 220-pound load. It has served humans at work since long ago.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The flaming magma it stores in the hump on its back is the source of its tremendous power.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees F. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.
pokedex_entries.X: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.
pokedex_entries.Y: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Numel is extremely dull witted—it doesn’t notice being hit. However, it can’t stand hunger for even a second. This Pokémon’s body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon’s body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing Numel down.

name: Wailord
desc: Wailord is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Float Whale Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 100 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)241 (Black 2/White 2)028 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)105 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)267 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)352 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)357 (Sword/Shield)191 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: WAILORD is the largest of all identified POKéMON up to now. This giant POKéMON swims languorously in the vast open sea, eating massive amounts of food at once with its enormous mouth.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: When chasing prey, WAILORD herds them by leaping out of the water and making a humongous splash. It is breathtaking to see this POKéMON leaping out of the sea with others in its pod.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It is among the largest of all POKéMON. It herds prey in a pack then swallows the massed prey in one gulp.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It breathes through nostrils that it raises above the sea. By inhaling to its maximum capacity, a WAILORD can dive close to 10,000 feet beneath the waves.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: The biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It is the largest of all identified Pokémon. They jump as a pack to herd their prey.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: The biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.
pokedex_entries.X: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.
pokedex_entries.Y: The biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Wailord is the largest of all identified Pokémon up to now. This giant Pokémon swims languorously in the vast open sea, eating massive amounts of food at once with its enormous mouth.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: When chasing prey, Wailord herds them by leaping out of the water and making a humongous splash. It is breathtaking to see this Pokémon leaping out of the sea with others in its pod.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Wailord pursue their prey in pods. With their large mouths, they can swallow entire schools of Wishiwashi whole.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: They eat so many fish Pokémon that when Wailord become too numerous, fishermen have to chase them off.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When a small Wailmer is attacked by Sharpedo or Dhelmise, its whole pod works together to protect it.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It’s the biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.

name: Wailmer
desc: Wailmer is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Ball Whale Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 099 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)240 (Black 2/White 2)027 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)104 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)266 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)351 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)356 (Sword/Shield)190 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: WAILMER’s nostrils are located above its eyes. This playful POKéMON loves to startle people by forcefully snorting out seawater it stores inside its body out of its nostrils.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: WAILMER can store water inside its body to transform itself into a ball for bouncing around on the ground. By filling itself up with more water, this POKéMON can elevate the height of its bounces.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: While this POKéMON usually lives in the sea, it can survive on land, although not too long. It loses vitality if its body becomes dried out.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It bounces playfully like a ball. The more seawater it swallows, the higher it bounces.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It eats one ton of food every day. It plays by shooting stored seawater out its blowholes with great force.
pokedex_entries.X: It bounces playfully like a ball. The more seawater it swallows, the higher it bounces.
pokedex_entries.Y: It eats one ton of food every day. It plays by shooting stored seawater out its blowholes with great force.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Wailmer’s nostrils are located above its eyes. This playful Pokémon loves to startle people by forcefully snorting out seawater it stores inside its body out of its nostrils.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Wailmer can store water inside its body to transform itself into a ball for bouncing around on the ground. By filling itself up with more water, this Pokémon can elevate the height of its bounces.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It loves to startle people. It fills itself up with seawater and plays by bouncing around like a ball.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It swims along with its mouth open and swallows down seawater along with its food. It sprays excess water out of its nostrils.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Due to their memories of when they once lived on land, pods of them will, very rarely, wash up on shore.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nostrils.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: CARVANHA’s strongly developed jaws and its sharply pointed fangs pack the destructive power to rip out boat hulls. Many boats have been attacked and sunk by this POKéMON.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: If anything invades CARVANHA’s territory, it will swarm and tear at the intruder with its pointed fangs. On its own, however, this POKéMON turns suddenly timid.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It lives in massive rivers that course through jungles. It swarms prey that enter its territory.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: CARVANHA attack ships in swarms, making them sink. Although it is said to be a very vicious POKéMON, it timidly flees as soon as it finds itself alone.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: They swarm any foe that invades their territory. Their sharp fangs can tear out boat hulls.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: They form packs to attack boats and rip out their hulls to sink them. They live in rivers in the jungle.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: They swarm any foe that invades their territory. Their sharp fangs can tear out boat hulls.
pokedex_entries.X: They form packs to attack boats and rip out their hulls to sink them. They live in rivers in the jungle.
pokedex_entries.Y: It lives in massive rivers that course through jungles. It swarms prey that enter its territory.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Carvanha’s strongly developed jaws and its sharply pointed fangs pack the destructive power to rip out boat hulls. Many boats have been attacked and sunk by this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: If anything invades Carvanha’s territory, it will swarm and tear at the intruder with its pointed fangs. On its own, however, this Pokémon turns suddenly timid.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Each school has its own territory. Any intruders are mercilessly attacked with fangs bared.
pokedex_entries.Moon: If they scent the faintest trace of blood, they rush to attack en masse. When alone, they’re rather cowardly.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: They’re such cowards that they won’t hunt alone. When five or so of them get together, they suddenly turn ferocious!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: With its sturdy jaws and fangs, it can easily chomp wooden boats to splinters. It fights with Basculin over food.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It won’t attack while it’s alone—not even if it spots prey. Instead, it waits for other Carvanha to join it, and then the Pokémon attack as a group.
pokedex_entries.Shield: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: They swarm any foe that invades their territory. Their sharp fangs can tear out boat hulls.

location.Ultra SunUltra Moon: Ancient Poni Path, Poni Breaker Coast
location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Great Marsh, Fountainspring Cave, Riverbank Cave, Still-Water Cavern

name: Swalot
desc: Swalot is a Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Poison Bag Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: When SWALOT spots prey, it spurts out a hideously toxic fluid from its pores and sprays the target. Once the prey has weakened, this POKéMON gulps it down whole with its cavernous mouth.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SWALOT has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this POKéMON’s mouth.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It can swallow a tire whole in one gulp. It secretes a horribly toxic fluid from the pores on its body.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its powerful stomach acid is capable of digesting almost anything. The one thing in the whole world a SWALOT can’t digest is its own stomach.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It gulps anything that fits in its mouth. Its special enzymes can dissolve anything.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.
pokedex_entries.X: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.
pokedex_entries.Y: It gulps anything that fits in its mouth. Its special enzymes can dissolve anything.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: When Swalot spots prey, it spurts out a hideously toxic fluid from its pores and sprays the target. Once the prey has weakened, this Pokémon gulps it down whole with its cavernous mouth.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon’s mouth.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.

name: Gulpin
desc: Gulpin is a Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Stomach Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: Virtually all of GULPIN’s body is its stomach. As a result, it can swallow something its own size. This POKéMON’s stomach contains a special fluid that digests anything.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: Most of GULPIN’s body is made up of its stomach - its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This POKéMON’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: There is nothing its stomach can’t digest. While it is digesting, vile, overpowering gases are expelled.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: This POKéMON’s stomach fluid can even digest scrap iron. In one gulp, it can swallow something that is as large as itself.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Almost all its body is its stomach. Its harsh digestive juices quickly dissolve anything it swallows.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It has a small heart and brain. Its stomach comprises most of its body, with enzymes to dissolve anything.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Almost all its body is its stomach. Its harsh digestive juices quickly dissolve anything it swallows.
pokedex_entries.X: It has a small heart and brain. Its stomach comprises most of its body, with enzymes to dissolve anything.
pokedex_entries.Y: There is nothing its stomach can’t digest. While it is digesting, vile, overpowering gases are expelled.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Virtually all of Gulpin’s body is its stomach. As a result, it can swallow something its own size. This Pokémon’s stomach contains a special fluid that digests anything.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Almost all its body is its stomach. Its harsh digestive juices quickly dissolve anything it swallows.

name: Roselia
desc: Roselia is a Grass/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Thorn Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Natural Cure2. Poison PointLeaf Guard (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 094 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)026 (Diamond/Pearl)026 (Platinum)134 (Black 2/White 2)072 (X/Y — Central Kalos)098 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)060 (Sword/Shield)026 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)090 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: ROSELIA shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that tries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this POKéMON brings serenity to living things.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: On extremely rare occasions, a ROSELIA is said to appear with its flowers in unusual colors. The thorns on this POKéMON’s head contain a vicious poison.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the ROSELIA is.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A ROSELIA that drinks nutritionally rich springwater blooms with lovely flowers. The fragrance of its flowers has the effect of making its foes careless.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: ROSELIA raised on clean drinking water are known to grow vividly colored flowers.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: The beautiful flowers on its arms have toxic thorns. Don’t even think about picking those flowers.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The more healthy the ROSELIA, the more pleasant its flowers’ aroma. Its scent deeply relaxes people.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: ROSELIA that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: The more healthy the Roselia, the more pleasant its flowers’ aroma. Its scent deeply relaxes people.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It uses the different poisons in each hand separately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma, the healthier it is.
pokedex_entries.X: It uses the different poisons in each hand separately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma, the healthier it is.
pokedex_entries.Y: Roselia that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Roselia shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that tries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this Pokémon brings serenity to living things.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: On extremely rare occasions, a Roselia is said to appear with its flowers in unusual colors. The thorns on this Pokémon’s head contain a vicious poison.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the Roselia is.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It uses the different poisons in each hand separately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma, the healthier it is.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Roselia raised on clean drinking water are known to grow vividly colored flowers.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: The beautiful flowers on its arms have toxic thorns. Don’t even think about picking those flowers.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Though beautiful, it has highly poisonous thorns. There is an old tradition in my homeland wherein one would send these thorns to an opponent to challenge them to a duel.

name: Illumise
desc: Illumise is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Firefly Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: ILLUMISE attracts a swarm of VOLBEAT using a sweet fragrance. Once the VOLBEAT have gathered, this POKéMON leads the lit-up swarm in drawing geometric designs on the canvas of the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: ILLUMISE leads a flight of illuminated VOLBEAT to draw signs in the night sky. This POKéMON is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It guides VOLBEAT to draw signs in night skies. There are scientists that study the patterns it creates.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A nocturnal POKéMON that becomes active upon nightfall. It leads a VOLBEAT swarm to draw patterns in the night sky. Over 200 different patterns have been confirmed.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: With its sweet aroma, it guides VOLBEAT to draw signs with light in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its fragrance attracts a swarm of VOLBEAT, so they draw over 200 patterns in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.X: Its fragrance attracts a swarm of Volbeat, so they draw over 200 patterns in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Y: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Illumise attracts a swarm of Volbeat using a sweet fragrance. Once the Volbeat have gathered, this Pokémon leads the lit-up swarm in drawing geometric designs on the canvas of the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Route 229, Grassland Cave, Dazzling Cave, Sunlit Cavern, Stargleam Cavern

name: Volbeat
desc: Volbeat is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Firefly Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: With the arrival of night, VOLBEAT emits light from its tail. It communicates with others by adjusting the intensity and flashing of its light. This POKéMON is attracted by the sweet aroma of ILLUMISE.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: VOLBEAT’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other VOLBEAT, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This POKéMON loves the sweet aroma given off by ILLUMISE.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It lives around clean ponds. At night, its rear lights up. It converses with others by flashing its light.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: With their taillights lit, VOLBEAT fly in a swarm, drawing geometric designs in the night sky. They move their nests if their pond water becomes dirty.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It communicates with others by lighting up its rear at night. It loves ILLUMISE’s sweet aroma.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It emits light from its tail to communicate. It loves the sweet aroma given off by ILLUMISE.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It communicates with others by lighting up its rear at night. It loves Illumise’s sweet aroma.
pokedex_entries.X: It communicates with others by lighting up its rear at night. It loves Illumise’s sweet aroma.
pokedex_entries.Y: It lives around clean ponds. At night, its rear lights up. It converses with others by flashing its light.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: With the arrival of night, Volbeat emits light from its tail. It communicates with others by adjusting the intensity and flashing of its light. This Pokémon is attracted by the sweet aroma of Illumise.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It communicates with others by lighting up its rear at night. It loves Illumise’s sweet aroma.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Route 229, Grassland Cave, Dazzling Cave, Sunlit Cavern, Stargleam Cavern

name: Minun
desc: Minun is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Cheering Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: MINUN is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: MINUN loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this POKéMON gives off increasing amounts of sparks.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: Its dislike of water makes it take shelter under the eaves of houses in rain. It uses pom-poms made of sparks for cheering.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: At a meeting of POKéMON academics, it was announced that simultaneous exposure to electricity from a PLUSLE and MINUN will promote circulation and boost vitality.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Exposure to electricity from MINUN and PLUSLE promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.
pokedex_entries.X: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.
pokedex_entries.Y: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Minun is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

name: Plusle
desc: Plusle is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Cheering Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: PLUSLE always acts as a cheerleader for its partners. Whenever a teammate puts out a good effort in battle, this POKéMON shorts out its body to create the crackling noises of sparks to show its joy.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: When PLUSLE is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this POKéMON cries loudly.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It cheers on partners while scattering sparks from its body. It climbs telephone poles to absorb electricity.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It has the trait of cheering on its fellow POKéMON. By shorting out the electricity it releases from its paws, it creates pom-poms for cheering.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.
pokedex_entries.X: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.
pokedex_entries.Y: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Plusle always acts as a cheerleader for its partners. Whenever a teammate puts out a good effort in battle, this Pokémon shorts out its body to create the crackling noises of sparks to show its joy.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

desc: Manectric is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Discharge Pokémon.

name: Electrike
desc: Electrike is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Lightning Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 078 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)073 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)080 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)293 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)066 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: ELECTRIKE stores electricity in its long body hair. This POKéMON stimulates its leg muscles with electric charges. These jolts of power give its legs explosive acceleration performance.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: ELECTRIKE runs faster than the human eye can follow. The friction from running is converted into electricity, which is then stored in this POKéMON’s fur.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It generates electricity using friction from the atmosphere. In seasons with especially arid air, its entire body blazes with violent showers of sparks.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks from all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.
pokedex_entries.X: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.
pokedex_entries.Y: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Electrike stores electricity in its long body hair. This Pokémon stimulates its leg muscles with electric charges. These jolts of power give its legs explosive acceleration performance.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Electrike runs faster than the human eye can follow. The friction from running is converted into electricity, which is then stored in this Pokémon’s fur.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Friction between the air and its fur produces static electricity. When Electrike runs, it makes a crackling sound.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Static electricity builds up all over its body as strands of its long fur rub together. This Pokémon boasts incredible speed.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks from all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: MEDITITE undertakes rigorous mental training deep in the mountains. However, whenever it meditates, this POKéMON always loses its concentration and focus. As a result, its training never ends.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: MEDITITE heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this POKéMON’s training.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It never skips its daily yoga training. It heightens its inner strength through meditation.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It continually meditates for hours every day. As a result of rigorous and dedicated yoga training, it has tempered its spiritual power so much it can fly.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger, its spirit is tempered and made sharper.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It never misses its daily yoga workouts, and it heightens its spiritual power through meditation.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It always trains deep in mountains. It levitates when it heightens its spiritual power through meditation.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It meditates to heighten its inner energy and to float in the air. It eats one berry a day.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It always trains deep in mountains. It levitates when it heightens its spiritual power through meditation.
pokedex_entries.X: It always trains deep in mountains. It levitates when it heightens its spiritual power through meditation.
pokedex_entries.Y: It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger, its spirit is tempered and made sharper.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Meditite undertakes rigorous mental training deep in the mountains. However, whenever it meditates, this Pokémon always loses its concentration and focus. As a result, its training never ends.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon’s training.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It meditates in order to build up its mental energy. It’s said to eat just one Berry a day.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It never misses its daily yoga workouts, and it heightens its spiritual power through meditation.

name: Lairon
desc: Lairon is a Steel/Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Iron Armor Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 071 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)167 (Black 2/White 2)100 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)073 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)192 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: LAIRON tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious mineral springwater until it is bloated. This POKéMON makes its nest close to springs of delicious water.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: LAIRON feeds on iron contained in rocks and water. It makes its nest on mountains where iron ore is buried. As a result, the POKéMON often clashes with humans mining the iron ore.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It habitually shows off its strength with the size of sparks it creates by ramming its steel body into boulders.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: When two LAIRON meet in the wild, they fight for territory by bashing into each other with their steel bodies. The sound of their collision carries for miles.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Lairon fight over territory, and when their steel bodies collide, sparks fly.
pokedex_entries.X: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.
pokedex_entries.Y: It habitually shows off its strength with the size of sparks it creates by ramming its steel body into boulders.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Lairon tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious mineral springwater until it is bloated. This Pokémon makes its nest close to springs of delicious water.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Lairon feeds on iron contained in rocks and water. It makes its nest on mountains where iron ore is buried. As a result, the Pokémon often clashes with humans mining the iron ore.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokémon often came into conflict with humans in the past.
pokedex_entries.Shield: During territorial disputes, Lairon fight by slamming into each other. Close inspection of their steel armor reveals scratches and dents.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Rocky Cave, Whiteout Cave, Icy Cave, Big Bluff Cavern, Glacial Cavern

name: Aron
desc: Aron is a Steel/Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Iron Armor Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 070 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)166 (Black 2/White 2)099 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)072 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)191 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: This POKéMON has a body of steel. To make its body, ARON feeds on iron ore that it digs from mountains. Occasionally, it causes major trouble by eating bridges and rails.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: ARON has a body of steel. With one all-out charge, this POKéMON can demolish even a heavy dump truck. The destroyed dump truck then becomes a handy meal for the POKéMON.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It eats iron to build its steel body. It is a pest that descends from mountains to eat bridges and train tracks.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A POKéMON that is clad in steel armor. A new suit of armor is made when it evolves. The old, discarded armor is salvaged as metal for making iron products.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that covered its whole body and develops a new one.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: In order to build up its steel body, it eats iron ore. This pesky Pokémon is known to eat railroad tracks.
pokedex_entries.X: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.
pokedex_entries.Y: When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that covered its whole body and develops a new one.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: This Pokémon has a body of steel. To make its body, Aron feeds on iron ore that it digs from mountains. Occasionally, it causes major trouble by eating bridges and rails.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Aron has a body of steel. With one all-out charge, this Pokémon can demolish even a heavy dump truck. The destroyed dump truck then becomes a handy meal for the Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks—to build up the steel armor that protects its body.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When Aron evolves, its steel armor peels off. In ancient times, people would collect Aron’s shed armor and make good use of it in their daily lives.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It usually lives deep in mountains. But when it’s hungry, it shows up at the foot of the mountains and eats railroad tracks and cars.

location.Brilliant Diamond: Fuego Ironworks, Rocky Cave, Whiteout Cave, Icy Cave, Big Bluff Cavern, Glacial Cavern
