name: Delcatty
desc: Delcatty is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Prim Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: DELCATTY prefers to live an unfettered existence in which it can do as it pleases at its own pace. Because this POKéMON eats and sleeps whenever it decides, its daily routines are completely random.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: DELCATTY sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other POKéMON approach it as it sleeps, this POKéMON will never fight - it will just move away somewhere else.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: The favorite of trend-conscious female TRAINERS, they are used in competition for their style and fur.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Rather than keeping a permanent lair, it habitually seeks comfortable spots and sleeps there. It is nocturnal and becomes active at dusk.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It dislikes dirty places. It often searches for a comfortable place in which to groom itself.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The reason it does not have a nest is that it simply searches for a clean, comfortable place then sleeps there.
pokedex_entries.X: It dislikes dirty places. It often searches for a comfortable place in which to groom itself.
pokedex_entries.Y: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Delcatty prefers to live an unfettered existence in which it can do as it pleases at its own pace. Because this Pokémon eats and sleeps whenever it decides, its daily routines are completely random.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokémon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémon will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is highly popular among Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.

name: Skitty
desc: Skitty is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Kitten Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SKITTY has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This POKéMON is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SKITTY is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this POKéMON lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It is said to be difficult to earn its trust. However, it is extremely popular for its cute looks and behavior.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A SKITTY’s adorably cute behavior makes it highly popular. In battle, it makes its tail puff out. It threatens foes with a sharp growl.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It can’t stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It’s adorable when it chases its own tail. It’s difficult to earn its trust.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It can’t stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.
pokedex_entries.X: It can’t stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.
pokedex_entries.Y: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Skitty has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This Pokémon is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It can’t stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in circles, chasing its own tail.

name: Nosepass
desc: Nosepass is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Compass Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 060 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)155 (Platinum)164 (Black 2/White 2)093 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)061 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)198 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)254 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)190 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: NOSEPASS’s magnetic nose is always pointed to the north. If two of these POKéMON meet, they cannot turn their faces to each other when they are close because their magnetic noses repel one another.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: NOSEPASS had been said to be completely unmoving, with its magnetic nose pointed due north. However, close observation has revealed that the POKéMON actually moves by a little over 3/8 of an inch every year.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: Its magnetic nose consistently faces north. Travelers check NOSEPASS to get their bearings.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its body emits a powerful magnetism. It feeds on prey that is pulled in by the force. Its magnetism is stronger in cold seasons.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Its nose is a magnet. As a result, this Pokémon always keeps its face pointing north.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When endangered, it may protect itself by raising its magnetism and drawing iron objects to its body.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: If two of these meet, they cannot get too close because their noses repel each other.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: When endangered, it may protect itself by raising its magnetism and drawing iron objects to its body.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its magnetic nose always faces north and draws iron objects to its body to protect itself better.
pokedex_entries.X: Its magnetic nose always faces north and draws iron objects to its body to protect itself better.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its magnetic nose consistently faces north. Travelers check Nosepass to get their bearings.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Nosepass’s magnetic nose is always pointed to the north. If two of these Pokémon meet, they cannot turn their faces to each other when they are close because their magnetic noses repel one another.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Nosepass had been said to be completely unmoving, with its magnetic nose pointed due north. However, close observation has revealed that the Pokémon actually moves by a little over 3/8 of an inch every year.
pokedex_entries.Sun: The magnet in Nosepass’s nose provides an unerring compass, making it an excellent partner for Trainers going on a journey.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It uses powerful magnetism to drag its prey toward it. It’s also been known to pull in metal, which it collects and uses to protect itself.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It moves less than an inch a year, but when it’s in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It hunts without twitching a muscle by pulling in its prey with powerful magnetism. But sometimes it pulls natural enemies in close.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its nose is a magnet. As a result, this Pokémon always keeps its face pointing north.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Once the people of Hisui discovered that its red nose always points north, they grew to rely on it greatly when traveling afar. The nose seems to work in a similar way to ancient compasses.

location.Black 2White 2: Chargestone Cave, Clay Tunnel, Underground Ruins

name: Azurill
desc: Azurill is a Normal/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Polka Dot Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Thick Fat2. Huge PowerSap Sipper (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 054 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)124 (Diamond/Pearl)124 (Platinum)030 (Black 2/White 2)041 (X/Y — Central Kalos)055 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)124 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)139 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: AZURILL spins its tail as if it were a lasso, then hurls it far. The momentum of the throw sends its body flying, too. Using this unique action, one of these POKéMON managed to hurl itself a record 33 feet.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: AZURILL’s tail is large and bouncy. It is packed full of the nutrients this POKéMON needs to grow. AZURILL can be seen bouncing and playing on its big, rubbery tail.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It battles by flinging around its tail, which is bigger than its body. The tail is a flotation device in water.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its tail, which is packed with nutrition, is very bouncy like a rubber ball. On sunny days they gather at the edge of water and splash about for fun.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: A Pokémon that lives by water. It moves quickly on land by bouncing on its big tail.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its tail is filled with nutrients necessary for growth. It plays by bouncing on its tail.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its tail bounces like a rubber ball. It flings that tail around to fight opponents bigger than itself.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its tail is packed full of the nutrients it needs to grow.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its tail bounces like a rubber ball. It flings that tail around to fight opponents bigger than itself.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It swings its large, nutrient-filled tail around to fight opponents bigger than itself.
pokedex_entries.X: A Pokémon that lives by water. It moves quickly on land by bouncing on its big tail.
pokedex_entries.Y: It swings its large, nutrient-filled tail around to fight opponents bigger than itself.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Azurill spins its tail as if it were a lasso, then hurls it far. The momentum of the throw sends its body flying, too. Using this unique action, one of these Pokémon managed to hurl itself a record 33 feet.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Azurill’s tail is large and bouncy. It is packed full of the nutrients this Pokémon needs to grow. Azurill can be seen bouncing and playing on its big, rubbery tail.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The ball on Azurill’s tail bounces like a rubber ball, and it’s full of the nutrients the Pokémon needs to grow.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Although Azurill are normally docile, an angry one will swing around the big ball on its tail and try to smash its opponents.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It’s a Pokémon that lives by water. It moves quickly on land by bouncing on its big tail.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its tail is filled with nutrients necessary for growth. It plays by bouncing on its tail.

name: Hariyama
desc: Hariyama is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Arm Thrust Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 049 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)096 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)050 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)057 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)069 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: HARIYAMA practices its straight-arm slaps in any number of locations. One hit of this POKéMON’s powerful, openhanded, straight-arm punches could snap a telephone pole in two.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: HARIYAMA’s thick body may appear fat, but it is actually a hunk of solid muscle. If this POKéMON bears down and tightens all its muscles, its body becomes as hard as a rock.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It stomps on the ground to build power. It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a straight-arm punch.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It has the habit of challenging others without hesitation to tests of strength. It’s been known to stand on train tracks and stop trains using forearm thrusts.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.
pokedex_entries.X: It stomps on the ground to build power. It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a straight-arm punch.
pokedex_entries.Y: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Hariyama practices its straight-arm slaps in any number of locations. One hit of this Pokémon’s powerful, openhanded, straight-arm punches could snap a telephone pole in two.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Hariyama’s thick body may appear fat, but it is actually a hunk of solid muscle. If this Pokémon bears down and tightens all its muscles, its body becomes as hard as a rock.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It is known for its fantastic strength, but as it grows older, it focuses more on training Makuhita.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They love to compare their freakish strength— strength enough to send a truck flying with a single slap.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although they enjoy comparing their strength, they’re also kind. They value etiquette, praising opponents they battle.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Hariyama that are big and fat aren’t necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can send a truck flying with its arm thrusts.

name: Makuhita
desc: Makuhita is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Guts Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 048 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)095 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)049 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)056 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)068 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: MAKUHITA is tenacious - it will keep getting up and attacking its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it gets back up, this POKéMON stores more energy in its body for evolving.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: MAKUHITA has a tireless spirit - it will never give up hope. It eats a lot of food, gets plenty of sleep, and it trains very rigorously. By living that way, this POKéMON packs its body with energy.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy POKéMON that can withstand any attack.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It loves to toughen up its body above all else. If you hear quaking rumbles in a cave, it is the sound of MAKUHITA undertaking strenuous training.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.
pokedex_entries.X: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.
pokedex_entries.Y: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pokémon that can withstand any attack.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Makuhita is tenacious—it will keep getting up and attacking its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it gets back up, this Pokémon stores more energy in its body for evolving.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Makuhita has a tireless spirit—it will never give up hope. It eats a lot of food, gets plenty of sleep, and it trains very rigorously. By living that way, this Pokémon packs its body with energy.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It was originally brought in from another region, but now Makuhita from Alola are more famous.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Their daily routine consists of training together first thing in the morning, eating and napping in the afternoon, and then more training afterward.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It practices its slaps by repeatedly slapping tree trunks. It has been known to slap an Exeggutor and get flung away.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: There’s a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.

location.RubySapphire: Granite Cave, Rustboro City, Victory Road
location.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Cerulean Cave, Cliff Cave, Dark Cave, Diglett's Cave, Ice Path, Mt. Moon, Mt. Mortar, Mt. Silver, Rock Tunnel, Seafoam Islands, Slowpoke Well, Tohjo Falls, Union Cave, Whirl Islands, Victory Road

name: Exploud
desc: Exploud is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Loud Noise Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 047 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)142 (X/Y — Central Kalos)048 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)150 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: EXPLOUD triggers earthquakes with the tremors it creates by bellowing. If this POKéMON violently inhales from the ports on its body, it’s a sign that it is preparing to let loose a huge bellow.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: EXPLOUD communicates its feelings to the others by emitting whistle-like sounds from the tubes on its body. This POKéMON only raises its voice when it is in battle.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It emits a variety of sounds from the holes all over its body. Its loud cries can be heard from over six miles away.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It has sound-generating organs all over its body. It communicates with others by adjusting the tone and volume of the cries it emits.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its roar in battle shakes the ground like a tremor--or like an earthquake has struck.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.
pokedex_entries.X: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its roar in battle shakes the ground like a tremor--or like an earthquake has struck.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Exploud triggers earthquakes with the tremors it creates by bellowing. If this Pokémon violently inhales from the ports on its body, it’s a sign that it is preparing to let loose a huge bellow.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Exploud communicates its feelings to the others by emitting whistle-like sounds from the tubes on its body. This Pokémon only raises its voice when it is in battle.
pokedex_entries.Sword: In the past, people would use the loud voices of these Pokémon as a means of communication between distant cities.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To communicate with others of its kind, it’ll emit all sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.

name: Loudred
desc: Loudred is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Big Voice Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 046 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)141 (X/Y — Central Kalos)047 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)149 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: LOUDRED’s bellowing can completely decimate a wood-frame house. It uses its voice to punish its foes. This POKéMON’s round ears serve as loudspeakers.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: LOUDRED shouts while stamping its feet. After it finishes shouting, this POKéMON becomes incapable of hearing anything for a while. This is considered to be a weak point.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: When it stamps its feet and bellows, it generates ultrasonic waves that can blow apart a house.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It positions the round speakers on its head to assail foes with ultrasonic waves at massive volume. It builds power by stomping the ground.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It shouts loudly by inhaling air, and then uses its well-developed stomach muscles to exhale.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.
pokedex_entries.X: It shouts loudly by inhaling air, and then uses its well-developed stomach muscles to exhale.
pokedex_entries.Y: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Loudred’s bellowing can completely decimate a wood-frame house. It uses its voice to punish its foes. This Pokémon’s round ears serve as loudspeakers.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Loudred shouts while stamping its feet. After it finishes shouting, this Pokémon becomes incapable of hearing anything for a while. This is considered to be a weak point.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Loudred’s ears serve as speakers, and they can put out sound waves powerful enough to blow away a house.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The force of this Pokémon’s loud voice isn’t just the sound—it’s also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.

name: Whismur
desc: Whismur is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Whisper Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 045 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)140 (X/Y — Central Kalos)046 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)148 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: Normally, WHISMUR’s voice is very quiet - it is barely audible even if one is paying close attention. However, if this POKéMON senses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: WHISMUR is very timid. If it starts to cry loudly, it becomes startled by its own crying and cries even harder. When it finally stops crying, the POKéMON goes to sleep, all tired out.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It usually murmurs, but starts crying loudly if it senses danger. It stops when its ear covers are shut.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its cries equal a jet plane in volume. It inhales through its ear canals. Because of this system, it can cry continually without having to catch its breath.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.
pokedex_entries.X: It usually murmurs but starts crying loudly if it senses danger. It stops when its ear covers are shut.
pokedex_entries.Y: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Normally, Whismur’s voice is very quiet—it is barely audible even if one is paying close attention. However, if this Pokémon senses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Whismur is very timid. If it starts to cry loudly, it becomes startled by its own crying and cries even harder. When it finally stops crying, the Pokémon goes to sleep, all tired out.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The cry of a Whismur is over 100 decibels. If you’re close to a Whismur when it lets out a cry, you’ll be stuck with an all-day headache.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it’s exhausted, then it falls asleep.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.

location.Emerald: Route 116, Desert Underpass, Rusturf Tunnel, Victory Road

name: Shedinja
desc: Shedinja is a Bug/Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Shed Pokémon.

name_origin.shed: to remove a shell or skin

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SHEDINJA’s hard body doesn’t move - not even a twitch. In fact, its body appears to be merely a hollow shell. It is believed that this POKéMON will steal the spirit of anyone peering into its hollow body from its back.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SHEDINJA is a peculiar POKéMON. It seems to appear unsought in a POKé BALL after a NINCADA evolves. This bizarre POKéMON is entirely immobile - it doesn’t even breathe.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: A most peculiar POKéMON that somehow appears in a POKé BALL when a NINCADA evolves.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A peculiar POKéMON that floats in air even though its wings remain completely still. The inside of its body is hollow and utterly dark.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one’s spirit.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: A strange Pokémon--it flies without moving its wings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does not breathe.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one’s spirit.
pokedex_entries.X: A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one’s spirit.
pokedex_entries.Y: A most peculiar Pokémon that somehow appears in a Poké Ball when a Nincada evolves.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Shedinja’s hard body doesn’t move—not even a twitch. In fact, its body appears to be merely a hollow shell. It is believed that this Pokémon will steal the spirit of anyone peering into its hollow body from its back.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Shedinja is a peculiar Pokémon. It seems to appear unsought in a Poké Ball after a Nincada evolves. This bizarre Pokémon is entirely immobile—it doesn’t even breathe.
pokedex_entries.Sword: A most peculiar Pokémon that somehow appears in a Poké Ball when a Nincada evolves.
pokedex_entries.Shield: A strange Pokémon—it flies without moving its wings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does not breathe.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is a discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one’s spirit.

name: Ninjask
desc: Ninjask is a Bug/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Ninja Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: NINJASK moves around at such a high speed that it cannot be seen, even while its crying can be clearly heard. For that reason, this POKéMON was long believed to be invisible.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: If NINJASK is not trained properly, it will refuse to obey the TRAINER and cry loudly continuously. Because of this quality, this POKéMON is said to be one that puts the TRAINER’s abilities to the test.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: This POKéMON is so quick, it is said to be able to avoid any attack. It loves to feed on tree sap.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Because it darts about vigorously at high speed, it is very difficult to see. Hearing its distinctive cries for too long induces a headache.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too long. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.
pokedex_entries.X: Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too long. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.
pokedex_entries.Y: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Ninjask moves around at such a high speed that it cannot be seen, even while its crying can be clearly heard. For that reason, this Pokémon was long believed to be invisible.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: If Ninjask is not trained properly, it will refuse to obey the Trainer and cry loudly continuously. Because of this quality, this Pokémon is said to be one that puts the Trainer’s abilities to the test.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too long. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon is so quick, it is said to be able to avoid any attack. It loves to feed on tree sap.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Because they move so quickly, they sometimes become unseeable. They congregate around tree sap.

name: Nincada
desc: Nincada is a Bug/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Trainee Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: NINCADA lives underground for many years in complete darkness. This POKéMON absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees. It stays motionless as it waits for evolution.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: NINCADA lives underground. It uses its sharp claws to carve the roots of trees and absorb moisture and nutrients. This POKéMON can’t withstand bright sunlight so avoids it.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It makes its nest at the roots of a mighty tree. Using its whiskerlike antennae, it probes its surroundings in the pitch-black darkness of soil.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.
pokedex_entries.X: Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.
pokedex_entries.Y: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Nincada lives underground for many years in complete darkness. This Pokémon absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees. It stays motionless as it waits for evolution.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Nincada lives underground. It uses its sharp claws to carve the roots of trees and absorb moisture and nutrients. This Pokémon can’t withstand bright sunlight so avoids it.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.

location.SwordShield: Route 5, South Lake Miloch, West Lake Axewell
location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Eterna Forest, Grassland Cave, Riverbank Cave, Still-Water Cavern, Sunlit Cavern

name: Slaking
desc: Slaking is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Lazy Pokémon.

name_origin.slack: slow or lazy; full name sounds like ‘slacking’

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SLAKING spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats grass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can reach, this POKéMON reluctantly moves to another spot.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: Wherever SLAKING live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the POKéMON as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It is the world’s most slothful POKéMON. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Hordes of SLAKING gather around trees when fruits come into season. They wait around patiently for ripened fruits to fall out of the trees.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: The world’s laziest Pokémon. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The world’s laziest Pokémon. It moves to another spot when there’s no food left within its reach.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: The world’s laziest Pokémon. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: This Pokémon lives lying on its side. It only rolls over and moves when there is no more grass to eat.
pokedex_entries.X: The world’s laziest Pokémon. It moves to another spot when there’s no food left within its reach.
pokedex_entries.Y: It is the world’s most slothful Pokémon. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Slaking spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats grass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can reach, this Pokémon reluctantly moves to another spot.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is the world’s laziest Pokémon. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.

name: Vigoroth
desc: Vigoroth is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Wild Monkey Pokémon.

name_origin.sloth: a mammal commonly known for being slow

pokedex_entries.Ruby: VIGOROTH is always itching and agitated to go on a wild rampage. It simply can’t tolerate sitting still for even a minute. This POKéMON’s stress level rises if it can’t be moving constantly.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: VIGOROTH is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this POKéMON to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It is always hungry because it won’t stop rampaging. Even while it is eating, it can’t keep still.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It can’t keep still because its blood boils with energy. It runs through the fields and mountains all day to calm itself. If it doesn’t, it can’t sleep at night.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its heart beats at a tenfold tempo, so it cannot sit still for even a moment.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its heart beats at a tenfold tempo, so it cannot sit still for even a moment.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its heartbeat is fast and its blood so agitated that it can’t sit still for one second.
pokedex_entries.X: Its heartbeat is fast and its blood so agitated that it can’t sit still for one second.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Vigoroth is always itching and agitated to go on a wild rampage. It simply can’t tolerate sitting still for even a minute. This Pokémon’s stress level rises if it can’t be moving constantly.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its heart beats at 10 times its previous rate, so it cannot sit still for even a moment.

name: Slakoth
desc: Slakoth is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Slacker Pokémon.

name_origin.slack: slow or lazy; full name sounds like ‘slack off’
name_origin.sloth: a mammal commonly known for being slow

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SLAKOTH lolls around for over twenty hours every day. Because it moves so little, it does not need much food. This POKéMON’s sole daily meal consists of just three leaves.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SLAKOTH’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this POKéMON in motion.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It sleeps for 20 hours every day. Making drowsy those that see it is one of its abilities.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It sleeps virtually all day and night long. It doesn’t change its nest its entire life, but it sometimes travels great distances by swimming in rivers.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The way SLAKOTH lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: If it eats just three leaves in a day, it is satisfied. Other than that, it sleeps for 20 hours a day.
pokedex_entries.X: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.
pokedex_entries.Y: If it eats just three leaves in a day, it is satisfied. Other than that, it sleeps for 20 hours a day.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Slakoth lolls around for over 20 hours every day. Because it moves so little, it does not need much food. This Pokémon’s sole daily meal consists of just three leaves.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.

name: Breloom
desc: Breloom is a Grass/Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Mushroom Pokémon.

name_origin.umbrella: a dome shape, referring to Breloom’s head

pokedex_entries.Ruby: BRELOOM closes in on its foe with light and sprightly footwork, then throws punches with its stretchy arms. This POKéMON’s fighting technique puts boxers to shame.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: The seeds ringing BRELOOM’s tail are made of hardened toxic spores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this POKéMON’s seed will cause your stomach to rumble.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: The seeds on its tail are made of toxic spores. It knocks out foes with quick, virtually invisible punches.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It scatters spores from holes in the cap on its head. It loves warm and humid climates. It feeds on trees and plants in fields and forests.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.
pokedex_entries.X: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.
pokedex_entries.Y: It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Breloom closes in on its foe with light and sprightly footwork, then throws punches with its stretchy arms. This Pokémon’s fighting technique puts boxers to shame.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: The seeds ringing Breloom’s tail are made of hardened toxic spores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this Pokémon’s seed will cause your stomach to rumble.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.

name: Shroomish
desc: Shroomish is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Mushroom Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Effect Spore2. Poison HealQuick Feet (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SHROOMISH live in damp soil in the dark depths of forests. They are often found keeping still under fallen leaves. This POKéMON feeds on compost that is made up of fallen, rotted leaves.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: If SHROOMISH senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This POKéMON’s spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It loves to eat damp, composted soil in forests. If you enter a forest after a long rain, you can see many SHROOMISH feasting on composted soil.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: If it senses danger, it scatters spores from the top of its head to protect itself.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.
pokedex_entries.X: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.
pokedex_entries.Y: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Shroomish live in damp soil in the dark depths of forests. They are often found keeping still under fallen leaves. This Pokémon feeds on compost that is made up of fallen, rotted leaves.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon’s spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over the body if inhaled.

name: Masquerain
desc: Masquerain is a Bug/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Eyeball Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 033 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)048 (X/Y — Central Kalos)034 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)140 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)173 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: MASQUERAIN intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns on its antennas. This POKéMON flaps its four wings to freely fly in any direction - even sideways and backwards - as if it were a helicopter.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: MASQUERAIN’s antennas have eyelike patterns that usually give it an angry look. If the “eyes” are droopy and appear sad, it is said to be a sign that a heavy rainfall is on its way.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: The antennae have distinctive patterns that look like eyes. When it rains, they grow heavy, making flight impossible.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It intimidates foes with the large eyelike patterns on its antennae. Because it can’t fly if its wings get wet, it shelters itself from rain under large trees and eaves.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four wings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any direction--to and fro and sideways.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four wings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.
pokedex_entries.X: Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four wings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.
pokedex_entries.Y: It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any direction--to and fro and sideways.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Masquerain intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns on its antennas. This Pokémon flaps its four wings to freely fly in any direction—even sideways and backwards—as if it were a helicopter.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Masquerain’s antennas have eyelike patterns that usually give it an angry look. If the “eyes” are droopy and appear sad, it is said to be a sign that a heavy rainfall is on its way.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It intimidates enemies with the eye-like patterns on its antennae. Its four wings allow it to fly in any direction.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its wings and antennae don’t cope well with moisture. After a rain, it faces sunward to dry off.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Masquerain intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns of its eyespots. If that doesn’t work, it deftly makes its escape on its set of four wings.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four wings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.

name: Surskit
desc: Surskit is a Bug/Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Pond Skater Pokémon.

name_origin.surface: outside or top of an object, e.g. a lake
name_origin.skitter: to skim along a surface (esp. water)

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 032 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)047 (X/Y — Central Kalos)033 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)139 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)172 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: From the tips of its feet, SURSKIT secretes an oil that enables it to walk on water as if it were skating. This POKéMON feeds on microscopic organisms in ponds and lakes.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: If SURSKIT senses danger, it secretes a thick, sugary syrup from the tip of its head. There are some POKéMON that love eating this syrup.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: They usually live on ponds, but after an evening shower, they may appear on puddles in towns.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: They gather on puddles after evening downpours, gliding across the surface of water as if sliding. It secretes honey with a sweet aroma from its head.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey with a sweet scent from the tip of its head.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It secretes a thick, sweet-scented syrup from the tip of its head. It lives on weed-choked ponds.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey with a sweet scent from the tip of its head.
pokedex_entries.X: They usually live on ponds, but after an evening shower, they may appear on puddles in towns.
pokedex_entries.Y: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey with a sweet scent from the tip of its head.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: From the tips of its feet, Surskit secretes an oil that enables it to walk on water as if it were skating. This Pokémon feeds on microscopic organisms in ponds and lakes.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: If Surskit senses danger, it secretes a thick, sugary syrup from the tip of its head. There are some Pokémon that love eating this syrup.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It moves as if skating on the surface of the water. It often fights with Dewpider over food.
pokedex_entries.Moon: When this Pokémon senses danger, a sweet fluid oozes from the tip of its head. The taste of it disgusts bird Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: If it’s in a pinch, it will secrete a sweet liquid from the tip of its head. Syrup made from gathering that liquid is tasty on bread.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey in with a sweet scent released from the tip of its head.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Lake Verity, Fountainspring Cave, Riverbank Cave, Still-Water Cavern

name: Gardevoir
desc: Gardevoir is a Psychic/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Embrace Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 031 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)159 (Platinum)066 (X/Y — Central Kalos)031 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)122 (Sword/Shield)103 (Legends: Arceus)036 (The Isle of Armor)

name: Kirlia
desc: Kirlia is a Psychic/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Emotion Pokémon.

name_origin.kirlian: a type of photography concerned with psychic aura

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 030 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)158 (Platinum)065 (X/Y — Central Kalos)030 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)121 (Sword/Shield)102 (Legends: Arceus)035 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: It is said that a KIRLIA that is exposed to the positive emotions of its TRAINER grows beautiful. This POKéMON controls psychokinetic powers with its highly developed brain.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: KIRLIA uses the horns on its head to amplify its psychokinetic power. When the POKéMON uses its power, the air around it becomes distorted, creating mirages of nonexistent scenery.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: The cheerful spirit of its TRAINER gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A KIRLIA has the psychic power to create a rip in the dimensions and see into the future. It is said to dance with pleasure on sunny mornings.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It is highly perceptive of its Trainer’s feelings. It dances when it is feeling happy.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.
pokedex_entries.X: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.
pokedex_entries.Y: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: It is said that a Kirlia that is exposed to the positive emotions of its Trainer grows beautiful. This Pokémon controls psychokinetic powers with its highly developed brain.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Kirlia uses the horns on its head to amplify its psychokinetic power. When the Pokémon uses its power, the air around it becomes distorted, creating mirages of nonexistent scenery.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is highly perceptive of its Trainer’s feelings. It dances when it is feeling happy.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It resembles a maiden in appearance, but it wields strange powers to project visions of paradise. I suspect the crimson ornaments on its head are the key to its abilities.

location.Legends: Arceus: Heart's Crag, Shrouded Ruins, Snowpoint Temple

name: Ralts
desc: Ralts is a Psychic/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Feeling Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 029 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)157 (Platinum)064 (X/Y — Central Kalos)029 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)120 (Sword/Shield)101 (Legends: Arceus)034 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: RALTS senses the emotions of people using the horns on its head. This POKéMON rarely appears before people. But when it does, it draws closer if it senses that the person has a positive disposition.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: RALTS has the ability to sense the emotions of people. If its TRAINER is in a cheerful mood, this POKéMON grows cheerful and joyous in the same way.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and POKéMON. It hides if it senses hostility.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A RALTS has the power to sense the emotions of people and POKéMON with the horns on its head. It takes cover if it senses any hostility.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It uses the horns on its head to sense human emotions. It is said to appear in front of cheerful people.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people’s emotions.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
pokedex_entries.X: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
pokedex_entries.Y: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Ralts senses the emotions of people using the horns on its head. This Pokémon rarely appears before people. But when it does, it draws closer if it senses that the person has a positive disposition.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Ralts has the ability to sense the emotions of people. If its Trainer is in a cheerful mood, this Pokémon grows cheerful and joyous in the same way.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It uses the horns on its head to sense human emotions. It is said to appear in front of cheerful people.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Tends to prefer people with a chipper disposition to those who are gloomy, but it has shown no discrimination with regard to age or gender. Needs more research.

name: Pelipper
desc: Pelipper is a Water/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Water Bird Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 028 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)120 (Diamond/Pearl)120 (Platinum)213 (Black 2/White 2)018 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)028 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)041 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)048 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)063 (Sword/Shield)120 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)049 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: PELIPPER is a flying transporter that carries small POKéMON and eggs inside its massive bill. This POKéMON builds its nest on steep cliffs facing the sea.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: PELIPPER searches for food while in flight by skimming the wave tops. This POKéMON dips its large bill in the sea to scoop up food, then swallows everything in one big gulp.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It is a flying transporter that carries small POKéMON in its beak. It bobs on the waves to rest its wings.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It skims the tops of waves as it flies. When it spots prey, it uses its large beak to scoop up the victim with water. It protects its eggs in its beak.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It dips its large bill in the sea, then scoops up numerous prey along with water.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It acts as a delivery service by carrying small Pokémon in its bill. It bobs on the waves to rest.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It protects its young in its beak. It bobs on waves, resting on them on days when the waters are calm.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Skimming the water’s surface, it dips its large bill in the sea, scoops up food and water, and carries it.
pokedex_entries.X: It dips its large bill in the sea, then scoops up numerous prey along with water.
pokedex_entries.Y: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Pelipper is a flying transporter that carries small Pokémon and eggs inside its massive bill. This Pokémon builds its nest on steep cliffs facing the sea.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Pelipper searches for food while in flight by skimming the wave tops. This Pokémon dips its large bill in the sea to scoop up food, then swallows everything in one big gulp.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its spacious beak is large enough for a small child to fit right inside.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Gathering food is the work of young males. They store food in their capacious beaks and carry it back to others waiting in the nest.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It places small Pokémon into its spacious beak and carries them around. No one knows where it’s taking them.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It scoops up Wishiwashi in its huge beak and swallows them whole. It can devour more than 30 at one go!
pokedex_entries.Sword: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Skimming the water’s surface, it dips its large bill in the sea, scoops up food and water, and carries it.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It dips its large bill in the sea, then scoops up numerous prey along with water.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It acts as a delivery service by carrying small Pokémon in its bill. It bobs on the waves to rest.

name: Wingull
desc: Wingull is a Water/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Seagull Pokémon.

name_origin.wing: forelimb of a bird that enables flight

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 027 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)119 (Diamond/Pearl)119 (Platinum)212 (Black 2/White 2)017 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)027 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)040 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)047 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)062 (Sword/Shield)119 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)048 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: WINGULL has the habit of carrying prey and valuables in its beak and hiding them in all sorts of locations. This POKéMON rides the winds and flies as if it were skating across the sky.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: WINGULL rides updrafts rising from the sea by extending its long and narrow wings to glide. This POKéMON’s long beak is useful for catching prey.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It rides upon ocean winds as if it were a glider. In the winter, it hides food around its nest.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It makes its nest on a sheer cliff at the edge of the sea. It has trouble keeping its wings flapping in flight. Instead, it soars on updrafts.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It makes its nest on steep sea cliffs. Riding updrafts, it soars to great heights.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Catching sea winds with its long wings, it soars as if it were a glider. It folds its wings to rest.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings. It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It makes its nest on sheer cliffs. Riding the sea breeze, it glides up into the expansive skies.
pokedex_entries.X: Catching sea winds with its long wings, it soars as if it were a glider. It folds its wings to rest.
pokedex_entries.Y: It makes its nest on steep sea cliffs. Riding updrafts, it soars to great heights.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Wingull has the habit of carrying prey and valuables in its beak and hiding them in all sorts of locations. This Pokémon rides the winds and flies as if it were skating across the sky.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Wingull rides updrafts rising from the sea by extending its long and narrow wings to glide. This Pokémon’s long beak is useful for catching prey.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its hollow bones enhance its lightness. It spreads its wings to the wind and soars away into the sky.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the sky, because wherever they’re circling, the ocean is sure to be teeming with fish Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: With its long, thin wings, it catches updrafts and flies like a glider high up into the sky.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It builds nests in cliffs by the sea. It circles the skies above the ocean looking for its favorite food—Wishiwashi.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It makes its nest on sheer cliffs. Riding the sea breeze, it glides up into the expansive skies.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings. It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It makes its nest on steep sea cliffs. Riding updrafts, it soars to great heights.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Catching sea winds with its long wings, it soars as if it were a glider. It folds its wings to rest.

name: Swellow
desc: Swellow is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Swallow Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SWELLOW flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs in the sky. This POKéMON dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by SWELLOW’s clawed feet, preventing escape.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SWELLOW is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two SWELLOW are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: If its two tail feathers are standing at attention, it is proof of good health. It soars elegantly in the sky.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A SWELLOW dives upon prey from far above. It never misses its targets. It takes to the skies in search of lands with a warm climate.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It circles the sky in search of prey. When it spots one, it dives steeply to catch the prey.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. It catches its prey with sharp claws.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It circles the sky in search of prey. When it spots one, it dives steeply to catch the prey.
pokedex_entries.X: If its two tail feathers are standing at attention, it is proof of good health. It soars elegantly in the sky.
pokedex_entries.Y: It dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. It catches its prey with sharp claws.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Swellow flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs in the sky. This Pokémon dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by Swellow’s clawed feet, preventing escape.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It circles the sky in search of prey and dives sharply to catch its target.

name: Taillow
desc: Taillow is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the TinySwallow Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: TAILLOW courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy POKéMON will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: TAILLOW is young - it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This POKéMON feeds on WURMPLE that live in forests.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It dislikes cold seasons. They migrate to other lands in search of warmth, flying over 180 miles a day.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Although it is small, it is very courageous. It will take on a larger SKARMORY on an equal footing. However, its will weakens if it becomes hungry.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When it gets cold, they migrate, flying over 180 miles a day. It hunts for tasty prey.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.
pokedex_entries.X: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.
pokedex_entries.Y: It dislikes cold seasons. They migrate to other lands in search of warmth, flying over 180 miles a day.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Taillow courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy Pokémon will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.

name: Shiftry
desc: Shiftry is a Grass/Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Wicked Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SHIFTRY is a mysterious POKéMON that is said to live atop towering trees dating back over a thousand years. It creates terrific windstorms with the fans it holds.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SHIFTRY’s large fans generate awesome gusts of wind at a speed close to 100 feet per second. The whipped-up wind blows anything away. This POKéMON chooses to live quietly deep in forests.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: A POKéMON that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe’s mind and take preemptive action.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is said to arrive on chilly, wintry winds. Feared from long ago as the guardian of forests, this POKéMON lives in a deep forest where people do not venture.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 ft/second that can level houses.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 ft/second that can level houses.
pokedex_entries.X: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe’s mind and take preemptive action.
pokedex_entries.Y: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 feet per second that can level houses.

pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Shiftry’s large fans generate awesome gusts of wind at a speed close to 100 feet per second. The whipped-up wind blows anything away. This Pokémon chooses to live quietly deep in forests.
pokedex_entries.Sword: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe’s mind and take preemptive action.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: By flapping its leafy fans, it can whip up gusts of 100 feet per second that can level houses.

name: Nuzleaf
desc: Nuzleaf is a Grass/Dark type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Wily Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: NUZLEAF live in densely overgrown forests. They occasionally venture out of the forest to startle people. This POKéMON dislikes having its long nose pinched.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: This POKéMON pulls out the leaf on its head and makes a flute with it. The sound of NUZLEAF’s flute strikes fear and uncertainty in the hearts of people lost in a forest.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound of NUZLEAF’s grass flute fills listeners with dread.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A forest-dwelling POKéMON that is skilled at climbing trees. Its long and pointed nose is its weak point. It loses power if the nose is gripped.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.

name: Seedot
desc: Seedot is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Acorn Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Ruby: SEEDOT attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the branch. The more water it drinks, the glossier this POKéMON’s body becomes.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SEEDOT looks exactly like an acorn when it is dangling from a tree branch. It startles other POKéMON by suddenly moving. This POKéMON polishes its body once a day using leaves.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: If it remains still, it becomes impossible to distinguish from real nuts. It delights in surprising foraging PIDGEY.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It hangs off branches and absorbs nutrients. When it finishes eating, its body becomes so heavy that it drops to the ground with a thump.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.X: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
pokedex_entries.Y: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Sword: If it remains still, it looks just like a real nut. It delights in surprising foraging Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon that try to peck at it.

name: Ludicolo
desc: Ludicolo is a Water/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Carefree Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Swift Swim2. Rain DishOwn Tempo (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: LUDICOLO begins dancing as soon as it hears cheerful, festive music. This POKéMON is said to appear when it hears the singing of children on hiking outings.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: Upon hearing an upbeat and cheerful rhythm, the cells in LUDICOLO’s body become very energetic and active. Even in battle, this POKéMON will exhibit an amazing amount of power.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates LUDICOLO’s cells, making it more powerful.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: When it hears festive music, all the cells in its body become stimulated, and it begins moving in rhythm. It does not quail even when it faces a tough opponent.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can’t help breaking out into a dance.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can’t help breaking out into a dance.
pokedex_entries.X: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can’t help breaking out into a dance.
pokedex_entries.Y: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo’s cells, making it more powerful.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Ludicolo begins dancing as soon as it hears cheerful, festive music. This Pokémon is said to appear when it hears the singing of children on hiking outings.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Upon hearing an upbeat and cheerful rhythm, the cells in Ludicolo’s body become very energetic and active. Even in battle, this Pokémon will exhibit an amazing amount of power.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo’s cells, making it more powerful.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can’t help breaking out into a dance.

name: Lombre
desc: Lombre is a Water/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Jolly Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Swift Swim2. Rain DishOwn Tempo (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: LOMBRE is nocturnal - it will get active after dusk. It is also a mischief-maker. When this POKéMON spots anglers, it tugs on their fishing lines from beneath the surface and enjoys their consternation.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: LOMBRE’s entire body is covered by a slippery, slimy film. It feels horribly unpleasant to be touched by this POKéMON’s hands. LOMBRE is often mistaken for a human child.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: In the evening, it takes great delight in popping out of rivers and startling people. It feeds on aquatic moss that grows on rocks in the riverbed.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It is nocturnal and becomes active at nightfall. It feeds on aquatic mosses that grow in the riverbed.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.
pokedex_entries.X: It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water-grass by day and becomes active at night.
pokedex_entries.Y: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

name: Lotad
desc: Lotad is a Water/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 3. It is known as the Water Weed Pokémon.

name_origin.lily pad: large, floating leaf of a water lily

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Swift Swim2. Rain DishOwn Tempo (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Ruby: LOTAD live in ponds and lakes, where they float on the surface. It grows weak if its broad leaf dies. On rare occasions, this POKéMON travels on land in search of clean water.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: LOTAD is said to have dwelled on land before. However, this POKéMON is thought to have returned to water because the leaf on its head grew large and heavy. It now lives by floating atop the water.
pokedex_entries.FireRedLeafGreen: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: This POKéMON lives in ponds with clean water. It is known to ferry small POKéMON across ponds by carrying them on the broad leaf on its head.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry to Pokémon that can’t swim.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry to Pokémon that can’t swim.
