name: Slugma
desc: Slugma is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Lava Pokémon.

name_origin.magma: the melted rock in a volcano

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Magma Armor2. Flame BodyWeak Armor (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Gold: It never sleeps. It has to keep moving because if it stopped, its magma body would cool and harden.
pokedex_entries.Silver: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: These group together in areas that are hotter than normal. If it cools off, its skin hardens.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: Molten magma courses throughout SLUGMA’s circulatory system. If this POKéMON is chilled, the magma cools and hardens. Its body turns brittle and chunks fall off, reducing its size.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SLUGMA does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this POKéMON’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It never sleeps. It has to keep moving because if it stopped, its magma body would cool and harden.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is a species of POKéMON that lives in volcanic areas. If its body cools, its skin hardens and immobilizes it. To avoid that, it sleeps near magma.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn’t keep moving, its body will cool and harden.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It never sleeps. It has to keep moving because if it stopped, its magma body would cool and harden.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn’t keep moving, its body will cool and harden.
pokedex_entries.X: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn’t keep moving, its body will cool and harden.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Molten magma courses throughout Slugma’s circulatory system. If this Pokémon is chilled, the magma cools and hardens. Its body turns brittle and chunks fall off, reducing its size.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn’t keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

name: Ursaring
desc: Ursaring is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Hibernator Pokémon.

name_origin.ring: circle, target; refers to its design

pokedex_entries.Gold: Although it is a good climber, it prefers to snap trees with its forelegs and eat fallen BERRIES.
pokedex_entries.Silver: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailingly finds all food buried deep underground.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Although it has a large body, it is quite skilled at climbing trees. It eats and sleeps in the treetops.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: In the forests inhabited by URSARING, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This POKéMON walks through its forest gathering food every day.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: With its ability to distinguish any smell, it unfailingly finds all food buried deep underground.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Although it is a good climber, it prefers to snap stout trees with its forelegs and eat fallen BERRIES.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: In forests, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where an URSARING gathers food. It walks through its forest collecting food every day.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: In its territory, it leaves scratches on trees that bear delicious berries or fruits.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Although it is a good climber, it prefers to snap trees with its forelegs and eat fallen berries.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailingly finds all food buried deep underground.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: In its territory, it leaves scratches on trees that bear delicious berries or fruits.
pokedex_entries.X: With its ability to distinguish any aroma, it unfailingly finds all food buried deep underground.
pokedex_entries.Y: Although it has a large body, it is quite skilled at climbing trees. It eats and sleeps in the treetops.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokémon walks through its forest gathering food every day.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: In its territory, it leaves scratches on trees that bear delicious berries or fruits.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: When the cold season arrives in Hisui, this Pokémon will wander fields and mountains alike in search of its favorite berries. Ursaring’s hunger during this time makes it a ferocious danger.

name: Teddiursa
desc: Teddiursa is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Little Bear Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they are soaked with honey.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Before food becomes scarce in wintertime, its habit is to hoard food in many hidden locations.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It always licks honey. Its palm tastes sweet because of all the honey it has absorbed.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: This POKéMON likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. TEDDIURSA concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by BEEDRILL.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Before food becomes scarce in wintertime, its habit is to hoard food in many hidden locations.

pokedex_entries.Emerald: It licks its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. A TEDDIURSA makes its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by BEEDRILL.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It lets honey soak into its paws so it can lick them all the time. Every set of paws tastes unique.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they’re soaked with honey.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Before food becomes scarce in wintertime, its habit is to hoard food in many hidden locations.

pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It lets honey soak into its paws so it can lick them all the time. Every set of paws tastes unique.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It licks its paws because of the sweet honey that has soaked into them. It is cunning, stealing into the nests of Combee and taking for itself the honey that the Combee have amassed.

pokedex_entries.Gold: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it flails about to fend off its attacker.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Because its fangs are too heavy, it always keeps its head tilted down. However, its BITE is powerful.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It can make most any POKéMON run away simply by opening its mouth wide to reveal its big fangs.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: GRANBULL has a particularly well-developed lower jaw. The enormous fangs are heavy, causing the POKéMON to tip its head back for balance. Unless it is startled, it will not try to bite indiscriminately.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Because its fangs are too heavy, it always keeps its head tilted down. However, its BITE is powerful.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it flails about to fend off its attacker.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It has a particularly well-developed lower jaw. The huge fangs are heavy, causing it to tilt its head. Unless it is startled, it will not try to bite.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It is timid in spite of its looks. If it becomes enraged, however, it will strike with its huge fangs.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it flails about to fend off its attacker.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Because its fangs are too heavy, it always keeps its head tilted down. However, its bite is powerful.

pokedex_entries.Sun: Its well-developed lower jaw and heavy fangs are its weapons. As long as it’s not provoked, it rarely bites.
pokedex_entries.Moon: More timid than Snubbull, this Pokémon is doted on by young people amused at the contrast between its looks and its attitude.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: While it has powerful jaws, it doesn’t care for disputes, so it rarely has a chance to display their might.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although it’s popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it’s totally incompetent as a watchdog.

pokedex_entries.Silver: It has an active, playful nature. Many women like to frolic with it because of its affectionate ways.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: In truth, it is a cowardly POKéMON. It growls eagerly in order to hide its fear from its opponent.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: By baring its fangs and making a scary face, SNUBBULL sends smaller POKéMON scurrying away in terror. However, this POKéMON seems a little sad at making its foes flee.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It has an active, playful nature. Many women like to frolic with it because of its affectionate ways.

pokedex_entries.Sun: Despite its intimidating face, it’s quite cowardly. Its desperate attempts to appear threatening make it popular with people.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokémon tends to sleep half the day.

pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

name: Gligar
desc: Gligar is a Ground/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the FlyScorpion Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: It flies straight at its target’s face then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It builds its nest on a steep cliff. When it is done gliding, it hops along the ground back to its nest.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: GLIGAR glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This POKéMON hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It flies straight at its target’s face, then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It glides without making a single sound. It grasps the face of its foe using its hind and large front claws, then stabs with its poison barb.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It sails on the winds with its limbs extended to strike from the sky. It aims for the prey’s face.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It glides as if sliding. It startles foes by clamping on to their faces, then jabs with its poison stinger.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It flies straight at its target’s face, then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.

pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It glides as if sliding. It startles foes by clamping on to their faces, then jabs with its poison stinger.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It clamps on to its chosen prey then jabs the stinger on its tail into the prey while it’s stunned with surprise.

pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It sails on the winds with its limbs extended to strike from the sky. It aims for the prey’s face.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its tail is tipped by a thick, horrible stinger. To bring down prey, it will first obscure their vision by covering their faces with its body, and then it will use the stinger to inject them with venom.

name: Dunsparce
desc: Dunsparce is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Land Snake Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 052 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)052 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)035 (Black 2/White 2)040 (X/Y — Central Kalos)063 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)052 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Gold: When spotted, this POKéMON escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
pokedex_entries.Silver: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It hides deep inside caves where no light ever reaches it and remains virtually motionless there.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: DUNSPARCE has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into the ground backwards. This POKéMON is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can hover just slightly using its wings.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: When spotted, this POKéMON escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its drill-tipped tail is used to burrow into the ground backwards. This POKéMON is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: When spotted, this Pokémon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.
pokedex_entries.X: When spotted, this Pokémon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.
pokedex_entries.Y: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Dunsparce has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into the ground backward. This Pokémon is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It travels by digging through the ground. Diglett and Dunsparce share one another’s tunnels happily.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When it sees a person, it digs a hole with its tail to make its escape. If you happen to find one, consider yourself lucky.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon’s tiny wings have some scientists saying that Dunsparce used to fly through the sky in ancient times.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels. They never get lost in their own nests—they can tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.

name: Forretress
desc: Forretress is a Bug/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Bagworm Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside the armor is a total mystery.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Usually found hanging on to a fat tree trunk. It shoots out bits of its shell when it sees action.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: FORRETRESS conceals itself inside its hardened steel shell. The shell is opened when the POKéMON is catching prey, but it does so at such a quick pace that the shell’s inside cannot be seen.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside the armor is a total mystery.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It keeps itself inside its steel shell. The shell is opened when it is catching prey, but it is so quick that the shell’s inside cannot be seen.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.
pokedex_entries.X: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.
pokedex_entries.Y: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Forretress conceals itself inside its hardened steel shell. The shell is opened when the Pokémon is catching prey, but it does so at such a quick pace that the shell’s inside cannot be seen.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When something approaches it, it fires off fragments of its steel shell in attack. This is not a conscious action but a conditioned reflex.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day, no one has ever seen that sight.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is encased in a steel shell. Forretress’s eyes peer out, but what lies within this Pokémon’s shell is unknown.

name: Pineco
desc: Pineco is a Bug type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Bagworm Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn’t bother it.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It hangs and waits for flying insect prey to come near. It does not move about much on its own.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It spits out a fluid that it uses to glue tree bark to its body. The fluid hardens when it touches air.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: PINECO hangs from a tree branch and patiently waits for prey to come along. If the POKéMON is disturbed while eating by someone shaking its tree, it drops down to the ground and explodes with no warning.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It hangs and waits for flying-insect prey to come near. It does not move about much on its own.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The extra weight doesn’t bother it.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A PINECO hangs from a tree branch and waits for prey. While eating, if it is disturbed by someone shaking its tree, it falls on the ground and suddenly explodes.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn’t bother it.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It hangs and waits for flying insect prey to come near. It does not move about much on its own.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.
pokedex_entries.X: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn’t bother it.
pokedex_entries.Y: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Pineco hangs from a tree branch and patiently waits for prey to come along. If the Pokémon is disturbed while eating by someone shaking its tree, it drops down to the ground and explodes with no warning.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Motionless, it hangs from trees, waiting for its bug Pokémon prey to come to it. Its favorite in Alola is Cutiefly.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva, making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco are ridiculously huge.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.

name: Girafarig
desc: Girafarig is a Normal/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Long Neck Pokémon.

name_origin.[palindrome]: Girafarig reads the same backwards as forwards, reflecting its symmetric design

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Inner Focus2. Early BirdSap Sipper (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.Gold: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its tail, which also contains a small brain, may bite on its own if it notices an alluring smell.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When it is in danger, its tail uses some sort of mysterious powers to drive away the enemy.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: GIRAFARIG’s rear head also has a brain, but it is small. The rear head attacks in response to smells and sounds. Approaching this POKéMON from behind can cause the rear head to suddenly lash out and bite.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: GIRAFARIG’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its tail, which also contains a small brain, may bite on its own if it notices an alluring smell.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A GIRAFARIG is an herbivore--it eats grass and tree shoots. While it is eating, its tail makes chewing and swallowing motions as if it were also eating.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its tail also has a small brain. It bites to repel any foe trying to sneak up on it from behind.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: While it sleeps, the head on its tail keeps watch. The tail doesn’t need to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The head on its tail contains a small brain. It can instinctively fight even while facing backward.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its tail, which also contains a small brain, may bite on its own if it notices an alluring smell.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The head on its tail contains a small brain. It can instinctively fight even while facing backward.
pokedex_entries.X: While it sleeps, the head on its tail keeps watch. The tail doesn’t need to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Girafarig’s rear head also has a brain, but it is small. The rear head attacks in response to smells and sounds. Approaching this Pokémon from behind can cause the rear head to suddenly lash out and bite.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Girafarig’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its tail has a separate small brain. The tail bites to repel any foe trying to sneak up on the Pokémon from behind.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: While it sleeps, the head on its tail keeps watch. The tail doesn’t need to sleep.

name: Wobbuffet
desc: Wobbuffet is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Patient Pokémon.

name_origin.buffet: strike repeatedly (relating to Wobbuffet’s punching bag shape)

pokedex_entries.Gold: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to pump up its counterstrike.
pokedex_entries.Silver: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: In order to conceal its black tail, it lives in a dark cave and only moves about at night.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: If two or more WOBBUFFET meet, they will turn competitive and try to outdo each other’s endurance. However, they may try to see which one can endure the longest without food. TRAINERS need to beware of this habit.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: WOBBUFFET does nothing but endure attacks - it won’t attack on its own. However, it won’t endure an attack on its tail. When that happens, the POKéMON will try to take the foe with it using DESTINY BOND.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to pump up its counterstrike.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Usually docile, a WOBBUFFET strikes back ferociously if its black tail is attacked. It makes its lair in caves where it waits for nightfall.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It desperately tries to keep its black tail hidden. It is said to be proof the tail hides a secret.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to build up its counterstrike.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It desperately tries to keep its black tail hidden. It is said to be proof the tail hides a secret.
pokedex_entries.X: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to build up its counterstrike.
pokedex_entries.Y: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: If two or more Wobbuffet meet, they will turn competitive and try to outdo each other’s endurance. However, they may try to see which one can endure the longest without food. Trainers need to beware of this habit.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Wobbuffet does nothing but endure attacks—it won’t attack on its own. However, it won’t endure an attack on its tail. When that happens, the Pokémon will try to take the foe with it using Destiny Bond.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to pump up its counterstrike.
pokedex_entries.Shield: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It desperately tries to keep its black tail hidden. This behavior is said to be proof that its tail hides a secret.

name: Unown
desc: Unown is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Symbol Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Because different types of UNOWN exist, it is said that they must have a variety of abilities.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: This POKéMON is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various UNOWN. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: This POKéMON is shaped like ancient text characters. Although research is ongoing, it is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various UNOWN.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: They seem to communicate among each other telepathically. They are always found stuck on walls.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When alone, nothing happens. However, if there are two or more, an odd power is said to emerge.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When alone, nothing happens. However, if there are two or more, an odd power is said to emerge.
pokedex_entries.X: Its flat, thin body is always stuck on walls. Its shape appears to have some meaning.
pokedex_entries.Y: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Because the Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether written language or Unown came first.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: They seem to communicate among each other telepathically. They are always found stuck on walls.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I’ve pointed out that the species’ many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

name: Misdreavus
desc: Misdreavus is a Ghost type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Screech Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 214 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)072 (Diamond/Pearl)072 (Platinum)219 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)066 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)372 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)072 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)197 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.Gold: It likes playing mischievous tricks such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It loves to bite and yank people’s hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It loves to watch people it’s scared. It frightens them by screaming loudly or appearing suddenly.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: MISDREAVUS frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. The POKéMON apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It loves to bite and yank people’s hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It likes playing mischievous tricks such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A MISDREAVUS frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. It apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fear of foes as its nutrition.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It loves to sneak up on people late at night, then startle them with its shrieklike cry.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It gets nourishment from fear that it absorbs into its red orbs. In daytime, it sleeps in darkness.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A Pokémon that startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It likes playing mischievous tricks, such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It loves to bite and yank people’s hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A Pokémon that startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.
pokedex_entries.X: It gets nourishment from fear that it absorbs into its red orbs. In daytime, it sleeps in darkness.
pokedex_entries.Y: It likes playing mischievous tricks, such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Misdreavus frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. The Pokémon apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It will use any means necessary to frighten people and absorb their life energy. It practices constantly to hone its skill in causing fear.
pokedex_entries.Moon: If you hear a sobbing sound emanating from a vacant room, it’s undoubtedly a bit of mischief from Misdreavus.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: What gives meaning to its life is surprising others. If you set your ear against the red orbs around its neck, you can hear shrieking.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: What makes it happy is imitating the voices of weeping people and scaring everyone. It doesn’t deal well with folks who aren’t easily frightened.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It loves to sneak up on people late at night and startle them with its shrieking cry.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It gets nourishment from fear that it absorbs into its red orbs. During the daytime, it sleeps in the shadows.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It conceals itself in darkness, sending chills up travelers’ spines with its childlike weeping. As it observes the frightened travelers with glee, the red orbs upon its chest let off an eerie light.

pokedex_entries.Gold: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It is said that when chased, it lures its attacker onto dark mountain trails where the foe will get lost.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It hides any shiny object it finds in a secret location. MURKROW and MEOWTH loot one another’s stashes.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: MURKROW was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This POKéMON shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It is said that when chased, it lures its attacker onto dark mountain trails where the foe will get lost.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: MURKROW were feared as the alleged bearers of ill fortune. It shows strong interest in anything that sparkles. It will even try to steal rings from women.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It is believed that seeing this Pokémon at night will bring about ominous occurrences.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It appears near travelers to lure them into deep forests. It is said to carry misfortune.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It is said that when chased, it lures its attacker onto dark mountain trails where the foe will get lost.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.
pokedex_entries.X: It hides any shiny object it finds in a secret location. Murkrow and Meowth loot one another’s stashes.
pokedex_entries.Y: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Murkrow was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This Pokémon shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They awaken at dusk and take wing in the twilight, leading to the expression, “Get home before the Murkrow fly.”
pokedex_entries.Moon: Seen as a symbol of bad luck, it’s generally disliked. Yet it gives presents—objects that sparkle or shine—to Trainers it’s close to.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It has a weakness for shiny things. It’s been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It searches for shiny things for its boss. Murkrow’s presence is said to be unlucky, so many people detest it.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is believed that seeing this Pokémon at night will bring about ominous occurrences.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It appears near travelers to lure them into deep forests. It is said to bring misfortune.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Widely shunned as a bearer of ill fortune. Upon crossing paths with this creature, I’ve been told one must chant “Workrum, Workrum—bad luck, don’t come” as a protective incantation.

pokedex_entries.Gold: When agitated, this POKéMON protects itself by spraying poisonous sweat from its pores.
pokedex_entries.Silver: When darkness falls, the rings on the body begin to glow, striking fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: On the night of a full moon, or when it gets excited, the ring patterns on its body glow yellow.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: UMBREON evolved as a result of exposure to the moon’s waves. It hides silently in darkness and waits for its foes to make a move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: When darkness falls, the rings on its body begin to glow, striking fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: When agitated, this POKéMON protects itself by spraying poisonous sweat from its pores.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: UMBREON evolved from exposure to the moon’s energy pulses. It lurks in darkness and waits for its foes to move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: The light of the moon changed EEVEE’s genetic structure. It lurks in darkness for prey.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When exposed to the moon’s aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: When agitated, this Pokémon protects itself by spraying poisonous sweat from its pores.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: When darkness falls, the rings on the body begin to glow, striking fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: When exposed to the moon’s aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When exposed to the moon’s aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it’s filled with a mysterious power.
pokedex_entries.X: The light of the moon changed Eevee’s genetic structure. It lurks in darkness for prey.
pokedex_entries.Y: When exposed to the moon’s aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it’s filled with a mysterious power.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Umbreon evolved as a result of exposure to the moon’s waves. It hides silently in darkness and waits for its foes to make a move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.
pokedex_entries.Sun: When this Pokémon becomes angry, its pores secrete a poisonous sweat, which it sprays at its opponent’s eyes.
pokedex_entries.Moon: With its black fur, it blends into the darkness. It bides its time, and when prey appears, this Pokémon goes for its throat, and then eats it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This Pokémon is nocturnal. Even in total darkness, its large eyes can spot its prey clearly!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It lurks in the dark of night looking for prey. At the moment it pounces, the rings on its body glow dimly but ominously.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When this Pokémon becomes angry, its pores secrete a poisonous sweat, which it sprays at its opponent’s eyes.
pokedex_entries.Shield: On the night of a full moon, or when it gets excited, the ring patterns on its body glow yellow.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: The light of the moon changed Eevee’s genetic structure. It lurks in the darkness, waiting for prey.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It is most active in the wee hours of the night, when moonlight bathes the land. Its large eyes can pierce the darkness and perceive prey with absolute clarity.

name: Espeon
desc: Espeon is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Sun Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy’s actions.
pokedex_entries.Silver: By reading air currents, it can predict things such as the weather or its foe’s next move.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent’s next move.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: ESPEON is extremely loyal to any TRAINER it considers to be worthy. It is said that this POKéMON developed its precognitive powers to protect its TRAINER from harm.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: By reading air currents, it can predict things such as the weather or its foe’s next move.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy’s actions.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: An ESPEON is extremely loyal to any TRAINER it considers to be worthy. It is said to have developed precognitive powers to protect its TRAINER from harm.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Its fur has the look and feel of velvet. The orb on its forehead glows when it uses psycho-power.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its fur is so sensitive, it can sense minute shifts in the air and predict the weather.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy’s actions.

pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its fur is so sensitive, it can sense minute shifts in the air and predict the weather.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its fur is so sensitive, it can feel minute shifts in the air and predict the weather...and its foes’ thoughts.
pokedex_entries.X: The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent’s next move.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its fur is so sensitive, it can feel minute shifts in the air and predict the weather...and its foes’ thoughts.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Espeon is extremely loyal to any Trainer it considers to be worthy. It is said that this Pokémon developed its precognitive powers to protect its Trainer from harm.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It can instantaneously sense its opponent’s movements by feeling air currents with its fine fur.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its forehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb grows dull and dark.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it originally had no powers at all, people say its precognitive faculties were awakened by its need to protect itself.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Psychic power builds up in the orb on its forehead as it bathes in the sunshine. Espeon is not good at battling at night.
pokedex_entries.Sword: By reading air currents, it can predict things such as the weather or its foe’s next move.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its forehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb grows dull and dark.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its fur has the look and feel of velvet. The orb on its forehead glows when it uses psychic power.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Wields an arcane power with which it can predict the weather and even people’s thoughts. When bathed in sunshine, the scarlet orb on its brow glows and builds energy.

desc: Quagsire is a Water/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Water Fish Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: This carefree POKéMON has an easy-going nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Due to its relaxed and carefree attitude, it often bumps its head on boulders and boat hulls as it swims.

pokedex_entries.Gold: This POKéMON lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.
pokedex_entries.Silver: When it walks around on the ground, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: A mucous membrane covers its body. Touching it barehanded will cause a shooting pain.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: WOOPER usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: When it walks around on the ground, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: This POKéMON lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: WOOPER usually live in water but come out onto land seeking food occasionally. On land, they coat their bodies with a gooey, toxic film.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives in cold water, half burying itself in mud at the bottom to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.

name: Yanma
desc: Yanma is a Bug/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Clear Wing Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its large eyes can scan 360 degrees. It looks in all directions to seek out insects as its prey.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It can see in all directions without moving its big eyes, helping it spot attackers and food right away.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: YANMA is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This POKéMON uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its large eyes can scan 360 degrees. It looks in all directions to seek out insects as its prey.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It can see 360 degrees without moving its eyes. It is a great flier capable of making sudden stops and turning midair to quickly chase down targeted prey.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its head. It won’t miss prey--even those behind it.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It can hover in one spot by flapping its wings at high speed. It flits about to guard its territory.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its large eyes can scan 360 degrees. It looks in all directions to seek out insects as its prey.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It can hover in one spot by flapping its wings at high speed. It flits about to guard its territory.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: By flapping its wings at high speed, it can fly freely through the air. Even sudden stops are no problem.
pokedex_entries.X: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without moving its head. It won’t miss prey--even those behind it.
pokedex_entries.Y: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its eyes can see 360 degrees without the Pokémon moving its head. It won’t miss prey— even those behind it.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its frail wings are so thin that one can see clear through them. However, during flight these wings exhibit the power to churn air with force enough to launch a house skyward.

name: Sunflora
desc: Sunflora is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Sun Pokémon.

name_origin.sunflower: flower with yellow petals that looks like the Sun

pokedex_entries.Gold: It converts sunlight into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.
pokedex_entries.Silver: In the daytime, it rushes about in a hectic manner, but it comes to a complete stop when the sun sets.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: As the hot season approaches, the petals on this POKéMON’s face become more vivid and lively.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: SUNFLORA converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: In the daytime, it rushes about in a hectic manner, but it comes to a complete stop when the sun sets.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It converts sunlight into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: SUNFLORA convert solar energy into nutrition. They are highly active in the warm daytime but suddenly stop moving as soon as the sun sets.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It gets energy from warm sunlight and is known for its habit of moving in pursuit of it.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It converts sunlight into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: In the daytime, it rushes about in a hectic manner, but it comes to a complete stop when the sun sets.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It gets energy from warm sunlight and is known for its habit of moving in pursuit of it.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Since it converts sunlight into energy, it is always looking in the direction of the sun.
pokedex_entries.X: As the hot season approaches, the petals on this Pokémon’s face become more vivid and lively.
pokedex_entries.Y: It gets energy from warm sunlight and is known for its habit of moving in pursuit of it.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It gets energy from warm sunlight and is known for its habit of moving in pursuit of it.

name: Sunkern
desc: Sunkern is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Seed Pokémon.

name_origin.sunflower: flower with yellow petals that looks like the Sun

pokedex_entries.Gold: It may drop out of the sky suddenly. If attacked by a SPEAROW, it will violently shake its leaves.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It lives by drinking only dewdrops from under the leaves of plants. It is said that it eats nothing else.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It is very weak. Its only means of defense is to shake its leaves desperately at its attacker.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: SUNKERN tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It lives by drinking only dewdrops from under the leaves of plants. It is said that it eats nothing else.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It may drop out of the sky suddenly. If attacked by a SPEAROW, it will violently shake its leaves.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: SUNKERN try to minimize movement to conserve the nutrients they have stored in their bodies for evolution. They will not eat, subsisting only on morning dew.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning. A year after a cold summer, their population explodes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It may plummet from the sky. If attacked by a SPEAROW, it will violently shake its leaves.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It lives by drinking only dewdrops from under the leaves of plants. It is said that it eats nothing else.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning. A year after a cold summer, their population explodes.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning. Knowing it’s weak, it simply feeds until it evolves.
pokedex_entries.X: It may plummet from the sky. If attacked by a Spearow, it will violently shake its leaves.
pokedex_entries.Y: It lives by drinking only dewdrops from under the leaves of plants. It is said that it eats nothing else.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: They may suddenly fall out of the sky in the morning. In the year following a cold summer, their population explodes.

name: Aipom
desc: Aipom is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Long Tail Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It uses its tail to hang on to tree branches. It uses its momentum to swing from one branch to another.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: AIPOM’s tail ends in a hand-like appendage that can be cleverly manipulated. However, because the POKéMON uses its tail so much, its real hands have become rather clumsy.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its tail ends with a dexterous, handlike appendage. However, because it uses the tail so much, AIPOM’s real hands have become rather clumsy.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It uses its tail to pluck fruits that are out of reach. Its tail is more adept than its real hands.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It lives atop giant trees. It wraps its tail around a branch so it won’t fall off while asleep.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It lives high among the treetops. It can use its tail as freely and cleverly as its hands.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It lives high among the treetops. It can use its tail as freely and cleverly as its hands.
pokedex_entries.X: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Aipom’s tail ends in a hand-like appendage that can be cleverly manipulated. However, because the Pokémon uses its tail so much, its real hands have become rather clumsy.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: As it did more and more with its tail, its hands became clumsy. It makes its nest high in the treetops.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It searches for prey from the tops of trees. When it spots its favorite food, Bounsweet, Aipom gets excited and pounces.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It uses its tail to pluck fruits that are out of reach. Its tail is more adept than its real hands.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It lives atop giant trees. It wraps its tail around a branch so it won’t fall off while asleep.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This treetop dweller possesses a tail as dexterous as a hand. Ancient writings describe this Pokémon as a one-armed oddity.

name: Jumpluff
desc: Jumpluff is a Grass/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Cottonweed Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores to float, even around the world.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Drifts on seasonal winds and spreads its cotton-like spores all over the world to make more offspring.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: JUMPLUFF rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The POKéMON descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It drifts on seasonal winds and spreads its cotton-like spores all over the world to make more offspring.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores to float, even around the world.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: JUMPLUFF ride warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. This POKéMON lands when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores--it can even float around the world.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Drifts on seasonal winds and spreads its cotton-like spores all over the world to make more offspring.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.
pokedex_entries.X: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.
pokedex_entries.Y: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.

name: Skiploom
desc: Skiploom is a Grass/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Cottonweed Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: As soon as it rains, it closes its flower and hides in the shade of a tree to avoid getting wet.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: SKIPLOOM’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees F. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this POKéMON is sometimes used as a thermometer.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees F. Because its flower’s blooming changes with the temperature, it is sometimes used as a thermometer.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It blooms when the weather warms. It floats in the sky to soak up as much sunlight as possible.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It blooms when the weather warms. It floats in the sky to soak up as much sunlight as possible.
pokedex_entries.X: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluctuates up and down.
pokedex_entries.Y: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Skiploom’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It blooms when the weather warms. It floats in the sky to soak up as much sunlight as possible.

location.Shining Pearl: Fuego Ironworks, Grassland Cave, Sunlit Cavern

name: Hoppip
desc: Hoppip is a Grass/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Cottonweed Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: To keep from being blown away by the wind, they gather in clusters. They do enjoy gentle breezes, though.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its body is so light, it must grip the ground firmly with its feet to keep from being blown away.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It can be carried away on even the gentlest breeze. It may even float all the way to the next town.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: This POKéMON drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, HOPPIP links its leaves with other HOPPIP to prepare against being blown away.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its body is so light, it must grip the ground firmly with its feet to keep from being blown away.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: To keep from being blown away by the wind, they gather in clusters. They do enjoy gentle breezes, though.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: This POKéMON drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, a HOPPIP links leaves with others to prepare against being blown away.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It drifts on winds. It is said that when HOPPIP gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: To keep from being blown away by the wind, they gather in clusters. But they do enjoy gentle breezes.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its body is so light, it must grip the ground firmly with its feet to keep from being blown away.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.
pokedex_entries.X: Its body is so light, it must grip the ground firmly with its feet to keep from being blown away.
pokedex_entries.Y: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: They are blown adrift by winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

name: Politoed
desc: Politoed is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Frog Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 075 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)075 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)036 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)152 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)185 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)145 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Gold: If POLIWAG and POLIWHIRL hear its echoing cry, they respond by gathering from far and wide.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When it expands its throat to croak out a tune, nearby POLIWAG and POLIWHIRL gather immediately.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: The curled hair on POLITOED’s head is proof of its status as a king. It is said that the longer and more curled the hair, the more respect this POKéMON earns from its peers.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: If POLIWAG and POLIWHIRL hear its echoing cry, they respond by gathering from far and wide.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: The curled hair on its head proves its status as a king. It is said that the longer and curlier the hair, the more respect it earns from its peers.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It gathers groups of others as their leader. Its cries make POLIWAG obey.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: If POLIWAG and POLIWHIRL hear its echoing cry, they respond by gathering from far and wide.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It gathers groups of others as their leader. Its cries make Poliwag obey.
pokedex_entries.X: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.
pokedex_entries.Y: If Poliwag and Poliwhirl hear its echoing cry, they respond by gathering from far and wide.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: The curled hair on Politoed’s head is proof of its status as a king. It is said that the longer and more curled the hair, the more respect this Pokémon earns from its peers.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They gather on moonlit nights to form a large chorus. Their cries sound angry and not at all pleasant, but they are certainly distinctive.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It’s the leader of Poliwag and Poliwhirl. When Politoed roars, they all cower in fear.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although its cries sound like screams, a composer created a beautiful ballad that was influenced by the sounds.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The longer and more luxurious the curled hair on its head, the greater the number of Poliwag and Poliwhirl that will obey it.
pokedex_entries.Sword: At nightfall, these Pokémon appear on the shores of lakes. They announce their territorial claims by letting out cries that sound like shouting.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The cry of a male is louder than that of a female. Male Politoed with deep, menacing voices find more popularity with the opposite gender.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: A group of Poliwag and Poliwhirl will form with a Politoed as the leader. Politoed’s cries make the Pokémon of the group obey.

name: Sudowoodo
desc: Sudowoodo is a Rock type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Imitation Pokémon.

name_origin.pseudo-: prefix meaning ‘false’ (Sudowoodo is based on petrified wood)
name_origin.wood: matter that trees are made of

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 106 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)093 (Diamond/Pearl)093 (Platinum)107 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)130 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)031 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)038 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)253 (Sword/Shield)093 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)124 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.Gold: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears to be closer to a rock than a plant.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: If a tree branch shakes when there is no wind, it’s a SUDOWOODO, not a tree. It hides from the rain.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: SUDOWOODO camouflages itself as a tree to avoid being attacked by enemies. However, because the forelegs remain green throughout the year, the POKéMON is easily identified as a fake during the winter.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears to be closer to a rock than a plant.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It mimics a tree to avoid being attacked by enemies. But since its forelegs remain green throughout the year, it is easily identified as a fake in the winter.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: Despite appearing to be a tree, its body is closer to rocks and stones. It is very weak to water.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It stands along paths pretending to be a tree. If it starts raining, it seems to disappear.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: To avoid being attacked, it does nothing but mimic a tree. It hates water and flees from rain.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: To avoid being attacked, it does nothing but mimic a tree. It hates water and flees from rain.
pokedex_entries.X: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.
pokedex_entries.Y: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Sudowoodo camouflages itself as a tree to avoid being attacked by enemies. However, because its hands remain green throughout the year, the Pokémon is easily identified as a fake during the winter.
pokedex_entries.Sun: To avoid attack, it mimics a tree. It will run off if splashed with water, which it hates.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Apparently, the larger the green parts of this Pokémon, the more collectors value it. It’s a particular favorite among elderly people.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s so popular with the elderly that there’s a magazine devoted to this Pokémon. Fans obsess over the particular length and angle of its arms.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The result of its holding the same pose all the time is arms that have become supple yet strong.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If a tree branch shakes when there is no wind, it’s a Sudowoodo, not a tree. It hides from the rain.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates water, so it will disappear if it starts raining.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Though it looks like a tree, its body is actually more like rock or stone. The Pokémon is very weak to water.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It stands along paths pretending to be a tree. If it starts raining, it seems to disappear.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children. To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark. Sudowoodo’s extreme aversion to water merits special note.

name: Azumarill
desc: Azumarill is a Water/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Aqua Rabbit Pokémon.

name_origin.marine: of or relating to the sea

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Thick Fat2. Huge PowerSap Sipper (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 131 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)056 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)126 (Diamond/Pearl)126 (Platinum)133 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)032 (Black 2/White 2)043 (X/Y — Central Kalos)057 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)126 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)141 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Gold: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.
pokedex_entries.Silver: When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it’s in the water.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: AZUMARILL’s long ears are indispensable sensors. By focusing its hearing, this POKéMON can identify what kinds of prey are around, even in rough and fast-running rivers.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: AZUMARILL can make balloons out of air. It makes these air balloons if it spots a drowning POKéMON. The air balloons enable the POKéMON in trouble to breathe.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: By keeping still and listening intently, it can even tell what is in wild, fast-moving rivers.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It lives in water virtually all day long. Its body color and pattern act as camouflage that makes it tough for enemies to spot in water.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives in rivers and lakes. In water, its coloring and patterns trick the vision of foes.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of living things on riverbeds.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It can spend all day in water, since it can inhale and store a large volume of air.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It can spend all day in water, since it can inhale and store a large volume of air.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.
pokedex_entries.X: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of living things on riverbeds.
pokedex_entries.Y: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it’s in the water.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Azumarill’s long ears are indispensable sensors. By focusing its hearing, this Pokémon can identify what kinds of prey are around, even in rough and fast-running rivers.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Azumarill can make balloons out of air. It makes these air balloons if it spots a drowning Pokémon. The air balloons enable the Pokémon in trouble to breathe.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It spends most of its time in the water. On sunny days, Azumarill floats on the surface of the water and sunbathes.
pokedex_entries.Shield: These Pokémon create air-filled bubbles. When Azurill play in rivers, Azumarill will cover them with these bubbles.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lives in rivers and lakes. In water, its coloring and patterns trick the vision of foes.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of living things on riverbeds.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Thick Fat2. Huge PowerSap Sipper (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 130 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)055 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)125 (Diamond/Pearl)125 (Platinum)132 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)031 (Black 2/White 2)042 (X/Y — Central Kalos)056 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)125 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)140 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Gold: The tip of its tail, which contains oil that is lighter than water, lets it swim without drowning.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The end of its tail serves as a buoy that keeps it from drowning, even in a vicious current.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry, even when it plays in the water.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: MARILL’s oil-filled tail acts much like a life preserver. If you see just its tail bobbing on the water’s surface, it’s a sure indication that this POKéMON is diving beneath the water to feed on aquatic plants.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: When fishing for food at the edge of a fast-running stream, MARILL wraps its tail around the trunk of a tree. This POKéMON’s tail is flexible and configured to stretch.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: The end of its tail serves as a buoy that keeps it from drowning, even in a vicious current.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: The tip of its tail, which contains oil that is lighter than water, lets it swim without drowning.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its body is covered with water-repellent fur. Because of the fur, it can swim through water at high speed without being slowed by the water’s resistance.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: Using its tail as a float, it dives underwater. It likes eating plants that grow on river bottoms.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The oil-filled end of its tail floats on water. It keeps MARILL from drowning even in a strong current.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: The tip of its tail, which contains oil that is lighter than water, lets it swim without drowning.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The end of its tail serves as a buoy that keeps it from drowning, even in a vicious current.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: The oil-filled end of its tail floats on water. It keeps Marill from drowning even in a strong current.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so it’s fine even in rivers with strong currents.
pokedex_entries.X: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry, even when it plays in the water.
pokedex_entries.Y: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Marill’s oil-filled tail acts much like a life preserver. If you see just its tail bobbing on the water’s surface, it’s a sure indication that this Pokémon is diving beneath the water to feed on aquatic plants.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: When fishing for food at the edge of a fast-running stream, Marill wraps its tail around the trunk of a tree. This Pokémon’s tail is flexible and configured to stretch.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon uses its round tail as a float. The ball of Marill’s tail is filled with nutrients that have been turned into an oil.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Even after Marill swims in a cold sea, its water- repellent fur dries almost as soon as Marill leaves the water. That’s why this Pokémon is never cold.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Using its tail as a float, it dives underwater. It likes eating plants that grow in riverbeds.
