name: Bellossom
desc: Bellossom is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Flower Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: BELLOSSOM gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When these dance together, their petals rub against each other, making pretty, relaxing sounds.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: When BELLOSSOM gets exposed to plenty of sunlight, the leaves ringing its body begin to spin around. This POKéMON’s dancing is renowned in the southern lands.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: A BELLOSSOM grows flowers more beautifully if it has evolved from a smelly GLOOM - the stinkier the better. At night, this POKéMON closes its petals and goes to sleep.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: BELLOSSOM gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its flower petals deepen in color through exposure to sunlight. When cloudy weather persists, it does a dance that is thought to be a ritual for summoning the sun.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: BELLOSSOM gather at times and seem to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.
pokedex_entries.X: Bellossom gather at times and seem to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.
pokedex_entries.Y: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: When Bellossom gets exposed to plenty of sunlight, the leaves ringing its body begin to spin around. This Pokémon’s dancing is renowned in the southern lands.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: A Bellossom grows flowers more beautifully if it has evolved from a smelly Gloom—the more stinky the better. At night, this Pokémon closes its petals and goes to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.

name: Ampharos
desc: Ampharos is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Light Pokémon.

name_origin.pharaoh: Ancient Egyptian ruler (which Ampharos is designed after)

name: Flaaffy
desc: Flaaffy is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Wool Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won’t grow.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electricity in its fur.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: FLAAFFY’s wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won’t grow.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its fleece quality changes to generate strong static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare, slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won’t grow.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Not even downy wool will grow on its rubbery, nonconductive patches of skin that prevent electrical shock.
pokedex_entries.X: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.
pokedex_entries.Y: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Flaaffy’s wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: In the places on its body where fleece doesn’t grow, its skin is rubbery and doesn’t conduct electricity. Those spots are safe to touch.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. Flaaffy can fire hair that zaps on impact.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Route 222, Grassland Cave, Whiteout Cave, Sunlit Cavern

name: Mareep
desc: Mareep is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Wool Pokémon.

name_origin.Mary: the girl in the poem ‘Mary Had a Little Lamb’

pokedex_entries.Gold: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: MAREEP’s fluffy coat of wool rubs together and builds a static charge. The more static electricity is charged, the more brightly the lightbulb at the tip of its tail grows.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its fluffy wool rubs together and builds a static charge. The more energy is charged, the more brightly the lightbulb at the tip of its tail glows.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When cold weather increases static electricity, its wool doubles in size and the tip of its tail glows slightly.
pokedex_entries.X: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.
pokedex_entries.Y: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Mareep’s fluffy coat of wool rubs together and builds a static charge. The more static electricity is charged, the more brightly the lightbulb at the tip of its tail glows.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Clothing made from Mareep’s fleece is easily charged with static electricity, so a special process is used on it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Rubbing its fleece generates electricity. You’ll want to pet it because it’s cute, but if you use your bare hand, you’ll get a painful shock.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its fluffy coat doubles in size when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Valley Windworks, Grassland Cave, Whiteout Cave, Sunlit Cavern

name: Xatu
desc: Xatu is a Psychic/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Mystic Pokémon.

name_origin.Atu: the first man, in Samoan mythology

pokedex_entries.Gold: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
pokedex_entries.Silver: In South America, it is said that its right eye sees the future and its left eye views the past.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Once it begins to meditate at sunrise, the entire day will pass before it will move again.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: XATU stands rooted and still in one spot all day long. People believe that this POKéMON does so out of fear of the terrible things it has foreseen in the future.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: XATU is known to stand motionless while staring at the sun all day long. Some people revere it as a mystical POKéMON out of their belief that XATU is in possession of the power to see into the future.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: In South America, it is said that its right eye sees the future and its left eye views the past.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It has the enigmatic power of foreseeing the future. Some people in different lands have long believed that XATU are emissaries from another world.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: In South America, it is said that its right eye sees the future and its left eye views the past.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.
pokedex_entries.X: Once it begins to meditate at sunrise, the entire day will pass before it will move again.
pokedex_entries.Y: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Xatu stands rooted and still in one spot all day long. People believe that this Pokémon does so out of fear of the terrible things it has foreseen in the future.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Xatu is known to stand motionless while staring at the sun all day long. Some people revere it as a mystical Pokémon out of their belief that Xatu is in possession of the power to see into the future.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s said that while this Pokémon has the power to predict the future, it’s not powerful enough to change the future it sees.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: While it can see the future, it has no desire to change it, which is probably why it remains motionless at all times.
pokedex_entries.Sword: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
pokedex_entries.ShieldBrilliant DiamondShining Pearl: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.

name: Natu
desc: Natu is a Psychic/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Tiny Bird Pokémon.

name_origin.Atu: the first man, in Samoan mythology

pokedex_entries.Gold: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: NATU cannot fly because its wings are not yet fully grown. If your eyes meet with this POKéMON’s eyes, it will stare back intently at you. But if you move even slightly, it will hop away to safety.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: NATU has a highly developed jumping ability. The POKéMON flaps and leaps onto tree branches that are taller than grown-up people to pick at the tree’s new shoots.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It runs up short trees that grow on the savanna to peck at new shoots. A NATU’s eyes look as if they are always observing something.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It picks food from cactus plants, deftly avoiding buds and spines. It seems to skip about to move.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It picks food from cactus plants, deftly avoiding buds and spines. It seems to skip about to move.
pokedex_entries.X: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
pokedex_entries.Y: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Natu cannot fly because its wings are not yet fully grown. If your eyes meet with this Pokémon’s eyes, it will stare back intently at you. But if you move even slightly, it will hop away to safety.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Natu has a highly developed jumping ability. The Pokémon flaps and leaps onto tree branches that are taller than grown-up people to pick at the tree’s new shoots.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it still can’t fly, its jumping power is outstanding. It jumps way up into trees and plucks the buds from the branches.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The look in its eyes gives the impression that it’s carefully observing you. If you approach it, Natu will hop away.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It picks food from cactus plants, deftly avoiding buds and spines. It seems to skip about to move.

name: Togetic
desc: Togetic is a Fairy/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Happiness Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Although it does not flap its wings very much, it can stay up in the air as it tags along after its trainer.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: TOGETIC is said to be a POKéMON that brings good fortune. When the POKéMON spots someone who is pure of heart, it is said to appear and share its happiness with that person.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is said to be a POKéMON that brings good fortune. When it spots someone who is pure of heart, a TOGETIC appears and shares its happiness with that person.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It is said to appear in front of kindly people to scatter a glowing down called “joy dust.”
pokedex_entries.Platinum: To share its happiness, it flies around the world seeking kindhearted people.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: To share its happiness, it flies around the world seeking kind-hearted people.
pokedex_entries.X: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.
pokedex_entries.Y: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Togetic is said to be a Pokémon that brings good fortune. When the Pokémon spots someone who is pure of heart, it is said to appear and share its happiness with that person.
pokedex_entries.Sword: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is said to appear in front of kindly people to scatter a glowing down called joy dust.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: No records exist of Togetic being seen in the wilds. Rumors abound that it evolves under the loving care of a trusted human companion, upon whom the Pokémon then bestows great joy.

location.Legends: Arceus: Bolderoll Slope, Cottonsedge Prairie, Tranquility Cove

name: Togepi
desc: Togepi is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Spike Ball Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
pokedex_entries.Silver: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping TOGEPI stand up.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It is considered to be a symbol of good luck. Its shell is said to be filled with happiness.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: As its energy, TOGEPI uses the positive emotions of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and POKéMON. This POKéMON stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell, then shares them with others.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping TOGEPI stand up.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: As its energy, it uses the feelings of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and POKéMON. It stores up happy feelings in its shell, then shares them out.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Its shell is said to be stuffed with happiness that it shares with kindhearted people.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It transforms the kindness and joy of others into happiness, which it stores in its shell.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping TOGEPI stand up.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It transforms the kindness and joy of others into happiness, which it stores in its shell.
pokedex_entries.X: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
pokedex_entries.Y: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping Togepi stand up.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: As its energy, Togepi uses the positive emotions of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and Pokémon. This Pokémon stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell, then shares them with others.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It is considered to be a symbol of good luck. Its shell is said to be filled with happiness.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its shell is said to be stuffed with happiness that it shares with kindhearted people.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains. Its guileless smile soothes the soul.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Route 230, Fountainspring Cave, Dazzling Cave, Stargleam Cavern
location.Legends: Arceus: Bathers' Lagoon, Cottonsedge Prairie, Tranquility Cove

name: Igglybuff
desc: Igglybuff is a Normal/Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Balloon Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 043 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)137 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)043 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)281 (Black 2/White 2)119 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)142 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)134 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)167 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)011 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Gold: It has a very soft body. If it starts to roll, it will bounce all over and be impossible to stop.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its extremely flexible and elastic body makes it bounce continuously--anytime, anywhere.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Instead of walking with its short legs, it moves around by bouncing on its soft, tender body.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: IGGLYBUFF’s vocal chords are not sufficiently developed. It would hurt its throat if it were to sing too much. This POKéMON gargles with freshwater from a clean stream.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: IGGLYBUFF has a soft and plushy body that feels very much like a marshmallow. From this body wafts a gently sweet fragrance that soothes and calms the emotions of its foes.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its extremely flexible and elastic body makes it bounce continuously--anytime, anywhere.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It has a very soft body. If it starts to roll, it will bounce all over and be impossible to stop.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its soft and pliable body is very bouncy. When it sings continuously with all its might, its body steadily turns a deepening pink color.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It has a soft and bouncy body. Once it starts bouncing, it becomes impossible to stop.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It has a very soft body. If it starts to roll, it will bounce all over and be impossible to stop.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its extremely flexible and elastic body makes it bounce continuously--anytime, anywhere.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It has a soft and bouncy body. Once it starts bouncing, it becomes impossible to stop.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its body has a faintly sweet scent and is bouncy and soft. If it bounces even once, it cannot stop.
pokedex_entries.X: Instead of walking with its short legs, it moves around by bouncing on its soft, tender body.
pokedex_entries.Y: It has a very soft body. If it starts to roll, it will bounce all over and be impossible to stop.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Igglybuff’s vocal cords are not sufficiently developed. It would hurt its throat if it were to sing too much. This Pokémon gargles with freshwater from a clean stream.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Igglybuff has a soft and plushy body that feels very much like a marshmallow. From this body wafts a gently sweet fragrance that soothes and calms the emotions of its foes.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It likes to sing but is not yet good at it. With praise and encouragement, it will get better little by little.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It moves by bouncing along. As it moves a lot, it sweats, and its body gives off a sweet aroma.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s always practicing its singing because it wants to improve. Even when it’s asleep, it keeps singing in its dreams!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Left to its own devices, it will constantly practice singing. You should make it take a break so it doesn’t hurt its throat.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Igglybuff loves to sing. Its marshmallow-like body gives off a faint sweet smell.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Taking advantage of the softness of its body, Igglybuff moves as if bouncing. Its body turns a deep pink when its temperature rises.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It has a soft and bouncy body. Once it starts bouncing, it becomes impossible to stop.

name: Cleffa
desc: Cleffa is a Fairy type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Star Shape Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Cute Charm2. Magic GuardFriend Guard (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 040 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)099 (Diamond/Pearl)099 (Platinum)040 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)088 (Black 2/White 2)210 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)272 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)254 (Sword/Shield)099 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)199 (Legends: Arceus)043 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Gold: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
pokedex_entries.Silver: When numerous meteors illuminate the night sky, sightings of CLEFFA strangely increase.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: If the impact site of a meteorite is found, this POKéMON is certain to be within the immediate area.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: On nights with many shooting stars, CLEFFA can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these POKéMON quench their thirst with the morning dew.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: When numerous meteors illuminate the night sky, sightings of CLEFFA strangely increase.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: On nights with many shooting stars, CLEFFA can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance until daybreak, when they quench their thirst with the morning dew.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its silhouette is like a star. It is believed to arrive riding on shooting stars.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Many appear when the night skies are filled with shooting stars. They disappear with sunrise.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is often seen when shooting stars fill the night skies. It’s said to arrive riding on a shooting star.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: When numerous meteors illuminate the night sky, sightings of CLEFFA strangely increase.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It is often seen when shooting stars fill the night skies. It’s said to arrive riding on a shooting star.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.
pokedex_entries.X: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
pokedex_entries.Y: Many appear when the night skies are filled with shooting stars. They disappear with sunrise.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these Pokémon quench their thirst with the morning dew.
pokedex_entries.Sun: On late nights illuminated by shooting stars, it gazes intently skyward, as if thinking of its home.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Because of its silhouette, it’s believed to be a star reborn. For some reason, it loves Minior.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: On nights with many shooting stars, they gather in packs and dance in circles. If you should see them, something good will happen!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Said to have ridden here on a shooting star, Cleffa seem to appear in places where meteorites have struck in the past.
pokedex_entries.Sword: According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its silhouette is like a star. It is believed to arrive riding on shooting stars.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Many appear when the night skies are filled with shooting stars. They disappear with sunrise.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: In silhouette, they resemble twinkling starlight. When shooting stars rain from the night sky, Cleffa gather in numbers and dance as though they are indeed incarnations of the stars.

name: Pichu
desc: Pichu is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Tiny Mouse Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 021 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)155 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)103 (Diamond/Pearl)103 (Platinum)021 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)035 (X/Y — Central Kalos)162 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)024 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)031 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)193 (Sword/Shield)103 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)055 (Legends: Arceus)084 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Gold: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It is unskilled at storing electric power. Any kind of shock causes it to discharge energy spontaneously.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: PICHU charges itself with electricity more easily on days with thunderclouds or when the air is very dry. You can hear the crackling of static electricity coming off this POKéMON.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: When PICHU plays with others, it may short out electricity with another PICHU, creating a shower of sparks. In that event, this POKéMON will begin crying, startled by the flash of sparks.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is still inept at retaining electricity. When it is startled, it discharges power accidentally. It gets better at holding power as it grows older.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: The electric pouches on its cheeks are still small. They cannot store much electricity yet.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It plays with others by touching tails and setting off sparks. This appears to be a test of courage.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a little electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a little electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.
pokedex_entries.X: It plays with others by touching tails and setting off sparks. This appears to be a test of courage.
pokedex_entries.Y: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Pichu charges itself with electricity more easily on days with thunderclouds or when the air is very dry. You can hear the crackling of static electricity coming off this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: When Pichu plays with others, it may short out electricity with another Pichu, creating a shower of sparks. In that event, this Pokémon will begin crying, startled by the flash of sparks.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It is not yet skilled at controlling electricity. If you take your eyes off it, it may shock itself.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Despite this Pokémon’s cute appearance, those who want to live with one should prepare to be on the receiving end of its electric jolts.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It still can’t use electricity well. When it’s surprised or excited, it discharges electricity unintentionally.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It has electric sacs in its cheeks. When they’re fully charged, Pichu plays very energetically.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a little electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: The electric sacs on its cheeks are still small. They cannot store much electricity yet.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It plays with others by touching tails and setting off sparks. This appears to be a test of courage.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Pichu stores electricity in the sacs on its cheeks but discharges it inadvertently when agitated or excited. Being yet immature, the Pokémon’s handling of electricity is rather inept.

location.Legends: Arceus: Nature’s Pantry, Floaro Gardens, Golden Lowlands

name: Lanturn
desc: Lanturn is a Water/Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Light Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 175 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)182 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)177 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)148 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)191 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)202 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)258 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)221 (Sword/Shield)189 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.Gold: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea’s surface from a depth of over three miles.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light, then swallows the immobilized prey in a single gulp.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: This POKéMON uses the bright part of its body, which changed from a dorsal fin, to lure prey.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: LANTURN is nicknamed “the deep-sea star” for its illuminated antenna. This POKéMON produces light by causing a chemical reaction between bacteria and its bodily fluids inside the antenna.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: LANTURN is known to emit light. If you peer down into the dark sea from a ship at night, you can sometimes see this POKéMON’s light rising from the depths where it swims. It gives the sea an appearance of a starlit night.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light, then swallows the immobilized prey in a single gulp.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea’s surface from a depth of over three miles.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: The light-emitting orbs on its back are very bright. They are formed from a part of its dorsal fin. This POKéMON illuminates the inky darkness of deep seas.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: LANTURN’s light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed “The Deep-Sea Star.”
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea’s surface from a depth of over three miles.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light. With the prey incapacitated, the Pokémon swallows it in a single gulp.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Lanturn’s light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed “The Deep-Sea Star.”
pokedex_entries.X: Lanturn’s light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed “The Deep-Sea Star.”
pokedex_entries.Y: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light. With the prey incapacitated, the Pokémon swallows it in a single gulp.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Lanturn is nicknamed “the deep-sea star” for its illuminated antenna. This Pokémon produces light by causing a chemical reaction between bacteria and its bodily fluids inside the antenna.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Lanturn is known to emit light. If you peer down into the dark sea from a ship at night, you can sometimes see this Pokémon’s light rising from the depths where it swims. It gives the sea an appearance of a starlit night.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Should you peer into the ocean at night and see a light shining like the stars, that is Lanturn.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When the bacteria living inside its antennae absorb Lanturn’s bodily fluids, a strong luminescent effect is produced.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It lives far down in the depths of the ocean. It blinds its prey with light, using the moment they’re dazzled to swallow them whole.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea’s surface from a depth of over three miles.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Lanturn’s light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed the Deep-Sea Star.

pokedex_entries.Gold: It shoots positive and negative electricity between the tips of its two antennae and zaps its enemies.
pokedex_entries.Silver: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: CHINCHOU lets loose positive and negative electrical charges from its two antennas to make its prey faint. This POKéMON flashes its electric lights to exchange signals with others.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: CHINCHOU’s two antennas are filled with cells that generate strong electricity. This POKéMON’s cells create so much electrical power, it even makes itself tingle slightly.

pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It shoots positive and negative electricity between the tips of its two antennae and zaps its enemies.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: When it senses danger, it discharges positive and negative electricity from its two antennae. It lives in depths beyond sunlight’s reach.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It shoots positive and negative electricity between the tips of its two antennae and zaps its enemies.

pokedex_entries.Moon: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its two antennae glow softly to lure in prey, making it a useful Pokémon for night fishing.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Chinchou blink their shining antennae at one another to claim their respective turf.

name: Crobat
desc: Crobat is a Poison/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Bat Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 039 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)065 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)030 (Diamond/Pearl)030 (Platinum)039 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)063 (Black 2/White 2)147 (X/Y — Central Kalos)067 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)070 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)082 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)030 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)036 (Legends: Arceus)146 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.Gold: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The development of wings on its legs enables it to fly fast but also makes it tough to stop and rest.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: As a result of its pursuit of faster, yet more silent flight, a new set of wings grew on its hind legs.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: If this POKéMON is flying by fluttering only a pair of wings on either the forelegs or hind legs, it’s proof that CROBAT has been flying a long distance. It switches the wings it uses if it is tired.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: CROBAT sneaks up on its intended prey using wings that barely make a sound. This POKéMON rests by hanging on a tree branch with its rear legs that serve as wings.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: The development of wings on its legs enables it to fly fast but also makes it tough to stop and rest.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Over the course of evolution, its hind legs turned into wings. By alternately resting its front and rear wings, it can fly all day without having to stop.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: Having four wings enables it to fly faster and more quietly. It turns active when the night comes.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: A Pokémon that gained vastly enhanced flying performance by having its legs turn into wings.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The transformation of its legs into wings made it better at flying, but more clumsy at walking.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The development of wings on its legs enables it to fly fast but also makes it tough to stop and rest.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: The transformation of its legs into wings made it better at flying, but more clumsy at walking.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Having four wings allows it to fly more quickly and quietly so it can sneak up on prey without its noticing.
pokedex_entries.X: It flies so silently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.
pokedex_entries.Y: Having four wings allows it to fly more quickly and quietly so it can sneak up on prey without its noticing.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: If this Pokémon is flying by fluttering only a pair of wings on either the forelegs or hind legs, it’s proof that Crobat has been flying a long distance. It switches the wings it uses if it is tired.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Crobat sneaks up on its intended prey using wings that barely make a sound. This Pokémon rests by hanging on a tree branch with its rear legs that serve as wings.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Both its legs became wings, and as a result, it can’t move well on the ground. All it can do is crawl around.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Silent and swift in its four-winged flight, it bites down on its prey before they realize what’s happening. In a heartbeat, it drains their blood.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its fangs are so sharp, if it bites you in the dark and sucks your blood, you won’t notice any pain or realize you’ve been bitten.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It feeds on the blood of living people and Pokémon. If it can’t drink any blood for even a short while, it becomes weak and unable to fly.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Both of its legs have turned into wings. Without a sound, Crobat flies swiftly toward its prey and sinks its fangs into the nape of its target’s neck.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon flaps its four wings skillfully. Crobat can fly through cramped caves without needing to slow down.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Having four wings enables it to fly faster and more quietly. It turns active when the night comes.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: This Pokémon gained vastly enhanced flying capabilities after its legs became wings.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its hind limbs have become another set of wings. Crobat expertly maneuvers its four wings to dart in exquisite fashion through even the most confined caves without losing any speed.

name: Ariados
desc: Ariados is a Bug/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Long Leg Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It is hard to tell which end is which.
pokedex_entries.Silver: A single strand of a special string is endlessly spun out of its rear. The string leads back to its nest.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Rather than making a nest in one specific spot, it wanders in search of food after darkness falls.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: ARIADOS’s feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. This POKéMON constricts the foe with thin and strong silk webbing.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: A single strand of a special string is endlessly spun out of its rear. The string leads back to its nest.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It is hard to tell which end is which.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. It constricts its foe with thin and strong silk webbing.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It attaches silk to its prey and sets it free. Later, it tracks the silk to the prey and its friends.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It’s hard to tell which end is which.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: A single strand of a special string is endlessly spun out of its rear. The string leads back to its nest.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It attaches silk to its prey and sets it free. Later, it tracks the silk to the prey and its friends.
pokedex_entries.X: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It’s hard to tell which end is which.
pokedex_entries.Y: It attaches silk to its prey and sets it free. Later, it tracks the silk to the prey and its friends.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Ariados’s feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. This Pokémon constricts the foe with thin and strong silk webbing.
pokedex_entries.Sun: There are some areas where people use the string Ariados spins for their own weaving. The resulting cloth is popular for its strength.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It spins thread from both its rear and its mouth. Then it wraps its prey up in thread and sips their bodily fluids at its leisure.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Every night, it wanders around in search of prey, whose movements it restrains by spewing threads before it bites into them with its fangs.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It attaches silk to its prey and sets it free. Later, it tracks the silk to the prey and its friends.

pokedex_entries.Gold: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It spins a web using fine--but durable--thread. It then waits patiently for prey to be trapped.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: If prey becomes ensnared in its nest of spun string, it waits motionlessly until it becomes dark.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: The web spun by SPINARAK can be considered its second nervous system. It is said that this POKéMON can determine what kind of prey is touching its web just by the tiny vibrations it feels through the web’s strands.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It spins a web using fine--but durable--thread. It then waits patiently for prey to be trapped.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: The web it spins can be considered its second nervous system. It is said that a SPINARAK determines its prey by the tiny vibrations it feels through the web.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It sets a trap by spinning a web with thin but strong silk. It waits motionlessly for prey to arrive.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It spins a web using fine--but durable--thread. It then waits patiently for prey to be trapped.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It sets a trap by spinning a web with thin but strong silk. It waits motionlessly for prey to arrive.
pokedex_entries.X: It spins a web using fine--but durable--thread. It then waits patiently for prey to be trapped.
pokedex_entries.Y: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: The web spun by Spinarak can be considered its second nervous system. It is said that this Pokémon can determine what kind of prey is touching its web just by the tiny vibrations it feels through the web’s strands.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It waits intently until its preferred prey, Cutiefly, gets caught in its web. In fact, it’s quite a patient Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Some fishermen weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: With threads from its mouth, it fashions sturdy webs that won’t break even if you set a rock on them.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although the poison from its fangs isn’t that strong, it’s potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It sets a trap by spinning a web with thin but strong thread. It waits motionlessly for prey to arrive.

pokedex_entries.Gold: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The star patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: In the daytime when it gets warm, it curls up inside a big leaf and drifts off into a deep slumber.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live LEDIAN in countless numbers. There is a good reason for this - the POKéMON uses the light of the stars as its energy.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: The star patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live many LEDIAN. For good reason, they use the light of the stars as energy.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It uses starlight as energy. When more stars appear at night, the patterns on its back grow larger.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The spot patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It uses starlight as energy. When more stars appear at night, the patterns on its back grow larger.
pokedex_entries.X: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.
pokedex_entries.Y: The spot patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live Ledian in countless numbers. There is a good reason for this—the Pokémon uses the light of the stars as its energy.
pokedex_entries.Sun: While it’s believed that starlight provides it with energy, this Pokémon also loves to eat berries. In the daytime, it curls up in the grass to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Moon: In battle, it throws punches with all four arms. The power of each individual blow is piddly, so it aims to win by quantity rather than quality.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s said that the patterns on its back are related to the stars in the night sky, but the details of that relationship remain unclear.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It uses starlight as energy. When more stars appear at night, the patterns on its back grow larger.

pokedex_entries.Gold: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.
pokedex_entries.Silver: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Its extremely soft feathers make no sound in flight. It silently sneaks up on prey without being detected.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: NOCTOWL never fails at catching prey in darkness. This POKéMON owes its success to its superior vision that allows it to see in minimal light, and to its soft, supple wings that make no sound in flight.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It unfailingly catches prey in darkness. NOCTOWL owe their success to superior vision that allows them to see in minimal light, and to their supple and silent wings.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its eyes are special. They can pick out objects as long as there is the tiniest amount of light.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: If it flips its head upside down, it’s a sign that it is engaged in very complex thinking.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.
pokedex_entries.X: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.
pokedex_entries.Y: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Noctowl never fails at catching prey in darkness. This Pokémon owes its success to its superior vision that allows it to see in minimal light, and to its soft, supple wings that make no sound in flight.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: With eyes that can see in pitch-darkness, it never lets its prey escape. Some even call it “the emperor of dark nights.”
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When it turns its head entirely upside down, you know it’s troubled by something. If you don’t leave it be, it will peck you.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its eyes are special. They can pick out objects as long as there is the tiniest amount of light.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: If it flips its head upside down, it’s a sign that it is engaged in very complex thinking.

pokedex_entries.Gold: It is very timid. It will be afraid to move if it is alone. But it will be active if it is in a group.
pokedex_entries.Silver: When the weather turns cold, lots of LEDYBA gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It is timid and clusters together with others. The fluid secreted by its feet indicates its location.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: LEDYBA secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its body. This fluid is used for communicating with others. This POKéMON conveys its feelings to others by altering the fluid’s scent.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: When the weather turns cold, numerous LEDYBA gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It is very timid. It will be afraid to move if it is alone. But it will be active if it is in a group.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: LEDYBA communicate using a fluid that they secrete from where the legs join the body. They are said to convey feelings to others by altering the fluid’s scent.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It is so timid, it can’t move if it isn’t with a swarm of others. It conveys its feelings with scent.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It is very timid. It will be afraid to move if it is alone. But it will be active if it is in a group.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: When the weather turns cold, lots of LEDYBA gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is so timid, it can’t move if it isn’t with a swarm of others. It conveys its feelings with scent.
pokedex_entries.X: When the weather turns cold, lots of Ledyba gather from everywhere to cluster and keep each other warm.
pokedex_entries.Y: It is timid and clusters together with others. The fluid secreted by its feet indicates its location.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Ledyba secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its body. This fluid is used for communicating with others. This Pokémon conveys its feelings to others by altering the fluid’s scent.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They are timid and grow uneasy when not in a swarm with others of their kind. The pattern on their backs differs slightly from one to another.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They communicate with one another using bodily fluids that give off odors. When they’re angry, their odor smells sour.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This Pokémon is very sensitive to cold. In the warmth of Alola, it appears quite lively.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It’s so timid that it can’t move unless it’s with a swarm. It conveys its feelings through scent.

pokedex_entries.Gold: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It has a perfect sense of time. Whatever happens, it keeps rhythm by precisely tilting its head in time.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It begins to hoot at the same time every day. Some trainers use them in place of clocks.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: HOOTHOOT has an internal organ that senses and tracks the earth’s rotation. Using this special organ, this POKéMON begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It has a perfect sense of time. Whatever happens, it keeps rhythm by precisely tilting its head in time.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It has an internal organ that senses the earth’s rotation. Using this special organ, a HOOTHOOT begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It always stands on one foot. Even when attacked, it does not brace itself using both feet.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It switches its standing foot so quickly, it can’t be seen. It cries at the same time every day.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It marks time precisely. Some countries consider it to be a wise friend, versed in the world’s ways.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It has a perfect sense of time. Whatever happens, it keeps rhythm by precisely tilting its head in time.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It marks time precisely. Some countries consider it to be a wise friend, versed in the world’s ways.
pokedex_entries.X: It has a perfect sense of time. Whatever happens, it keeps rhythm by precisely tilting its head in time.
pokedex_entries.Y: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Hoothoot has an internal organ that senses and tracks the earth’s rotation. Using this special organ, this Pokémon begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Every day, it tilts its head in the same rhythm. A long time ago, people raised these Pokémon to serve as clocks.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It cries out at the same time every day. A long time ago, people cherished it and considered it a divine messenger sent to tell the time.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It begins to hoot at the same time every day. Some Trainers use them in place of clocks.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It always stands on one foot. Even when attacked, it does not brace itself using both feet.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It switches its standing foot so quickly that the switch can’t be seen. It cries at the same time every day.

name: Furret
desc: Furret is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Long Body Pokémon.

name_origin.ferret: a mammal in the weasel family

pokedex_entries.Gold: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other POKéMON to enter.
pokedex_entries.Silver: There is no telling where the tail begins. Despite its short legs, it is quick at hunting RATTATA.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It lives in narrow burrows that fit its slim body. The deeper the nests go, the more mazelike they become.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: FURRET has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this POKéMON is very nimble and fleet.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: There is no telling where its tail begins. Despite its short legs, it is quick at hunting RATTATA.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other POKéMON to enter.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A FURRET has a very slim build. When under attack, it can squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, it is very nimble and fleet.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokémon to enter.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: There is no telling where the tail begins. Despite its short legs, it is quick and likes to chase RATTATA.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.
pokedex_entries.X: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.
pokedex_entries.Y: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokémon to enter.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.

name: Sentret
desc: Sentret is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Scout Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: A very cautious POKéMON, it raises itself up using its tail to get a better view of its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It stands on its tail so it can see a long way. If it spots an enemy, it cries loudly to warn its kind.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When acting as a lookout, it warns others of danger by screeching and hitting the ground with its tail.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: When SENTRET sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this POKéMON becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It stands on its tail so it can see a long way. If it spots an enemy, it cries loudly to warn its kind.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: A very cautious POKéMON, it raises itself up using its tail to get a better view of its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: They take turns standing guard when it is time to sleep. The sentry awakens the others if it senses danger. If one becomes separated, it turns sleepless with fear.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It has a very nervous nature. It stands up high on its tail so it can scan wide areas.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: A very cautious Pokémon, it raises itself up using its tail to get a better view of its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It stands on its tail so it can see a long way. If it spots an enemy, it cries loudly to warn its kind.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It has a very nervous nature. It stands up high on its tail so it can scan wide areas.
pokedex_entries.X: When acting as a lookout, it warns others of danger by screeching and hitting the ground with its tail.
pokedex_entries.Y: It stands on its tail so it can see a long way. If it spots an enemy, it cries loudly to warn its kind.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It has a very nervous nature. It stands up high on its tail so it can scan wide areas.

name: Feraligatr
desc: Feraligatr is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Big Jaw Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It is hard for it to support its own weight out of water, so it gets down on all fours. But it moves fast.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Although it has a massive body, its powerful hind legs enable it to move quickly, even on the ground.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: FERALIGATR intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It is hard for it to support its own weight out of water, so it gets down on all fours. But it moves fast.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears up its victim.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It opens its huge mouth to intimidate enemies. In battle, it runs using its thick and powerful hind legs to charge the foe with incredible speed.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It is hard for it to support its weight out of water, so it sometimes gets down on all fours. But it moves fast.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.
pokedex_entries.X: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.
pokedex_entries.Y: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.

name: Croconaw
desc: Croconaw is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Big Jaw Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It opens its huge jaws wide when attacking. If it loses any fangs while biting, they grow back in.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The tips of its fangs are slanted backward. Once those fangs clamp down, the prey has no hope of escape.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: Once CROCONAW has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It opens its huge jaws wide when attacking. If it loses any fangs while biting, they grow back in.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Once it bites down, it won’t let go until it loses its fangs. New fangs quickly grow into place.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

name: Totodile
desc: Totodile is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Big Jaw Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: Its well-developed jaws are powerful and capable of crushing anything. Even its trainer must be careful.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It is small but rough and tough. It won’t hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: This rough critter chomps at any moving object it sees. Turning your back on it is not recommended.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: Despite the smallness of its body, TOTODILE’s jaws are very powerful. While the POKéMON may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It has the habit of biting anything with its developed jaws. Even its Trainer needs to be careful.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its powerful, well-developed jaws are capable of crushing anything. Even its Trainer must be careful.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It is small but rough and tough. It won’t hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.

name: Typhlosion
desc: Typhlosion is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Volcano Pokémon.

name: Quilava
desc: Quilava is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Volcano Pokémon.

name_origin.lava: magma that flows out of a volcano

pokedex_entries.Gold: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.
pokedex_entries.Silver: This POKéMON is fully covered by nonflammable fur. It can withstand any kind of fire attack.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Before battle, it turns its back on its opponent to demonstrate how ferociously its fire blazes.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: QUILAVA keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This POKéMON applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: This POKéMON is fully covered by nonflammable fur. It can withstand any kind of fire attack.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It intimidates foes with intense gusts of flames and superheated air. Its quick nimbleness lets it dodge attacks even while scorching an enemy.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It intimidates foes with the heat of its flames. The fire burns more strongly when it readies to fight.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: This Pokémon is fully covered by nonflammable fur. It can withstand any kind of fire attack.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It intimidates foes with the heat of its flames. The fire burns more strongly when it readies to fight.
pokedex_entries.X: Before battle, it turns its back on its opponent to demonstrate how ferociously its fire blazes.
pokedex_entries.Y: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It intimidates foes with the heat of its flames. The fire burns stronger as it prepares to fight.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This creature’s fur is most mysterious—it is wholly impervious to the burning touch of flame. Should Quilava turn its back to you, take heed! Such a posture indicates a forthcoming attack.

name: Cyndaquil
desc: Cyndaquil is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Fire Mouse Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: It is timid, and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The fire that spouts from its back burns hottest when it is angry. The flaring flames intimidate foes.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: CYNDAQUIL protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the POKéMON is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It is timid and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It flares flames from its back to protect itself. The fire burns vigorously if the POKéMON is angry. When it is tired, it sputters with incomplete combustion.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It is timid, and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.
pokedex_entries.X: It is timid and always curls itself up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.
pokedex_entries.Y: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Hails from the Johto region. Though usually curled into a ball due to its timid disposition, it harbors tremendous firepower.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Volcanic Cave, Sandsear Cave, Typhlo Cavern

name: Meganium
desc: Meganium is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Herb Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: The aroma that rises from its petals contains a substance that calms aggressive feelings.
pokedex_entries.Silver: MEGANIUM’s breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Anyone who stands beside it becomes refreshed, just as if they were relaxing in a sunny forest.

name: Bayleef

pokedex_entries.Silver: A spicy aroma emanates from around its neck. The aroma acts as a stimulant to restore health.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The scent that wafts from the leaves on its neck causes anyone who smells it to become energetic.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: BAYLEEF’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.

name: Chikorita
desc: Chikorita is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 2. It is known as the Leaf Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.Gold: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up the sun’s rays.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its pleasantly aromatic leaves have the ability to check the humidity and temperature.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It loves to bask in the sunlight. It uses the leaf on its head to seek out warm places.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: In battle, CHIKORITA waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling POKéMON and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its pleasantly aromatic leaves have the ability to check the humidity and temperature.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up the sun’s rays.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It waves its leaf around to keep foes at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, creating a friendly atmosphere that becalms the battlers.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up sunrays.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its pleasantly aromatic leaf has the ability to check humidity and temperature.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.
