pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the air’s temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Grassland Cave, Riverbank Cave, Still-Water Cavern, Sunlit Cavern

name: Mew
desc: Mew is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the New Species Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: When viewed through a microscope, this POKéMON’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Apparently, it appears only to those people who are pure of heart and have a strong desire to see it.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all POKéMON, so it can use all kinds of techniques.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Because it can learn any move, some people began research to see if it is the ancestor of all POKéMON.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: MEW is said to possess the genetic composition of all POKéMON. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: A POKéMON of South America that was thought to have been extinct. It is very intelligent and learns any move.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A MEW is said to possess the genes of all POKéMON. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe MEW to be the ancestor of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Apparently, it appears only to those people who are pure of heart and have a strong desire to see it.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokémon, so it can use all kinds of techniques.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.X: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokémon, so it can use all kinds of techniques.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all Pokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s very intelligent and can use an incredible variety of moves. Many believe that all other Pokémon are descendants of this one.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This mythical Pokémon is said to be extinct, but sightings of it are still being reported to this day.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: An extremely rarely seen marine POKéMON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: It is said that this POKéMON lives somewhere in the sea and that it flies. However, it is only a rumor.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It is said that this POKéMON constantly flies over the immense seas and rescues drowning people.
pokedex_entries.Silver: This marine POKéMON has an impressive build that lets it freely fly over raging seas without trouble.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: DRAGONITE is capable of circling the globe in just sixteen hours. It is a kindhearted POKéMON that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It can fly in spite of its big and bulky physique. It circles the globe in just 16 hours.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Only a very few people ever see this POKéMON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It can circle the globe in just 16 hours. It is a kindhearted POKéMON that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It is said that this Pokémon constantly flies over the immense seas and rescues drowning people.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: This marine Pokémon has an impressive build that lets it freely fly over raging seas without trouble.

pokedex_entries.Sun: This Pokémon saved a shipwrecked man, taking him to a remote island—a paradise occupied solely by Dragonite.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokémon at your peril, because it will smash everything to smithereens before it’s satisfied.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It flies over raging seas as if they were nothing. Observing this, a ship’s captain dubbed this Pokémon “the sea incarnate.”
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: You’ll often hear tales of this kindhearted Pokémon rescuing people or Pokémon that are drowning.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: It is said that this Pokémon lives somewhere in the sea and that it flies. However, these are only rumors.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: A mystical POKéMON that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: According to a witness, its body was surrounded by a strange aura that gave it a mystical look.
pokedex_entries.Gold: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its crystalline orbs appear to give this POKéMON the power to freely control the weather.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It is called the divine POKéMON. When its entire body brightens slightly, the weather changes.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: DRAGONAIR stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity by discharging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It is said to live in seas and lakes. Even though it has no wings, it has been seen flying occasionally.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: A mystical POKéMON that exudes a gentle aura. It is said to have the ability to change the weather.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A DRAGONAIR stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter the weather around it by loosing energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its crystalline orbs appear to give this Pokémon the power to freely control the weather.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.
pokedex_entries.X: Its crystalline orbs appear to give this Pokémon the power to freely control the weather.
pokedex_entries.Y: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. It is said to have the ability to change the weather.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity by discharging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It has long been thought that its crystalline orbs are imbued with the power to control the weather.
pokedex_entries.Moon: From time immemorial, it has been venerated by agricultural peoples as an entity able to control the weather.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with offerings from people, because they believe this Pokémon is able to control the weather.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Some say that if you see it at the start of the year, flying through the sky and twisting its body, you’ll be healthy all year long.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: According to a witness, its body was surrounded by a strange aura that gave it a mystical look.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes. It can control the weather, and it uses this power to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

location.SunMoon: Poni Gauntlet, Poni Meadow, Vast Poni Canyon

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Long considered a mythical POKéMON until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: The existence of this mythical POKéMON was only recently confirmed by a fisherman who caught one.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.
pokedex_entries.Silver: This POKéMON is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: DRATINI continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Even the young can exceed 6.5 feet in length. It grows larger by repeatedly shedding skin.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Long considered a mythical POKéMON until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A DRATINI continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It is called the “Mirage Pokémon” because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: This Pokémon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is called the “Mirage Pokémon” because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
pokedex_entries.X: It is called the “Mirage Pokémon” because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.
pokedex_entries.Y: This Pokémon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It grows by molting repeatedly. Boots made from the tanned cast-off skin are a super luxury item.
pokedex_entries.Moon: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It sheds its skin—almost on a daily basis—and grows larger. Its skin is soft just after it’s been shed.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Long thought to be a myth, this Pokémon’s existence was only recently confirmed by a fisherman who caught one.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s forehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is called the Mirage Pokémon because so few have seen it, but its shed skin has been found.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Will eat anything, even if the food happens to be a little moldy. It never gets an upset stomach.
pokedex_entries.Gold: What sounds like its cry may actually be its snores or the rumblings of its hungry belly.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its stomach’s digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. It can even eat things off the ground.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: This POKéMON’s stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: SNORLAX’s typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile POKéMON that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: SNORLAX’s typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile POKéMON that there are children who use its big belly as a place to play.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It stops eating only to sleep. It doesn’t feel full unless it eats nearly 900 pounds a day.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: What sounds like its cry may actually be its snores or the rumblings of its hungry belly.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its stomach’s digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. It can even eat things off the ground.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.
pokedex_entries.X: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Snorlax’s typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its stomach is said to be incomparably strong. Even Muk’s poison is nothing more than a hint of spice on Snorlax’s tongue.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It eats nearly 900 pounds of food every day. It starts nodding off while eating—and continues to eat even while it’s asleep.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It doesn’t do anything other than eat and sleep. When prompted to make a serious effort, though, it apparently displays awesome power.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It has no interest in anything other than eating. Even if you climb up on its stomach while it’s napping, it doesn’t seem to mind at all!
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Will eat anything, even if the food happens to be a little moldy. It never gets an upset stomach.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon’s stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It stops eating only to sleep. It doesn’t feel full unless it eats nearly 900 pounds a day.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the entirety of their rice granaries—such occurrences have long been counted among the gravest of disasters.

location.Sword: Gigantamax energy has affected stray seeds and even pebbles that got stuck to Snorlax, making them grow to a huge size.
location.Shield: Terrifyingly strong, this Pokémon is the size of a mountain—and moves about as much as one as well.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: A slim and fast swimmer. It slices its prey with its sharp sickles and drinks the body fluids.
pokedex_entries.Gold: In the water, it tucks in its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.
pokedex_entries.Silver: With sharp claws, this ferocious, ancient POKéMON rips apart prey and sucks their body fluids.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It was able to swim quickly through the water by compactly folding up its razor-sharp sickles.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: KABUTOPS swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times. The POKéMON was apparently evolving from being a water-dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings of change in its gills and legs.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It swims freely through water. It catches prey with its scythe-like arms and drains the victim’s fluids.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains their fluids.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: KABUTOPS once swam underwater to hunt for prey. It was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land as evident from changes in its gills and legs.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It is thought that this Pokémon came onto land because its prey adapted to life on land.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: In the water, it tucks in its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: With sharp claws, this ferocious, ancient Pokémon rips apart prey and sucks their body fluids.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is thought that this Pokémon came onto land because its prey adapted to life on land.
pokedex_entries.X: In the water, it tucks in its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.
pokedex_entries.Y: A slim and fast swimmer. It slices its prey with its sharp sickles and drinks the body fluids.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times. The Pokémon was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings of change in its gills and legs.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its body had begun to change so it could function on land. But it didn’t adapt in time and went extinct.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It swims at speeds of roughly 29 knots, quickly closing in on its prey and slashing into them with its scythes to finish them off.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: A slim and fast swimmer. It sliced its prey with its sharp sickles and drank the body fluids.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is thought that this Pokémon came onto land because its prey adapted to life on land.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: A POKéMON that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: A POKéMON that was recovered from a fossil. It uses the eyes on its back while hiding on the sea floor.
pokedex_entries.Gold: On rare occasions, some have been found as fossils which they became while hiding on the ocean floor.
pokedex_entries.Silver: This POKéMON lived in ancient times. On rare occasions, it has been discovered as a living fossil.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Three hundred million years ago, it hid on the sea floor. It also has eyes on its back that glow.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: KABUTO is a POKéMON that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in extremely rare cases, living examples have been discovered. The POKéMON has not changed at all for 300 million years.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: This POKéMON was regenerated from the fossil of an ancient creature. It protects itself with a hard shell.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: A POKéMON that was regenerated from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor long ago.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is a POKéMON that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in rare cases, living examples have been discovered. KABUTO have not changed for 300 million years.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: On rare occasions, some have been found as fossils which they became while hiding on the ocean floor.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: This Pokémon lived in ancient times. On rare occasions, it has been discovered as a living fossil.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.
pokedex_entries.X: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.
pokedex_entries.Y: This Pokémon was regenerated from the fossil of an ancient creature. It protects itself with a hard shell.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Kabuto is a Pokémon that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in extremely rare cases, living examples have been discovered. The Pokémon has not changed at all for 300 million years.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This Pokémon thrived 300 million years ago. It’s said that living specimens can still be seen in a certain region—a rare sight.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This Pokémon became extinct everywhere, except in a few areas. It protects itself with its hard shell.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: A Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It used the eyes on its back while hiding on the seafloor.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.
pokedex_entries.Shield: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a sturdy shell.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: A prehistoric POKéMON that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Sharp beaks ring its mouth. Its shell was too big for it to move freely, so it became extinct.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Apparently, it cracked SHELLDER’s shell with its sharp fangs and sucked out the insides.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Once wrapped around its prey, it never lets go. It eats the prey by tearing at it with sharp fangs.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Its heavy shell allowed it to reach only nearby food. This could be the reason it is extinct.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: OMASTAR uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow and ponderous.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its tentacles are highly developed as if they are hands and feet. As soon as it ensnares prey, it bites.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Despite having strong fangs and tentacles, it went extinct when its heavy shell made it unable to catch prey.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: An OMASTAR uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large, making its movements slow and ponderous.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It is thought that this Pokémon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Apparently, it cracked SHELLDER’s shell with its sharp fangs and sucked out the insides.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Once wrapped around its prey, it never lets go. It eats the prey by tearing at it with sharp fangs.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is thought that this Pokémon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.
pokedex_entries.X: Its tentacles are highly developed as if they are hands and feet. As soon as it ensnares prey, it bites.
pokedex_entries.Y: Once wrapped around its prey, it never lets go. It eats the prey by tearing at it with sharp fangs.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow and ponderous.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its heavy shell is thought to be the reason this ancient Pokémon died out. It’s apparently a distant ancestor of Octillery.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It wraps its prey in its tentacles to immobilize them and then finishes them off with its sharp fangs.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Its sharp beak rings its mouth. Its shell was too big for it to move freely, so it became extinct.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Omastar’s sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is thought that this Pokémon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: An ancient POKéMON that was recovered from a fossil. It swims by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Revived from an ancient fossil, this POKéMON uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.
pokedex_entries.Silver: This POKéMON from ancient times is said to have navigated the sea by adeptly twisting its 10 tentacles.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: In prehistoric times, it swam on the sea floor, eating plankton. Its fossils are sometimes found.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: OMANYTE is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct POKéMON that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: A prehistoric POKéMON that lived in the primordial sea, it swims by twisting its 10 tentacles about.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically regenerated from fossils.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: One of the ancient and long-since-extinct POKéMON that have been regenerated from fossils by humans. If attacked, it withdraws into its hard shell.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pokémon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: This Pokémon from ancient times is said to have navigated the sea by adeptly twisting its 10 tentacles.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.
pokedex_entries.X: A prehistoric Pokémon that lived in the primordial sea, it swims by twisting its 10 tentacles about.
pokedex_entries.Y: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pokémon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Omanyte lived in the seas of antiquity. Its fossils have been found bearing bite marks from Archeops, so apparently Archeops preyed on it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It was restored from an ancient fossil. Those Helix Fossils are excavated from areas that were once oceans long, long ago.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: An ancient Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It swam by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It’s a Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: A POKéMON that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: The only POKéMON people anticipate can fly into space. None has managed the feat yet, however.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It is a manmade POKéMON. Since it doesn’t breathe, people are eager to try it in any environment.
pokedex_entries.Silver: A manmade POKéMON that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: An artificial POKéMON created due to extensive research, it can perform only what is in its program.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: PORYGON is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This POKéMON is copy-protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Using the most advanced technologies, scientists finally succeeded in making the first artificial POKéMON.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: A POKéMON that consists entirely of programming code. It is capable of moving freely in cyberspace.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data in order to enter cyberspace. A PORYGON is copy-protected so it cannot be duplicated.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: The world’s first artificially created Pokémon. It can travel through electronic space.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A man-made Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely in cyberspace.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It is a manmade Pokémon. Since it doesn’t breathe, people are eager to try it in any environment.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: A manmade Pokémon that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A man-made Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely in cyberspace.
pokedex_entries.X: A man-made Pokémon that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions.
pokedex_entries.Y: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. It is capable of moving freely in cyberspace.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This Pokémon is copy protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Roughly 20 years ago, it was artificially created, utilizing the latest technology of the time.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It can convert its body into digital data, which enables it to enter cyberspace.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: This Pokémon was created using the cutting-edge science of 20 years ago, so many parts of it have since become obsolete.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It was built 20 years ago by scientists who dreamed of exploring space. Their dreams have yet to come true.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: The only Pokémon that people anticipate can fly into space. None has managed the feat yet, however.
pokedex_entries.Sword: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.
pokedex_entries.Shield: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: The world’s first artificially created Pokémon. It can travel through electronic space.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It has no discernible heartbeat and does not seem to draw breath, and yet it appears to function without issue. I cannot even begin to explain this utterly bizarre anomaly.

name: Flareon
desc: Flareon is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Flame Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: It has a flame chamber inside its body. It inhales, then blows out fire that is over 3,000F degrees.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It fluffs out its fur collar to cool down its body temperature, which can reach 1,650 degrees.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Once it has stored up enough heat, this POKéMON’s body temperature can reach up to 1700 degrees.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: FLAREON’s fluffy fur has a functional purpose - it releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot. This POKéMON’s body temperature can rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees F.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It has a flame bag inside its body. After inhaling deeply, it blows out flames of nearly 3,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature can soar to over 1,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: FLAREON’s fluffy fur releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot. Its body temperature can rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees F.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It has a flame sac in its body. Its body temperature tops 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit before battle.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Inhaled air is heated in the flame sac in its body to an intense fire over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It fluffs out its fur collar to cool down its body temperature, which can reach 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Inhaled air is heated in the flame sac in its body to an intense fire over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees F.
pokedex_entries.X: It has a flame sac in its body. Its body temperature tops 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit before battle.
pokedex_entries.Y: It has a flame bag inside its body. After inhaling deeply, it blows out flames of nearly 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Flareon’s fluffy fur has a functional purpose—it releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot. This Pokémon’s body temperature can rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Sun: When it catches prey or finds berries, it breathes fire on them until they’re well done, and then it gobbles them up.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its average body temperature is between 1,300 and 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. In its internal flame sac, temperatures reach 3,000 degrees.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: If it inhales deeply, that’s a sign it’s about to attack. Prepare to be hit by flames of over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The flame chamber inside its body ignites when Flareon gets agitated, reaching temperatures of up to 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: It has a flame chamber inside its body. It inhales, then breathes out fire that is over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon’s body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It has a flame sac in its body. Its body temperature tops 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit before battle.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Flames burn within a saclike organ inside this Pokémon. When Flareon inhales, these flames grow in intensity, reaching a mighty 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000-volt lightning bolts.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: A sensitive POKéMON that easily becomes sad or angry. Every time its mood changes, it charges power.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Every hair on its body starts to stand sharply on end if it becomes charged with electricity.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The negatively charged ions generated in its fur create a constant sparking noise.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: JOLTEON’s cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the POKéMON to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its cells generate weak power that is amplified by its fur’s static electricity to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It controls 10,000-volt power and can raise all the fur on its body as if it were sharp needles.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Every hair on its body starts to stand sharply on end if it becomes charged with electricity.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: By storing electricity in its body, it can shoot its bristlelike fur like a barrage of missiles.
pokedex_entries.X: Every hair on its body starts to stand sharply on end if it becomes charged with electricity.
pokedex_entries.Y: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Jolteon’s cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the Pokémon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They send out electrical charges of about 10,000 volts. Because they are high-strung, it can be difficult to grow close to them.
pokedex_entries.Moon: When its fur stands on end, that’s a sign it’s about to give off a jolt of electricity. Take care, as sometimes lightning strikes next to it, too.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its lungs contain an organ that creates electricity. The crackling sound of electricity can be heard when it exhales.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its fur stands on end, becoming like needles it fires at enemies. Once they’re weakened, it finishes them off with a 10,000 volt shock.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: A sensitive Pokémon that easily becomes sad or angry. Every time its mood changes, it charges power.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It controls 10,000-volt power. When the fur covering its body stands on end, the fur is hard and sharp, like needles.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Bristles its fur into sharp, needlelike points when enraged. One can hear electricity crackle in its breath when it exhales.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid’s.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Its cell structure is similar to water molecules. It will melt away and become invisible in water.
pokedex_entries.Gold: When VAPOREON’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It prefers beautiful shores. With cells similar to water molecules, it could melt in water.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: As it uses the fins on the tip of its tail to swim, it blends with the water perfectly.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: VAPOREON underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater. This POKéMON has the ability to freely control water.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its body’s cellular structure is similar to the molecular composition of water. It can melt invisibly in water.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid’s.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: VAPOREON underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow them to live underwater. They have the ability to freely control water.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It has evolved to be suitable for an aquatic life. It can invisibly melt away into water.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can melt away into water.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: When VAPOREON’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It prefers beautiful shores. With cells similar to water molecules, it could melt in water.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can melt away into water.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can’t be seen when it melts away into water.
pokedex_entries.X: It prefers beautiful shores. With cells similar to water molecules, it could melt in water.
pokedex_entries.Y: It has evolved to be suitable for an aquatic life. It can invisibly melt away into water.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater. This Pokémon has the ability to freely control water.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its cells are composed of units much like water molecules. It lives close to water and is often mistaken for a mermaid.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Blending in with the water and erasing all signs of its presence, it patiently waits for its prey, fish Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When it’s about to be attacked by an invading enemy, it dives into the water to hide.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It detects nearby moisture with its fin. When its fin begins trembling rapidly, that means rain will fall in a few hours.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Its cell structure is similar to water molecules. It melts into the water and becomes invisible.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When Vaporeon’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its body’s cellular structure is similar to the molecular composition of water. It can melt invisibly in water.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It has evolved to be suited for an aquatic life. It can become invisible when it melts away into water.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Tests show that its cells closely resemble water molecules, which perhaps explains its ability to conceal its form while submerged. I believe the origins of mermaid folklore lie with this Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Capable of copying an enemy’s genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: When it spots an enemy, its body transfigures into an almost perfect copy of its opponent.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It can transform into anything. When it sleeps, it changes into a stone to avoid being attacked.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can’t maintain its disguise.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When it encounters another DITTO, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: DITTO rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on its memory, this POKéMON manages to get details wrong.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It can freely recombine its own cellular structure to transform into other life-forms.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Capable of copying an opponent’s genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A DITTO rearranges its cell structure to transform itself. However, if it tries to change based on its memory, it will get details wrong.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It can transform into anything. When it sleeps, it changes into a stone to avoid being attacked.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can’t maintain its disguise.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.
pokedex_entries.X: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.
pokedex_entries.Y: It can freely recombine its own cellular structure to transform into other life-forms.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Ditto rearranges its cell structure to transform itself into other shapes. However, if it tries to transform itself into something by relying on its memory, this Pokémon manages to get details wrong.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It can reorganize its cells to make itself into a duplicate of anything it sees. The quality of the duplicate depends on the individual.
pokedex_entries.Moon: With its astonishing capacity for metamorphosis, it can get along with anything. It does not get along well with its fellow Ditto.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: While it can transform into anything, each Ditto apparently has its own strengths and weaknesses when it comes to transformations.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It transforms into whatever it sees. If the thing it’s transforming into isn’t right in front of it, Ditto relies on its memory—so sometimes it fails.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: When it spots an enemy, its body transfigures into an almost-perfect copy of its opponent.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When it encounters another Ditto, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: A POKéMON that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: A gentle soul that can read the minds of people. It can ferry people across the sea on its back.
pokedex_entries.Gold: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It ferries people across the sea on its back. It may sing an enchanting cry if it is in a good mood.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: This gentle POKéMON loves to give people rides and provides a very comfortable way to get around.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: People have driven LAPRAS almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this POKéMON is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its high intelligence enables it to understand human speech. It likes to ferry people on its back.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: A POKéMON that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people on its back.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: People have driven LAPRAS almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, it is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It ferries people across the sea on its back. It may sing an enchanting cry if it is in a good mood.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Able to understand human speech and very intelligent, it loves to swim in the sea with people on its back.
pokedex_entries.X: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its high intelligence enables it to understand human speech. It likes to ferry people on its back.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this Pokémon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its high intelligence enables it to comprehend human speech. When it’s in a good mood, it sings in its beautiful voice.
pokedex_entries.Moon: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It likes swimming around with people on its back. In the Alola region, it’s an important means of transportation over water.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: They’ve been so cherished that there’s now an overabundance. The fish Pokémon population has declined in waters with too many Lapras.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: A gentle soul that can understand human speech. It can ferry people across the sea on its back.
pokedex_entries.Sword: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

location.Sword: Over 5,000 people can ride on its shell at once. And it’s a very comfortable ride, without the slightest shaking or swaying.
location.Shield: It surrounds itself with a huge ring of gathered ice particles. It uses the ring to smash any icebergs that might impede its graceful swimming.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Famous for being very unreliable. It can be found swimming in seas, lakes, rivers and shallow puddles.
pokedex_entries.Gold: An underpowered, pathetic POKéMON. It may jump high on rare occasions, but never more than seven feet.
pokedex_entries.Silver: For no reason, it jumps and splashes about, making it easy for predators like PIDGEOTTO to catch it mid-jump.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: This weak and pathetic POKéMON gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: MAGIKARP is a pathetic excuse for a POKéMON that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: MAGIKARP is virtually useless in battle as it can only splash around. As a result, it is considered to be weak. However, it is actually a very hardy POKéMON that can survive in any body of water no matter how polluted it is.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic POKéMON in the world.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its swimming muscles are weak, so it is easily washed away by currents. In places where water pools, you can see many MAGIKARP deposited there by the flow.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It is said to be the world’s weakest Pokémon. No one knows why it has managed to survive.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It is unable to swim against even slow-moving currents. It always splashes about for some reason.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A MAGIKARP living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions, but usually not more than seven feet.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: For no reason, it jumps and splashes about, making it easy for predators like PIDGEOTTO to catch it mid-jump.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.
pokedex_entries.X: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
pokedex_entries.Y: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Magikarp is a pathetic excuse for a Pokémon that is only capable of flopping and splashing. This behavior prompted scientists to undertake research into it.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Magikarp is virtually useless in battle as it can only splash around. As a result, it is considered to be weak. However, it is actually a very hardy Pokémon that can survive in any body of water no matter how polluted it is.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Although weak and helpless, this Pokémon is incredibly fertile. They exist in such multitudes, you’ll soon grow tired of seeing them.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its reckless leaps make it easy pickings for predators. On the bright side, many Pokémon enjoy longer life spans, thanks to Magikarp.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: In the distant past, they were fairly strong, but they have become gradually weaker over time.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Thanks to their strong hold on life, dirty water doesn’t bother them at all. They live in waters all over the world!
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Famous for being very unreliable. It can be found swimming in seas, lakes, rivers and shallow puddles.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily pushed along rivers when there are strong currents.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is said to be the world’s weakest Pokémon. No one knows why it has managed to survive.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It is unable to swim against even slow-moving currents. It always splashes about for some reason.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A feeble, pitiful imbecile of a Pokémon that is nonetheless very hardy. Unperturbed by turbid water, it can be found living in all sorts of places.

name: Tauros
desc: Tauros is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Wild Bull Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 128 (Red/Blue/Yellow)148 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)128 (FireRed/LeafGreen)150 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)125 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)137 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)170 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)128 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)116 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: A rowdy POKéMON with a lot of stamina. Once running, it won’t stop until it hits something.
pokedex_entries.Gold: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd’s protector takes pride in its battle-scarred horns.
pokedex_entries.Silver: After heightening its will to fight by whipping itself with its three tails, it charges at full speed.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: These violent POKéMON fight with other members of their herd in order to prove their strength.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: This POKéMON is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for TAUROS to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: When it is about to TACKLE, it whips its body repeatedly with its three long tails.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for TAUROS to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd’s protector takes pride in its battle-scarred horns.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: After heightening its will to fight by whipping itself with its three tails, it charges at full speed.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.
pokedex_entries.X: After heightening its will to fight by whipping itself with its three tails, it charges at full speed.
pokedex_entries.Y: When it is about to tackle, it whips its body repeatedly with its three long tails.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: This Pokémon is not satisfied unless it is rampaging at all times. If there is no opponent for Tauros to battle, it will charge at thick trees and knock them down to calm itself.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Historically, people in areas all over the world have ridden Tauros, but the practice is said to have started in Alola.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Although it’s known to be a fierce Pokémon, Tauros in the Alola region are said to possess a measure of calmness.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: They live in groups. The one with the longest, thickest, and most-scarred horns is the boss of the herd.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The climate seems to be related to the reason Tauros in Alola are a little calmer than those in other regions.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: A rowdy Pokémon with a lot of stamina. Once running, it won’t stop until it hits something.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on their backs.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Once it takes aim at its prey, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.

name: Magmar
desc: Magmar is a Fire type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Spitfire Pokémon.

name_origin.magma: the melted rock in a volcano

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 126 (Red/Blue/Yellow)151 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)126 (FireRed/LeafGreen)201 (Platinum)153 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)054 (Black 2/White 2)167 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)201 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)126 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)175 (Legends: Arceus)019 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The fiery surface of its body gives off a wavering, rippling glare that is similar to the sun.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It moves more frequently in hot areas. It can heal itself by dipping its wound into lava.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: In battle, MAGMAR blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This POKéMON’s fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather’s body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly amidst flames.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: In battle, it blows out intense flames from all over its body to intimidate its foe. These fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in the area.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When it breathes deeply, heat waves form around its body, making it hard to see clearly.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suitable for itself.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The fiery surface of its body gives off a wavering, rippling glare that is similar to the sun.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: When it breathes deeply, heat waves form around its body, making it hard to see clearly.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The scorching fire exhaled by Magmar forms heat waves around its body, making it hard to see the Pokémon clearly.
pokedex_entries.X: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather’s body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Y: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: In battle, Magmar blows out intensely hot flames from all over its body to intimidate its opponent. This Pokémon’s fiery bursts create heat waves that ignite grass and trees in its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.Sun: When it’s tired, it leaps into the mouth of a volcano and soaks its body in magma to ease its weariness. Its body burns at 2,192 degrees F.
pokedex_entries.Moon: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn’t calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes, the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames shoot out!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The hotter the place, the better they feel. Magmar in Alola are said to be hardier than those in other areas.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.
pokedex_entries.Shield: These Pokémon’s bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It was born in the crater of a volcano. Its body is covered with flames that shimmer like the sun.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Legend has it that this Pokémon was born from the crater of a volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much as one would soak in a hot spring.

name: Electabuzz
desc: Electabuzz is an Electric type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Electric Pokémon.

name_origin.buzz: low humming sound, as in electricity

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 125 (Red/Blue/Yellow)155 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)125 (FireRed/LeafGreen)198 (Platinum)157 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)057 (Black 2/White 2)227 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)296 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)125 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)183 (Legends: Arceus)016 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this POKéMON has eaten electricity at a power plant.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish-blue.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When two ELECTABUZZ touch, they control the electric currents to communicate their feelings.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: When a storm arrives, gangs of this POKéMON compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use ELECTABUZZ in place of lightning rods.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: When a storm approaches, it competes with others to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning. Some towns use ELECTABUZZ in place of lightning rods.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It windmills its arms to slightly boost its punches. Foes have been known to escape in the meantime.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish-blue.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It windmills its arms to slightly boost its punches. Foes have been known to escape in the meantime.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Research is progressing on storing lightning in Electabuzz so this energy can be used at any time.
pokedex_entries.X: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its entire body glows a whitish blue.
pokedex_entries.Y: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: When a storm arrives, gangs of this Pokémon compete with each other to scale heights that are likely to be stricken by lightning bolts. Some towns use Electabuzz in place of lightning rods.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Half of all sudden blackouts are caused by Electabuzz gathering at electric power plants and gobbling up electricity.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Electricity permeates its body. It swings its arms round and round to charge up electricity before unleashing a punch.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: While it’s often blamed for power outages, the truth is the cause of outages is more often an error on the part of the electric company.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this Pokémon has eaten electricity at a power plant.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With the coming of a storm, many of these Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there waiting for lightning to strike.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Half of all blackouts occur when this Pokémon appears at power plants and eats electricity.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall trees, where the Pokémon will then wait for lightning to strike.

name: Jynx
desc: Jynx is an Ice/Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Human Shape Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 124 (Red/Blue/Yellow)153 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)124 (FireRed/LeafGreen)155 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)084 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)110 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)124 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)014 (The Crown Tundra)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Appears to move to a rhythm of its own, as if it were dancing. It wiggles its hips as it walks.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It rocks its body rhythmically. It appears to alter the rhythm depending on how it is feeling.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It speaks a language similar to that of humans. However, it seems to use dancing to communicate.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It has several different cry patterns, each of which seems to have its own meaning.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: JYNX walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It speaks using a language that sounds human. Research is under way to determine what is being said.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A JYNX sashays rhythmically as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without noticing.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It rocks its body rhythmically. It appears to alter the rhythm depending on how it is feeling.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It speaks a language similar to that of humans. However, it seems to use dancing to communicate.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.
pokedex_entries.X: It wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.
pokedex_entries.Y: It speaks using a language that sounds human. Research is under way to determine what is being said.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are truly wonderful.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its strange cries sound like human language. There are some musicians who compose songs for Jynx to sing.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Appears to move to a rhythm of its own, as if it were dancing. It wiggles its hips as it walks.
pokedex_entries.Sword: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have even gathered a fan base.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.

name: Scyther
desc: Scyther is a Bug/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Mantis Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 123 (Red/Blue/Yellow)110 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)123 (FireRed/LeafGreen)195 (Platinum)111 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)136 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)275 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)365 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)123 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)072 (Legends: Arceus)118 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
pokedex_entries.Silver: When it moves, it leaves only a blur. If it hides in grass, its protective colors make it invisible.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It’s very proud of its speed. It moves so fast that its opponent does not even know what knocked it down.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: SCYTHER is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This POKéMON’s scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of itself.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its blindingly fast speed adds to the sharpness of its twin forearm scythes. The scythes can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja’s.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: When it moves, it leaves only a blur. If it hides in grass, its protective coloration makes it invisible.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
pokedex_entries.X: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.
pokedex_entries.Y: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This Pokémon’s scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It confuses its prey with its quick, ninja-like movements. Then, in an instant, it cleaves them with its scythes.
pokedex_entries.Moon: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its two sharp scythes are more than just weapons. It uses them with dexterity to dress its prey before eating.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Some call it a ninja. Its movements— imperceptibly quick—are sufficient to cleave the air in two. It’s very popular in Alola.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.
pokedex_entries.Sword: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If you come across an area in a forest where a lot of the trees have been cut down, what you’ve found is a Scyther’s territory.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja’s.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey’s attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon’s nimble motions.
