pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in 7 colors.
pokedex_entries.Gold: The center section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Regardless of the environment it lives in, its body grows to form a symmetrical geometric shape.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It is said that it uses the seven-colored core of its body to send electric waves into outer space.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: STARMIE’s center section - the core - glows brightly in seven colors. Because of its luminous nature, this POKéMON has been given the nickname “the gem of the sea.”
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: STARMIE swims through water by spinning its star-shaped body as if it were a propeller on a ship. The core at the center of this POKéMON’s body glows in seven colors.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: This POKéMON has a geometric body. Because of its body, the locals suspect that it is an alien creature.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: People in ancient times imagined that STARMIE were transformed from the reflections of stars that twinkled on gentle waves at night.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: The middle section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Regardless of the environment it lives in, its body grows to form a symmetrical geometric shape.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its core shines in many colors and sends radio signals into space to communicate with something.
pokedex_entries.X: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.
pokedex_entries.Y: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Starmie’s center section—the core—glows brightly in seven colors. Because of its luminous nature, this Pokémon has been given the nickname “the gem of the sea.”
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Starmie swims through water by spinning its star-shaped body as if it were a propeller on a ship. The core at the center of this Pokémon’s body glows in seven colors.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its shining core is thought to receive and transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known to cause headaches in those who approach it.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its unusual body shape, reminiscent of abstract art, led local people to spread rumors that this Pokémon may be an invader from outer space.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its sparkling core is called “the gem of the sea.” This core can be made into high-priced accessories that are traded in secret.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It rotates its geometrically shaped body to swim through the water. It always seems to be sending out mysterious radio waves.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in seven colors.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: At the center of its body is a red core that sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

name: Staryu
desc: Staryu is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Star Shape Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: An enigmatic POKéMON that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: As long as the center section is unharmed, it can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.
pokedex_entries.Gold: At night, the center of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When the stars twinkle at night, it floats up from the sea floor, and its body’s center core flickers.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: STARYU’s center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these POKéMON look like the stars in the sky.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: STARYU apparently communicates with the stars in the night sky by flashing the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its body are torn, this POKéMON simply regenerates the missing pieces and limbs.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: An enigmatic POKéMON that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It gathers with others in the night and makes its red core glow on and off with the twinkling stars. It can regenerate limbs if they are severed from its body.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: At night, the middle of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: As long as its red core remains, it can regenerate its body instantly, even if it’s torn apart.
pokedex_entries.X: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
pokedex_entries.Y: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Staryu’s center section has an organ called the core that shines bright red. If you go to a beach toward the end of summer, the glowing cores of these Pokémon look like the stars in the sky.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Staryu apparently communicates with the stars in the night sky by flashing the red core at the center of its body. If parts of its body are torn, this Pokémon simply regenerates the missing pieces and limbs.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Large numbers of these Pokémon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon gets nibbled on by Lumineon and others. Thanks to its red core, it regenerates fast, so it’s unconcerned by their snack attacks.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: In many places, there are folktales of stardust falling into the ocean and becoming Staryu.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: No number of injuries can bother Staryu. Its amazing regenerative powers return it to its previous state in half a day!
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: As long as the center section is unharmed, this Pokémon can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: If Staryu’s body is damaged, it will regenerate as long as the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: It is the male’s job to make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using the horn on its head.
pokedex_entries.Gold: During spawning season, SEAKING gather from all over, coloring the rivers a brilliant red.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When autumn comes, the males patrol the area around their nests in order to protect their offspring.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: In the autumn, SEAKING males can be seen performing courtship dances in riverbeds to woo females. During this season, this POKéMON’s body coloration is at its most beautiful.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SEAKING is very protective of its eggs. The male and female will take turns patrolling around their nest and eggs. The guarding of eggs by these POKéMON goes on for over a month.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: The horn on its head is sharp like a drill. It bores a hole in a boulder to make its nest.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It punches holes in boulders on streambeds. This is a clever innovation that prevents its eggs from being attacked or washed away by the current.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: To protect its family, it will fight with its drill-sharp horn. It lives in hollowed rocks in streams.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: During spawning season, SEAKING gather from all over, causing rivers to appear a brilliant red.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
pokedex_entries.X: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.
pokedex_entries.Y: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: In the autumn, Seaking males can be seen performing courtship dances in riverbeds to woo females. During this season, this Pokémon’s body coloration is at its most beautiful.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Seaking is very protective of its eggs. The male and female will take turns patrolling around their nest and eggs. The guarding of eggs by these Pokémon goes on for over a month.
pokedex_entries.Sun: When the weather grows cold, its whole body flushes a deep red. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that autumn has arrived.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Trainers who are crazy for Seaking are divided into horn enthusiasts and fin enthusiasts. The two groups do not get along well.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its horn spins like a drill to steadily hollow out rocks—even harder ones. The coloration of the male is more vivid.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: To attract females, males dance on the river’s floor. The females gather around the male that dances most gracefully.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: It is the male’s job to make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using the horn on its head.
pokedex_entries.Sword: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. The Pokémon defends its eggs with its life.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: To protect its family, it will fight with its drill-sharp horn. It lives in hollowed rocks in streams.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: When it is time for them to lay eggs, they can be seen swimming up rivers and falls in large groups.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Its dorsal, pectoral and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.
pokedex_entries.Silver: A strong swimmer, it is capable of swimming nonstop up fast streams at a steady speed of five knots.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: During spawning season, they swim gracefully in the water, searching for their perfect mate.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: GOLDEEN is a very beautiful POKéMON with fins that billow elegantly in water. However, don’t let your guard down around this POKéMON - it could ram you powerfully with its horn.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: GOLDEEN loves swimming wild and free in rivers and ponds. If one of these POKéMON is placed in an aquarium, it will shatter even the thickest glass with one ram of its horn and make its escape.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of “The Water Queen.”
pokedex_entries.Emerald: In the springtime, schools of GOLDEEN can be seen swimming up falls and rivers. It metes out staggering damage with its single horn.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It swims elegantly by flittering its tail fin as if it were a dress. It has the look of a queen.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It swims at a steady 5 knots. If it senses danger, it will strike back with its sharp horn.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Though it appears very elegant when swimming with fins unfurled, it can jab powerfully with its horn.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its dorsal, pectoral and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: A strong swimmer, it is capable of swimming nonstop up fast streams at a steady speed of five knots per hour.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Though it appears very elegant when swimming with fins unfurled, it can jab powerfully with its horn.
pokedex_entries.X: It swims at a steady 5 knots. If it senses danger, it will strike back with its sharp horn.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Goldeen is a very beautiful Pokémon with fins that billow elegantly in water. However, don’t let your guard down around this Pokémon—it could ram you powerfully with its horn.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Goldeen loves swimming wild and free in rivers and ponds. If one of these Pokémon is placed in an aquarium, it will shatter even the thickest glass with one ram of its horn and make its escape.
pokedex_entries.Sun: When the weather grows warm, they form groups and swim upriver. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that spring has arrived.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Spellbound by the length of its horn and the beauty of its fins, many strange Trainers raise Goldeen and nothing but Goldeen.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although known for their splendid tail fins, Goldeen apparently compete among themselves to see whose horn is thickest and sharpest.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The way it swims along fluttering its dress-like fins has earned it the name “princess of the water.”
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: When it is time for them to lay eggs, they can be seen swimming up rivers and falls in large groups.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It swims elegantly by flittering its tail fin as if it were a dress. It has the look of a queen.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It swims at a steady five knots. If it senses danger, it will strike back with its sharp horn.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Touching the back fin causes numbness. It hooks its tail to coral to stay in place while sleeping.
pokedex_entries.Gold: An examination of its cells revealed the presence of a gene not found in HORSEA. It became a hot topic.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its fin-tips leak poison. Its fins and bones are highly valued as ingredients in herbal medicine.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The male raises the young. If it is approached, it uses its toxic spikes to fend off the intruder.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: SEADRA sleeps after wriggling itself between the branches of coral. Those trying to harvest coral are occasionally stung by this POKéMON’s poison barbs if they fail to notice it.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: SEADRA generates whirlpools by spinning its body. The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even fishing boats. This POKéMON weakens prey with these currents, then swallows it whole.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its body bristles with sharp spikes. Carelessly trying to touch it could cause fainting from the spikes.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It is capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its winglike pectoral fins and stout tail.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: The poisonous barbs all over its body are highly valued as ingredients for making traditional herbal medicine. It shows no mercy to anything approaching its nest.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: An examination of its cells revealed the presence of a gene not found in HORSEA. It became a hot topic.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its fin-tips leak poison. Its fins and bones are highly valued as ingredients in herbal medicine.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional-medicine ingredients.
pokedex_entries.X: Its body bristles with sharp spikes. Carelessly trying to touch it could cause fainting from the spikes.
pokedex_entries.Y: It is capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its winglike pectoral fins and stout tail.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Seadra sleeps after wriggling itself between the branches of coral. Those trying to harvest coral are occasionally stung by this Pokémon’s poison barbs if they fail to notice it.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Seadra generates whirlpools by spinning its body. The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even fishing boats. This Pokémon weakens prey with these currents, then swallows it whole.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Touching the back fin causes numbness. It hooks its tail to coral to stay in place while sleeping.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: If it senses any danger, it will vigorously spray water or a special type of ink from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.Gold: If attacked by a larger enemy, it quickly swims to safety by adeptly controlling its dorsal fin.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its big, developed fins move rapidly, allowing it to swim backward while still facing forward.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When they’re in a safe location, they can be seen playfully tangling their tails together.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: HORSEA eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean current turns fast, this POKéMON anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: If HORSEA senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This POKéMON swims by cleverly flapping the fins on its back.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It maintains balance using its tail, which is wound up like a coil. It may spray ink from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: By cleverly flicking the fins on its back side to side, it moves in any direction while facing forward. It spits ink to escape if it senses danger.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: If attacked by a larger enemy, it quickly swims to safety by adeptly controlling its well-developed dorsal fin.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its big, developed fins move rapidly, allowing it to swim backward while still facing forward.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
pokedex_entries.X: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
pokedex_entries.Y: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Horsea eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean current turns fast, this Pokémon anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: If Horsea senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This Pokémon swims by cleverly flapping the fin on its back.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: If it senses any danger, it will vigorously spray water or a special type of ink from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.
pokedex_entries.Shield: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits black ink and flees.

name: Tangela
desc: Tangela is a Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Vine Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 114 (Red/Blue/Yellow)179 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)114 (FireRed/LeafGreen)181 (Platinum)182 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)217 (Black 2/White 2)114 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)095 (Legends: Arceus)080 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. Its vines shake as it walks.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick, blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.
pokedex_entries.Gold: The vines that cloak its entire body are always jiggling. They effectively unnerve its foes.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: During battle, it constantly moves the vines that cover its body in order to annoy its opponent.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: TANGELA’s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Blue plant vines cloak the POKéMON’s identity in a tangled mass. It entangles anything that gets close.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. The vines sway as it walks.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its vines snap off easily and painlessly if they are grabbed, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by new growth the very next day.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: The vines that cloak its entire body are always jiggling. They effectively unnerve its foes.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.
pokedex_entries.X: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.
pokedex_entries.Y: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Tangela’s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent. In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used as herbs.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when chewed—they’re useful as a spice.

name: Chansey
desc: Chansey is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Egg Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: A rare and elusive POKéMON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: A gentle and kindhearted POKéMON that shares its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured POKéMON.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Few in number and difficult to capture, it is said to bring happiness to the trainer who catches it.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: People try to catch it for its extremely nutritious eggs, but it rarely can be found.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: CHANSEY lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It lays several eggs a day. The eggs are apparently rich in nutrients and extremely delicious.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: A rare and elusive POKéMON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to catch one.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: CHANSEY lay nutritionally excellent eggs every day. The eggs are so delicious, they are eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It lays several eggs a day and won’t share them with those who have evil in their hearts.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Being few in number and difficult to capture, it is said to bring happiness to the Trainer who catches it.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
pokedex_entries.X: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
pokedex_entries.Y: It lays several eggs a day. The eggs are apparently rich in nutrients and extremely delicious.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
pokedex_entries.Sun: The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients and a favorite food of many Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Not only are these Pokémon fast runners, they’re also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It seems that other Pokémon’s efforts to take its delicious, nutritious egg away from it caused Chansey to get faster at fleeing.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Because the eggs on their bellies have been overharvested by people in the past, the Chansey population remains very small.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: A gentle and kindhearted Pokémon that shares its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a high-class cooking ingredient.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This species was once very slow. To protect their eggs from other creatures, these Pokémon became able to flee quickly.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It lays several eggs a day and won’t share them with those who have evil in their hearts.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This purehearted Pokémon shares its eggs with the injured. These eggs are so nutritious that they’ve been nicknamed “doctors’ doubles.”

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Walks on its hind legs. Shows signs of intelligence. Its armor-like hide even repels molten lava.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Its rugged hide protects it from even the heat of lava. However, the hide also makes it insensitive.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its brain developed when it began walking on hind legs. Its thick hide protects it even in magma.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: By lightly spinning its drill-like horn, it can easily shatter even a diamond in the rough.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: RHYDON’s horn can crush even uncut diamonds. One sweeping blow of its tail can topple a building. This POKéMON’s hide is extremely tough. Even direct cannon hits don’t leave a scratch.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: RHYDON has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for destroying rocks and boulders. This POKéMON occasionally rams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents it from feeling the heat.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its horn, which rotates like a drill, destroys tall buildings with one strike. It stands on its hind legs, and its brain is well developed.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Its brain developed after it stood up on its hind legs. Its drill horn bores tunnels through solid rock.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Standing on its hind legs freed its forelegs and made it smarter. It is very forgetful, however.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its rugged hide protects it from even the heat of lava. However, the hide also makes it insensitive.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its brain developed when it began walking on hind legs. Its thick hide protects it even in magma.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Standing on its hind legs freed its forelegs and made it smarter. It is very forgetful, however.
pokedex_entries.X: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Y: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Rhydon’s horn can crush even uncut diamonds. One sweeping blow of its tail can topple a building. This Pokémon’s hide is extremely tough. Even direct cannon hits don’t leave a scratch.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Rhydon has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for destroying rocks and boulders. This Pokémon occasionally rams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents it from feeling the heat.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Its brain developed when it began walking on its hind legs. Its armor-like hide even repels molten lava.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its brain developed after it stood up on its hind legs. Its drill horn bores tunnels through solid rock.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Rapidly rotates its horn to bore through bedrock. It swaggers around volcanic regions, protected from the lava’s heat by its tough, armorlike hide.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Its massive bones are 1000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: A POKéMON with a one-track mind. Once it charges, it won’t stop running until it falls asleep.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It doesn’t care if there is anything in its way. It just charges and destroys all obstacles.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: RHYHORN runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path. It is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of steel. This POKéMON may feel some pain from the collision the next day, however.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: RHYHORN’s brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Strong, but not too bright, this POKéMON can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging TACKLES.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. Its TACKLE can knock a semitrailer flying.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Once it starts running, it doesn’t stop. Its tiny brain makes it so stupid that it can’t remember why it started running in the first place.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Its body is clad in a thick hide, and its tackles topple buildings. Unfortunately, it is not smart.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its powerful tackles can destroy anything. However, it is too slow witted to help people work.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It doesn’t care if there is anything in its way. It just charges and destroys all obstacles.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its powerful tackles can destroy anything. However, it is too slow witted to help people work.
pokedex_entries.X: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.
pokedex_entries.Y: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Rhyhorn runs in a straight line, smashing everything in its path. It is not bothered even if it rushes headlong into a block of steel. This Pokémon may feel some pain from the collision the next day, however.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Rhyhorn’s brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: A Pokémon with a one-track mind. Once it charges, it won’t stop running until it falls asleep.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its body is clad in a thick hide, and its tackles topple buildings. Unfortunately, it is not smart.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Ludicrously strong—when it butts heads with a mountain, it is the mountain that shatters. But its short legs struggle with turns, and it is incapable of stopping unless it collides with something.

name: Koffing
desc: Koffing is a Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Poison Gas Pokémon.

name_origin.coughing: expulsion of air from the lungs

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 109 (Red/Blue/Yellow)114 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)108 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)109 (FireRed/LeafGreen)115 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)046 (Black 2/White 2)113 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)109 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)250 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: In hot places, its internal gases could expand and explode without any warning. Be very careful!
pokedex_entries.Gold: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The poisonous gases it contains are a little bit lighter than air, keeping it slightly airborne.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: If one gets close enough to it when it expels poisonous gas, the gas swirling inside it can be seen.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: If KOFFING becomes agitated, it raises the toxicity of its internal gases and jets them out from all over its body. This POKéMON may also overinflate its round body, then explode.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: KOFFING embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this POKéMON.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Getting up close to a KOFFING will give you a chance to observe, through its thin skin, the toxic gases swirling inside. It blows up at the slightest stimulation.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The poisonous gases it contains are a little bit lighter than air, keeping it slightly airborne.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Toxic gas is held within its thin, balloon-shaped body, so it can cause massive explosions.
pokedex_entries.X: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.
pokedex_entries.Y: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: If Koffing becomes agitated, it raises the toxicity of its internal gases and jets them out from all over its body. This Pokémon may also overinflate its round body, then explode.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: In hot places, its internal gases could expand and explode without any warning. Be very careful!
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell; they are also explosive.

name: Lickitung
desc: Lickitung is a Normal type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Licking Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 108 (Red/Blue/Yellow)178 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)108 (FireRed/LeafGreen)161 (Platinum)180 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)284 (Black 2/White 2)134 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)375 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)108 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)125 (Legends: Arceus)054 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon’s. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Its tongue spans almost 7 feet and moves more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can cause paralysis.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Its tongue has well-developed nerves that run to the very tip, so it can be deftly manipulated.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It has a tongue that is over 6’6’’ long. It uses this long tongue to lick its body clean.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: Whenever LICKITUNG comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon’s. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Whenever it sees something unfamiliar, it always licks the object because it memorizes things by texture and taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Instead of hands, it uses its tongue, which is twice its height. Its sticky saliva grips anything.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When it extends its over-six-foot-long tongue, its tail quivers. There is a possibility they are connected.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its tongue has well-developed nerves that run to the very tip, so it can be deftly manipulated.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: When it extends its over-six-foot-long tongue, its tail quivers. There is a possibility they are connected.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Being licked by its long, saliva-covered tongue leaves a tingling sensation. Extending its tongue retracts its tail.
pokedex_entries.X: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It checks out whatever’s around it by licking everything. If you don’t clean off a spot where it’s licked you, you’ll break out in a rash!
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It licks filth clean with its tongue. Whatever it licks always stinks afterward, so whether it’s really clean is...questionable.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Its tongue spans almost seven feet and moves more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can cause paralysis.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung’s main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Instead of its hands, it uses its tongue, which can stretch to twice this Pokémon’s height. Lickitung’s sticky saliva grips anything.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Wields its long tongue deftly, as though it were an arm. The Pokémon’s viscous saliva, once it has been collected and boiled down, yields a strong and highly useful adhesive.

location.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Lake Valor, Spacious Cave, Fountainspring Cave, Swampy Cave, Riverbank Cave, Still-Water Cavern, Bogsunk Cavern
location.Legends: Arceus: Avalanche Slopes, Shrouded Ruins, Snowfall Hot Spring

name: Hitmonchan
desc: Hitmonchan is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Punching Pokémon.

name_origin.chan: from Jackie Chan, martial arts actor

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Keen Eye2. Iron FistInner Focus (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Punches in corkscrew fashion. It can punch its way through a concrete wall in the same way as a drill.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: To increase the strength of all its punch moves, it spins its arms just before making contact.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: HITMONCHAN is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working towards a world championship. This POKéMON has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face of adversity.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: The spirit of a pro boxer has infused this POKéMON. It throws punches that are faster than a bullet train.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning-fast volleys that are impossible to see.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A HITMONCHAN is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who aimed to become the world champion. Having an indomitable spirit means that it will never give up.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.
pokedex_entries.X: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.
pokedex_entries.Y: The spirit of a pro boxer has infused this Pokémon. It throws punches that are faster than a bullet train.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working toward a world championship. This Pokémon has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face of adversity.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Punches in corkscrew fashion. It can punch its way through a concrete wall like a drill.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: When Hitmonchan twists its arm while throwing a punch, the blow will pulverize even concrete. The Pokémon rests after three minutes of fighting.

name: Hitmonlee
desc: Hitmonlee is a Fighting type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Kicking Pokémon.

name_origin.lee: from Bruce Lee, martial arts actor

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: When kicking, the sole of its foot turns as hard as a diamond on impact and destroys its enemy.
pokedex_entries.Gold: This amazing POKéMON has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
pokedex_entries.Silver: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It is also called the Kick Master. It uses its elastic legs to execute every known kick.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: HITMONLEE’s legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra-long, loping strides.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its legs freely stretch and contract. Using these springlike limbs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its tired legs.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.
pokedex_entries.X: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
pokedex_entries.Y: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Hitmonlee’s legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: When kicking, the sole of its foot turns as hard as a diamond on impact and destroys its enemy.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its legs can stretch to double their length. First-time foes are startled by Hitmonlee’s extensible reach.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this POKéMON’s real face.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Wears the skull of its deceased mother. Its cries echo inside the skull and come out as a sad melody.
pokedex_entries.Gold: If it is sad or lonely, the skull it wears shakes, and emits a plaintive and mournful sound.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It always wears the skull of its dead mother, so no one has any idea what its hidden face looks like.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It lost its mother after its birth. It wears its mother’s skull, never revealing its true face.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: CUBONE pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull the POKéMON wears are made by the tears it sheds.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It wears the skull of its dead mother on its head. When it becomes lonesome, it is said to cry loudly.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this POKéMON’s real face.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull it wears are from its tears.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: If it is sad or lonely, the skull it wears shakes and emits a plaintive and mournful sound.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It always wears the skull of its dead mother, so no one has any idea what its hidden face looks like.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.
pokedex_entries.X: It wears the skull of its dead mother on its head. When it becomes lonesome, it is said to cry loudly.
pokedex_entries.Y: It always wears the skull of its dead mother, so no one has any idea what its hidden face looks like.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull the Pokémon wears are made by the tears it sheds.
pokedex_entries.Sun: When it thinks of its deceased mother, it weeps loudly. Mandibuzz that hear its cries will attack it from the air.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: At night, it weeps loudly for its dead mother, but those cries only attract its natural enemy—Mandibuzz.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It wears its mother’s skull on its head, so no one knows what its bare face looks like. However, it’s clear that it’s always crying.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Wears the skull of its deceased mother. Its cries echo inside the skull and come out as a sad melody.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: The heads attract each other and spin around. There must be 6 heads for it to maintain balance.
pokedex_entries.Gold: The shell is very durable. Even if it cracks, it can survive without spilling the contents.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Using telepathy only they can receive, they always form a cluster of six EXEGGCUTE.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: If even one is separated from the group, the energy bond between the six will make them rejoin instantly.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: This POKéMON consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, EXEGGCUTE is close to evolution.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Even though it appears to be eggs of some sort, it was discovered to be a life-form more like plant seeds.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It is often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It consists of six eggs that care for each other. The eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear, it is close to evolution.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Their shells are very durable. Even if they crack, they can survive without spilling their contents.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Using telepathy only they can employ, they always form a cluster of six EXEGGCUTE.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
pokedex_entries.X: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.
pokedex_entries.Y: Even though it appears to be eggs of some sort, it was discovered to be a life-form more like plant seeds.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate among themselves. It is believed to carry plant genes and the genes of other species.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Six of them together form a full-fledged Pokémon. It’s often hunted by Crabrawler, but uses psychokinesis to drive it off.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Six of them form a single Pokémon. Should one of the six be lost, the next morning there will once more be six.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although they are the same size as other Exeggcute, the ones produced in Alola are quite heavy. Their shells are packed full.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: The heads attract each other and spin around. There must be six heads for it to maintain balance.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
pokedex_entries.Shield: These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: One claw grew massively and as hard as steel. It has 10,000-HP strength. However, it is too heavy.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It can hardly lift its massive, overgrown pincer. The pincer’s size makes it difficult to aim properly.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its pincers grow peculiarly large. If it lifts the pincers too fast, it loses its balance and staggers.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: KINGLER has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because the claw is so heavy, the POKéMON quickly tires.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: The large pincer has 10,000-horsepower crushing force. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It waves its huge, oversized claw in the air to communicate with others. But since the claw is so heavy, this POKéMON quickly tires.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: The larger pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is so heavy, it is difficult to aim.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It can hardly lift its massive, overgrown pincer. The pincer’s size makes it difficult to aim properly.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its pincers grow peculiarly large. If it lifts the pincers too fast, it loses its balance and staggers.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The larger pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is so heavy, it is difficult to aim.

pokedex_entries.Y: Its pincers grow peculiarly large. If it lifts the pincers too fast, it loses its balance and staggers.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Kingler has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because the claw is so heavy, the Pokémon quickly tires.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: One claw grew massively and is as hard as steel. It has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is too heavy.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.

location.Sword: The flow of Gigantamax energy has spurred this Pokémon’s left pincer to grow to an enormous size. That claw can pulverize anything.
location.Shield: The bubbles it spews out are strongly alkaline. Any opponents hit by them will have their bodies quickly melted away.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Its pincers are superb weapons. They sometimes break off during battle, but they grow back fast.
pokedex_entries.Gold: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The pincers break off easily. If it loses a pincer, it somehow becomes incapable of walking sideways.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: If it is unable to find food, it will absorb nutrients by swallowing a mouthful of sand.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: KRABBY live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these POKéMON can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: KRABBY live in holes dug into beaches. On sandy shores with little in the way of food, they can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are broken in battle.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The pincers break off easily. If it loses a pincer, it somehow becomes incapable of walking sideways.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are broken in battle.
pokedex_entries.X: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
pokedex_entries.Y: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these Pokémon can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Its pincers are superb weapons. They sometimes break off during battle, but they grow back fast.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are lost in battle.

name: Hypno
desc: Hypno is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Hypnosis Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 097 (Red/Blue/Yellow)088 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)097 (FireRed/LeafGreen)088 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)055 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)067 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)097 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as HYPNOSIS and CONFUSION.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
pokedex_entries.Gold: When it is very hungry, it puts humans it meets to sleep, then it feasts on their dreams.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Always holding a pendulum that it rocks at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The longer it swings its pendulum, the longer the effects of its hypnosis last.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: HYPNO holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this POKéMON searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It carries a pendulum-like device. There once was an incident in which it took away a child it hypnotized.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as HYPNOSIS and CONFUSION.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum in a HYPNO’s hand lull the foe into deep hypnosis. While searching for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: When it is very hungry, it puts humans it meets to sleep, then it feasts on their dreams.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
pokedex_entries.X: It carries a pendulum-like device. There once was an incident in which it took away a child it hypnotized.
pokedex_entries.Y: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this Pokémon searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.
pokedex_entries.Sun: While it is an extremely dangerous Pokémon, people who are in need of a good, sound sleep call it their savior.
pokedex_entries.Moon: As a matter of course, it makes anyone it meets fall asleep and has a taste of their dreams. Anyone having a good dream, it carries off.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: In Alola, Komala is Hypno’s main target. It rarely harms people.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: There are some Hypno that assist doctors with patients who can’t sleep at night in hospitals.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.

name: Drowzee
desc: Drowzee is a Psychic type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Hypnosis Pokémon.

name_origin.zee: the letter ‘z’, often used to denote sleep

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 096 (Red/Blue/Yellow)087 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)096 (FireRed/LeafGreen)087 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)054 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)066 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)096 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it has eaten in the past.
pokedex_entries.Gold: If you think that you had a good dream, but you can’t remember it, a DROWZEE has probably eaten it.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children’s are much tastier.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it’s a sure sign that one of these POKéMON is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: A descendent of the legendary animal baku, which is said to eat dreams. It is skilled at hypnotism.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating only bad dreams.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it’s a sure sign that a DROWZEE is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: If you think that you had a good dream but you can’t remember it, a DROWZEE has probably eaten it.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children’s are much tastier.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.
pokedex_entries.X: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating only bad dreams.
pokedex_entries.Y: If you think that you had a good dream but you can’t remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it’s a sure sign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
pokedex_entries.Sun: A Pokémon that nourishes itself by eating dreams, it is thought to share common ancestry with Munna and Musharna.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes friends with people, it may show them the most delicious dreams it’s ever eaten.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It can be spotted near recreational facilities, intending to eat the pleasant dreams of children who enjoyed themselves there that day.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It puts its prey to sleep and devours their dreams. It seems that bad dreams taste sour, so Drowzee doesn’t particularly like eating them.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.

name: Onix
desc: Onix is a Rock/Ground type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Rock Snake Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by DIGLETTs.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: ONIX has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this POKéMON does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to black-colored diamonds.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: There is a magnet in its brain that prevents an ONIX from losing direction while tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes steadily rounder and smoother.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It squirms through the ground using its long and rugged body. It always eats while burrowing.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Opening its large mouth, it ingests massive amounts of soil and creates long tunnels.
pokedex_entries.X: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
pokedex_entries.Y: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
pokedex_entries.Sword: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: When it travels underground, it causes rumbling and tremors. It can move at 50 mph.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It squirms through the ground using its long and rugged body. It always eats while burrowing.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.

name: Haunter
desc: Haunter is a Ghost/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Gas Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 093 (Red/Blue/Yellow)059 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)093 (FireRed/LeafGreen)070 (Diamond/Pearl)070 (Platinum)059 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)031 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)062 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)074 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)093 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)142 (Sword/Shield)070 (Brilliant Diamond/Shining Pearl)137 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: By licking, it saps the victim’s life. It causes shaking that won’t stop until the victim’s demise.
pokedex_entries.Gold: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, HAUNTER lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It hides in the dark, planning to take the life of the next living thing that wanders close by.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: HAUNTER is a dangerous POKéMON. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This POKéMON will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, HAUNTER is there.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: If a HAUNTER beckons you while it is floating in darkness, don’t approach it. This POKéMON will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal the victim’s life force. It lurks in darkness for prey.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, HAUNTER lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
pokedex_entries.X: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
pokedex_entries.Y: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal the victim’s life force. It lurks in darkness for prey.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It fears the light and revels in the dark. It may be on the verge of extinction in cities that stay brightly lit at night.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: On moonless nights, Haunter searches for someone to curse, so it’s best not to go out walking around.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It’s dangerous to go outside alone on nights when you’re feeling sad. Haunter will catch you, and you won’t be able to go back home.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: By licking, it saps the victim’s life. It causes shaking that won’t stop until the victim’s demise.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal its victim’s life-force. It lurks in darkness, waiting for prey.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls, appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of a Haunter’s lick will wither to death day by day.
