pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Almost invisible, this gaseous POKéMON cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape as it appears to be made of a gas.
pokedex_entries.Gold: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Its thin body is made of gas. It can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: GASTLY is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this POKéMON cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: A being that exists as a thin gas. It can topple an Indian elephant by enveloping the prey in two seconds.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Almost invisible, this gaseous POKéMON cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: When exposed to a strong wind, a GASTLY’s gaseous body quickly dwindles away. They cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: This Pokémon’s body is 95% made up of gases, which are blown away by strong gusts of wind.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: A Pokémon born from poison gases. It defeats even the largest foes by enveloping them in gas.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
pokedex_entries.X: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
pokedex_entries.Y: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Although Gastly is barely visible, when it’s near, a faint sweet smell lingers.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s said that gas emanating from a graveyard was possessed by the grievances of the deceased and thus became a Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Poisonous gas comprises 95% of its body. It’s said that the remaining 5% is made up of the souls of those who died from the gas.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape, as it appears to be made of a gas.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: This Pokémon’s body is 95 percent made up of gases. The Pokémon can be blown away by strong gusts of wind.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It’s a Pokémon born from poison gases. It defeats even the largest foes by enveloping them in gas.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Gaseous and completely impalpable. Also highly dangerous— inhaling part of its poisonous body will cause one to faint instantly.

desc: Cloyster is a Water/Ice type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Bivalve Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 091 (Red/Blue/Yellow)170 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)091 (FireRed/LeafGreen)172 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)037 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)116 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)139 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)091 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)151 (Sword/Shield)132 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamonds shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.
pokedex_entries.Silver: CLOYSTER that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Even a missile can’t break the spikes it uses to stab opponents. They’re even harder than its shell.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: CLOYSTER is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This POKéMON shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It swims in the sea by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. The CLOYSTER shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: CLOYSTER that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.
pokedex_entries.X: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its hard shell cannot be shattered—not even by a bomb. The contents of the shell remain unknown.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Excavation of the tombs of ancient hunting tribes has turned up many spears tipped with spikes that had fallen off this Pokémon’s shell.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: If areas of Cloyster’s very hard shell get damaged, those areas swell, gradually growing into large sharp spikes.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Slowpoke tails are its favorite food. It has even been known to come up on land to look for Slowpoke from time to time.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamonds shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.

desc: Shellder is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Bivalve Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 090 (Red/Blue/Yellow)169 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)090 (FireRed/LeafGreen)171 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)036 (X/Y — Coastal Kalos)115 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)138 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)090 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)150 (Sword/Shield)131 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: The shell can withstand any attack. However, when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Grains of sand trapped in its shells mix with its body fluids to form beautiful pearls.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: At night, this POKéMON uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, SHELLDER closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: At night, it burrows a hole in the seafloor with its broad tongue to make a place to sleep. While asleep, it closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Grains of sand trapped in its shells mix with its body fluids to form beautiful pearls.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.
pokedex_entries.X: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
pokedex_entries.Y: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: At night, this Pokémon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, Shellder closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
pokedex_entries.Sun: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon’s tongue is always hanging out. It uses its tongue with great dexterity to dig up sand from the seabed in its search for food.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The sand that accumulates inside its shell eventually becomes a pearl. But the pearl gets in the way, so it spits it out and discards it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Even when its shell is closed, its tongue still hangs out. If you give its tongue a good yank, the shock will cause Shellder to open its shell.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: The shell can withstand any attack. However, when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Its entire body is a snowy-white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It loves frigid seas with ice floes. It uses its long tail to change swimming direction quickly.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It sleeps under shallow ocean waters during the day, then looks for food at night when it’s cold.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: DEWGONG loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this POKéMON sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its body is covered with a pure white fur. The colder the weather, the more active it becomes.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: It stores thermal energy in the body. It swims at a steady eight knots even in intensely cold waters.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this POKéMON sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It loves frigid seas with ice floes. It uses its long tail to change swimming direction quickly.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Its streamlined body has low resistance, and it swims around cold oceans at a speed of eight knots.
pokedex_entries.X: Its body is covered with a pure white fur. The colder the weather, the more active it becomes.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight knots, searching for Pokémon that will become its prey. It’s especially fond of Wishiwashi.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It sunbathes on the beach after meals. The rise in its body temperature helps its digestion.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.

location.Brilliant Diamond: Route 226, 230, Fountainspring Cave, Whiteout Cave, Icy Cave, Glacial Cavern

name: Seel
desc: Seel is a Water type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Sea Lion Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 086 (Red/Blue/Yellow)176 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)086 (FireRed/LeafGreen)178 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)265 (Black 2/White 2)115 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)086 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Loves freezing cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14F degrees.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Although it can’t walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It especially loves being in frigid seas.
pokedex_entries.Silver: In daytime, it is often found asleep on the seabed in shallow waters. Its nostrils close while it swims.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The light blue fur that covers it keeps it protected against the cold. It loves iceberg-filled oceans.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: SEEL hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick icebergs.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: SEEL hunt for prey in frigid, ice-covered seas. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Although it can’t walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It especially loves being in frigid seas.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: In daytime, it is often found asleep on the seabed in shallow waters. Its nostrils close while it swims.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The colder it gets, the better it feels. It joyfully swims around oceans so cold that they are filled with floating ice.
pokedex_entries.X: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.
pokedex_entries.Y: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of -40 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don’t bother it at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in warm waters.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: This Pokémon lives on icebergs. It uses the sharp point on its head to break up ice as it swims in the sea.

name: Dodrio
desc: Dodrio is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Triple Bird Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Run Away2. Early BirdTangled Feet (hidden ability)
pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 085 (Red/Blue/Yellow)200 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)093 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)085 (FireRed/LeafGreen)205 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)095 (X/Y — Central Kalos)096 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)085 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: One of DODUO’s 2 heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 MPH in prairies.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and become immobilized.
pokedex_entries.Silver: If one of the heads gets to eat, the others will be satisfied, too, and they will stop squabbling.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads--even for a second--will get pecked severely.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: Watch out if DODRIO’s three heads are looking in three separate directions. It’s a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don’t go near this POKéMON if it’s being wary - it may decide to peck you.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: Apparently, the heads aren’t the only parts of the body that DODRIO has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head is said to stay awake.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A peculiar POKéMON species with three heads. It vigorously races across grassy plains even in arid seasons with little rainfall.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: When DODUO evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and fall into a state of immobility.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: If one of the heads gets to eat, the others will be satisfied, too, and they will stop squabbling.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.
pokedex_entries.X: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads--even for a second--will get pecked severely.
pokedex_entries.Y: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Watch out if Dodrio’s three heads are looking in three separate directions. It’s a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don’t go near this Pokémon if it’s being wary—it may decide to peck you.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Apparently, the heads aren’t the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. This Pokémon runs at nearly 40 mph.

desc: Doduo is a Normal/Flying type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Twin Bird Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Run Away2. Early BirdTangled Feet (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this POKéMON runs at high speed on developed legs.
pokedex_entries.Gold: By alternately raising and lowering its two heads, it balances itself to be more stable while running.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It races through grassy plains with powerful strides, leaving footprints up to four inches deep.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It lives on a grassy plain where it can see a long way. If it sees an enemy, it runs away at 60 mph.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: DODUO’s two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch for enemies while the other one sleeps.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: DODUO’s two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this POKéMON possessing different sets of brains.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: A two-headed POKéMON that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Even while eating or sleeping, one of the heads remains always vigilant for any sign of danger. When threatened, it flees at over 60 miles per hour.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: By alternately raising and lowering its two heads, it balances itself to be more stable while running.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It races through grassy plains with powerful strides, leaving footprints up to four inches deep.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
pokedex_entries.X: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.
pokedex_entries.Y: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Doduo’s two heads never sleep at the same time. Its two heads take turns sleeping, so one head can always keep watch for enemies while the other one sleeps.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Doduo’s two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 082 (Yellow/Red/Blue)119 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)083 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)082 (FireRed/LeafGreen)179 (Platinum)120 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)049 (Black 2/White 2)070 (X/Y — Mountain Kalos)085 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)048 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)055 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)082 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)178 (Legends: Arceus)106 (The Isle of Armor)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Formed by several MAGNEMITEs linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6F degrees within 3,300 feet.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Three MAGNEMITE are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The MAGNEMITE are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinities.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When many MAGNETON gather together, the resulting magnetic storm disrupts radio waves.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: MAGNETON emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this POKéMON.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: MAGNETON emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this POKéMON inside a POKé BALL.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: A linked cluster formed of several MAGNEMITE. It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Formed by several MAGNEMITE linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It is actually three MAGNEMITE linked by magnetism. It generates powerful radio waves that raise temperatures by 3.6 degrees F within a 3,300-foot radius.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It is actually three MAGNEMITE linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Three MAGNEMITE are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The MAGNEMITE are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinity.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.
pokedex_entries.X: A linked cluster formed of several Magnemite. It discharges powerful magnetic waves at high voltage.
pokedex_entries.Y: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to mechanical devices. As a result, large cities sound sirens to warn citizens of large-scale outbreaks of this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this Pokémon inside a Poké Ball.
pokedex_entries.Sun: When three Magnemite link together, their brains also become one. They do not become three times more intelligent.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas inhabited by Magneton, which send out mysterious electrical signals.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When rain clouds form, many Magneton gather in high places to wait for lightning to strike.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful magnetic force. Most computers go haywire when a Magneton approaches.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: A Magneton is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group of these Pokémon can set off a magnetic storm.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Three Magnemite gathered to evolve into this Pokémon. The source of much vexation on my part, as its powerful magnetism destroys my research equipment.

name: Magnemite
desc: Magnemite is an Electric/Steel type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Magnet Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses THUNDER WAVE and similar moves.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: It is born with the ability to defy gravity. It floats in air on powerful electromagnetic waves.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach trainers if they are using their POKéGEAR.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The units at the sides of its body generate antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The electricity emitted by the units on each side of its body cause it to become a strong magnet.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: MAGNEMITE attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this POKéMON clinging to the breaker box.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: MAGNEMITE floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This POKéMON becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical supply is depleted.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges THUNDER WAVE and so on from the units at its sides.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Uses antigravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses THUNDER WAVE and similar moves.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: The units at its sides are extremely powerful magnets. They generate enough magnetism to draw in iron objects from over 300 feet away.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach Trainers if they are using their Pokégear.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The units at the sides of its body generate antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
pokedex_entries.X: The units at the sides of its body generate antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
pokedex_entries.Y: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this Pokémon clinging to the breaker box.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Magnemite floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This Pokémon becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical supply is depleted.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They gather in places where electricity is available. They can be found clinging to the steel towers used to support power lines.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it’s eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can’t stand.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Perhaps because electrical lines are often buried these days, the number of Magnemite attacks on power plants has increased.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: It is hatched with the ability to defy gravity. It floats while emitting powerful electromagnetic waves.
pokedex_entries.Sword: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it emits electromagnetic waves from the units on each side of its body.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and contract freely. They wrap around prey and weaken it with poison.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Its 80 tentacles absorb water and stretch almost endlessly to CONSTRICT its prey and enemies.
pokedex_entries.Silver: In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When its 80 feelers absorb water, it stretches to become like a net to entangle its prey.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: TENTACRUEL has large red orbs on its head. The orbs glow before lashing the vicinity with a harsh ultrasonic blast. This POKéMON’s outburst creates rough waves around it.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: TENTACRUEL has tentacles that can be freely elongated and shortened at will. It ensnares prey with its tentacles and weakens the prey by dosing it with a harsh toxin. It can catch up to 80 prey at the same time.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It has 80 tentacles that move about freely. They can sting, causing poisoning and sharp, stabbing pain.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: It lives in complex rock formations on the ocean floor and traps prey using its 80 tentacles. Its red orbs glow when it grows excited or agitated.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: With 80 tentacles for ensnaring victims, it prevents escape until the prey is weakened by poison.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It alerts others to danger by stridently flashing the red orbs on its head.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It extends its 80 tentacles to form an encircling poisonous net that is difficult to escape.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its 80 tentacles absorb water and stretch almost endlessly to constrict its prey and enemies.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It extends its 80 tentacles to form an encircling poisonous net that is difficult to escape.
pokedex_entries.X: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.
pokedex_entries.Y: It has 80 tentacles that move about freely. They can sting, causing poisoning and sharp, stabbing pain.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Tentacruel has large red orbs on its head. The orbs glow before lashing the vicinity with a harsh ultrasonic blast. This Pokémon’s outburst creates rough waves around it.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Tentacruel has tentacles that can be freely elongated and shortened at will. It ensnares prey with its tentacles and weakens the prey by dosing it with a harsh toxin. It can catch up to 80 prey at the same time.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles. The longer one has been alive, the fewer tentacles it will have.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Although these Pokémon are rare, when a large outbreak of them occurs, all fish Pokémon disappear from the surrounding sea.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs to weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up in its 80 tentacles.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It communicates with others of its kind by lighting up the red orbs on its head. When the orbs are blinking, it’s a warning sign.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and contract freely. They wrap around prey and weaken it with poison.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: With 80 tentacles for ensnaring victims, it prevents escape until the prey is weakened by poison.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It alerts others to danger by stridently flashing the red orbs on its head.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It has 80 tentacles, each with a venomous tip. These tentacles are also extendible, lengthening when Tentacruel attempts to catch prey. Use caution.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: It can sometimes be found all dry and shriveled up on a beach. Toss it back into the sea to revive it.
pokedex_entries.Gold: When the tide goes out, dehydrated TENTACOOL remains can be found washed up on the shore.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It drifts aimlessly in waves. Very difficult to see in water, it may not be noticed until it stings.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: As it floats along on the waves, it uses its toxic feelers to stab anything it touches.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: TENTACOOL’s body is largely composed of water. If it is removed from the sea, it dries up like parchment. If this POKéMON happens to become dehydrated, put it back into the sea.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: TENTACOOL absorbs sunlight and refracts it using water inside its body to convert it into beam energy. This POKéMON shoots beams from its crystal-like eyes.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its eyes are as transparent as crystals. From them, it shoots mysterious beams of light.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by their stingers.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its body is almost entirely composed of water. It ensnares its foe with its two long tentacles, then stabs with the poison stingers at their tips.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It drifts in sea currents. Countless fishermen are hurt by its poison stingers.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Because its body is almost entirely composed of water, it shrivels up if it is washed ashore.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: When the tide goes out, dehydrated TENTACOOL remains can be found washed up on the shore.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It drifts aimlessly in waves. Very difficult to see in water, it may not be noticed until it stings.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Because its body is almost entirely composed of water, it shrivels up if it is washed ashore.
pokedex_entries.X: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.
pokedex_entries.Y: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by their stingers.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Tentacool’s body is largely composed of water. If it is removed from the sea, it dries up like parchment. If this Pokémon happens to become dehydrated, put it back into the sea.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Tentacool absorbs sunlight and refracts it using water inside its body to convert it into beam energy. This Pokémon shoots beams from the small round organ above its eyes.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They can be found lying dehydrated on beaches, but they are often still alive. When soaked in water, they will revive.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It drifts in shallow seas, such as the areas near beaches. If you get bitten or stabbed by its toxic tentacles, rush to the hospital.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It drifts through the sea searching for prey. Its poisonous tentacles break off sometimes, but after a while, they grow back.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its body is 99% water. The remaining 1% contains the organ that makes its poison.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: It can sometimes be found all dry and shriveled up on a beach. Toss it back into the sea to revive it.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its body is mostly composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It drifts in sea currents. Countless fishers are hurt by its poison stingers.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: They fire beams from the glassy, magenta orbs that resemble eyes atop their heads, and they drift in shallow seas. During low tide, they can sometimes be found on beaches, desiccated.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is melted in a day, bones and all.
pokedex_entries.Gold: ACID that has dissolved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey.
pokedex_entries.Silver: This horrifying plant POKéMON attracts prey with aromatic honey, then melts them in its mouth.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: Once ingested into this POKéMON’s body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: VICTREEBEL has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this POKéMON swallows it whole.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Lures prey into its mouth with a honeylike aroma. The helpless prey is melted with a dissolving fluid.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: The long vine extending from its head is waved about as if it were a living thing to attract prey. When an unsuspecting victim approaches, it is swallowed whole.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Acid that has dissolved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: This horrifying plant Pokémon attracts prey with aromatic honey, then melts them in its mouth.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honey-like scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.
pokedex_entries.X: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
pokedex_entries.Y: Once ingested into this Pokémon’s body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokémon swallows it whole.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: In its mouth, it pools a fragrant nectar-like fluid. The fluid is really an acid that dissolves anything.

name_origin.gold: a color (oddly this applies to Psyduck more)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Its slim and long limbs end in broad flippers. They are used for swimming gracefully in lakes.
pokedex_entries.Gold: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It appears by waterways at dusk. It may use telekinetic powers if its forehead glows mysteriously.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: It swims gracefully along on the quiet, slow-moving rivers and lakes of which it is so fond.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: The webbed flippers on its forelegs and hind legs and the streamlined body of GOLDUCK give it frightening speed. This POKéMON is definitely much faster than even the most athletic swimmer.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: GOLDUCK is the fastest swimmer among all POKéMON. It swims effortlessly, even in a rough, stormy sea. It sometimes rescues people from wrecked ships floundering in high seas.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: The forelegs are webbed, helping to make it an adept swimmer. It can be seen swimming elegantly in lakes, etc.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Often seen swimming elegantly by lakeshores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster Kappa.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A GOLDUCK is an adept swimmer. It sometimes joins competitive swimmers in training. It uses psychic powers when its forehead shimmers with light.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: A Pokémon that lives in lakes. It swims faster than any human swimming champion.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: The flippers of its well-developed limbs give it shocking speed. It is the best swimmer among Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It appears by waterways at dusk. It may use telekinetic powers if its forehead glows mysteriously.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When its forehead shines mysteriously, Golduck can use the full extent of its power.
pokedex_entries.X: It appears by waterways at dusk. It may use telekinetic powers if its forehead glows mysteriously.
pokedex_entries.Y: The forelegs are webbed, helping to make it an adept swimmer. It can be seen swimming elegantly in lakes, etc.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: The webbed flippers on its forelegs and hind legs and the streamlined body of Golduck give it frightening speed. This Pokémon is definitely much faster than even the most athletic swimmer.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Golduck is the fastest swimmer among all Pokémon. It swims effortlessly, even in a rough, stormy sea. It sometimes rescues people from wrecked ships floundering in high seas.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It is said that the red part of its forehead grants supernatural powers to those who possess one, so it was over-hunted in the past.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It swims along the banks of lakes and catches fish Pokémon. It takes them to the shore and quietly eats them up.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Even fast-swimming fish Pokémon can be disabled by Golduck. It brings them to a standstill and seizes them.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: A professional swimmer, it can continue swimming for two days straight by waving its long tail skillfully.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Its long, slim limbs end in broad flippers. They are used for swimming gracefully in lakes.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Old tales tell of Golduck punishing those that defiled its river. The guilty were dragged into the water and taken away.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: This Pokémon lives in lakes. It swims faster than any world-class swimmer.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: The flippers of its well-developed limbs give it shocking speed. It is the best swimmer among Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its body is strong, and it has webbing on its hands and feet. Golduck can swim easily through rough seas, clawing its way through the high waves.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily POKéMON will use psychokinetic powers.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Always tormented by headaches. It uses psychic powers, but it is not known if it intends to do so.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It has mystical powers but doesn’t recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.
pokedex_entries.Silver: If its chronic headache peaks, it may exhibit odd powers. It seems unable to recall such an episode.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The only time it can use its psychic power is when its sleeping brain cells happen to wake.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: PSYDUCK uses a mysterious power. When it does so, this POKéMON generates brain waves that are supposedly only seen in sleepers. This discovery spurred controversy among scholars.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: If it uses its mysterious power, PSYDUCK can’t remember having done so. It apparently can’t form a memory of such an event because it goes into an altered state that is much like deep sleep.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily POKéMON will use psychokinetic powers.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: When its headache intensifies, it starts using strange powers. However, it has no recollection of its powers, so it always looks befuddled and bewildered.
pokedex_entries.Diamond: If its usual headache worsens, it starts exhibiting odd powers. It can’t remember doing so, however.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It never remembers using its odd powers, so it always tilts its head in puzzlement.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It has mystical powers but doesn’t recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: If its chronic headache peaks, it may exhibit odd powers. It seems unable to recall such an episode.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When headaches stimulate its brain cells, which are usually inactive, it can use a mysterious power.
pokedex_entries.X: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.
pokedex_entries.Y: It has mystical powers but doesn’t recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Psyduck uses a mysterious power. When it does so, this Pokémon generates brain waves that are supposedly only seen in sleepers. This discovery spurred controversy among scholars.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: If it uses its mysterious power, Psyduck can’t remember having done so. It apparently can’t form a memory of such an event because it goes into an altered state that is much like deep sleep.
pokedex_entries.Sun: As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without meaning to.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon is troubled by constant headaches. The more pain it’s in, the more powerful its psychokinesis becomes.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it normally passes the time spacing out and doing as little as possible.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It has been found that its brain cells are 10 times more active when Psyduck is experiencing a headache.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Always tormented by headaches. It uses psychic powers, but whether it intends to do so is not known.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.
pokedex_entries.Shield: As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets progressively worse. It uses intense psychic energy to overwhelm those around it.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: If its usual headache worsens, it starts exhibiting odd powers. It can’t remember doing so, however.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It never remembers using its odd powers, so it always tilts its head in puzzlement.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Suffers perpetual headaches. If the agony grows too great, Psyduck’s latent power erupts, contrary to Psyduck’s intent. Ergo, I am exploring ways to ease the pain.

name: Venomoth
desc: Venomoth is a Bug/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Poison Moth Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Shield Dust2. Tinted LensWonder Skin (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
pokedex_entries.Gold: When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poisonous powder all around.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The powder on its wings is poisonous if it is dark in color. If it is light, it causes paralysis.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: VENOMOTH is nocturnal - it is a POKéMON that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: The dustlike scales covering its wings are color-coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: VENOMOTH are nocturnal--they only are active at night. Their favorite prey are insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poisonous powder all around.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The powder on its wings is poisonous if it is dark in hue. If it is light in hue, it causes paralysis.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.
pokedex_entries.X: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.
pokedex_entries.Y: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.

name: Venonat
desc: Venonat is a Bug/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Insect Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Abilities: 1. Compound Eyes2. Tinted LensRun Away (hidden ability)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Its large eyes act as radars. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Its eyes also function as radar units. It catches and eats small bugs that hide in darkness.
pokedex_entries.Silver: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches and eats small bugs at night that are attracted by light.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The small bugs it eats appear only at night, so it sleeps in a hole in a tree until night falls.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: VENONAT is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even miniscule prey.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its eyes act as radar, enabling it to be active in darkness. The eyes can also shoot powerful beams.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats bugs. It is attracted by light at night.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: Its coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body is said to have evolved for protection. Its large eyes never fail to spot even miniscule prey.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its eyes also function as radar units. It catches and eats small bugs that hide in darkness.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches and eats small bugs at night that are attracted by light.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.
pokedex_entries.X: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.
pokedex_entries.Y: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats bugs. It is attracted by light at night.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Its large eyes act as a radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

name: Parasect
desc: Parasect is a Bug/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Mushroom Pokémon.

name_origin.parasite: insect/bacterium that feeds off another animal

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 047 (Red/Blue/Yellow)071 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)047 (FireRed/LeafGreen)071 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)148 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)181 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)047 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)054 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushrooms on its back. They appear to do all the thinking.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It stays mostly in dark, damp places, the preference not of the bug, but of the big mushrooms on its back.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: When nothing’s left to extract from the bug, the mushrooms on its back leave spores on the bug’s egg.
pokedex_entries.RubySapphire: PARASECT is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: It scatters toxic spores from the mushroom cap. In China, the spores are used as herbal medicine.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: PARASECT are known to infest the roots of large trees en masse and drain nutrients. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPlatinum: A mushroom grown larger than the host’s body controls PARASECT. It scatters poisonous spores.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It is controlled by a mushroom grown larger than the bug body. It is said to prefer damp places.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It stays mostly in dark, damp places, the preference not of the bug, but of the big mushroom on its back.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A mushroom grown larger than the host’s body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
pokedex_entries.X: A mushroom grown larger than the host’s body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.
pokedex_entries.Y: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
pokedex_entries.Sun: The large mushroom on its back controls it. It often fights over territory with Shiinotic.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It scatters toxic spores from its mushroom cap. Once harvested, these spores can be steeped and boiled down to prepare herbal medicines.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The bug is mostly dead, with the mushroom on its back having become the main body. If the mushroom comes off, the bug stops moving.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its poisonous spores are also used in traditional medicine. Apparently, spores produced in Alola are not of very good quality.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushrooms on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Parasect is controlled by a mushroom that has grown larger than its host’s body. The Pokémon scatters poisonous spores.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It is controlled by the mushroom, which has grown larger than the bug body. It is said to prefer damp places.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Mushroom-lacking specimens of this Pokémon lie unmoving in the forest, lending credence to the hypothesis that the large mushroom is in control of Parasect’s actions.

location.Legends: Arceus: Nature’s Pantry, Cloudpool Ridge, Cottonsedge Prairie, Diamond Heath, Golden Lowlands, Heavenward Lookout, Wayward Wood, Windbreak Stand

name: Paras
desc: Paras is a Bug/Grass type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Mushroom Pokémon.

name_origin.parasite: insect/bacterium that feeds off another animal

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 046 (Red/Blue/Yellow)070 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)046 (FireRed/LeafGreen)070 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)147 (Sun/Moon — Alola dex)180 (U.Sun/U.Moon — Alola dex)046 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)053 (Legends: Arceus)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It is doused with mushroom spores when it is born. As its body grows, mushrooms sprout from its back.
pokedex_entries.Silver: As its body grows large, oriental mushrooms named tochukaso start sprouting out of its back.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The tochukaso growing on this POKéMON’s back orders it to extract juice from tree trunks.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: PARAS has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from the BUG POKéMON host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: PARAS has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this BUG POKéMON host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Growing out of the bug’s back are mushrooms called tochukaso. The mushrooms grow with the bug host.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A PARAS has parasitic tochukaso mushrooms growing on its back. They grow by drawing nutrients from the host. They are valued as a medicine for long life.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host PARAS.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It is doused with mushroom spores when it is born. As its body grows, mushrooms sprout from its back.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: As its body grows, large mushrooms named tochukaso start sprouting out of its back.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
pokedex_entries.X: Growing out of the bug’s back are mushrooms called tochukaso. The mushrooms grow with the bug host.
pokedex_entries.Y: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
pokedex_entries.Omega RubyAlpha Sapphire: Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
pokedex_entries.Sun: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Mushrooms called tochukaso sprout from its back. They can be dried and powdered to make a medicine used to extend life.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Whether it’s due to a lack of moisture or a lack of nutrients, in Alola the mushrooms on Paras don’t grow up quite right.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The mushrooms, known as tochukaso, are controlling the bug. Even if the bug bugs the mushrooms, they tell it to bug off.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Sometimes seen at the foot of trees in humid forests. The mushrooms on its back—called tochukaso—are not present on infant specimens and instead emerge as Paras matures.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Flaps its broad flower petals to scatter its poisonous pollen. The flapping sound is very loud.
pokedex_entries.Gold: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
pokedex_entries.Silver: The bud bursts into bloom with a bang. It then starts scattering allergenic, poisonous pollen.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: By shaking its big petals, it scatters toxic pollen into the air, turning the air yellow.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: VILEPLUME’s toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks. That’s why it is advisable never to approach any attractive flowers in a jungle, however pretty they may be.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: VILEPLUME has the world’s largest petals. They are used to attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this POKéMON catches and devours them.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its petals are the largest in the world. It fiendishly scatters allergy-causing pollen from its petals.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: In seasons when it produces more pollen, the air around a VILEPLUME turns yellow with the powder as it walks. The pollen is highly toxic and causes paralysis.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The bud bursts into bloom with a bang. It then starts scattering allergenic, poisonous pollen.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.
pokedex_entries.X: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
pokedex_entries.Y: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Vileplume’s toxic pollen triggers atrocious allergy attacks. That’s why it is advisable never to approach any attractive flowers in a jungle, however pretty they may be.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Vileplume has the world’s largest petals. They are used to attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this Pokémon catches and devours them.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Flaps its broad flower petals to scatter its poisonous pollen. The flapping sound is very loud.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

name: Gloom
desc: Gloom is a Grass/Poison type Pokémon introduced in Generation 1. It is known as the Weed Pokémon.

pokedex_data.Local \u2116: 044 (Red/Blue/Yellow)084 (Gold/Silver/Crystal)089 (Ruby/Sapphire/Emerald)044 (FireRed/LeafGreen)084 (HeartGold/SoulSilver)106 (X/Y — Central Kalos)092 (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire)044 (Let's Go Pikachu/Let's Go Eevee)056 (Sword/Shield)

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn’t drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: Smells incredibly foul! However, around 1 out of 1,000 people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
pokedex_entries.Gold: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.
pokedex_entries.Silver: It secretes a sticky, drool-like honey. Although sweet, it smells too repulsive to get very close.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: The smell from its drool-like syrup and the pollen on its petals is so bad, it may make opponents faint.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: GLOOM releases a foul fragrance from the pistil of its flower. When faced with danger, the stench worsens. If this POKéMON is feeling calm and secure, it does not release its usual stinky aroma.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: From its mouth GLOOM drips honey that smells absolutely horrible. Apparently, it loves the horrid stench. It sniffs the noxious fumes and then drools even more of its honey.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn’t drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: A horribly noxious honey drools from its mouth. One whiff of the honey can result in memory loss. Some fans are said to enjoy this overwhelming stink, however.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It secretes a sticky, drool-like honey. Although sweet, it smells too repulsive to get very close.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.
pokedex_entries.X: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
pokedex_entries.Y: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: Gloom releases a foul fragrance from the pistil of its flower. When faced with danger, the stench worsens. If this Pokémon is feeling calm and secure, it does not release its usual stinky aroma.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: From its mouth Gloom drips honey that smells absolutely horrible. Apparently, it loves the horrid stench. It sniffs the noxious fumes and then drools even more of its honey.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.
pokedex_entries.Shield: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: The nectar it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious that it can make noses curl from more than a mile away.

pokedex_entries.RedBlue: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.
pokedex_entries.Yellow: It may be mistaken for a clump of weeds. If you try to yank it out of the ground, it shrieks horribly.
pokedex_entries.Gold: Awakened by moonlight, it roams actively at night. In the day, it stays quietly underground.
pokedex_entries.Silver: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
pokedex_entries.Crystal: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
pokedex_entries.Ruby: During the daytime, ODDISH buries itself in soil to absorb nutrients from the ground using its entire body. The more fertile the soil, the glossier its leaves become.
pokedex_entries.Sapphire: ODDISH searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself. During the daytime, while it is planted, this POKéMON’s feet are thought to change shape and become similar to the roots of trees.
pokedex_entries.FireRed: Its scientific name is “Oddium Wanderus.” At night, it is said to walk nearly 1,000 feet on its two roots.
pokedex_entries.LeafGreen: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.
pokedex_entries.Emerald: This POKéMON grows by absorbing moonlight. During the daytime, it buries itself in the ground, leaving only its leaves exposed to avoid detection by its enemies.
pokedex_entries.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Awakened by moonlight, it roams actively at night. In the day, it stays quietly underground.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.
pokedex_entries.X: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
pokedex_entries.Y: Its scientific name is “Oddium Wanderus.” At night, it is said to walk nearly 1,000 feet on its two roots.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: During the daytime, Oddish buries itself in soil to absorb nutrients from the ground using its entire body. The more fertile the soil, the glossier its leaves become.
pokedex_entries.Alpha Sapphire: Oddish searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself. During the daytime, while it is planted, this Pokémon’s feet are thought to change shape and become similar to the roots of trees.
pokedex_entries.Let's Go PikachuLet's Go Eevee: It may be mistaken for a clump of weeds. If you try to yank it out of the ground, it shrieks horribly.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
pokedex_entries.Shield: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.
